title: Navigate the Lessons View in Content | Learner

captions.text: This video explains how to navigate the Lessons view in Content.
Easily navigate your course content with a simultaneous display of the table of contents and course activities.
In the Lessons view, the table of contents displays on the left side of your screen.
Click on a unit to view all the course activities associated with it.
Navigate through each unit’s activities by clicking on them in the table of contents and viewing the content on the right side of your screen.

title: New Learner Experience | Learner

captions.text: This video demonstrates how to navigate the New Learner Experience in Content.
Use the New Learner Experience to improve your focus on content topics and organize your completion.
If you see this view in Content, you are using the New Learner Experience.
The table of contents allows you to explore all available content within your course.
You can choose to view an available module at any time; you are not forced to view modules in a specific sequence.
The table of contents shows you how many of the required activities you have completed for each module and adds a checkmark beside each activity as you complete it.
To view a module description and topics within a module, click Launch Unit or Launch Lesson.
When you decide what you want to view, click the item from the table of contents.
From the title bar, navigate through content by clicking the arrow buttons or choose specific content to view by clicking an item from the navigation menu.
At any time, you can return to the table of contents by clicking Back to Content.

title: Navigate Brightspace | Learner

captions.text: This video demonstrates how to navigate Brightspace as a learner.
Develop confidence and comfort as you navigate the common elements of Brightspace.
The My Home icon lets you return to your organization’s homepage.
Next is the Course Selector. The Course Selector allows you to access all your courses through a drop-down menu.
There are three alert icons.
Message Alerts notifies you about unread mail and instant messages.
Subscription Alerts notifies you about new and updated announcements and grades and upcoming due dates and end dates for course activities or assessments.
Update Alerts notifies you about new blog posts and new discussion posts in forums, topics, and threads you have subscribed to.
Click your name to open your personal menu.
Your personal menu lets you edit user-specific settings, including your Profile, Notifications, and Account Settings.
You can also change your preferred language and log out.
The navbar provides links to course-specific tools. The style, layout, and available links in your navbar may change depending on your course.
Your course homepage will also vary from course to course.
However, it generally provides access to important information such as announcements and calendar items.

title: September 2023/20.23.9 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the September 2023 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe September 2023 Version 20.23.9 Release
Notes, which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Quickly find enrollment rules with enhancedsearch using Discover.
Quiz Timing Improvements featuring SynchronousQuizzes now in the Quizzes tool.
And lastly, a summary of the all the otherfeatures this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
This feature improves upon the Discover – Createand add rules to multiple courses with Enhanced
Enrollment Rules feature released in August2023/Version 20.23.8.
To further help users manage enrollment rulesat scale, users with the correct permissions
can:Search for existing enrollment rules from
the Enrollment Rules page.
Search within a list of courses applied toa rule from the Create Enrollment Rule page.
Select all courses to add from the Add Coursesdialog; and
Add or remove existing enrollment rules directlyfrom the Course Offering Information page
of a course using the Add Enrollment Rulesbutton.
Previously, users could not search for existingenrollment rules from the Enrollment Rules
page or search for courses from the CreateEnrollment Rule page.
Additionally, users could not add or removeexisting rules directly from the Course Offering
Information page.
Navigate to Discover and select More Actions> Enrollment Rules.
Enter the rule name you want to search forinto the search field and click the magnifying
glass icon.
Partial search terms are allowed.
Click the X button at any time to clear thesearch field.
To add a rule to a course, click Create EnrollmentRule or select an existing rule.
Click Add Courses.
Click the checkbox to select all courses.
Otherwise, enter the search terms into thesearch field and click the magnifying glass
icon.
Click Add to add the courses.
Once complete, click Save and Close.
The Discover feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
To see Add Enrollment Rules on the CourseOffering information page, your role must
have the Configure Availability in Discoverpermission or the Manage Discover permission.
This release adds synchronous quizzes to theQuizzes tool, enabling instructors to set
up a quiz where the quiz timer starts on thestart date and ends when the time limit has
lapsed for all learners, rather than whenthe learner launches the quiz (which is the
case for an asynchronous quiz).
Because a synchronous quiz starts at the StartDate and ends when the time limit has lapsed,
learner action does not affect the time left.
For example, if a learner clicks Start Quiz!
15 minutes after the start date on a 1-hourquiz, they only have 45 minutes left to complete
it.
In a quiz, expand the Availability Dates & Conditionssection and set a Start Date.
Leave End Date blank.
To add the availability dates to the calendar,check Add availability dates to Calendar.
Expand the Timing & Display section, clickSet time limit, and set a time limit.
Click Timer Settings.
Select Synchronous under Quiz Start.
Select the desired time limit expiry optionand click Ok.
Click Save and Close.
To ensure that learners are aware of upcomingsynchronous quizzes, instructors should create
instructional or manual solutions:Create an announcement with information about
the synchronous quiz.
Set up an event and give a link to the quizto provide more context.
Lastly, make a synchronous quiz visible inthe calendar:
Instructors can select Add availability datesto Calendar or set up an event showing the
whole time.
Learners require the Allows Out of Date Quizzesto be Viewed in the User Quiz List permission
to open the Quiz Information page of a synchronousquiz.
The Quizzes feature implements the followingPIE Items:
D1552, D2914, D2135, D4450, D4481, D6373,D6812, D8924, and D9257 (Quiz End Time enforces
quiz attempt submission);D8816 (Submit Quiz attempts in bulk or through
API); andD9656 (Quizzes improvements and updates)
Thank you to all those who put forward thesePIE suggestions to implement this feature!
The Quizzes feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
Learners can access information about a synchronousquiz before it starts in the Quiz Information
page if they have the Allows Out of Date Quizzesto be Viewed in the User Quiz List permission.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Brightspace Virtual Assistant features a newfully-localized icon.
The Book Management tool is being removedas of this release.
The LTI Launches permission is no longer requiredin Data Hub.
And lastly, In the Widgets tool, End of Lifefor the Brightspace Community Widget.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the September 2023
/ Version 20.23.9 Release Notes on BrightspaceCommunity.
See you next month!

title: Synchronize Quizzes for Learners | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains how to sync quizzes for learners in Brightspace.
Synchronous quizzes enable instructors to set up a quiz where the quiz timer starts on the start date and time for all learners rather than when the learner launches the quiz, which is asynchronous.
From your quiz page, in the Availability Dates & Conditions area, set a Start Date for your quiz.
Note that an End Date is not required for synchronous quizzes.
Enter the time you want your quiz to be available.
The time you enter for the Start Date is the time when your quiz starts for learners.
If you want to add your quiz to the course Calendar, select Add availability dates to Calendar.
The dates show as follows for synchronous quizzes:
If the Start Date and  End Date  are set, an End Date event is created.
If only the  Start Date is set, a Start Date event is created.
If only the  End Date is set, an End Date event is created.
Expand the Timing & Display area.
Click Set time limit and enter a time limit.
Then click Timer Settings.
In the Timing dialog, select Synchronous: Timer starts on the start date.
Click OK.
Note that a synchronous quiz starts on the Start Date and ends when the time limit has lapsed, regardless of any action taken by the learner.
The Due Date option is disabled for synchronous quizzes.

title: August 2023/20.23.8 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the August 2023 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe August 2023 Version 20.23.8 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Instructors and administrators can now pinannouncements to top of the Announcement widget
and tool pages.
In Creator+, Layouts now supports Insert Element.
Data Hub features Brightspace Data Sets improvementsfor August.
Create and add rules to multiple courses withenhanced Enrollment Rules in Discover.
And finally, a summary of the all the otherfeatures this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Instructors and Administrators can now pinannouncements and global announcements to
the top of the Announcement Widget and Toolpages, allowing important information to remain
visible to learners.
Pinned announcements are marked with the newpinned icon, so that users can see which announcements
have been pinned.
Global announcements appear at the top ofthe page before any announcements pinned within
a course offering.
Note that pinning an announcement or viewinga pinned announcement is not currently supported
in Slim Announcements.
Navigate to Announcements and click the drop-downmenu button beside the announcement you want
to pin.
Click Pin to top.
To unpin an announcement, either click thepinned icon, or select Unpin from the drop-down
menu.
Note that clicking the icon to unpin is onlyavailable in the Announcements tool, not the
widget.
The Announcements feature implements the followingPIE Item:
D7111 (Ability to Pin Announcement to theTop)
Thank you to all those who put forward thisPIE suggestion to implement this feature!
The Announcements feature is available toall clients.
It is automatically enabled for all userswho have the Announcements tool permission
Add, Edit and Delete Announcements enabledfor their role.
Creator+ Layouts now supports inserting Elementsin a Layouts panel.
Elements respond to the size of the Layoutpanels they are inserted into in the same
way they respond when displayed on smallerscreens, such as on mobile devices.
These elements include:Accordions, Carousels, Hotspots, Tabs, Callouts,
Timelines, Click and reveals, Stylized quotes,and Flip cards.
The Creator+ feature is available to all Creator+users and is automatically enabled wherever
Insert Element is available.
This release adds new columns to existingBrightspace Data Sets (BDS):
The Version column is added to the RubricsEdit BDS to track which edits were made during
the same session and allow users to determinethe sequence of changes made to a rubric.
This column only has data for edits made toassessed rubrics from August 2023 onward.
All records from before August 2023 have avalue of 0 in this column.
The Criteria column is added to the AwardObjects BDS to indicate the criteria necessary
to issue the award.
The possible values for this column are determinedby the instructor.
The Data Hub feature is available to all BrightspaceCore clients.
To enable, ensure that the Can Access BrightspaceData Sets permission is granted to administrators
at the org level, and that the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Versionconfiguration variable is set to version 8.
New and changed data sets appear the firsttime the data set runs after the version update.
This feature allows users with proper permissionsthe ability create an enrollment rule and
apply it to as many courses as required.
Users can review and edit enrollment rulesfrom the Enrollment Rules page, select Create
Enrollment Rule to create a new rule, applyconditions to the rule, and associate that
rule with multiple courses.
Previously, users could only create and addenrollment rules to a single course from the
Course Offering Information page on a course-by-coursebasis.
Users can add a Role in Organization conditionto the rule in the Create Enrollment Rule
page.
Users can select from up to 10 role valuesto apply to the Role in Organization condition
(for example, Learner).
Users can also add or remove as many coursesas required while creating or editing an enrollment
rule from this page.
Navigate to Discover and click More Actions> Enrollment Rules.
Click Create Enrollment Rule.
Enter a Rule Name and select the desired conditions.
Click Add or Remove Courses and select thecourses to apply this rule to.
Click Update.
Once you’ve reviewed the details of yourrule, click Save and Close.
Users of Manager Dashboard can add up to 10conditions, each with up to 10 specified User
Attributes.
Users with the Manage Discover permissioncan access the Manage Enrollment Rules link,
which takes them to the new Enrollment Rulespage.
Previously, users required the Configure Availabilityin Discover permission and could only add
or remove enrollment rules from a course directlyfrom the Course Offering Information page.
Access to the new Enrollment Rules and CreateEnrollment Rules pages, as well as adding
Role in Organization conditions, is availableto all clients with the proper permissions.
Adding multiple attributes as an enrollmentrule condition is available only to Manager
Dashboard subscribers with User Attributes.
To enable access to the Enrollment Rules page(including the ability to create, edit, and
delete rules) and the Manage Enrollment Ruleslink, ensure that the Manage Discover permission
is granted to the desired user roles.
The Configure Availability in Discover permissionis required to view existing rules applied
to a course from the Course Offering Informationpage.
This is read-only.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
End of Life for App Finder and App FinderLTI 1.1 integration.
Two new features with the Rubrics tool: improveyour evaluation experience with the new collapsible
panel for Assignments and Discussions in mobileview, and new pop-out details provide increased
evaluator awareness.
And finally, Class Progress displays absentperiods more clearly in the User Progress
tool.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the August 2023
/ Version 20.23.8 Release Notes on BrightspaceCommunity.
See you next month!

title: Apply Enrollment Rules to Multiple Courses within Discover | Administrator

captions.text: This video explains how to apply enrollment rules across multiple courses in Discover.
The 20.23.8 update to Enrollment Rules adds the ability to apply rules to as many courses as required.
This feature is most flexible with Manager Dashboard and User Attributes because it offers more possible conditions for an enrollment rule.
However, Brightspace Core still gives users the ability to add rules across multiple courses based on a user’s Role in Organization.
To apply enrollment rules, the following permissions are necessary: Manage Discover and Configure Availability in Discover.
From your organizational homepage, navigate to Discover.
Click More Actions > Enrollment Rules.
On the Enrollment Rules page, click Create Enrollment Rule.
Enter a Rule Name and select the conditions for your enrollment rule.
To apply this rule to courses, click Add or Remove Courses.
In the dialog, select all the courses you want to apply the rule to. Click Update.
Review the details of your enrollment rule and click Save and Close.
You have created a new enrollment rule and applied it to multiple courses in your organization.

title: July 2023/20.23.7 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the July 2023 Release.The full list of features can be found in
the July 2023 Version 20.23.7 Release Notes,which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
In Data Hub, a newly added column tracks whenparent relationship between org units is deleted;
in addition, the Adoption Period for BrightspaceData Sets Version 8 has ended.
The New Creation Experience is set to on bydefault in Discussions.
The Quizzes tool now has the New Quiz CreationExperience universally enabled, as well as
featuring redesigned quiz timing options tosimplify workflows.
The AI Coach feature for Premium users isintroduced in Bongo Video Assignments.
And finally, a summary of the all the otherfeatures this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
This release adds the new DateDeleted columnto the end of the Organizational Unit Parents
Brightspace Data Set (BDS).The Organizational Unit Parents BDS lists
the direct parent of each org unit withinyour organization and the DateDeleted column
captures the date when the parent-child relationshipwas deleted.
This field is null if the relationship hasn'tbeen deleted.
The Data Hub Feature is available to all clients.To enable, grant the Can Access Brightspace
Data Sets permission to administrators atthe org level and ensure that the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version
configuration variable is set to version 8.New and changed data sets appear the first
time the data set runs after the version update.
The adoption period for Brightspace Data SetsMajor Version 8, announced in January 2023
/Version 20.23.1, has ended.Version 8 is now the only supported version
and any clients who are still using Version7 will be automatically migrated.
Clients using Insights Report Builder mustupdate any DataFlows, reports, and dashboards
that use the data sets impacted by the versionupdate. Anything mapped to BDS Version 7 will
continue to function but will have outdateddata.
The Data Hub part of this feature is availableto all clients. To enable, grant the Can Access
Brightspace Data Sets permission to administratorsat the org level and ensure that the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version
configuration variable is set to version 8.New and changed data sets appear the first
time the data set runs after the version update.Insights Report Builder is available to clients
who have the Performance+ package or who havepurchased Brightspace Insights in the previous
packaging model. To enable, ensure that theCan Manage Insights Report Builder permission
is enabled for administrators at the org level.For more information about this version update,
refer to Motivations behind the changes inData Hub Brightspace Data Set (BDS) Major
Version 8 in Brightspace Community.
Previously introduced in April 2023 / Version20.23.4 as an opt-in feature, this release
sets the default state of the d2l.Tools.Discuss.CreateExperienceOptInconfiguration variable setting to ON.
Administrators can choose to override thischange ahead of this release by overriding
the default setting of this configurationvariable and setting it to OFF.
The ON (Opt-In) value remains available toallow users to choose their experience and
let administrators opt in their organizationor specific areas.
The Discussions feature is available to allclients and is automatically enabled.
With this release, the New Quiz Creation Experiencereaches the end of the adoption phase of feature
development and becomes the only editing experiencefor all customers. The New Quiz Creation Experience
is therefore set to on as the default withno option to opt out.
The d2l.Tools.Quizzes.CreateExperienceOptInconfiguration variable no longer appears and
cannot be updated by site administrators.
The Quizzes feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
This release updates the quiz creation andquiz taking experiences to simplify existing
workflows. For Instructors, these changesinclude:
Prevent the student from making further changesis now Automatically submit the quiz attempt,
which hands in quizzes on enforced time limitquizzes at the end of the set time.
Allow the student to continue working is nowFlag the attempt as exceeded time limit and
allow the learner to continue working.
Outdated options such as Grace Period andAllow student to continue working but automatically
score zero have been removed to further streamlinethe quiz creation process. Any existing and
in-progress quizzes that include these settingsare changed to the following new behavior:
Grace Period quizzes now use the set timelimit, if applicable.
Quizzes scored as zero when the time limitwas exceeded now are set to submit the learner's
quiz attempt automatically.
The Timing & Display section displays summaryinformation in either collapsed or expanded
view. The updated settings allow instructorsto choose if they want to set a time limit
by selecting the Set time limit checkbox.If Set time limit is selected, instructors
can add a Time Limit and edit the Timer Settings.
This feature also adds updates for learners:The Option to show or hide the timer. The
learner’s choice for this setting is preservedacross all quizzes.
Warnings displayed at certain times to supportawareness of time left (1 minute, 5 minutes,
and half the elapsed time remaining). Quiztime limits must be at least 10 minutes for
the 5-minute warning, and at least 20 minutesfor the half-elapsed time warning.
Option to review quiz instructions and detailswithout leaving the quiz.
Lastly, simplified Quiz Results (previouslyknown as Submission View) page appears when
viewing quiz results. This page appears whena learner completes a quiz attempt or returns
later to view their quiz results.
The Quizzes feature implements the followingPIE Items:
D576, D583, D2860, D4106, D4145, D6731, D8816,and D9798 (Automatically submit all quiz attempts);
D462 (Replace Final and Adjusted Final witheditable grade column);
D779, D3514, D3627, D6359, D6516, D6904, D7742,and D8038 (Improved timeout warning settings
for quizzes);D1552, D4450, D7473, D9257, and D9656 (Date
and Time restrictions); andD461 and D516 (Grace Period changes).
Thank you to all those who put forward thesePIE suggestions to implement this feature!
The quizzes feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
Starting on June 29th, 2023, Video Assignmentsincludes the new AI Coach, which reviews a
learner’s video and shares tips and feedbackaround opportunities for improvement, areas
of excellence, and unique facets to what theyhave presented.
AI Coach provides specific examples from alearner’s transcript to support each of
those areas.
The Video Assignments feature is availableto all Premium Video Assignment clients and
is automatically enabled. For more informationabout this feature, refer to the Bongo Release
Notes.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Download a file with an empty filename usinga new configuration variable in Assignments.
With Brightspace Editor, edited images aresaved with their original names to improve
ease of location.SIS Course Merge Log Brightspace Data Set
has been added to Data Hub.
In Discover, filters are available for semesterand custom org unit type. In addition, pending
enrollment request alerts are now includedin multiple tools and widgets.
Consistent settings and interface of availabilitydates across Brightspace with Discussions.
Migration Log information limited to the last90 days' data to improve user-friendliness
in LTI.Outcomes Management adds the Save and Close
button to Settings.And finally, language term change in French
and Canadian French language packs in theRubrics tool.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights. As before, you can get the full
details of this month’s changes in the July2023 / Version 20.23.7 Release Notes on Brightspace
Community. See you next month!

title: Access the LOR | Learner

captions.text: This video explains how to access the LOR as a learner in Brightspace.
The Learning Object Repository (LOR) is a great place to search for course materials that support your learning.
Your instructor can add resources like documents, videos, podcasts, and more that enhance your Brightspace experience.
On your course homepage, navigate to the LOR.
Depending on how your course is set up, the LOR can be located in your navbar or in the Admin Tools menu.
There are multiple ways to search the LOR. You can perform a search by navigating through either of the following:
In the Search For field, enter the name or keyword for the resource you want to find.
Click Search to be shown resources linked to your search.
You can also click Advanced Search to filter and add details to your search.
In the Explore a Repository section, click the name of any repository to be taken to the Results page.
Once you have entered the selected repository, the Search Filters panel can be found on the left-hand side.
Choose any of the filters to customize your search.
For example, by selecting a keyword from the Search Filters panel, objects are filtered and displayed on the right-hand side.
Select Show Details to learn more about a specific learning object. The details include the object’s Type, Keywords, and Identifier.

title: Create a Randomized Set of Quiz Questions | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains how to create a quiz with a set of randomized questions.
Randomizing quiz questions ensures that learners receive a unique set of questions, reducing instances of cheating.
In the Content module where you want to create your quiz, click Create New > Quiz.
On the New Quiz page, enter your quiz details.
Click Create New and click Question Pool.
Enter your question pool details.
Click Browse Question Library and select all the questions you want included in your quiz.
Click Import and then click Save.
After applying any additional details to your quiz, switch your quiz’s Visibility from Hidden to Visible and click Save and Close.
Your quiz appears in the Quizzes tool and your chosen module.

title: June 2023/20.23.6 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the June 2023 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe June 2023 Version 20.23.6 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
With Assignments, availability dates are nowon by default.
Create a full presentation from your browserwith Capture Web and create greater accessibility
for your images with the Hotspot element,all in Creator+.
The Quizzes tool features improved workflowsfor large quizzes.
And finally, a summary of the all the otherfeatures this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
This release sets the configuration variabled2l.Tools.Dropbox.ConsistentDatesEnabled default
to ON.
This builds upon the improvements to the Assignmentstool's availability dates that were introduced
in the 20.22.12 release, allowing instructorsgreater control over the access and visibility
of their assignments.
Previously, the configuration variable's defaultstate was OFF.
Administrators can opt out of this featureafter the release sets the configuration variable's
default behavior.
The Assignments feature is available to allclients.
The change to the configuration variable isautomatically enabled.
Note that the new Assignments availabilitydate experience is scheduled to become the
default experience in the 20.23.12 release.
Capture Web is a new Creator+ tool which enablesusers to create full presentations from their
browser without the need to download a desktopclient.
It includes both screen capture and mixedcamera-and-screen presentations.
Previously, Capture required users to downloada desktop client that is only supported on
macOS and Windows.
As a result, Capture is not available on manyplatforms, including Chrome books.
Capture Web is scheduled to replace the existingCapture App.
Users that downloaded the app can continueto launch it from their desktop.
Navigate to Media Library and click CreateRecording.
Then set your camera input and audio settings.
Click Share Screen and select what you wantto share.
Click Start Recording to begin the recording.
You can Pause and Resume recording at anytime by clicking Pause Recording or Resume
Recording.
This feature is available to all clients withCreator+ and is automatically enabled for
Capture users.
The initial release of Capture Web supportsFirefox, Chrome, and Microsoft Edge for desktop.
Mobile browsers and Safari are not supported.
Hotspot is a new element for HTML Contentpages launched through Brightspace Editor's
Insert Element.
Learners can select hotspot icons associatedwith a part of an image to open a modal window
with additional learning about the image.
Hotspots can include a variety of contenttypes, including text, images, videos, or
links.
Up to nine hotspots can be added to a singleimage, and hotspot markers can be customized
in style and color.
Grid overlay allows images to be fully accessiblewith the integration of micro alt tags.
In Brightspace Editor, navigate to Other InsertOptions > Insert Element > Hotspot.
After adding your image, click on it to adda Hotspot.
Add text, links, or visual content in theHotspot Content field.
Click Hotspot Marker to change the style andcolor of your hotspot.
Once completed, click Hotspots to return tothe hotspot selection option.
This feature is available to all clients withCreator+ wherever Insert Element is available
and is automatically enabled.
This feature updates instructors' workflowsfor large quizzes in two ways:
Firstly, Instructors can now use the LoadMore button on the initial page load if a
quiz has more than 200 questions, sections,and/or question pools.
List operations such as moving or adding newquestions function normally, though Instructors
must click the Load More button to revealthe updated list.
Secondly, instructors can now select multipleitems and use drag and drop to rearrange the
question list.
Navigate to Manage Quizzes and select a quiz.
Click the Load More button to load up to 200additional questions.
Click the checkboxes to select multiple questions,and then drag and drop them to the desired
location.
The Quizzes feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Assignments features an accessible RubricConfirmation dialog box in Consistent Evaluation
experience, as well as consistent settingsand interface of availability dates across
Brightspace.
With Course Import, Course Groups are addedto Course Import and Export packages.
Improved Import and Export of Gradebook settingsin Course Import.
Easily convert layouts with the new conversionfeature in Creator+.
Data Hub adds the Session History BrightspaceData Set.
Improved course description search is availablein Discover.
Access to external data is restricted whenimpersonating other users with Google Workspace.
And lastly, improved access and enablementfor Auditor Tool and Bulk Auditor functions
in User and Role Management.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the June 2023 / Version
20.23.6 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: Create Presentations with Capture Web | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains how to create a presentation with Capture Web.
Capture Web enables full presentation capture from your browser without the need to download a desktop client.
This includes both screen capture and mixed camera and screen presentations.
Capture Web is available with the purchase of Creator+.
In Media Library, click Create Recording.
Click Change Inputs to change your camera input, your audio input, and to test your audio.
Switch your camera on or off by clicking the Camera toggle.
Click Share Screen and select a tab in your browser, a window, or your entire screen to display during your recording. Then, click Share.
Click Start Recording to begin your presentation.
You can pause your recording by selecting Pause Recording and continue your presentation by selecting Resume Recording.
Click Finish Recording to end your presentation.
Add a title.
Click Caption Settings and select Generate Captions to add subtitles to your video.
In the Language drop-down, select the language in which you recorded your presentation.
Click Save and Close.

title: May 2023/20.23.5 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the May 2023 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe May 2023 Version 20.23.5 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Using the Awards tool, users can add criteriato badges that are in compliance with the
latest Open Badges Standard.
As a subscriber to End User Support, userscan access the new Brightspace Virtual Assistant.
In Discussions, the new Discussions creationexperience now defaults to On (Opt-In).
Using the Learning Outcomes tool, instructorscan now select the appropriate achievement
scales for a course.
And finally, a summary of all the other featuresthis month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Instructors can now specify what a learnermust do to achieve a particular award by using
a new required Criteria field in compliancewith Open Badges 2.0 standard from 1EdTech
(formerly known as IMS Global).
Previously, there was no mandatory criteriafield available in the Awards tool.
When learners shared their awards to Badgr,the same field values were used for both Evidence
and Criteria fields.
The Awards feature implements the followingPIE Item:
D6128 (Awards: Incorporate Open Badge 2.1Standards)
Thank you to Eric Floyd for putting forwardthis PIE suggestion to implement this feature!
The Awards feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
Brightspace Virtual Assistant provides a newcontextual help tool that is integrated into
Brightspace.
With this tool, users can ask questions aboutBrightspace directly within their course and
receive persona-specific documentation fromBrightspace Community.
If further assistance is needed, users cango to the Community to find additional resources,
or contact Support by either email, messaginga live agent, or by phone.
Note that phone support is not available forclients that have Basic End User Support Entitlements.
End users can receive support in all 4 EUS-supportedlanguages, including Canadian English, Canadian
French, Spanish, and Brazilian Portuguese.
Note that language is controlled by a user’sLocale settings in Brightspace.
If a user’s chosen Language and Locale settingis not supported, then the default language
is English.
As a learner or instructor, click Get Help.
Select I have a different question to typein your own question and receive persona-specific
documentation.
Virtual Assistant connects you directly withthe help you need.
Brightspace Virtual Assistant is availableto all clients with an End User Support (EUS)
subscription.
To enable this feature, contact your EUS Manager.
If you do not currently subscribe to EUS,contact your D2L Account Team for more information
about EUS packages.
To encourage user adoption of the new Discussionscreation experience, the default state for
the experience is now On (Opt-in) with theoption to opt out.
Previously, the new Discussions creation experiencewas turned Off by default.
Note that Administrators can avoid this changeby adding appropriate organization and course
level overrides to the configuration variabled2l.Tools.Discuss.CreateExperienceOptIn.
The Discussions feature is available to allclients and is automatically enabled.
To learn more about the new Discussions creationexperience, refer to the Introducing the New
Discussion Creation Experience article inBrightspace Community.
With this release, Instructors can now evaluatelearners’ achievements related to learning
outcomes by selecting the appropriate achievementscales within a course offering.
Note that Administrators must create achievementscales for courses at the organization level
before instructors can select them.
Instructors can select alternative achievementscales for a course until assessment evaluation
begins.
Previously, only a single achievement scalecould be selected for all courses across any
organization.
Navigate to Course Administration and clickStandards.
Note that Standards can also be displayedas Learning Outcomes, depending on how your
administrator has configured achievement scales.
Click Edit Settings, select an alternativeachievement scale, and click Save.
The Learning Outcomes feature implements thefollowing PIE items:
D6605 (Set a different Achievement Scale perCourse offering); and
D9382 (Set a different Learning Outcomes achievementscale per program)
Thank you to Joost Nordeloos and Lynn Wardfor putting forward these PIE suggestions
to implement this feature!
This feature is available to all clients whouse both Mastery View in Grades and Learning
Outcomes.
To enable, ensure that the Manage Outcomespermission is enabled for the desired user
roles.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
In Blog, comments on Blog entries limitedto reduce page load times.
Create dynamic content in a carousel usingInsert Element, and use Layouts to organize
course content, all with Creator+.
With the Email tool, Emails sent from sendersexternal to your organization can be reported
as spam.
In Homepages and Navbars, the Help link pointsto the new Brightspace Community.
Manage Content permission is no longer requiredin Learning Outcomes.
And finally, with Learning Outcomes, the MasteryView table loads faster and includes the activity
counter.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the May 2023 / Version
20.23.5 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: The New Assignments Creation Experience | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains how to create an assignment through Content in Brightspace as an instructor.
The new Assignments creation experience has a fully immersive layout that is consistent with other areas of Brightspace.
To enable the new Assignments creation experience, the configuration variable d2l.Tools.Dropbox.CreateExperienceOptIn must be set to ON.
In Content, in the module where you want to create your assignment, click Create New and select Assignment.
On the assignment creation page, enter a Name, Grade Out Of, Due Date, and Instructions for your assignment.
In the Availability Dates & Conditions menu, enter a Start Date and End Date.
Click Add Release Condition to add a release condition.
Click Manage Special Access to control assignment availability for certain groups of learners.
In the Submission & Completion menu, select the Assignment Type, choose a Category, and choose the assignment Submission Type.
Choose the number of files allowed per submission, allowable file extensions, and how submissions will be kept in Brightspace.
Enter a Notification Email that will receive notifications when learners submit assignments.
In the Evaluation & Feedback menu, click Add Rubric to add a rubric.
Choose to enable or disable Annotation Tools and Anonymous Marking by selecting the respective check boxes.
Toggle the visibility for your assignment from Hidden to Visible if desired and click Save and Close.
