for an in-depth look at the feature and
capability changes refer to the
introducing the new discussion creation
experience knowledge article on
brightspace community
this feature introduces a confirmation
dialog box to Learners closing
in-progress quizzes the dialog box is
context based providing additional
information about the impact of exiting
a quiz such as whether a learner will be
able to return to their quiz After
exiting or that any quiz timers will
continue to run
note that the dialogue only appears when
the learner selects the X close the quiz
button for the quiz closing the browser
window or tab does not display the
confirmation dialog
previously there was no dialogue or
warning to Learners who exited a quiz
accidentally or on purpose
exit the quiz in the exit quiz dialogue
in the exit quiz dialog click exit to
return to the quiz summary pair while
taking a quiz click the x button to exit
the quiz
feature implements the following Pi item
d7289 close or exit for Zero's
Corrections thank you to all those who
put forward this pie suggestion to
implement this feature
the quizzes feature is available to all
clients and is automatically enabled
we hope you enjoyed this month's release
highlights as before you can get the
full details of this month's changes in
the April 2023 version
20.23.4 release notes on brightspace
community see you next month
[Music]
foreign

title: Use Discussions for Journaling | Instructor

captions.text: This video demonstrates how to create private groups in the Discussions tool where learners can keep a journal.
You can create private groups with restricted discussion areas for learners to journal. Journal posts can be graded per entry or over time.
Before beginning, make sure your administrator has the following configuration variables enabled:
d2l.Tools.Groups.AllowSingleUserNamedGroups
d2l.Tools.Discuss.EnableGroupFilteredTopics
In the Groups tool, in Manage Groups, click New Category.
Enter a name and description for the category.
Click the Enrollment Type menu and select Single user, member-specific groups.
In the Additional Options section, click Set up discussion areas.
Select an existing discussion topic or create a new topic.
Click the forum drop-down menu to select where your discussion will live or create a new Forum if required.
Note that you can only create group-restricted threads for empty topics without existing posts or group restrictions.
When you’re done, click Save.
To create a journal group, from Discussions, click the Actions menu of the topic you want to create groups in and click Edit Topic.
In the Availability Dates & Conditions accordion, click Manage Restrictions.
Click Restrict topic and separate threads and select the group you want to restrict the topic to.
When you’re done, click Add.
In the Evaluation & Feedback accordion, select the Allow evaluation of individual posts to evaluate learners’ posts individually.
Select a Calculation Method.
Click Save and Close.

title: Make Content Topics Visible by Default | Administrator

captions.text: This video explains how to make content topics visible by default in the New Content Experience as an administrator.
By making content topics automatically visible, instructors no longer need to toggle topics’ Visibility.
Content can always be visible to learners to prevent confusion when topics are hidden.
On your organizational homepage, navigate to Admin Tools and click Config Variable Browser.
In the Config Variable Browser, go to d2l.Tools.Content.Lessons.NewTopicsAreVisibleByDefault.
To cascade the configuration for org unit types like semesters and departments, under Cascading Org Unit Types, click Edit.
Select the Org Unit Type you desire and click Save and Close.
To add a specific org unit, under Override Values, click Add Value.
Enter the Org Unit ID or click Select Org Unit to search for an org unit.
Change the Value to ON and click Save.

title: February 2023/20.23.2 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the February 2023 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe February 2023 Version 20.23.2 Release
Notes, which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Easily find audio-video content with the newFilter by Owner Names filter in Media Library.
In Data Hub, the TurnItIn Submissions BrightspaceData Set has updated the data type for the
FileId column, and the Quiz Objects BrightspaceData Set has added the PagingTypeId column.
Keep track of changes to assessed rubricswith enhanced visual cues using the Rubrics
tool.
And finally, a summary of changes for allthe other features this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
To help administrators more easily sort andfind content, Media Library is updated to
include a filter for sorting by a specificcreator.
The new Ownership filter allows finding andpotentially updating the creators for large
groups of content.
Administrators can now quickly find creators’videos and audio for transferring ownership
or performing bulk actions.
Previously, there was no way to filter orsearch by creator.
In the Media Library landing page, click theFilters button to expand the drop-down menu.
Click Ownership and enter the name into thesearch field.
You can also enter partial search terms.
Click the Search button (the Magnifying glass)to apply the filter to the search results
below.
The Media Library feature is available toall clients and is automatically enabled for
all administrator users with the Can ManageAll Objects and relevant user management permissions.
Turning now to our Data Hub features, in theTurnItIn Submissions Brightspace Data Set,
the data type of the FileId column is nowBigInt.
Previously, the data type for FileId was Int.
This change allows a larger value with upto eight bytes to be saved, as the previous
four-bytes limit is too small for some largerorganizations.
This Data Hub feature is available to allclients.
To enable, ensure that the Can Access BrightspaceData Sets permission is granted to administrators
at the org level, and that the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Versionconfiguration variable is set to version 7
or 8.
Note that New and changed data sets appearthe first time the data set runs after the
version update.
The Brightspace Data Set for Quiz Objectsnow includes a new value for the PagingTypeID
column to support two new paging options ofeither 5 questions per page or 10 questions
per page.
The possible values for PagingTypeID are asfollows:
Uses classic quiz creation paging = NULLAll questions on one page = 0
1 question per page = 1Page breaks after each section = 2
5 questions per page = 3; and10 questions per page = 4
This Data Hub feature is available to allclients.
To enable, ensure that the Can Access BrightspaceData Sets permission is granted to administrators
at the org level and the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Versionconfiguration variable is set to version 7
or 8.
Note that New and changed data sets appearthe first time the data set runs after the
version update.
To maintain the integrity of assessments,any rubric that has been used to assess a
grade item is locked.
However, as it may be necessary to add orupdate the text or criteria levels on a rubric
without changing any points, these changescan be made after the rubric has been locked.
This feature, building on the Rubrics – Clarifygrading criteria by editing text fields in
assessed rubrics feature released in November2022, grants users enhanced visual cues to
keep track of changes made.
In Rubrics, navigate to a locked Rubric youwish to edit and select a grid box.
Enter the changes you wish to make.
Once completed, navigate away from the gridbox by clicking elsewhere on the page.
Any changed areas are highlighted blue andlabelled as “Edited”.
The Rubrics feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
This feature addresses the following accessibilityimpacts:
WCAG 2.1 Success Criterion 1.3.3 (SensoryCharacteristics); and
WCAG 2.1 Success Criterion 1.4.1 (Use of Color)
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Intelligent Agents now features Support forcopying One-Time Run agents.
Improved D2L standard CSV Delete functionin IPSIS.
In Learner Experience, users can now marka topic as complete.
LTI features improved Grades Associationsfor LTI 1.3.
Support has been added to allow for Bulk Actionsin Media Library.
Additional paging options now in the Quizzestool.
And lastly, the Quizzes tool now allows youto add quiz availability dates to your Calendar.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the February 2023
/ Version 20.23.2 Release Notes on BrightspaceCommunity.
See you next month!

title: Enable the New Content (Lessons) Experience | Administrator

captions.text: This video explains how to enable the New Content Experience (Lessons) as an administrator in Brightspace.
Lessons provides an intuitive way for instructors to create engaging content for learners.
On your organizational homepage, navigate to Course Admin and click Config Variable Browser.
In the Config Variable Browser, select Tools > Content > UseLessonsExperience.
Click Add Value.
Enter the Org Unit ID or click Select Org Unit to add a course.
Change the Value to ON and click Save.

title: New Quiz Experience | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains the features for the New Quiz Experience in Brightspace.
Creating a quiz using the new quiz experience provides a fully immersive layout that lets you determine every detail for your quiz.
Enter a Name, Grade Out Of, and Due Date for your quiz.
You can add your quiz to your Grade Book and you can also choose to write a Description.
For Availability Dates & Conditions, select a Start Date and End Date for your quiz.
Click the Add availability dates to Calendar checkbox to add your quiz dates to your Calendar.
You can add Release Conditions, Manage Special Access, set a Password, and control users’ IP Restrictions.
Under Timing & Display, set a time limit for your quiz.
Control how questions are displayed by adjusting your quiz’s Paging and choosing to shuffle quiz questions.
You can also display hints to learners and disable email, instant messages, and alerts within Brightspace while they take the quiz.
If desired, you can add a header or footer to your quiz.
For Attempts and Completion, click Manage Attempts to set how many times learners can take your quiz.
You can add your quiz to a Category, if desired.
Enter an email address if you want to receive email notifications when learners complete your quiz.
You can also Manage Completion Tracking for your quiz if you want learners to meet specific conditions when they finish a quiz.
Under Evaluation & Feedback, set publication options for your quiz, like auto-publish quiz results and display a grade and specific questions when learners submit their quiz.
Customize Quiz Results Displays lets you edit how quiz results are shown to learners.
Manage Learning Objectives lets you add learning objectives to your quiz.

title: Enable Self Enrollment for Users in Discover | Administrator

captions.text: This video explains how an administrator can enable users to self-enroll in courses in Discover.
Enabling self-enrollment for Discover reduces the enrollment configuration process for administrators and allows users to decide freely what courses they want to take based on course availability.
On your organizational homepage, click Admin Tools and select Roles and Permissions.
From the Role List, select Student or the name for learners in your organization.
On the Edit Permissions page, from the Filter by Tool drop-down list, select Discover. Click Apply Filter.
For the permission Access Discover, select All. Click Save and Close.

title: Create Presentations with Capture App | Instructor

captions.text: Brightspace Creator+ subscribers can create a presentation by launching the Capture App from the Media Library.
Create Presentation provides a simple way to capture your screen and webcam for quick demonstrations and presentations and then add them to Media Library.
Before you start recording, in the Media Library, select the Options (...) button to select your preference for HD or SD recording (to a maximum of 720p).
Set your Security and Privacy settings to allow the Capture App to access your camera, microphone, and screen recording.
Click Add and select Create Presentation.
Click Launch and then click Record.
Add a title and description for your recording.
And then choose a layout.
Select Camera and Screen to create a video using the combination of webcam and desktop feed. This option enables you to switch the view between both feeds.
Select Camera to create a video using the feed from your webcam.
Select Screen to create a video using the feed from your desktop.
Click Start to begin your recording.
When you finish your recording, click Finish.

title: Creating Approval Workflows in Discover | Administrator

captions.text: The approval workflows function provides organizations with the ability to create a basic approval request process.
Students will be able to apply for courses and be advised of their acceptance or rejection.
Administrators can set up discoverable courses with a request approval action that can be approved or rejected by approvers.
Approvers can: Review a list of learner requests and approve or deny those requests to manage course enrollment.
Approve enrollment requests with the permission Approve enrollment requests.
In the Role List for your Approver role, ensure that the following permissions are enabled at the org level:
Access Discover and Approve Enrollment Requests
To configure a course to use approval workflows, navigate to a course’s Course Offering Information and select Discover.
Enable the permission Require approval for self-enrollment requests.

title: Share Awards with a Public Link | Learner

captions.text: This video explains how to showcase your achievements by sharing the Awards you earn as a learner in Brightspace
Share your awards directly with a public URL, which can be copied to social media or to a digital resume to highlight your achievements and skills
From your course homepage, navigate to Awards
Then click the Share option for the award you want to share
In the Share My Award dialog, click Create Link. Then do one of the following:
Click Copy Link to copy your link and use it to link to your award on a resume or other document
Click the Open this link in a new window icon to open the link in a new tab
The new tab follows the Open Badges standard to show your award’s image, title, description, criteria, issuer, issued date and expiration date, and your name

title: Classlist Overview | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains how to use the Classlist tool as an instructor in Brightspace
The Classlist tool is a directory of names, emails, and group settings that provide you with quick access to the full list of users in your course
On your course homepage, navigate to Classlist
The icons above your Classlist allow you to perform multiple functions
Email lets you email one or more users
Instant Message allows you to send an instant message to one or more users
Print lets you print your classlist
Select the checkbox on the left side of a user’s name to perform any of these functions
Enrollment Statistics provide a breakdown of the roles users hold in your course with enrollment and withdrawal statistics
Email Classlist lets you send a mass email to all the users in your course. Click Send Email to email your class.
Click on any user’s name to prompt the Compose New Message dialog
If you click on the drop-down menu beside a user’s name, you can choose from a variety of options like viewing their progress and sending them an email

title: Enable ReadSpeaker | Administrator

captions.text: This video explains how to enable and disable ReadSpeaker as an administrator in Brightspace
ReadSpeaker improves course accessibility by providing a text-to-speech solution for Brightspace content
ReadSpeaker is off by default and can be turned off or on using the configuration variable: d2l.3rdParty.ReadSpeaker.Enabled
On your organizational homepage, click Admin Tools and click Config Variable Browser
Under All Variables, click 3rdParty.
Click ReadSpeaker
Click Enabled
Click Add Value to add an org unit
Enter the Org Unit ID or click Select Org Unit
Click Update
Set the Value to ON and click Save

title: Announcements Overview | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains how to use the Announcements tool as an instructor in Brightspace
Help boost engagement by scheduling announcements for frequent and regular communication to all learners enrolled in a course
Learners can set notification preferences to be made aware of important updates
On your course homepage, navigate to Course Tools and click Announcements
Click New Announcement
Enter a Headline
Enter a description in the Content textbox
Set a Start Date and an End Date
If desired, add attachments or release conditions to your announcement
Click Publish

title: Configuring Widgets | Administrator

captions.text: This video explains how to configure widgets as an administrator in Brightspace
Enabling different widgets provides instructors with additional ways to present learning resources to students and improve student engagement with their course
The example we will use today to demonstrate the workflow is the Work To Do widget
Administrators with the Can See/Edit Config Variable Values permission can configure widgets in the Config Variable Browser found in the Admin Tools menu
For the Work To Do widget, administrators can enable date ranges using the configuration variables:
d2l.Tools.WorkToDo.OverdueWeekLimit d2l.Tools.WorkToDo.UpcomingWeekLimit
On your organizational homepage, click Admin Tools and click Config Variable Browser
Under All Variables, click Tools and then click WorkToDo
Customize the date ranges for the OverdueWeekLimit and UpcomingWeekLimit config variables by clicking on either, setting the Org Value, and clicking Save

title: How to Take a Quiz | Learner

captions.text: This video explains how to take a quiz as a learner in Brightspace
On your course homepage, navigate to Quizzes
Click on the quiz you want to take
Click Start Quiz, and make sure you view the instructions before starting
Answer the questions and click Next Page to move on to the next question
Sometimes instructors restrict moving back to previous questions in a quiz.
Make sure to see how your instructor wants you take your quiz
Your quiz questions automatically save after each response
When you're done, click Submit Quiz
Click Submit Quiz again if you are sure you are done your quiz
Your instructor may publish quiz results immediately and allow you to view the marking for each question immediately
Click done after reviewing your responses

title: Create a Discussion Post | Learner

captions.text: This video explains how to create and delete a discussion post as a learner in Brightspace
To find a discussion post, navigate to Content.
Alternatively, click on Discussions
Under Content, locate the discussion post you want to answer and click on it
If you want to start a new thread, click on Start a New Thread or click on a thread to a reply to it.
Click Reply to Thread to reply to a thread
In the Brightspace Editor box, begin to write your discussion post
You can use Brightspace Editor to change the text style, font, text size, text alignment, list format, and text colour
If you want to insert media, click Insert Stuff. You can choose between options like Add Video Note, Video Note Search, YouTube, Flickr, Insert Link, and Enter Embed Code
If you navigate to the + button, you can also insert things like an equation, table, images, attributes, divider, emoji, symbol, or code
You can also enlarge Brightspace Editor by clicking on the fullscreen button; and you can minimize the screen by clicking the same fullscreen button
You can choose to Subscribe to this thread if you want to receive notifications about other posts users create in the same thread
If you want to add attachments to your discussion post, like a Word document, click the Add attachment button
From there, you can choose to upload a file, record video or audio, or choose an existing file from your Brightspace account
When you are finished with your discussion post, click Post
If you want to delete a thread or discussion post that you created, click the dropdown button beside your post title and select Delete Thread or Delete Post.

title: Adding the Work to Do Widget To Your Homepage | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains how to add the Work To Do widget to your homepage as an instructor in Brightspace
The Work To Do widget keeps students up to date on coursework, assignments, and quizzes
The Work To Do widget must be enabled for you to access it from the System Widgets list
You must have a widget-based homepage set up for your course and permissions to edit homepages
Ensure you have set due dates for all learning activities in your course that you want to appear to learners in the Work To Do widget
At the bottom of your course homepage, click the Homepage Actions Menu
Click Edit this Homepage
In the Widgets area, click Add Widgets
Click System Widget
Select the Work To Do checkbox
Click Add
Drag and drop the widget to the desired location on your homepage
Click Save and Close

title: Grades Tool Overview

captions.text: The Grades tool is a series of features usedto create and manage your Grade Book.
From the organizational homepage, select thedesired course using the My Courses Widget
or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page.
From your course level Navbar, select Grades to access the Grades tool.
You can also access the Grades tool through your Course Admin link if you do not have the Grades link on your course Navbar.
There are five key points of navigation in the Grades tool to help you create and manage your Grade Book.
The Enter Grades tab is used to review your student's grades, Import and Export your Grade Book to either Excel or .csv,
grade student assessments, and manually enter or override grades.
You can also Edit Display Settings and the Event Log.
See video titled "Grades Tool – Enter Grades" for more details.
The Managed Grades tab is used to create newgrade categories and grade items.
You can also Bulk Edit your Grade Book, Reorder,and view the Event Log.
See video titled "Grades Tool – Manage Grades" for more detail.
Schemes are used to review available grading schemes that have been shared from a higher level in the organization.
You can also Create and Edit custom gradingschemes in this area, including the ability to Copy and Delete.
See video titled "Grades Tool – Schemes" for more details.
The Setup Wizard includes a seven-step SetupWizard to help guide you through initial Grade Book configuration.
See the video titled "Grades Tool – Setup Wizard" for further details.
Use the Settings icon to configure your display and calculation options,
such as Personal Display Options, Org Unit Display Options, and Calculation Options.
For more detail, please refer to the videotitled "Grades Tool – Settings".

title: Grades Tool – Enter Grades Part 1

captions.text: From the organizational homepage, select thedesired course using the My Courses widget
or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page.
From your course level Navbar, select Grades to access the Grades tool.
You can also access the grades tool through your Course Admin link if you do not have the gradeslink on your course Navbar.
From the Grades tool, select Enter Grades under the top navigation bar.
The Enter Grades tab provides an overall view of all learner grades as well as their grade category
(for example, quizzes and assignments), as well as grade items, (for example, week one quiz.)
Instructors can use the enter grades tab to:
Import or Export a Grade Book; use the filter to View by User, which will show the entire class roster
or by group or section, if applicable to the course.
Click Apply to set the desired filter.
Communicate with learners easily and send email in bulk to selected students by clicking the box beside their name,
or by clicking the uppermost box to select all students from the filtered range (for an example, user group or section);
Evaluate student assessments; review and update allGrade Items for the course;
view the Event Log, which can be used to track and review any historical changes to the item such as Scheme Change, Description Change,
Category Change, and more; and hide and show columns.
If your grade book is set to Weighted and does not equal one 100%,
you will see an error stating that the grade book does not sum to 100%.
Verify the total weight of all top level categories and items is 100%.
To correct this, use the Managed Grades area. For more information on managing grades, see Grades tool > Manage Grades.
With Import, instructors can easily import external grades using the Grades tool.
To import grades, click Import at the upper left side of the page.
For reference, a sample grades import file is available on the Import page.
This gives instructors the option to create your Grade Structure, including Grade Items and Grade Categories,
using the sample file rather than using the Managed Grades tool.
Click Choose File to select the import file from your computer's file management system.
Save your file as one of the accepted formats, which are .cvs, .txt, or .tsv format.
If you would like to create a new grade item that does not already exist in the Grade Book, select the checkbox beside Create New Grade Item
when an unrecognized item is referenced.
Click Continue to proceed and you will be guided through detailed steps to complete the import process.
Please note only Numeric, Pass/Fail, Select Box, and Text grade items can be created.
To Export your Grade Book from Brightspace, click the Export button at the upper left.
You can select your entire class roster, individual users, or select groups or sections if applicable,
and then click Apply to select the chosen subset.
Use Key field to define what learner identifier is included in the export (for example Org Defined ID, Username, or Noth).
Org Defined ID is a unique identifier for each learner and this is typically student number.
Select Sort By options, which define how the user identifiers are displayed from left to right in the exportfile.
Use Grade Values to define which grade details are exported, including Points Grade, Weighted Grade, and/or Grade Scheme
to find user details to set which additional identifiers are included in the export (such as Last Name, First Name,
Email, and Group Membership or Enrollment).
Choose Grades to Export to define which grade categories and grade items are included in the export.
Once the desired fields have been verified, select the desired export file type by clicking Export to .csv or Export to Excel.

title: Create a Discussion Forum | Instructor

captions.text: From the Organizational Homepage, select the desired course using the My Courses widget or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page
From your course level navbar, select Discussions to access the Discussions tool
You can also access the Discussions tool through your Course Admin link if you do not have the Discussions tool on your course navbar
Discussion forums organize course discussions topics into categories such as weekly discussions, open discussions, and group discussions.
All discussion topics must have an associated discussion forum.
From the Discussions tool, select the drop-down New > New Forum.
Next, fill out the discussion forum properties.
Provide a discussion forum name, use the Brightspace Editor to add a description, and set forum options
such as anonymous posts, or even make it mandatory for users to post prior before they can see other users' posts.
Select the Restrictions tab to set availability and dates to set when a user can access it.
Add Release Conditions to automate access to the discussion and apply group and section restrictions
All restrictions that are applied to a discussion forum will be applied to all discussion topics within that forum.
Select Save and Close to create the discussion forum or select Save and Add Topic to create a discussion topic within the new forum
To learn about discussion topic creation,  see the next video titled Create a Discussion Topic.

title: March 2022 / 20.22.3 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the March 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe March 2022 Version 20.22.3 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
In Brightspace Insights, the New AssessmentQuality Dashboard is now the default setting,
and features several new additions to improvequality and ease of use.
Brightspace Parent & Guardians boasts an improvedviewing experience on mobile devices when
looking at your child's grades.
Learners can view a list of other users andtheir roles in their courses with the Multi-Profile
Widget, improving their ability to quicklyfind who their instructors, teaching assistants,
and peers are.
Improved ease of setting up Single Sign Onsecurity settings with SAML Administration
— Register an Identity Provider in Brightspace;and finally a Summary of Changes made for
all the other features.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Improving consistency in the Brightspace experience,the new Assessment Quality Dashboard, which
was introduced in December 2021/ version 20.21.12release, is turned on by default.
Administrators can return to the legacy AssessmentQuality Dashboard experience using the configuration
variable d2l.Tools.Insights.AssessmentQuality.EnableNewExperienceand setting it to off.
This configuration variable will be removedin the June 2022 release, making the new Assessment
Quality Dashboard the only option.
This Brightspace Insights feature is availableto all clients and is automatically enabled.
Improving the value of the new AssessmentQuality Dashboard, several new features have
been added this release.
These include:The new Flagged Question card, added to the
Summary area.
When a user clicks this card, it filters theQuiz Details table and displays a "flagged
questions" status indicator at the top ofthe page to indicate that this filter is in
place.
Flagged questions are those that are outsidethe set threshold for acceptable values in
their statistics.
Flagged Quiz Items column has been added tothe Quiz Details table.
The In Question Pool column is added to theQuiz Item Analysis table to indicate if the
item is part of a question pool.
The new ability to link out to the Quiz editpage from the Quiz Item Analysis allows users
to quickly take actions.
Finally, an Exclamation Mark warning iconnow appears next to quiz items that have one
or more flagged questions.
To access the Assessment Quality Dashboard,Navigate to Insights Portal -> Assessment
Quality Dashboard.
Click the number link in the Flagged QuizArea to filter the results by flagged items.
The filter appears above.
You can navigate to a Quiz’s details byclicking on it in the table.
The Brightspace Insights feature is availableto all clients who have the Performance Plus
package or who have purchased BrightspaceInsights in the previous packaging model.
This feature is automatically enabled.
When viewing Brightspace Parent On mobiledevices, the focus of the page automatically
moves down to the grades area, which is filteredaccording to the course you selected.
Previously, there was no visual aid to indicatethat selecting a course triggered a filter
for the grades displayed.
This feature only affects viewing on mobiledevices; desktop instances of Parent & Guardian
are unaffected.
Navigate to View All Grades, then select thecourse you wish to view.
The dashboard filters the grades area by thecourse selected.
It is only possible to select one course optionat a time.
To select a different course, return to thecourse list, clear your choice, and then select
a different course.
The Brightspace Parent & Guardian featureis available to all Core clients and is automatically
enabled.
It has the following accessibility impacts:WCAG 2.1 Success criterion: 1.4.10 Reflow
and 2.4.3 Focus Order.
The new Multi-Profile Widget retrieves userinformation from both User Profiles and Classlist
to display a list of users in the Course andtheir roles to learners.
This gives learners the ability to quicklyidentify which users have which role in their
course.
Learners can use the widget to view theirinstructors, peers, and other users and quickly
understand their role in the course.
The following options are available to Administrators:Customize Widget Heading allows for the creation
of a unique heading for the widget.
Display Roles lets administrators select rolesto display in the widget (for example, Instructors,
Facilitators, etc.)
Create Categories allows administrators togroup roles based on function (for example,
Facilitators and Instructors grouped withina category called Course Leaders).
Categories are fully customizable.
Lastly, Display Profile Fields selects theprofile fields to display in the widget.
Instructors can use the administrator functionsfor their courses.
In addition, they can do the following:Under Display Profile Fields, select Display
My Profile Only to switch to a single profileview.
Update User Settings to remove users froman instance of the widget; change a user's
category; and/or reorder the appearance ofusers.
Finally, Edit Custom Course Information allowsinstructors to add custom text for the course
(for example, office hours, area of interest,and important links).
The Multi-Profile Widget feature is availableas part of the Homepage Widget Expansion Pack.
This widget is deployed by D2L Learning andCreative Services.
The SAML Administration user interface isnow available for administrators that allows
registration of an identity provider for theirSingle Sign On (SSO) of choice.
Previously, this task required the assistanceof D2L Support.
From the Admin Tools menu, access the SAMLAdministration tool.
The SAML Administration tool consists of threemain areas:
Identity Providers allows you to Add, Edit,and Delete Identity Providers.
Click Add Identity Provider and then Fillin the corresponding fields.
Once you are completed, click Save.
You can also Set the Default Brightspace Login Experience and Troubleshoot issues by enabling
SAML logging.
Set the Default Brightspace Log in ExperienceTroubleshoot issues by enabling SAML logging
The SAML Administration Feature is availableto all clients.
To enable, ensure that the necessary administratorroles are granted the Security tool > Manage
SAML Authentication permission.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
New announcements can be quickly created fromexisting ones with Announcements – Create
announcements with new Copy option.
Show and Hide interface updated to be consistentacross the platform with Brightspace Learning
Environment – Improved layout of show/hideinterface.
Learners can study offline by downloadingHTML and other Content with Content – New
Learner Experience now supports Print & Downloadfor all file types.
Users can navigate away from Upload page andperform other tasks while media uploads, as
part of Content – Workflow improvementsto creating media topics.
Users can quickly find enrolled or withdrawnusers by various filters with Data Hub – Enrollments
& Withdrawals ADS includes Org Unit filter.
Content – Redundant activity type no longerappears on course cards, as Course is the
only type of activity currently availablein Discover.
And lastly, use and avoid conflict with nativereview processes with SCORM — Optional custom
review/retake process.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the March 2022 / Version
20.22.3 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: Teaching Tips - Customize Content Paths Using Release Conditions - Instructor

captions.text: Create a responsive content path for learnersby scaling, personalizing, and staggering
the flow of information using release conditions.
This tutorial shows an example of how to customizecontent paths by using release conditions
in Brightspace Learning Environment.
Release conditions are available in many tools,such as Awards, Discussion forums and topics,
and Intelligent Agents.
In Content you can prepare learners for anassessment by scaling the flow of information
by attaching a release condition to individualtopics as well as larger containers such as
modules and submodules.
For this example, we will apply a completionrelease condition on an assignment, hiding
it from learners until they have completedthe specific content topic.
Navigate to the assessment topic you wantto add a release condition to…
click its context menu…
and select Edit Properties In-Place.
Next, click Add dates and restrictions.
Then, click Create.
Select a Condition Type.
The Condition Type specifies which tool andaction will prompt the release of the content.
For this example, select Visited content topic.
Next, select the Condition Details.
Condition Details allows you to further specifyoptions for the condition type.
When you are ready, click Create.
You can add more conditions, delete a condition,and specify if one or all available conditions
must be met prior to releasing the content.
When you are ready, navigate to Update…
and click it.
The release condition icon displays. Itemswith release conditions are not visible to
learners until the conditions are met.
Note: Exemptions do not trigger completionrelease conditions, so you must manually release
them to learners.
Next, let’s set up a Release Condition forresponsive communication.
Navigate to Announcements…
…and click New Announcement.
You can also use release conditions to createresponsive and customizable communications.
In this example, we will create an announcementwith supplementary materials for learners
who score below a certain grade threshold.
Enter a headline.
and a message for learners.
Then, navigate to the Additional Release Conditionssection…
and click Create and Attach.
Specify the condition type…
and the Condition Details.
Continue to complete Condition Details.
Then, click Create.
Your release condition displays.
When you are ready, click Publish.
The release condition icon identifies itemswith attached release conditions.
Note: Once a learner meets a release conditionyou cannot reset it.
Learners who meet the conditions will receivea notification, and a personalized announcement
that outlines it has been conditionally released.
Create a responsive content path for learners by scaling, personalizing, and staggering the flow of information
using release conditions.

title: Release Highlights - January 2020 (v.20.20.1) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.20.1.
The d2l.Tools.Dropbox.UseAssignmentListOptIn configuration variable has been removed making the
new Assignments page for Instructors on by default.
This feature implements PIE items D5124 and D5396.
Online corporate and employee training coursesfrom BizLibrary are now available for purchase
through D2L. Course content is downloadedas SCORM objects from the BizLibrary portal.
Thousands of courses are available in English,as well as a large collection of content in
French, Spanish, German and Japanese.To enable, contact your D2L Client Sales Executive.
As of January 1st, Brightspace has ended supportfor Internet Explorer. All versions of Internet
Explorer will no longer be able to accessBrightspace.
Brightspace Learning Object Repository (LOR)now supports sending packages to the new SCORM
engine. No changes to SCORM version supportwith LOR have been made.
You can select a SCORM package and uploadit to any pre-defined LOR repository with
the ability to preview the upload package.Once uploaded you can also change the package
name and defined language, create a packagedescription, and add associated key words.
This feature is automatically enabled fornew clients. Existing clients that wish to
use the new workflow can request this changeby contacting D2L Support.
Brightspace Pulse is now available in thefollowing additional languages: Arabic (Saudi
Arabia), Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional),Danish, French (France), German, Japanese,
Korean, Swedish, and Turkish.
Improvements have been made to Classlist toimprove ease of use.
This feature implements PIE items D508 andD4286.
Instructors can now see the total number ofusers for their selections (whole class, section,
group) at the bottom of the Classlist page.
Now, on the Print Classlist and Email Classlist pages, the clickable buttons now float consistently on screen.
You can now define whether configuration settingscan cascade to child org units. Now, the back-end
service uses the first value found in thefollowing order: explicit value set for the
given org unit, For each org unit type inthe cascading org unit type selection list,
check for a value while traversing up thegiven org unit’s ancestor hierarchy (considering
only org ancestors that match the org type),the organization (org) value, the system value.
Note: Any cascading org unit settings alreadyset using the previous API method retain their
settings and are visible in the ConfigurationVariable Browser.
Course Import now supports sending packagesto the new SCORM engine.
This functionality is automatically enabledfor new SCORM users. Existing SCORM users
can request this feature by contacting D2LSupport.
This release includes new columns for existingBrightspace Data Sets (BDS): The RoleCode
column has been added to the Role Detailsdata set, and the IsHidden column has been
added to the Competency Objects data set.You must have the Can Access Brightspace Data
Sets permission at the org level, and thed2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version configuration
variable set to version 3 or 4. This feature implements PIE items D5306 and D5567.
Instructors now have new multi-select optionsto Publish Feedback and Retract Feedback.
In the Status column, the Draft/Publishedcheckbox has been replaced by information
on the date when feedback was saved as draftor published.
The Save, Save and Close, and Cancel buttonshave also been removed as their functionality
has been replaced by the Publish Feedbackand Retract Feedback options.
This feature introduces the ability to sortexported grade books based on the following
options: OrgDefinedID, Username, Last Nameand First Name.
The sort options available are based on the User Information Privacy permissions for the role.
This feature implements PIE items D1058 andD1804.
This feature includes three improvements toGroups:
Group members can now see the descriptionof their group, Instructors can now increase
or decrease the capacity for self-enrollmentgroups after they have been created and prior
to the group sign-up expiry date, and Instructorscan also set Start dates for self-enrollment groups.
For more information, review the release notes.
This feature implements PIE items, D1027,D373, and D3002.
Levels of achievement are now automatically mapped to rubric levels.
This functionality is automatically enabled for learning outcomes users.
To use the learning outcome suggestions feature, ensure that
d2l.Tools.LearningOutcomes.LoaSuggestions is enabled for instructors.
For more details on mapping configurations, review the release notes.
To improve security and management for theclient authentication process, D2L is transitioning
to publicly signed certificates and communicationover secure ports on client authentication
servers using the D2L Lightweight DirectoryAccess Protocol (LDAP) configuration.
For more information, review the release notes.
The Picture Library widget is no longer supportedand is removed from the system widgets in
Brightspace Learning Environment.To offer a more intuitive and updated interface
for adding images to course homepages, thePhoto Carousel widget is available with the
Homepage Widget Expansion Pack.To purchase the Homepage Widget Expansion
Pack, contact your D2L Client Sales Executive.
Instructors can now dismiss activities inQuick Eval.
This feature implements PIE item D5505.
Instructors can dismiss activities using Dismiss until… to dismiss activities until a specified date, or forever.
Instructors can view dismissed items in the Dismissed Activities List from the More Actions menu,
and restore them to the Quick Eval list at any time.
The default value for the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewQuizBuilderExperience
configuration variable is changing from Off to On (opt-in). You are still able to set this configuration
variable to Off if desired.
Quiz scores and feedback entered in Gradesnow synchronize automatically with Quizzes.
The Overall Feedback fields in Grades andQuizzes are now consolidated, and the Grade
Item Public Comments field has been removedfrom Grades. All comments entered in the Overall
Feedback field in Grades synchronizes automaticallywith the Overall Feedback field in Quizzes.
Note: Synchronization only occurs for newgrade entries. Existing grade entries for quizzes
will not be migrated due to the high impactof all past data and reports.
This feature implements PIE item D391.
Reporting is now listed when you access OrganizationTools, and can be toggled off or on.
The default setting for the d2l.Tools.Rubrics.CreateExperienceOptIn
configuration variable is changing from Off to On.
This configuration variable has 3 possiblestates, On, Off and On (opt-in).
The target date for turning this on and removingthe ability to opt-out is November 2020.
You can no longer edit the d2l.Tools.Rubrics.UpdatedGradingExperience
configuration variable. There is no impact to any client who has already set it to OFF
or has not adopted the original Rubric functionality.
Changes to this variable will only be availablefor D2LSupport.
When creating new rubrics, users can now share the rubric created at the organization level
with other org units.
This functionality is automatically enabled for Rubrics users who have set the
d2l.Tools.Rubrics.CreateExperienceOptInconfiguration variable to On.
When Instructors create new rubrics from the org level, they can now specify the org unit
that they want to share with.
In the User Profile page, the following PersonalInfo fields are now limited to 4000 characters
each:Interests/Hobbies, Favorite Music, Favorite
Books, Favorite TV Shows, Favorite Movies,Favorite Quotations, Favorite Websites, Future
Goals, and Most Memorable Learning Experience.
Thanks for watching! We are always lookingto hear from you about the videos you’d
like to see, drop us a comment below, andas always don’t forget to subscribe!

title: Navigate Brightspace Learning Environment - Class Progress - Learner

captions.text: Check how you’re doing in different areasof a course by accessing Class Progress. This
tutorial shows how to view feedback and progressusing Class Progress in Brightspace Learning
Environment.When you first access Class Progress, a summary
displays.Click Expand to view details of your progress
within each category.For example, the Grades area displays all
graded items and their feedback, in the course.You may also see the distribution of grades
for the rest of the class. On this graph,a black dot represents your grade. To view
graded rubrics and feedback, click Feedback.Note: This assessment information applies
to other categories in Class Progress suchas Discussions, Assignments and Quizzes, making
all of your grades and feedback accessiblefrom one location.
The course panel categorizes your progress.Click a category to view your progress for
that area of a course, click Standards.Here, you can review a summary of standards
aligned to your course. If standards are tiedto assessment in your course, you can view
a visual indicator of achievement. To learnmore about how a standard is assessed, click
it.Note: Based on your organization’s settings,
the Standards page may have a different label,for example, Learning Objectives.
Let’s also explore our Content progress.Each module has a progress bar that indicates
complete level. You can also expand the moduleto see which topics you have and have not
completed.Check how you’re doing in different areas
of a course by accessing Class Progress.

title: Teaching Tip - Disable Spell Check During a Quiz Attempt - Administrator

captions.text: Empower your instructors to assess learnersspelling and grammar by disabling spell-check
during quiz attempts.This tutorial shows how to disable spell-check
during quiz attempts, on a course by coursebasis.
To begin, click Admin Tools...
and select Config Variable Browser.
To disable spell-check in quizzes, the d2l.tools.Quizzing.ShowSpellCheckInAttempts
must be set to off at the course offering level.
Search for the configuration variable.
Next, to edit the variable, click it.
Here, you can turn the variable off for specificcourses. Navigate to Add Value.
and click it.
Enter the Org Unit ID or click Select OrgUnit to browse all courses.
In this example, click Select Org Unit.
Navigate to the course you want to disablespell-check.
and click it.
Then click Update.
Next, click the value drop down...
and select off.
When you are ready, click Save.
Your selected course, and configuration valuedisplay.
Empower your instructors to assess learnersspelling and grammar by disabling spell-check
duing quiz attempts.

title: Brightspace Insights™ - Manipulate Data in Adoption Dashboard - Administrator

captions.text: Assess, monitor, and action against adoptiontrends across your organization using Adoption
Dashboard.This tutorial shows how to view and manipulate
the data in Adoption Dashboard. To begin,from Insights Portal, click Adoption Dashboard.
Adoption Dashboard provides interactive datavisualizations for Login Trends, Course Access
Counts, Tool Usage Trends, Tool Usage Comparisonsand Enrollment and Withdrawal Trends.
Note: You can only view course level datafor courses you are enrolled in. To focus
on a specific date range for Login Trends,click and drag the visualization to see data
specific to that date range. To return tothe data overview, click Back. Hover over
a specific date... to view a total login summary.Click Sort... to cycle through the available
date range sorting options. Next, navigateto Tool Usage Trends. Tool Usage Trends shows
how frequently tools are being used over thelast 12 months in weekly summaries.
To filter tools out of the visualization,select the tool from the legend. For this
example, filter out Checklist. Click on asingle tool in the visualization to view more
details about its use. Note: Visualizationsdrill into data based on organizational structure,
up to six levels deep until course offering.For this example, click Content. Click on
a single role in the visualization to viewmore details. For this example, click Student...
to view usage by organizational units. ToolUsage Comparison allows you to see which tools
are used across each of your organizationalunits. The tools can be filtered out by selecting
them from the legend. To review which coursetemplates within an organizational unit are
using each tool, select it. For this example,within the Business organizational unit, click
Quizzes. You can further drill into the datato view which sections are accessing the tool,
click the course template visualization. Assess,monitor, and action against adoption trends
across your organization using Adoption Dashboard.

title: Release Highlights - November 2018 (Version 10.8.7) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 10.8.7.
To help reduce unconscious bias in assignment grading you can set assignments to display
a user’s Org Defined Id as an anonymous identifier.
The d2l.Tools.AnonymousMarking.UseOrgDefinedId configuration variable must be turned on
at the Course Offering level.
A new icon displays identifying that anonymoussubmissions has been set for an assignment.
For instructors to access Publish All Feedback, you must set the Publish All Feedback on Anonymized
Assignment Submission Folders, Assignmentspermission.
The confirmation window has been improvedto remind instructors to complete feedback
for all anonymous users and will state thenumber of users with feedback and the total
number of users.
The Evaluate submissions page has been updated.
This feature implements PIE items D4815 andD4500.
The Evaluate Submission page no longer displaysnavbar links. This update provides instructors
with more screen space to view and evaluateassignments.
On paper submission and Observed in personsubmission types are now available in Content
from the Existing Activities menu.From Content, click the module you want to
add an existing assignment to.Click Existing Activities.
and select Assignments.The new assignment types now display.
Click the assignment to add it to Content.
There is a new Course Access Brightspace data set.
This data set is included in a beta periodstarting November 2018 and D2L may make updates
at a more rapid cadence. These updates willbe communicated as necessary.
The legacy Brightspace Data Set column, InternalEmail,will remain in the relevant data set but the
column value will be empty.
You, and your instructors with the appropriate
permissions, can change homepage banner imagetitles.
Click the More Options menu...and select Customize Banner Text...
... to change the title to the Org Unit Name,a custom value, or none.
In Lessons, you can now specify a color schemefor units.
Note: You must have the Manage Navbar Themes,Navbars permission at the Organization and
Course Offering levels to make these changes.From Create or Edit Theme, in the Primary
Color section, click Choose Colors to specifythe color of the Navbar in Lessons, and update
the foreground text if necessary.Next, in the Accent Color, click Choose a color.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Now, when the theme is applied to a navbar,the colors display to create a stronger sense
of your branding throughout Brightspace LearningEnvironment.
In Manager Dashboard and Learning Groups,the course cards for corporate learners has
been improved.The d2l.Tools.MyCoursesWidget.UpdatedSortLogic
configuration variable must be turned on forthis feature.
The existing Enroll End User Users permissionis now defaulted to off. You must turn on
this permission for the Manager role at theCourse Offering level. Without this permission
Managers will no longer be able to assignor remove courses.
Manager Dashboard and Learning Groups arenow available in Spanish when users set their
system Locale & Language settings.
Quizzes now display in full screen. This feature
implements PIE items D4574 and D4601.When a user starts a quiz the navbar no longer
displays. This provides additional screenspace for the quiz by removing unnecessary
navigation elements from view.
Users can now add files containing closed captions to their video notes.
Various improvements have been made to the My Courses widget.
These changes require thed2l.Tools.MyCoursesWidget.UpdatedSortLogic
configuration variable to be on.New status badges indicate Closed, and Inactive
courses.Course cards now feature a cleaner layout
for the course name, course code, semesterand dates.
Notifications, if configured, are now sortedby tool, and when a user hovers over the notification
icon a tooltip provides more information.Image dimensions for course cards have been
updated to support all screen sizes. D2L continuesto recommend an image size of 2400 x 960 pixels
for optimal viewing.
Check out the updates to Assignments, and
how to create a theme by following the linksin the video.

title: Groups - Create a Group - Instructor

captions.text: Use Groups to design special work areas wherelearners can discuss, share, and submit work
as a group.This tutorial shows how to create groups in
your course.The Groups tool allows you to create and edit
groups and categories.Categories house collections of related groups.
Groups subdivide the learners.To begin, from Groups, click New
Category.First, we will set up the category.
Enter a name for the category.Then, enter a description.
Select from a number of group enrollment types,which define how learners are enrolled and
how many groups are created.Next, we will specify the properties for the
group enrollment type.For this example, we will create groups of
two learners......who are divided into ten groups of their
choosing.Optionally, you can create sub-groups, based
on Section or Group enrollment by selectingan option from the Restrict Enrollments To
menu.Note: If you cannot see the Restrict Enrollment
To menu and would like access to this option,please contact your administrator.
Then, enter a Group Prefix, which precedesthe group number upon creation.
Next, we will set the Advanced Properties.Click Set Self Enrollment Expiry Date to set
a due date for learners to enroll in a group.Then, select the expiry date.
Click Allocate unenrolled users after SelfEnrollment Expiry Date to automatically enroll
learners who haven’t chosen a group by theexpiry date.
Next, we will specify the workspaces we wantto associate with the group category.
Workspaces can include discussion areas, lockers,and assignment submission folders.
For this example, we want to set up discussionareas...
You can create a new topic, or attach groupdiscussions to an existing topic. Note: You
can only create group restricted threads forempty topics without existing posts or group
restrictions.For this example, let’s create a new topic
in an existing discussion forum. Select theforum from the Forum drop down.
Next, let’s include assignment submissionfolders.
Select the type of assignment submission folderthat will be created, either File submission
or Text submission. For this example, let’sleave file selected.
When you are satisfied, click Save.Now, we will set up the discussion topics,
select a topic type. You can create one topicper group, or one topic with threads separated
by group.Keep in mind that once you create and save
the topic, you cannot change the topic type.Then, click Create and Next to finish setting
up the discussion topics.You will now be prompted to set up the assignment
submission folders.Enter a name for the folder.
If desired, select or create a category andgrade item.
For this example, we will select an existinggrade item. Click the Grade Item drop down.
and select the desired Grade Item.Next, define the possible score in the Out
Of field.You can add a rubric to assist with grading
the assignment......or instructions that the learner will see
when viewing the assignment submission folder.For this example, add instructions for the
learners so they know which files to submitfor the assignment.
Finally, you can add files for the learnersto review and define the submission options.
When you are ready, click Create.Review your workspace summary, then Click
Done.Now that your workspaces are set up, you are
returned to the Category creation.Review the category and, when you are ready,
click Save.You have now created a category with related
restricted group topics for private discussionsand assignment submission folders.
Use Groups to design special work areas wherelearners can discuss, share, and submit work
as a group.

title: Intelligent Agents - Create an Intelligent Agent - Instructor

captions.text: Use intelligent agents to monitor login activity,course activity, and release conditions in
your course.This tutorial shows how to create an intelligent
agent.Before you begin creating your new intelligent
agent, you need to decide:The criteria the agent looks for, which can
include login activity, course activity, andattached release conditions.
The content of the email that the agent sendsand how often the agent acts.
For this example, we will create an intelligentagent that notifies learners to access their
course if they have not logged in within thelast 5 days.
To begin, from the Agent list, click New.Enter a name for your agent.
Ensure Agent is enabled, in the Status section,is selected so the agent is enabled upon creation.
Click Edit Description...then enter one in the field. These additional
details will display on the Agent List page.Navigate to the Criteria section.
For this example, we want the agent to contactlearners who have not logged in within the
last five days.Select Take action when the following login
criteria are satisfied.Determine the login activity you want to monitor
and enter the number of days you want to set.Then, in the Actions section...
set the repetition details and action specifics.For this example, leave Take action every
time the agent is evaluated and the agent’scriteria are satisfied for a user selected.
Next, we will create the email that will besent when a learner satisfies the agent criteria.
Click Send an email when the criteria aresatisfied.
Enter who the agent will contact when a useris identified, a detailed subject, and a message.
Note: You can use special replace strings,which auto-populate content, in the To, CC,
BCC, Email Subject, and Message fields.Lastly, navigate to the Scheduling section.
If you want the agent to run on a schedule,select Use Schedule.
Then, to define the schedule, click UpdateSchedule.
You can select whether the repetition is daily,weekly, monthly, or annually. For this example,
we want the agent to run daily for the durationof the course.
Select the start and end dates for your course.Then, click Update.
When you are ready, click Save and CloseYour new Intelligent Agent is enabled and
will send notifications to users as necessary.Use intelligent agents to monitor login activity,
course activity, and release conditions inyour course.

title: Release Highlights - December 2017 (Version 10.7.8) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.7.8.Instructors can now load an existing assignment
as an Assignment post using Activity Feed.When creating an Assignment post in Activity
Feed, click Select Existing.Then, select an assignment from the Assignment
Picker.Instructors can now attach files directly
from OneDrive to Message and Assignment postsin Activity Feed.
To use this feature, turn on the d2l.3rdParty.OneDrive.EnableOneDrivePickerconfiguration variable.
From a Message or Assignment post in ActivityFeed, click the OneDrive icon and navigate
to and select the file you want to uploadand attach.
Then, click Select.You can now turn on and off Google Drive and
OneDrive attachments in Activity Feed.You can now turn on or off the d2l.3rdParty.GoogleDrive.EnableGooglePicker
and d2l.3rdParty.OneDrive.EnableOneDrivePickerconfiguration variables to determine whether
instructors can attach Google Drive and OneDrivefiles to Message and Assignment posts in Activity
Feed.Improvements have been made to increase the
value of the Brightspace Data Sets.Differentials are now available for the following
data sets: Course Copy Logs, Org Units, OrgUnit Ancestors, Org Unit Descendants, and
Users.The CompetencyActivityResults data set now
has a new CriterionId field column.In addition, the data sets previously available
in Brightspace Insights are converted to ensurefresher data and reduce reliance on the old
warehouse split; all the data now residesin one location.
To support the new data sets, there are twonew permissions in the Advanced Data Sets
Tool that are automatically changed duringthe update.
To support the new data sets, there are twonew permissions in the Advanced Data Sets
Tool that are automatically changed duringthe update. CanExecuteFinalGrades and CanExecuteEnrollmentsAndWithdrawals.
Instructors can now attach an item directlyfrom OneDrive to an assignment submission
folder.To enable this feature, you must set the d2l.3rdParty.OneDrive.EnableOneDrivePicker
configuration variable to On.When creating or editing an assignment submission
folder, in the Attached Files section, clickAdd Attachment and select OneDrive.
Navigate to and select a file from the OneDrivepicker window.
Then, click Select.The attachment appears, including the OneDrive
logo to differentiate it from other attachmenttypes.
Parents can now view assignment posts in theActivity Feed.
When Parents view a learner's portfolio, andnavigate to the Latest Posts they can now
view assignment posts.Note: Attachments added to assignment posts
are not available to parents, however linksto external URLs are.
Additionally, parents cannot select the assignmentpost to view assignment details.
Parents can now view grade items releasedfrom all courses that their child is enrolled
in.Note: This does not include their child's
final calculated or final adjusted grade,or feedback left on grade items.
When Parents view a learner's portfolio, theywill now see the Recent Grades widget.
Click View all grades to view the grades thatare associated with an assignment or quiz.
Updates have been made to the browsers thatare supported by D2L.
D2L supports the current major version ofiOS and the previous major version of iOS,
and the latest version of Google Chrome onAndroid KitKat (4.4) and above
D2L supports the latest versions of GoogleChrome, Safari, Opera, and Firefox desktop
browsersD2L no longer supports BlackBerry and Microsoft
Surface mobile browsersFor an up-to-date list of supported browsers,
refer to the Brightspace Platform Requirementsguide.
Brightspace has developed two new data sets.The Competency Log records changes to the
competency structureThe Competency Activity Log records changes
as competencies are mapped to specific activities.For more information, refer to the updated
Data Hub Administrator GuideTwo improvements have been added to the My
Courses widget.First, there is a new widget setting that
provides the ability to show or hide the semesteron the course tile.
To do so, click the context menu for the MyCourses widget and select Customize this widget.
Select Show Semester.Then, click Save.
The semester now appears on course tiles.Second, courses can now be filtered by Role
in View All Courses.Navigate the My Courses widget and click View
All Courses.Click the Filter drop down menu and select
Roles.Then, select the role you want to filter the
courses by.Note: A user only sees the role filter if
they have more than one Role Alias and a RoleAlias must exist for the role to appear in
the filter.Improvements have been made to the User Progress
and Manage Exemptions pages.The Summary page hides exempted activities
for Assignments, Surveys, Quizzes, and Checklists.Details pages of Assignments, Quizzes, Discussions,
Surveys, and Checklists now display if anactivity is exempt by showing the (exempted)
label beside the name of the activity.A set of statistics, excluding the exempted
activities, appear at the top of each respectivetool's Summary page and the same statistics
appear at the top of each tool's Details page.The Manage Exemptions page now displays a
loading spinner while data is retrieved.This page now supports search to help instructors
find a learner who can then be exempted.And, the list of users on this page now only
includes those with the Can be graded in Gradesrole setting.
Note: When activities are exempted, any associatedrelease conditions must still be met.
New action types have been added to the IntelligentAgents tool.
This feature implements PIE item D1904.The following improvements have been made
to the existing Edit Agent page and the NewAgent work flow.
The Description field is minimized by default.Numbers have been added to the sections to
help with work flow.The New Agent work flow has been changed to
initially call out role criteria, then actions,and lastly scheduling.
Note: A schedule is not a necessity for allintelligent agents; an agent can be run as
a one-time query or on-demand.In the Actions section, the new Change User
Enrollments option allows instructors to enrolla user into a course or unenroll a user from
the current course.Additionally, UI changes have been made to
the Send Email action.You can now turn on the new d2l.Tools.Content.ChooseContentExperience
configuration variable to allow instructorsto choose the content experience used in their
course.If the new configuration variable is turned
on, instructors see a pull-down menu in Contentallowing them to switch between the Classic
content experience and the Lessons experience.Instructors can now add a description to Lessons
materials.Now, when instructors add or edit course materials
they can add a descriptionThis allows instructors to provide learners
with general information on course materialsusing the familiar HTML editor.
Instructors can now set release conditionson materials in Lessons.
When an instructor clicks the More Optionsmenu they can now select View Release Conditions
from the drop-down menu.This allows instructors to restrict access
to materials based on learner enrollment,completion of an activity, mark received on
a quiz, and many other factors.Instructors can now add LTI links directly
to their course materials when using Lessons.Now, when adding material to a course offering,
a new External tool activity tile is visible.Learners and instructors can no longer view
numbering and labels for units and lessonswhen viewing the Lessons table of contents.
Numbering and labels for units and lessonsno longer display when viewing the Lessons
table of contents.

title: Competencies - Add and Remove Associations - Instructor

captions.text: Build and edit competency structures by adding and removing associations between structure elements.
This tutorial shows how to add and remove associations between competency structure elements.
From Competencies add and remove associationsfor a particular element by browsing to and
selecting that element.
In this example we will change the associationsfor an existing learning objective that is
already associated with a competency.
Browse to the learning objective by expandingthe parent competency...
...and select the learning objective.
Now click Structure......and select the Edit structure tab.
There are two sections within the Edit structuretab.
The Parents section is used to view, add,and remove elements that are associated as parents.
Likewise the Children section is used to view,add, and remove child elements.
In this example the learning objective isalready associated with two other elements.
To remove its association with the parentcompetency check the box beside the competency...
...and click the remove associations icon.
Click OK to confirm.
With the association removed, the learningobjective in this example has no parent elements.
It is now classified as an independent learningobjective.
To add a new association to an existing competencyclick Add parent...
...and click Existing Competency.
Browse to and check the elements you wouldlike to associate as parents.
When you are finished click Add Selected.
The newly associated competency is now shownas a parent element.
Build and edit competency structures by adding and removing associations between structure elements.

title: Create Accessible, Immersive Content with Hotspot | Instructor

captions.text: This video demonstrates how to use the Hotspot tool with Brightspace Editor.
Hotspots provide a multilayer learning experience enriched with multimedia and interactive components that promote exploration, analysis, and evaluation.
Learners can select and open active icons to learn more about parts of an image.
The Hotspot Element comes with the purchase of Creator+.
In Brightspace Editor, select Other Insert Options > Insert Element.
From the Insert Element menu, select Hotspot.
In the Learner Instructions field, choose to leave the standard instructions or write your own custom instructions that provide more details or context.
Click Add Image and select an image from your personal device.
You must enter alt text in the Alternative Text field. Click Save.
Click anywhere on the image to place a hotspot marker.
On the right panel, select the hotspot to edit or add. You can enter a custom name for your hotspot.
The Hotspot Content field allows you to add associated content like text, images, videos, and links.
Click Hotspot Marker to change the style and color of the hotspot marker.
When you’re done editing your hotspot, click Hotspots to return to the hotspot selection option.
Repeat these steps to add up to nine hotspot markers.
After adding all your hotspot markers, below Learner Instructions, click Accessibility.
Accessible hotspots only: Lets you add a description for each hotspot marker using micro alt tags.
This is a great option when the position of the hotspot or the context surrounding the hotspot don’t impact learning.

Fully accessible image: Lets you split the image into a grid that screen reader users can navigate cell by cell to hear a micro alt tag description of the full image, including the position of hotspots within the grid.
This option is ideal to ensure that screen reader users have access to the same contextual insights as any other user. You must add a micro alt tag for each cell.
Use Add Column and Add Row to create the necessary grid size for your image.
You can only have one hotspot marker in any grid cell. The Valid Grid check will be displayed when you meet these criteria.
Click Save and Insert to add the image into Brightspace Editor.

title: The New Discussions Creation Experience | Instructor

captions.text: This video demonstrates how to use the new Discussions creation experience.
The new Discussions creation experience adopts creation elements from Assignments and Quizzes, making it familiar and easier to create great course content.
In Content, click Create New and then click Discussion.
In the primary panel, enter a Topic Title, Grade Out Of value, and a Description.
Click Change Forum to add the discussion topic to an existing forum or let the system automatically create a new forum for your topic.
In the Availability Dates & Conditions accordion:
Enter a Start Date and End Date for your topic.
Click Add Release Condition to create or add existing release conditions.
In Group and Section Restrictions, you can create restrictions for specific groups of learners.
In the Post & Completion accordion:
Choose how participation is displayed and activated for your topic.
Select Posts must be approved before they display in the topic if you want to hide learners’ posts and approve them before they are released.
In the Evaluation & Feedback accordion:
Click Add Rubric to add a rubric to your topic.
Click Manage Learning Objectives to associate learning objectives with your discussion.
If you use the Learning Outcomes tool, you'll find the learning outcomes button, called Standards, in the primary panel.
The Manage Learning Objectives button disappears.
You can choose different options for evaluating posts in the Evaluate Posts section.
If you select Allow evaluation of individual posts, you can select a Calculation Method.
Click the Standards button to browse learning outcomes you can associate with your discussion topic.
Toggle the Visibility of your topic to Hidden or Visible.
Then, click Save and Close.
