title: New Content Experience (Lessons) Overview | Instructor

captions.text: This video provides an overview of the New Content (Lessons) Experience in Brightspace for Instructors.
Lessons provides an intuitive way for instructors to create engaging content for learners.
Outcomes displays all your course units and the learning standards that you aligned to them.
New Unit lets you create a new unit for your course.
Course Options, or the gear icon, provides options to pace your course, preview your course as a student, and view reports.
Use the visibility toggle to change your course content from Hidden or Visible.
Create New and Add Existing display separate dialogs for creating new materials, adding a new lesson, or inserting existing materials.
When you click the Options menu and select Edit for materials, you can update their titles, properties, and dates.
If you select Edit for a unit, lesson, or folder, you can update its title, availability and due dates, and description.

title: Navigate Lessons | Learner

captions.text: This video explains how to navigate Lessons as a learner in Brightspace.
Use the Lessons tool to find all your course materials like modules, quizzes, assignments, and discussions.
On your course homepage, navigate to Lessons or Content.
You will see your course units as accordions.
Units will display your course modules, assignments, quizzes, and discussions.
Click either topic to launch the respective activity.
Click Launch Unit to begin that unit.
Your progress for a unit is shown beside the unit name.
Activities like quizzes, discussions, or assignments are only marked as complete when you submit your work.
You can expand or close the side panel to change how you view your module.
You can transition through a unit using the arrows at the top right of the page.
Click the Download icon above your module to download it to your device.

title: November 2022/20.22.11 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the November 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe November 2022 Version 20.22.11 Release
Notes, which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Share achievements with Public URL sharingfor awards in the Awards tool.
In Media Library, create content with webcamrecordings and easily search content with
improved filter-sort options.
Media Library also features view and downloadof audio transcripts to improve the content
consumer experience, as well as introducingMedia Library’s ability to quickly access,
create, edit, and manage all audiovisual content.
In Pulse, Personalize notifications for emailand SMS.
And finally, a summary of changes for allthe other features this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Learners can now share their awards with aPublic URL directly from the Awards tool using
the new Awards Sharing option.
This method simplifies sharing a badge orcertificate to showcase achievements.
Learners can create a public URL for an award,which can then be shared on a digital resume
or a social media profile.
Navigate to Awards and then click the Shareoption for your award.
Click Create Link and then do one of the following:Click Copy Link to copy the link to your clipboard;
orClick Open this link in a new window to view
the award details.
The Awards feature implements the followingPIE Item:
D5202 (Make Awards and Badges External)Thank you to Wendy Grisham for putting forward
this PIE suggestion to implement this feature!
The Awards feature is available to all clients.
To enable, ensure that the configuration variabled2l.Tools.Awards.PublicAwardsEnabled is set
to ON and set the option to share awards toON at the course level.
The first of our Media Library updates thismonth, this feature introduces webcam recording
as an option in Media Library.
Users can create both video and audio-onlyrecordings, improving your ability to directly
record content within Media Library.
Note that the Video Note record bar is nowchanged to show the New Recording option and
the Audio only toggle.
Navigate to Media Library and click RecordWebcam.
Set the Audio only toggle to the desired setting.
The default setting is off.
When you’re ready to start recording, clickNew Recording.
Once your recording is complete, click StopRecording, and then click Next.
Enter the details of your content, such asTitle, Description, and Audio language, into
the corresponding fields.
Then click Finish.
This Media Library feature is available toall clients.
To enable, ensure that the following ContentService permissions are granted:
Can Access Media Library Management Tool (forboth Administrators and Instructors);
Can Manage Objects (Instructors only); andCan Manage All Objects (Administrators only).
Media Library now offers improved filter-sortfunctionality when searching for files, making
Audio-visual content easier to find.
Users can search for specific pieces of contentusing the following filters:
Content Type: Audio, Video, or BothSource: Where content was added from.
Multiple filters can be selected.
Source filters include: Content, Media LibraryAudio or Video Note, Capture App, Imported
(content added from course imports), and Other(content added prior to the addition of source
tracking)Date Modified (which is called Date Deleted
in Recycle Bin); andDate Created.
This Media Library feature is available toall clients and is automatically enabled.
Users can now view and download transcriptsfrom audio-video content in Media Library
using Transcript View.
This update also ensures that the media playerexperience is the same for all uploaded Media
Library files.
Transcript View allows users to pair playbackof a video file with the captions scrolling.
A button in the media player allows usersto download the transcript in either .txt
or the caption track in .VTT format to theirdevice.
In Media Library, open the desired content.
Click the Gear icon and select View transcript.
Click Download and select your preferred formatfrom the drop-down.
This Media Library feature is available toall clients and is automatically enabled.
Due to current limitations with the iOS MediaPlayer, this feature is not available on iOS.
The final Media Library feature for this release– which is now available to Brightspace
Core users – offers a consolidated mediaprocessing, storage, and streaming option
for all audiovisual materials.
Media files uploaded using Record Audio, RecordVideo, Video Note, Content Tool (Add video
workflow), Lessons, or Capture App (Creator+only) are stored in the same Media repository.
The new Media Library management tool providesthe following options:
Filter content based upon audiovisual typeUpdate file information, such as the title
and descriptionEdit video timelines using the editor
Add chapters to video contentCreate manual and automated captions for video
contentDownload audiovisual content to a device
Preview contentDelete files; and
Transfer ownership of audiovisual content.
(Administrator only).
Media Library consists of three sections:My Media, which contains your content; Recycle
Bin; and Filters, which you can use to sortcontent in either My Media or Recycle Bin.
To create content, click the Add button andthen select one of the following options:
Upload File to select content from your computer;Record Webcam to begin a webcam recording;
orCreate Presentation to create content with
the Capture app.
The Media Library feature implements the followingPIE Items:
D6447 (Ability for instructors to manage videonotes more effectively)
D3840 (Add a title to Audio Notes 2.0 & VideoNotes 2.0 file name)
D9189 (Edit Video Note Title)Thank you to Kerrie Meister, Olly Fayers,
and all those who put forward these PIE suggestionsto implement this feature!
This feature is available to all BrightspaceCore Clients.
To enable, ensure that the following ContentService permissions have been granted:
Can Access Media Library Management ToolCan Manage Objects (Instructors only); and
Can Manage All Objects (Administrators only)
Building on the Personalize push notificationsfeature originally released in October 2022
Version 20.22.10, this release allows youto choose which email or SMS notifications
you receive by accessing settings directlyfrom the Pulse app.
Previously, you could only personalize emailnotifications through Brightspace.
The Pulse feature implements the followingPIE Item:
D8239 (Controlling Pulse Notifications fromthe Student’s Profile Notifications and
Settings Page)Thank you to Clayton Riehle for putting forward
this PIE suggestion to implement this feature!
The Pulse feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Enable the Ally accessibility tool for anyorg unit in Brightspace with Anthology Ally.
In Assignments, expand or collapse the listof aligned outcomes.
Share homepages, widgets, and navigation barswith multiple org units in Brightspace.
Brightspace Insights features usability improvementsin all Insights Dashboards.
With Data Hub, report on changes made to rubricswith the Rubric Edit Audit Log data set, as
well as track any issues or failures withthe SAML Provisioned Users Log data set.
Override Email on Export with External Emailbased on a new configuration variable with
the Grades tool.
In LTI, manage grade associations for LTIcontent in New Content Experience.
Easily migrate legacy LTI links in a coursewith LTI Migration.
In Group and Section Management, create sectionswith unique section ID codes; descriptions
now available for sections and self-enrollmentgroups; and improved clarity when performing
deletions of associated activities.
Org Unit Editor features improved consistencyof page design, navigation, and user interface
elements in Org Unit Editor, as well as improvedtable display and filtering for Org Unit Properties
and searches.
The Quizzes tool now includes improved populationmethod for calculating standard deviation.
Clarify grading criteria by editing text fieldsin assessed rubrics using the Rubrics tool.
And finally, new user provisioning optionusing SAML Authentication in SAML.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the November 2022
/ Version 20.22.11 Release Notes on BrightspaceCommunity.
See you next month!

title: October 2022/20.22.10 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the October 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe October 2022 Version 20.22.10 Release
Notes, which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
In Brightspace Insights, the New AdoptionDashboard is now the default setting.
Access links and images in module descriptionswhen you’re on-the-go, as well as personalize
Push Notifications using Brightspace Pulse.
And finally, a summary of changes for allthe other features this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Building on the new version of the AdoptionDashboard released in Brightspace Platform
20.22.7/July 2022, the new Adoption Dashboardexperience is turned ON by default.
Administrators can still return to the legacyAdoption Dashboard experience by setting the
d2l.Tools.Insights.Adoption.EnableNewExperienceconfiguration variable to OFF.
This configuration variable will be removedas of the January 2023 / 20.23.1 release,
leaving the new Adoption Dashboard as thesole available option.
The Brightspace Insights feature is availableto all clients who have the Performance Plus
package or who have purchased BrightspaceInsights in the previous packaging model.
This functionality is automatically enabled.
Improving the overall user experience in BrightspacePulse, users can view module descriptions
in a web view that displays images and preserveslinks.
Previously, users could only view module descriptiontext without any rich text elements or HTML.
Links or images placed in a module descriptionin Brightspace were not preserved in the module
description while using Brightspace Pulse.
In your course, navigate to the Content tab.
Select a module and tap the View Descriptionlink.
Images and links in the module descriptionare visible in the Pulse app.
You can access Links by tapping them.
The Brightspace Pulse feature is availableto all clients and is automatically enabled.
To help improve the flexibility of push notificationsin Brightspace Pulse, users are able to choose
which push notifications they receive.
Previously, it was not possible to limit orcontrol push notifications.
In the Pulse app, navigate to Settings > PushNotifications.
For each Tool item, toggle notifications tobe either On (green) or Off (gray).
You can also toggle notifications on or offfor specific courses.
The Brightspace Pulse feature implements thefollowing PIE Item:
D8239 (Controlling Pulse Notifications fromthe Student’s Profile Notifications and
Settings Page)Thank you to all those who put forward this
PIE suggestion to implement this feature!
The Brightspace Pulse feature is availableto all clients and is for notification types
that are already supported in the Pulse app.
This feature is automatically enabled.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Reach every learner with the introductionof ReadSpeaker text-to-speech technology in
Discussions.
With Google Apps, Google Workspace Settingsprovides improved clarity for Export As options.
Removal of unused and duplicated grade schemeswill be taking place in Grades tool.
Load more functionality for the initial overviewpage in Learner Experience.
Improved Granularity of LTI Migration Permissionswith the LTI Tool.
ReadSpeaker has a streamlined ability to setlanguage parameters with a new configuration
variable.
And lastly, ReadSpeaker can be turned On andoff in the org unit.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the October 2022
/ Version 20.22.10 Release Notes on BrightspaceCommunity.
See you next month!

title: Understanding Grades | Learner

captions.text: This video teaches learners how to interpret Brightspace’s grade items, other grade features, and overall grades
Grades shows all grades for your assignments and quizzes.Grade Item is your assignment or quiz.
Points are the amount of marks granted to a learner out of a maximum number.Grade is the weighted percentage of your number of Points for a Grade Item.
Class Progress provides a detailed breakdown of your assignments and quizzes that includes points, grade as a percentage, and feedback
The Feedback drop-down shows feedback on your assignments and quizzes from your instructor

title: Navigating Content | Learner

captions.text: This video will demonstrate how to navigate Content in Brightspace as a Learner
On your course home page, navigate to Content
Content allows you to view your Course Schedule, the Table of Contents for all your course content, and shows all the modules for your course
When you select Course Schedule, you can see any events scheduled for today and tomorrow as well as any events upcoming within the next seven days
You can also view the Full Schedule for your course to see all upcoming events for the duration of the course
In Table of Contents, you can view all the modules, assignments, discussions, and quizzes that you will complete throughout your course
Each of your course’s modules are displayed as sections beneath the Table of Contents tab.
By selecting any module, you can view the content available for that module
The progress bar below the title of the module shows your completion rate of the module

title: Grades Tool – Manage Grades

captions.text: From the organizational homepage, select the desired course using the My Courses widget,
or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page.
From your course level Navbar, select Grades to access the Grades tool.
You can also access the Grades Tool through your Course Admin link if you do not have the grades link on your Course Navbar.
From the Grades Tool, select the Manage Grades tab under the top navigation bar.
To create a new Grade Category, click New > Category.
Enter Grade Category details including the Name, Short Name, Description,
Weight (Enter the Weight percentage that you want the Category to contribute to the final grade.
Grade Items within the category contributetowards this weight);
Distribution (This will determine how the Grade Items withinthe category contribute towards the category total);
And finally, the Display Options including Student View options, Grade Distribution, and Scheme Display.
Select Save and Close to return to the Manage Grades page.
Use Save and New to create more grade categories.
Assessments created in other areas of Brightspace, such as the Content Tool or Assignments Tool, may already appear in your Grades Tool.
To create a new Grade Item, click New > Item.
Select the Grade Item type: Numeric, SelectBox, Pass/Fail, Formula, Calculated, and Text.
Enter Grade Item details, including Name, Short Name (which is a short version of the Grade Item Name or
an abbreviation to display in the Gradebook to save space);
Select the desired Category, or leave as None if no Categories required;
Description, Maximum Points, Weight (the weight percentage is what you want the Grade Item to contribute to the Category or Final Grade.
If a Grade Item is within a category, you must specify the Weight as a percentage of the Category, not the Final Grade);
Can Exceed, Bonus (Bonus items are not included in the maximum points for a category or final grade.
They are added on top of the calculated grade.
Bonus Items cannot make a User’s grades exceed the maximum points specified, unless the Can Exceed option is selected);
Grade Scheme (This will be set to the Default Scheme.
You can choose a different Scheme for this Grade Item, if required, by clicking the menu and selecting the desired Scheme);
Add or Create a Rubric to associate to the Grade Item.
(For more information on Grade Schemes, see the video “Grades Tool – Schemes”; also “Create a Rubric”);
And finally, Display Options including StudentView, Scheme Options, and Overriding Display Options.
Select Save and Close. Use Save and New to create more Grade Items.
To Bulk Edit, select the items you'd like to edit.
You can also select all items at once by selectingthe checkbox that is in line with the Titles row.
Click Bulk Edit after you select your GradeItems and/or Categories.
On the new screen, you'll be able to edit Grade Categories (including Name, Short Name, and Weight);
And Grade Items (Name, Short Name, Max Points,
Weight - if the Category is not set to evenly distributed -
Bonus, Can Exceed, Grade Scheme, and Change Category).
Click Save to preserve the edits you just made.

title: Create and Edit a Rubric

captions.text: From the organizational homepage, select thedesired course using the My Courses widget
or the Course Selector icon at the top rightof the page.
From your course level Navbar, select the Course Tools drop-down menu to access the Rubrics tool.
You can also access the Rubrics tool throughyour Course Admin link if you do not have
the Rubrics tool in the Course Tools drop-down.
From the Rubrics Tool, click New Rubric.
Provide a name for the Rubric and choose thedesired Rubric Type and Scoring.
The Analytic Rubric Type provides the abilityto add multiple criteria within a rubric.
The Holistic Rubric Type provides a singlecriterion.
Holistic Rubrics can also be assessed withpercentage scores that are set per each rubric level.
The default Scoring Type of Points resultsin each rubric level having the same score for each criterion.
No point values are set when the Scoring Typeis set to No Score.
The custom point Scoring Type provides theability to set unique point values for each level per criterion.
Continue on to enter the Criterion Name, adjustthe Rubric levels and adjust the Point Values.
Optionally, additional Rubric levels can beadded by clicking the Plus button and additional
criterion can be added by clicking Add Criterion.
Further, Rubric levels can be deleted by clickingthe remove level button.
Add a Description for each achievement levelif applicable and add initial feedback that
is to be applied when assessing learner work.
You may add additional criterion groups in order to create multipart Rubrics
by selecting the Add Criterion Group button.
Adjust the overall score parameters to define the overall level and score that will be assigned to the Learner.
Set the Rubric options that include Rubric Visibility, Score Visibility, Description, and Advanced Availability.
Click Close to finish creating your Rubric.
Edit a rubric by choosing Edit within thedrop-down menu beside the desired Rubric name.
Please note: rubrics that have been used toassess learner work cannot be edited.
Use Copy to create and edit a new versionof the rubric.

title: Grades Tool – Setup Wizard

captions.text: From the organizational homepage,  select the desired course using the My Courses widget,
or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page.
From your course level Navbar, select Grades to access the Grades tool.
You can also access the Grades tool through your Course Admin link if  you do not have the Grades link on your course Navbar.
From the Grades tool, select Setup Wizard under the top navigation bar.
The Setup Wizard includes a seven-step process to help guide you through initial Grade Book configuration.
This includes: Grading System (which defines the overall grading system for your course):
Options are Weighted, Points, or Formulas.
Final Grade Released: you can set the Final Grade to be released automatically based on one of the following: Calculated and Adjusted.
Grade Calculations: drop ungraded items or treat them as a zero.
You can also set for the Final Grade to be automatically adjusted when changes are made to Grade Items or Calculation Options.
Choosing Default Grading Scheme: based on available grading schemes in your course,
this can be Institutional Default or Custom Course Schemes.
For more information on schemes, please refer to the Grades Tool Schemes article.
Manage View Display Options: this setting controls how many decimals will be displayed to the user.
The value must be an integer between zero (0) and five (5).
Student View Display Options: control what learners view, including Grade details, Decimal Places,
Characters Displayed for Comments, and Final Grade Calculation.
Grade Setup Summary: review settings and click Finish to save.
The Setup Wizard can be accessed at any time to adjust the configurations if a change is required.

title: Grades Tool – Enter Grades Part 2

captions.text: To evaluate learner submissions or edit existinggrades, there are multiple ways to accomplish this.
We recommend using Quick Eval to assess alllearners submissions quickly and efficiently.
Within the Grades tool, there are optionalmethods available to evaluate by assessment,
learners submissions, and manually enter gradesacross entire courses with the Enter Grades tab.
To access individual learner submissions fromthe Enter Grades tab,
click on the associated icon next to the learner submission under the desired grade item.
Each assessment has its own unique icon. You will be directed to the evaluation.
Note: new learner submissions will be identifiedby an orange dot on the upper right corner of the icon.
For more information on the evaluation of learner submissions, please refer to the Grading and Brightspace article.
Grades can also be entered manually using Switch to Spreadsheet View.
To use this feature, click Spreadsheet View at the upper left of the page.
This will allow for numeric grade entry for all grade items.
You can also override or edit previously entered grades through this feature as well.
Click Switch to Standard View to return to the default view.

title: Navigate Brightspace | Instructor

captions.text: Here are the key points of navigation for your Organizational Homepage.Home button - this button is located throughout Brightspace
Home button - this button is located throughout Brightspace to easily return to your Organizational Homepage.
Minibar - quickly access course you're enrolled in or teaching, global notifications, and your profile settings.
From your username on the minibar, you can make changes to your user Profile, Notifications, Account Settings, and also log out
Navbar - configurable by your administrative team, the navbar is a list of tools serviced on your page for convenient access to powerful Brightspace features
Homepages can be customized with Brightspace widgets
Widgets are powerful tools that augment and enrich the user experience,
such as Announcements, Quick Eval, Calendar, and access to any course that you are enrolled in with the My Courses widget
From the Organizational Homepage, select the desired course using the My Courses widget or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page.
Now that you are at the course level homepage, you will notice that the navbar has changed to reflect the tools that are available to you within your course
This is an example of what D2L recommends as a course homepage configuration
Brightspace is highly customizable and your institution may have chosen a different configuration
With very similar features to the Organizational Homepage,
there are a few key points of navigation to optimize your time in course
Select the course title to return to the course homepage at any point
As a faculty member, you will spend most of the time managing and editing your course within the Content tool
The Content tool is your all-in-one tool for creating and managing all your course materials
We recommend using this tool as the most efficient way to link to the various tools throughout the course
Announcements widget - this widget helps you stay connected with your students by making it easier to access and create announcements
Course Admin - if you cannot find a tool at any point, Course Admin will bring you to the page that lists all tools enabled in your course
This means some tools could be named differently or not available
For more information on creating content and managing your course, see Setting Up and Managing your Course and Create Course Content

title: Copy Existing Content into a Course | Instructor

captions.text: This is part three of a four-part video series
that will walk you through various course setup and management features.
To copy existing content from another course,
navigate to the Content tool and select table of contents.
Select the Import Course drop-down menu. Two options exist to import content into your course:
Copy Existing Course and Import Course Package.
To copy an existing course within Brightspace,
select the Import Course drop-down menu and click Copy Existing Course.
Select Copy Components from Another Org Unit.
Use Search for Offering to search for your desired course to copy its components.
Choose the course you wish to copy and select Add Selected.
Note: From the Import/Export Copy Components menu, additional options are to Copy Components from
Parent Template; Export as Brightspace Package; Export as Common Cartridge;
Export as Thin Common Cartridge;
Import Components from Learning Objective Repository; or Course Package.
Finally select Copy All Components or Select Components
to select individual components to copy over.
You will be notified when the course upload is complete.
Additionally, the Copy Course Components History
menu will display your current and any previous course copies.
From this page you can:
Copy another package;
View content you just imported;or review and manage dates.
Please continue to view the next video for additional course setup management features.

title: Set Up a Course | Instructor

captions.text: This is part one of a four-part video series that will walk you
through various course setup management features.
To set up your course, log into Brightspace.
From the organizational Home Page, select the desired course using the my courses widget,
or the course selector icon at the top right of the page.
To create an announcement, locate the announcement widget from your course Home Page.
Select New Announcements from the drop down menu.
Fill out the announcement details, including Headline and Content.
Note: A Headline and Content are required to create an announcement.
For information on the Brightspace editor that is available to create your content,
see Create Course Content.
Optional settings include availability, attachments, and additional release conditions.
To complete your announcement, select Publish to publish announcement to your course.
Save as Draft is also available to save your progress and return for future publication.
To create and arrange modules for your course navigate to the course-level navbar
and select Content to access the Content tool.
In the left-hand table of contents, select the Add a Module field.
Add a Title, and use the Enter key to create it.
Newly created modules will populate at the bottom of your table of contents menu.
Select the drag-and-drop handle to relocate the module on your list,
or consolidate modules by dragging one module on top of another.
To add third-party tool resources to a course,
select the module you want to create the content for.
Select the Existing Activities drop-down menu.
Select the third-party tool from the drop-down menu you wish to choose
and then select your desired activity from the list to add to your module.
Note: Availability of third-party tools is
configured and managed by your Brightspace administrators.
Please continue on to view the next video for additional course setup management features.

title: Create Course Content | Instructor

captions.text: From the Organizational Homepage, select the course in which you would like to add or create content using the My Courses widget or the Course Selector at the top of the page
From your course level navbar, select Content to access the Content tool
To create and manage modules, please see the video titled Setting Up and Managing a Course
There are two ways you can add content directly from your computer.
To add external files from your computer using Drag & Drop, select the module you want to add the content into
Select the files from your computer to import into Brightspace
Drag and drop those files into the module.
To add external files from your computer using your keyboard or the user interface,
select the Upload \ Create drop-down menu, select Upload Files, select files from your computer, and select Open.
To create new content in Brightspace, select the Upload \ Create drop-down menu and select Create a File
From here, fill out document file details in the Brightspace Editor
If it is configured in your site, use the Select a Document Template menu to view the available premade file templates
Use the Brightspace Editor to format your file
Brightspace offers a robust set of options found at the top of the Editor to customize your document
For more information, see the article on How to Create Content and the video titled Use the Brightspace Editor
Once you are done creating your document, click Save and Close to review and publish your file
You can review the completed file and scroll down to add additional configurations
You can set Visibility options, add dates and restrictions, attach learning objectives to the file,
and the Completion Summary tab services student completion and objectives
You can navigate back to your Content tool for further file creation or course setup using the breadcrumbs at the top-left of the page found under the navbar

title: Create a Quiz | Instructor

captions.text: From the Organizational Homepage, select the desired course using the My Courses widget or the Course Selector icon at the top-right of the page
From your course level navbar, select Content to access the Content tool
You can also access the Content tool through your Course Admin link if you don't have the Content tool on your course navbar
From the Content tool, select the module you want the quiz to be created in
To create and manage modules, see the article Setting Up and Managing a Course
Select Upload \ Create > New Quiz
Fill in the quiz details, including the name of the quiz, grade value, be sure to Add to Grade book to create an item in the Grade book,
and for practice quizzes or performative quizzes, select Not in Grade book
Add a Due Date, if applicable, and add a Description
For additional quiz configurations, use the drop-down menus on the right side of the quiz creation page
To create a new quiz question, select Create New > New Question on the quiz creation page
Select the question type and fill out the question details
Written-response question types will require manual grading
To create another question, select Save and New; or select Save to return to the quiz creation page
Select Upload a File from your personal device to attach a file to your quiz
Click Browse Files, drag the file you want to add to the Upload a File window, and click Import All
You can also alternatively select Browse Question Library to add questions from previous quizzes in Brightspace

You can do this by selecting the checkbox of the questions you want to add to your quiz and selecting import As a final option, you can select Import from Learning Repository to browse and choose learning resources to add to your quiz
Click Save and Close
The quiz has now been created
If a grade item was entered, you will now see it in your Grade book
Date and grade information will now be visible based on quiz details
Once you finish reviewing the quiz, use the breadcrumbs, or the file path, located under the navbar to return to the course Content tool

title: August 2022/20.22.8 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the August 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe August 2022 Version 20.22.8 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Access new shortcuts to undo and redo PDFannotations on evaluations with Assignments.
With Brightspace Data Sets, Quiz Objects includesthe additional column Paging Type ID.
Seamlessly access files from personal andWorkspace Google accounts with a single file
picker using Google File Picker.
Save time and prevent data loss with the RestoreDeleted Quizzes functionality in the Quizzes
tool.
In Assignments, apply the filters Show Everyoneand Show All groups for individual and group
assignments.and finally, a Summary of Changes made for
all the other features.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
With this release, the Assignments tool featuresan undo and redo button for use with PDF annotations
when evaluating assignment submissions.
You can also use standard keyboard shortcutswhen using the undo and redo functionality.
These are:Ctrl-z or Command-z for Undo; and
Ctrl-Shift-z or Command-Shift-z for Redo.
In Assignments, navigate to the PDF assignmentyou wish to view.
Click the Annotations button in the PDF viewer.
When making Annotations, click the Undo orRedo buttons as needed.
Alternatively, you can use the keyboard shortcuts.
The Assignments feature implements the followingPIE Items:
D6620 (Undo button and freezing of Studentwork on screen)
D7342 (Online correction tool – Undo keyboardshortcut); and
D8698 (Annotation Tool improvement suggestions)Thank you to Brandyn Sauer, Mandeep Deegon,
and Krystyna BAGLAI for putting forward thesePIE suggestions to implement this feature!
The Assignments feature is available to allclients, and is automatically enabled.
The Brightspace Data Set - Quiz Objects nowincludes a new column called Paging Type ID
that exposes page break information set ona quiz from the new quiz creation experience.
The possible values for Paging Type Id are:Uses classic quiz creation paging = NULL
All questions on one page = 0One question per page = 1; and
Page breaks after each section = 2
The Brightspace Data Sets feature is availableto all clients, and is automatically enabled.
With this release, Brightspace Learning Environmentreplaces the previous multiple file pickers
with a single, universal file picker for Googleaccounts.
This supports both personal and WorkspaceGoogle accounts.
The previous file picker is being replacedwith the updated file picker to integrate
Google Workspace.
Note that selecting multiple files is temporarilynot possible and will be restored at a later
date.
The Google File Picker feature implementsthe following PIE Items:
D2792 (Allow submissions from Google Docscreated from any Google accounts)
D5086 (Display Google Drive in Dropbox Submissioneven if account is not connected)
D1709 (Upload files from Cloud-based services);and
D5795 (Google Drive/OneDrive Picker Integration).
Thank you to Jonathan Sorrenti, Jeff Allison,and all those who put forward these PIE suggestions
to implement this feature!
The Google File Picker feature is availableto all clients, and is automatically enabled
with Google Suite and Google Drive.
This feature provides a new option to allowinstructors to restore deleted quizzes.
This option appears in the More Actions menuin the Quizzes tool.
Instructors are provided with a list of deletedquizzes that indicates when they were deleted
and by whom, along with a Restore button.
Restored quizzes automatically restore anyassociated quiz attempts, statistics, and
scores.
Links to a grade item and competencies arenot restored.
In the Quizzes tool, navigate to Manage Quizzes.
Click on More Actions, and select Restorefrom the drop-down menu.
Click on the Restore button for the quiz youwish to restore.
Once you’re finished, click the Manage Quizzeslink to return.
The Quizzes feature implements the followingPIE Item:
D2807 (Restore Deleted Quizzes)Thank you to Jonathan Sorrenti for putting
forward this PIE suggestion to implement thisfeature!
The Quizzes feature is available to all clients.
To enable, administrators must enable theDelete and Restore Quizzes permission for
desired instructor roles.
This permission was previously Delete Quizzes.
Roles with the previous permission now havethe updated permission.
The Assignments search filter now defaultsto Show everyone (for individual assignments)
and Show all groups (for group assignments).
Instructors can apply additional filters toimprove search optimization.
Previously, the search filter defaulted toUsers with submissions for individual assignments
and Submitted groups for group assignments.
In Assignments, navigate to Submissions.
Click the Show Search Options link to expandthe filters list.
The default for individual assignments isShow everyone.
To change this filter, select and option fromthe drop-down menu.
Click the Search magnifying glass to updatethe results table.
The Assignments feature implements the followingPIE Items:
D1659 (Show all students when going to gradein shared folder); and
D5126 (Change Assignments submissions defaultto View All Users).
Thank you to Brandyn Sauer and Elizabeth Harsmafor putting forward these PIE suggestions
to implement this feature!
The Assignments feature is available to allclients, and is automatically enabled.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
In the Audio/Visual tool, obsolete configurationvariables related to the Download button have
been removed.
Extend your learning ecosystem with BrightspaceCourse Connector for Microsoft Teams®.
With Brightspace Editor, easily insert codesnippets with the Insert Code option.
Brightspace Editor’s Insert Stuff optionnow includes Media Library, as well as allowing
for quick access and management of the filesyou uploaded.
With Brightspace Insights, use additionaldata and sorting options in the new Adoption
Dashboard.
The Status Indicator is now set to Title Caseto improve readability throughout Brightspace
Learning Environment.
OAuth2-compliant added for user login in BrightspacePulse.
With Intelligent Agents, create more flexibleagents with fewer criteria.
With Language Management, clients can updateMastery View terminology to better reflect
their institutional preferences.
With LTI, manage grade associations for LTIcontent in New Content Experience.
Paper airplane icon no longer appears fortopics posted to Activity Feed in New Content
Experience.
And lastly, End of Life for Disable RightClick option in the Quizzes tool.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the August / Version
20.22.8 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: July 2022/20.22.7 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the July 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe July 2022 Version 20.22.7 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
In Brightspace Pulse, Discovery better supportstext-to-speech assistive technology.
Importing and Exporting Quiz Questions nowincludes alignment to outcomes for ASN standards
with the Import/Export tool.
With Turnitin, Restrict files to file typessupported by Turnitin with the updated panel.
Use Microsoft's OneDrive LTI application tolink and embed files from OneDrive.
and finally, a Summary of Changes made forall the other features.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Brightspace Pulse's Discovery feature sportsseveral improvements to better support users
who employ text-to-speech assistive technology:The Who provides your learning autocomplete
field is renamed to Find your school or institutionto make the label more intuitive for non-visual
learners.
The field is additionally marked as an editfield, indicating where to tap to activate
and what to enter.
The prompt displayed when no results are returnedhas been changed to "We're sorry!
We were not able to find a match.
Please try a different institution.
Or, if you know the school or institution'sweb address, you can enter it down below."
Typing a letter into the field has the displayedresults announced via an ARIA audio alert.
If there are no results, users are notifiedwithout requiring them to press the Enter
key.
This indicates to non-visual users if thereare results.
The Brightspace Pulse feature is availableto all Brightspace Pulse clients, and is automatically
enabled.
This feature has the following accessibilityimpacts:
WCAG 2.1 Success criteria: 3.3.2 (Labels orInstructions); 1.3.1 (Info and Relationships);
and 4.1.3 (Status Messages).
With this release, Brightspace Learning Environmentreplaces the previous multiple file pickers
with a single, universal file picker for Googleaccounts.
This supports both personal and WorkspaceGoogle accounts.
The previous file picker is being replacedwith the updated file picker to integrate
Google Workspace.
The Google File Picker feature implementsthe following PIE Items:
D2792 (Allow Google Doc submissions from anyGoogle Account)
D1709 (Upload files from Cloud-based services)D5795 (Google Drive/OneDrive Picker Integration);
andD5086 (Display Google Drive in Submissions
for all accounts)Thank you to Jonathan Sorrenti, Jeff Alison,
and all those who put forward these PIE suggestionsto implement this feature!
The Google File Picker feature is availableto all clients, and is automatically enabled.
With the Import/Export tool, D2L course ZIPpackages can now be imported and exported
with ASN outcome alignment for questions.
Previously, the quiz import process retainedthe alignments of ASN standards only for Content
topics and those directly aligned to Assignments.
Question alignments for importing or exportingRubrics and Quizzes is not presently supported.
The Import/Export feature is available toall clients, and is automatically enabled.
With this release, instructors can now restrictfile types to those supported by Turnitin.
If an invalid type is submitted, an erroris reported.
The updated side panel now indicates whichTurnitin services are enabled.
The text on these indications reflects thenew Turnitin feature names for Similarity
Report and Online Grading.
Navigate to Assignments and under the drop-downoptions menu, select Edit Assignment.
Expand the Submission and Completion tab,and select an option from the Allowable File
Extensions drop-down.
Here, we've selected PDF only.
Once completed, click Save and Close to saveyour changes.
This feature is available to all clients withthe Turnitin integration.
To enable, navigate to the Allowable FileExtensions drop-down menu and select Compatible
with Turnitin.
The new Microsoft OneDrive application supportsfile browsing, navigating and sorting directories,
selecting files, and switching between Microsoftaccounts.
The changes to support the new OneDrive LTIinclude:
Supporting the OneDrive LTI app Cancel button;and
Adding a configuration variable to displaythe OneDrive LTI App in the Quicklink option
(found in Edit Assignments).
The Microsoft OneDrive feature implementsthe following PIE Item:
D4975 (Disable document viewer on per-topicor per-course basis)
Thank you to those who put forward this PIEsuggestion to implement this feature!
This feature can be added by an Administratoras a regular LTI 1.3 tool.
To enable, first disable the former OneDriveapp.
Administrators can then add the new OneDriveLTI application to the Quicklink bar.
Please note that the current OneDrive Link/Embedtool will end-of-life in the near future.
This update does not change any existing learnerOneDrive file pickers.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Obsolete configuration variables related tothe Download button have been removed from
Audio/Visual tool.
Harness powerful data with a new version ofthe Adoption Dashboard in Brightspace Insights.
In Brightspace Learning Environment, easilyfilter items across the platform with improved
multi-contextual filter dialog.
Brightspace Platform Requirements is improvedto receive browser update alerts.
In Data Hub, access meaningful content fileinformation with the Content Files Properties
Log data set.
Copy grade items only copies unique or in-usegrade schemes with the Grades tool.
With Learning Groups, target personalizedlearning with the ability to add restrictions
during locked learning group setup.
LTI features additional supported claim valuesfor LTI 1.3 as well as changes to the LTI
Advantage administrative interfaces.
Using Outcomes Management, eliminate duplicationof effort with improved import rules around
aligned ASN standards in the Standards (LearningOutcomes) tool.
And finally, rearrangement of options forthe Turnitin integration, as well as Turnitin
feature names now reflected in BrightspaceLearning Environment’s user interface.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the July 2022 / Version
20.22.7 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: June 2022 / 20.22.6 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the June 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe June 2022 Version 20.22.6 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
View user pronouns next to names to furtherpersonalize learning with Classlist
Automate asynchronous group creation withAPIs with Group and Section Management
In Quizzes, create engaging assessments quicklywith the new quiz creation experience
Quickly determine a Rubrics state with archivedtags and selection list descriptions with
the Rubrics tooland finally, a Summary of Changes made for
all the other features.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Classlist can now display the pronouns ofusers next to their names.
This requires the new d2l.Tools.Classlist.DisplayPronounsconfiguration variable to be ON for the org
unit.
The default value of this configuration variableis OFF.
Pronouns were previously only displayed inthe User’s profile card.
As a Learner, navigate to Account Settings.
To allow others to see your pronouns, checkthe box for Allow others to see my pronouns.
Then, either chose the pronouns your organizationhas on file for you or enter in your pronouns.
When done, click Save and Close.
The Classlist feature implements the followingPIE Items:
D5207 (Preferred Pronoun field in Classlist);and
D8232 (Display Pronouns in Classlist).
Thank you to those who put forward these PIEsuggestions to implement this feature!
This feature is available to all clients.
To enable, set the d2l.Tools.Classlist.DisplayPronounsconfiguration variable to ON for the org unit,
and d2l.Settings.EnablePronouns to ON.
Then enable both the Account Settings > SetMy Pronouns and the User Information Privacy
> See Pronouns permissions for the appropriateuser role.
This feature implements changes to the groupcreation APIs to take advantage of the new
asynchronous creation method already in usein the Groups tool.
Upon creating a new group category with theAPI, a 202 Accepted response code is sent
acknowledging the request submission.
Any other PUT, POST or DELETE calls againstthe currently processing group category creation
receives a 409 Conflict status because thegroup category is not finished processing.
The Groups and Sections Management featureis available to all clients, and is automatically
enabled.
For more details on changes on the API workflow,refer to Changes to the Group Category creation
API workflow in Brightspace Community.
The new quiz creation experience brings theconsistency changes around create and edit
from Assignments into Quizzes.
These include:Quiz creation and other features most relevant
to learners now exist in the primary panel.
Quiz creation no longer has a separate interface.
The right-hand panel organizes additional,more advanced options such as start and end
dates, release conditions, and special access.
In addition, newly created quizzes auto-publishattempt results to learners and the grade
book by default if the quiz is connected tothe grade book.
The primary panel on the left contains commonfields most relevant to learners, such as
the Quiz name, Grading, and Due Date.
The Add/Edit Question workflow has been broughtinto this panel as well.
The question creation workflow remains unchanged.
The right-hand panel organizes more advancedoptions such as start/end dates, release conditions,
and special access.
Other quiz-specific settings can be foundhere as well.
When the accordion box is closed, a shortsummary of the settings contained within is
displayed under the accordion box title.
This feature is available to all clients.
To enable, set the new configuration variabled2l.Tools.Quizzes.CreateExperienceOptIn to
ON (Opt-In).
For an in-depth overview of the feature updates,refer to Welcome to the New Quiz Creation
Experience in Brightspace Community.
This release features the following updatesand improvements to the Rubrics Tool:
Archived Rubrics now appear with an archivedtag, which enables users to update rubric
versions while keeping the existing evaluationrecords available for instructors and learners
to review.
The Rubric selection dialog window includesthe first two rows of the rubric description
to better identify the version of a rubricwhen the name is being reused.
Finally, the help text icon appears next tothe Status column heading, and the Archived
Status text now more accurately reflects theavailable interactions with archived status
rubrics.
Navigate to Admin Tools > Rubrics.
You can observe the status of a rubric inthe Status column.
Click the icon in the Status header to viewthe descriptions of the various rubric statuses.
Click on the Rubric name to navigate to theEdit Rubric page.
You can see the status of the Rubric in theStatus heading.
Select Preview from the Edit Rubric dropdown.
You can see that an archived rubric is markedas such to learners.
This feature is available to all clients whouse Rubrics with any assessment tool across
the Brightspace Learning Environment.
This feature is automatically enabled.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
In Assignments, save time by copying assignmentsto other courses you teach.
End of life for Legacy Assessment QualityDashboard in Brightspace Insights.
Improved and consistent multi-contextual filterdialog across Brightspace Learning Environment.
In Brightspace Pulse, the Pulse App is nowonly supported on Android 6 and above or iOS13
and above.
The Bulk user management tool enhanced tosupport optional Gender field.
New and Edit File workflow change with theManage Files Tool.
With New Content Experience, streamline workflowswith the replace uploaded files functionality.
Use signed comments feature no longer supportedin Surveys tool.
Context copy history substitution for alllaunches provides a more consistent experience
with LTI.
And finally, improve course import workflowswith the creation of LTI Advantage links.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the June 2022 / Version
20.22.6 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: May 2022 / 20.22.5 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: this video is a selection of the new and
updated features we're excited to share
with you from the may 2022 release
the full list of features can be found
in the may 2022 version 20.22.5 release
notes which you can find on brightspace
community
this month we're highlighting the
following features
in datahub learners can now upload
portfolio evidence outside or otherwise
not linked to a course
manage files now features an improved
error message explaining why files with
names containing invalid characters
failed to upload
with new content experience the new edit
pages for lessons are now the default
allowing instructors to manage
availability and due dates
[Music]
saml now allows administrators to create
single sign-on buttons and links for the
login page which is available through
login page management
and finally a summary of changes made

let's take a closer look at this month's
features
in this release the brightspace datasets
from bds that capture portfolio activity
specifically the portfolio evidence

bds now accept null values in the org

this allows learners to upload portfolio
evidence from outside a course
this feature is available to brightspace
insights and brightspace core clients in
all regions who have the portfolio tool
enabled
to enable ensure the can access
