title: February 2022 / 20.22.2 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the February 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe February 2022 Version 20.22.2 Release
Notes, which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Enable Learners to see only the courses meantfor them with Discover – Role- and Custom
user attribute-based access to courses.
Make editing and organizing Intelligent Agentseasy with changes to the Intelligent Agent
List page.
Improved accessibility and user experiencewith Brightspace Editor’s Additional Page
Attributes (Language and Title).
Make grading faster when viewing learner submissionswith Ouriginal – Similarity Score on View
Submissions page;and finally a Summary of Changes made for
all the other features.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
In Discover, Administrators can now configurerole- and custom user attribute-based access
to individual courses in Discover.
For example:A university has professional development
courses that are only visible to instructors;or A company offers leadership courses that
are only visible to managers in specific departments.
Navigate to your Course Offering Informationpage, and then scroll down to the checkbox
Make this course available in Discover soLearners can self-enroll.
Click this checkbox to enable it.
Then, click Add Enrollment Rule.
Select either a Custom User-created attribute,or Role in organization, and enter the desired
value into the field.
The number of users matching the rule displaysbelow.
To add multiple conditions, click Add AnotherCondition.
Otherwise when finished, click Done and thenclick Save.
The updates to Discover implement PIE ItemsD5670 and D1000.
Thank you to Lori Wendt from Parkland Collegeand everyone else for your PIE suggestions
to implement these features!
The Discover features are available to allCore Clients.
The Change Visibility in Discover permissionis required to create rules.
However, users with the Manage Discover permissioncan still edit the Featured section.
These features have the following accessibilityimpacts: WCAG 2.1 Success criterion: 2.1.1
Keyboard.
The Intelligent Agents tool’s Agent Listpage now has several new features to help
you manage the Agents you've created:You can create and assign categories for your
Intelligent Agents, allowing for easier organization;and The new Bulk Edit button allows you to
edit the Title, Category, and/or Active orInactive status of multiple agents at once.
The icons denoting active/inactive state havealso been updated.
In your Course Administration page, navigateto Intelligent Agents to reach the Agent List
page.
There, either select the agent or agents youwish to edit, or click New Agent.
To create a new category, click on Add Categoryand enter the name in the corresponding field.
Once you’ve finished, click save to createthe new Category.
The category is automatically applied to anew agent.
To assign or change the category of an agent,select an option from the Category drop-down
menu.
Click Save and Close to save your changes.
You can view your agents organized by categoryby selecting By Category from the View drop-down
menu, and then clicking Apply.
To edit multiple agents at once, click thecheckboxes of the agents you wish to edit,
and select the Bulk Edit button.
You can only change title, category, and/orthe active or inactive state using bulk edit.
To save your changes, click Save.
The updates to Intelligent Agent List Pageimplements PIE Item D7196.
Thank you to those who put forward this PIEsuggestion to implement this feature!
The Intelligent Agent feature is availableto all clients and is automatically enabled.
It has the following accessibility impacts:WCAG 2.1 Success criterion: 1.3.6 Identify
Purpose
New to Brightspace Editor, the Attributesmenu has a new Page Attributes tab, where
you can set the title and/or language of yourpage.
This means that users of assistive technologyare provided descriptive information about
what they are viewing.
Note that the Page Attributes tab only appearsin legacy Content, Lessons, and Custom Widgets.
Instead of adding your titles and languagemanually, there are also two new configuration
attributes that do so automatically when enabled.
These are:d2l.Tools.Content.ApplyPageTitleElement; and
d2l.Tools.Content.ApplyPageLangAttribute.
These both are off by default.
The new permissions are only for legacy Content.
The Page Attributes tab can be found whencreating or editing any HTML page in Brightspace.
Click Other Insert Options and then clickAttributes.
The Page Attributes tab appears at the topof the window.
Once completed, click Create or Save to saveyour changes.
The Brightspace Editor updates are availableto all clients.
To enable automatically displaying titles,set the d2l.Tools.Content.ApplyPageTitleElement
configuration variable to ON.
By the same token, set d2l.Tools.Content.ApplyPageLangAttributeto ON to enable automatic display of language.
Previously called Urkund, Ouriginal’s similarityscores give instructors viewing assignment
submissions an easy-to-use plagiarism detectiontool.
The higher the percentage score, the moresimilar the document is to a document found
in Ouriginal's body of content.
If Brightspace fails to retrieve a similarityscore for the document, a warning icon is
present above the percent-similar icon.
The Ouriginal similiarity score displays besidethe assignment.
Click on the percent-similar icon to viewa detailed report.
The Ouriginal feature is available to allOuriginal clients, and is automatically enabled.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
New Look.
Same Mission.
Brightspace is getting new visual brandingto better reflect who we are today and will
be in the future.
We will be updating default logos and iconsover the coming releases.
Improving your experience with classic Content,as we make the Print and Download buttons
visible in full screen view.
Data Hub is adding the LastModifiedBy columnto existing datasets, allowing you to capture
learner attendance more effectively.
And lastly, upgrading and improving your securityby enabling Magic ETL (version 2) and making
OrgRoleId a Trusted Attribute in InsightsReport Builder.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the February 2022
/ Version 20.22.2 Release Notes on BrightspaceCommunity.
See you next month!

title: January 2022 20.22.1 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
Brightspace LeaP – Available in the Singaporeregion | New
As of this release, Brightspace LeaP is nowavailable to clients who require Singapore
hosting for regional or data residency requirements.
The regional LeaP LTI Launch Point URL forSingapore is https://leaplti-ap.brightspace.com/D2LLink.
This feature is available to all BrightspacePerformance Plus clients is automatically
enabled for all Brightspace LeaP users.
Brightspace Learning Environment – Improvedediting features in Audio-Video Editor | New
This feature introduces new capabilities tothe Audio-Video editor for files uploaded
to the Content Service. Users can now editvideo timelines, create chapters, and add
captions to their videos. D2L recommends usingthe desktop experience when editing audio-video
files.
Videos can be edited from course content orby using the Edit > Advanced Editing option
in the Admin Tools menu.
Editing timelines allows users to skip unwantedsections of a video recording.
Chapter titles can be used to create a Tableof Contents for videos to allow quick navigation
to specific sections.
Captions can be uploaded from a .vtt or .srtfile or automatically generated to make videos
accessible to all users.
In Content/Lessons, the editor features areonly available for newly uploaded audio-video
files and do not apply to files that wereuploaded prior to this feature being introduced.
This feature addresses the following accessibilitycriteria:
WCAG 2.1 Success criterion WCAG 1.2.2 Captions(Prerecorded)
This feature is available to all clients andis automatically enabled.
Administrators with the Media Platform > CanInsert All Video Notes and Can Administer
Video Notes and the Content Service > CanManage All Objects permissions can see the
Edit options for all Video Notes.
Users with the Media Platform > Can UploadVideo Notes and Can Administer Video Notes
permissions, along with the Content Service> Can Manage Objects permissions can see the
Edit options for Video Notes they uploaded.
Brightspace Learning Environment – Improvedviewing features in Audio-Video player | New
To improve the functionality of the Audio-Videoplayer in Brightspace Learning Environment,
multi-bitrate streaming, and search functionalityare now available.
Multi-bitrate streaming allows high-definitionvideos to be played at standard definition
to reduce the bandwidth necessary for usersto watch videos.
The new search functionality allows usersto locate key words in video captions and
quickly navigate to those sections.
This feature addresses the following accessibilitycriteria:
WCAG 2.1 Success criterion WCAG 1.2.2 Captions(Prerecorded)
This feature is available to all clients andis automatically enabled.
Brightspace Learning Environment – Supportedbrowsers | Updated
With this release, Brightspace Learning Environment'sbrowser version check now displays warnings
for browsers earlier than the following versions:
Chrome 93 (released in August 2021)Safari 13 (released in September 2019)
Firefox 91 (released in August 2021)Edge 93 (released in August 2021)
You can access Brightspace Learning Environmentwith older versions of our supported browsers;
however, D2L does not test Brightspace LearningEnvironment against these older versions.
This means you may encounter unexpected userinterface behavior and appearance or broken
and unsupported functionality. In most cases,D2L does not fix software defects experienced
in unsupported browser versions.
For an optimal experience that offers betterperformance, accessibility, and security,
D2L strongly recommends that all users accessBrightspace Learning Environment with the
latest version of a supported browser.
This feature is available to all clients andis automatically enabled for Brightspace Learning
Environment users.
Calendar – Improvements to Date and TimeSelection Web Components | Updated
Building upon the Calendar – ImprovementsTo Date And Time Selection Web Components
| Updated feature released in BrightspacePlatform March 2021/20.21.3 Release Notes,
this release updates the date and time pickerin Brightspace Learning Environment to include
the following usability changes:
The Set to Today button is renamed to Today.The Today button continues to set the date
and the time based on the context. For example,choosing Today for an End Date sets the current
date and sets the time to 11:59 PM.
Added a Now button that sets the current dateand time. The Today and Now buttons only appear
when a date and time are required. When onlya date is required, only the Today button
appears and functions the same as the Nowbutton.
The Today, Now, and Clear buttons are center-alignedin the date and time picker.
This feature implements PIE item D7627.
This feature addresses the following accessibilitycriteria:
WCAG 2.1 Success criterion 2.1.1 Keyboard
This feature is available to all clients andis automatically enabled for all tools that
use the date and time selector.
Content - Completion tracking for New LearnerExperience | Updated
With this release, the activity completiontracking in New Learner Experience (LX) no
longer includes optional activities. Thisremoves redundant information and provides
clarity for learners to distinguish betweenoptional and required course content. Updates
include the following:
Removed completion count 0/0 from Table ofContents, navigation menu, and End of Unit
page for modules with no required activities.
Note that this applies when there are no topicsin a module, or all the topics in a module
are either optional or the learner is exempt.
Removed empty progress meter from navigationmenu and End of Unit page for modules with
no required activities.
Removed completion checkmark from navigationtile for optional or exempt activities that
the learner has completed.
Total Activities component added to End ofUnit page, only for modules with one or more
optional activities. This component providesa count of all required activities in the
module, a count of all optional activitiesin the module, and the note "Optional activities
are not required for the completion of thisUnit".
Note that the count of optional activitiesincludes both optional and exempt activities.
Header on End of Unit page is now "OptionalActivities Unit" for modules with no required
activities. Previously, the header was "Nicework so far!" if any activities in the module
were incomplete, or "Congratulations!" ifall the activities in the module were complete.
Button on End of Unit page is now I'm Done!for modules with no required activities. Previously,
the button was Back to Content if any activitiesin the module were incomplete.
These are the pieces left to complete thisunit list on End of Unit page only includes
incomplete required activities. Previously,the list included all incomplete activities,
both required and optional.
This feature implements PIE items D7824 andD8581.
This feature is available to all clients andis automatically enabled for New Learner Experience
users.
Content - Date management and display forLOR Links in Lessons | New
This release introduces a new layout and datemanagement experience for editing linked LOR
objects in the new Content experience (Lessons).The experience is consistent with the Content
Date management and display in Lessons | Newfeature released in August 2021/20.21.8.
Previously, the edit page for LOR link contenttopics in Lessons only allowed users to edit
the title and provided no additional informationabout the object.
With this release, the edit page for LOR linkcontent topics in Lessons includes:
The ability to change topic name and displayoption; to add or change Due Date, Start Date,
and End Date;
Information about the LOR object, including:Document name
Version numberLast edit date
File type; andRepository name
Settings button, which opens the LearningObject Properties dialog. Previously, users
accessed this dialog by navigating to theOptions menu and clicking Use a different
version. This release removes that optionfrom the menu.
This feature is available to all clients.To enable, ensure the d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn
configuration variable is set to On(Opt-In).
Content - Link to Content Report in Lessons| New
This release adds a link to the Content Reportspage for courses using the new Content experience
(Lessons). To access, open the settings menuby clicking the gear symbol next to New Unit,
and click View Reports.
Previously, the only way to access contentreports from Lessons was creating a custom
link on the navbar.
This feature implements PIE item D7643.
This feature is available to all roles withSee Content Statistics permission and is automatically
enabled for Lessons users.
Content Service – Uploaded media files useContent Service | New
To improve the functionality of audio-videofiles in Brightspace this feature ensures
most audio-video files are handled by theContent Service. The new capabilities are
documented in the Brightspace Learning Environment– Improved viewing features in Audio-Video
player | New, and the Brightspace LearningEnvironment – Improved editing features
in Audio-Video Editor | New features fromthis release. Newly uploaded audio-video files
can now take advantage of all the featuresof the Content Service, and similar behavior
is experienced in all locations where mediafiles can be uploaded or edited. Audio-video
files that were uploaded prior to this releasedo not have access to the features available
to files hosted by the Content Service. Allaudio-video files uploaded to Content service
are now automatically converted to mp4 files(or mp3 for audio) to ensure they are playable
on all supported devices.
Note that videos uploaded as Assignment submissionsor uploaded to a course’s Manage Files area
continue to use the legacy method for handlingfiles.
To manage media files used by the ContentService, this feature introduces the following
new permissions:
Content Service > Can Manage ObjectsContent Service > Can Manage All Video Notes
The Content Service > Can Manage Objects permissionallows users to upload video and audio files
to Course Content using the Content Service,and edit their own content using the Advanced
Editing options. This permission requiresthe Content > Manage Content (at the Course
offering level) permission. Roles that currentlyhave the Content > Manage Content permission
are automatically assigned the new ContentService > Can Manage Objects permission.
The Content Service > Can Manage All VideoNotes permission allows users to manage and
edit video notes uploaded by any user at theirOrganization in the Audio/Video Notes Editor.
This permission requires the Media Platform> Can Insert Any Video Notes, and the Media
Platform > Can Administer Video Notes permissions.This permission is intended for administrators
as it grants access to all Video Notes uploadedby your organization.
The existing Content Service > Can ManageAll Objects permission (reserved for administrators)
is updated to allow users to edit all Video/Audionotes in the Audio/Video Notes Editor. Users
with this permission can also modify Videoor Audio Notes with the built-in editing tools.
This permission requires the Content > ManageContent, Media Platform > Can Insert Any Video
Notes, Media Platform > Can Upload Video Notes,and the Media Platform > Can Administer Video
Notes permissions. The Can Manage All Objectspermission grants full access to Content Service
objects, including the ability to permanentlydelete files, and should only be granted to
roles that require unlimited access to filesuploaded by your organization.
This feature is available to all clients.To enable, ensure that the new and existing
permissions that control media file uploadsare set appropriately for all necessary roles
at your Organization.
Course Import/Export – Logging improvements| New
To simplify user access to import/export logs,the Course Import/Export tool now includes
import/export logs as part of the Course Import/ExportHistory, which include navigation breadcrumbs.
In addition, the logs display the resultsin the order of import/export operations.
Previously, import/export logs opened in anew tab and displayed the results out of order,
without navigation breadcrumbs.
This feature is available to all clients,and is automatically enabled for all users.
Data Purge - Additional columns displayedin Org Unit and User Purge Sets | Updated
When clients create a data purge set for Usersor Orgunits, it was previously not possible
to review the data of the purge set for potentialissues (such as courses that are currently
in use) before performing the archive or purge.
The OrgUnitName (OrgUnitId), OrgUnitType,Active Status, and Start/End date are now
available for each orgunitid in the Org Unitpurge set.
Users can now sort each column.
The Name (Username), Active Status, and LastAccessed date are now available for each username
in the User data purge set.
Users can now sort by Active Status and LastAccessed date.
Note that if descendants of an org unit arechosen, the child orgunits do not display.
This feature is available to all clients.This functionality is automatically enabled
for Data Purge users. The existing Can ManagePurge Sets permission must also be selected
at the Organization level.
Discussions – Scoring Rubric drop-down forevaluations | New
To make the Discussion evaluation consistentwith the Assignments evaluation, this feature
adds the Grading Rubric drop-down to the sidebarmenu. This allows the instructor to choose
a grading rubric when evaluating a discussion.
If a normal topic assessment with Points/CustomPoints-based rubric is selected, this rubric
is the one whose score transfers to the OverallGrade field. The score transfer does not occur
if Allow assessment of individual posts ora Percentage rubric is selected.
This feature is available to all clients andis automatically enabled for Discussions users.
IPSIS - D2L Standard CSV Zip Name for BatchDisplay | New
To assist with the usability of IPSIS batchinformation, the zip folder name is now visible
in batch information in IPSIS, and in thebatch notification. This allows clients to
identify which locally saved batch matchesa specific batch process in IPSIS.
The zip folder name is visible on the latestbatch status on the IPSIS dashboard, within
each batch status on the batch tab, it ispart of the Batch Identifier in the Batch
filter on the Log Messages tab, and in batchnotifications.
This feature is available to all clients andis automatically enabled for IPSIS users.
IPSIS – Support for surname prefixes duringsort function | Updated
Continuing on the Support for surname prefixesduring sort function feature released in December
2021/ 20.21.12, the sortable last name isnow supported by the D2L Standard CSV.
The new version 2.1 CSV now includes the optionalsort_last_name column in addition to the existing
type, action, username, org_defined_id, first_name,last_name, password, is_active, role_name,
email, relationships, pref_first_name, andpref_last_name columns.
This feature is available to all IPSIS clientswith a CSV source system. To enable, administrators
must have the Manage IPSIS Bulk Operationspermission.

title: December 2021 Release Highlights

captions.text: This video will highlight some of the new and  updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.21.12.
Assignments – New Assignment creation experience universally enabled | Updated
This feature sets the new Assignment creation experience to ON by default.
This will mean that the Classic Assignment experience will no longer be available.
The d2l.Tools.Dropbox.CreateExperienceOptIn
org unit configuration variable is deprecated and no longer available to site administrators.
This feature is available to all clients. The d2l.Tools.Dropbox.CreateExperience Opt-In
(OrgUnit) configuration variable is deprecated.
Brightspace Editor – Hotkey shortcut to Brightspace Editor source editor | New
This feature adds a new hotkey shortcut in the Brightspace Editor to access the source editor.
Previously, the source editor was unavailable by a hotkey shortcut.
The hotkey shortcut is: Ctrl-Shift-e for Windows; and Command-Shift-e for Mac.
This feature addresses the following accessibility criteria:
WCAG 2.1 success criterion 2.1.4 Character Key Shortcuts
This feature is automatically enabled for all clients.
Brightspace Insights – New version of the Assessment  Quality Dashboard | Updated
To increase the value of the Assessment Quality Dashboard, originally released in Brightspace
Platform 20.19.5 / May 2019, this release updates and adds the following features:
Organization level permission support, which removes the need for full cascading roles for users to access the necessary data;
Org filtering, which allows filtering of data across different org levels;
Exporting data to CSV;
Settings page, where users can define their own settings to better control and surface the relevant data;
Interactive cards and visualizations that apply different views to the data ;
Accessibility features: visual cues like filter tags and toast messages;  support for screen readers; and keyboard navigation;
Pagination, which enables users to define the number of results per view and easily sequence the results;
Question Analysis View,  which displays a preview of the question, the question grading, comments, and hints; and
Updated wording:"Top Lure" is now "Popular Incorrect Answer"; and
"Top Lure Response Rate" is now "Popular Incorrect Answer Response Rate"
Currently the new feature is turned off by default and requires administrator action to enable.
In the March 2022 Release the new  experience will be turned on by default, but an administrator can still turn it off.
In the June 2022 Release , the configuration variable will be removed
and the new assessment quality dashboard will be the only experience available.
This feature addresses the following accessibility criteria:
WCAG 2.1 success criterion 1.4.13 Content on Hover or Focus;
success criterion 2.1.1 Keyboard; andsuccess criterion 2.4.3 Focus order
This feature implements PIE item D7209.
This feature is available to all clients who have the Performance Plus package,
or who have purchased Brightspace Insights  in the previous packaging model. To enable, administrators must set the
d2l.Tools.Insights.AssessmentQuality.EnableNewExperience configuration variable to on.
Brightspace Learning Environment – Support for surname prefixes during sort function | Updated
In some countries, including the Netherlands, Belgium, and Sri Lanka, surnames have one or more prefixes
(known in Dutch as Tussenvoegsel) that are part of the formal last name. For example, van der Spiegel or Van Gogh.
In some cases, the sortable last name should not include those prefixes.
It is now possible to indicate if a user's Legal Last Name differs from the Sortable Last Name.
If clients include a Sortable Last Name, the Brightspace Learning Environment uses the Sortable Last Name when alphabetizing user lists.
The following tools currently support the Sortable Last Name:
ClasslistGrades
QuizzesAssignments
Discussions Manage Exemptions; and
New Content – Completion Summary
Additional tools will be added to this list in future releases.
To add a Sortable Last Name to a user's information, do one of the following:
In the Users Tool, in User Information, add a Sortable Last Name; or
In the Brightspace API add a Sortable Last Name for the appropriate user.
This feature is available to all clients. This functionality is automatically enabled for users of the supported tools:
Classlist, Grades, Quizzes, Assignments,
Discussions, Manage Exemptions, and New Content – Completion Summary.
Brightspace Portfolio – Collecting evidence not linked to a course | New
With this release, administrators can enable a new workflow that allows learners to collect evidence
and choose whether they want to link it to a course or not.
While most learners capture evidence of learning for the courses they are enrolled in,
some learners may not be enrolled in courses and still need to collect
evidence of learning in an independent location where assessment by an instructor is unnecessary.
For example: program learning in higher education, extracurricular activities,
internships, or independent learning and research.
Previously, learners were required to link collected evidence to courses they were currently enrolled in.
When a learner uploads evidence in the Portfolio web application, they are redirected to the Evidence page, which displays a new option
that allows them to choose whether to link the evidence to a course or not.
With a new workflow uploaded evidence is unlinked by default indicated by the Not Linked label.
To link the evidence to a course, learners click the pencil icon beside Not Linked,
select an active course they are enrolled in, and click Link. When a learner uploads evidence in the
Brightspace Portfolio app, they are prompted to choose a folder to upload evidence to:
Unlinked Evidence, or one of the courses they are enrolled in.
From the Portfolio web application, when a learner navigates to the Portfolio landing page and clicks
View By: Courses, an Unlinked Evidence tile displays, along with active course styles.
The Unlinked Evidence tile is where learners can add and view all uploaded evidence that is not linked to a course.
Clicking the Unlinked Evidence tile displays all unlinked and linked evidence on the View By: Evidence page.
From this page learners can filter the evidence by Has Course or Has No Course.
This feature addresses the following accessibility criteria:
WCAG 2.1 success criterion 1.4.3 Contrast (minimum); and 2.1.1 Keyboard
This feature is available to all clients. To enable the new workflow,
administrators turn on the new d2l.Tools.Folio.EvidenceOutsideOfCourses
configuration variable at the Org level. This configuration is off by default.
Brightspace Pulse – Display Pulse banner in Grades | New
To promote Brightspace Pulse usage in organizations, administrators can choose to display a banner in the learner view of the Grades tool.
The banner includes links to the Brightspace Pulse app from the Google Play and Apple App Store.
Previously, the banner was only visible from the Notification Settings page.
This feature is available to Brightspace Core clients in all regions. To enable, ensure that
the d2l.System.Mobile.ImproveAppDiscoverability configuration variable is turned on at the Org level.
The default value is on. When set to on, this banner appears in the learner view of the Grades tool
and in the Notification Settings page in the Brightspace Learning Environment.
Content – New Content edit experience supports media file captions | New
The new Content edit experience now supports the ability to upload captions to a media file.
This functionality was previously only available in the previous Lessons view and in the Classic Content experience.
To add captions, users select Advanced Editing and select a language along with their SRT file with the subtitles.
This feature addresses the following accessibility criteria:
WCAG 2.1 success criterion 1.2.2 Captions (pre-recorded)
This feature is available to all clients. To enable, ensure that the New Content experience is enabled,
and allow instructors to opt into the new create/edit experience using
the d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn configuration variable.
Content – updated count and overdue badges | New
In the Classic Content tool for instructors and learners, the count and overdue badges in the Table of Contents
now reflect an updated appearance that is consistent with the New Content experience and other Brightspace tools.
The new count badge is circular (for single digits) or a capsule (for double digits) with a gray background and with higher contrast text.
In addition, the overdue badge is now circular (for single digits) or a capsule (for double digits).
Previously the count badge was rectangular, with a white background and gray text and outline. The overdue badge was rectangular and red.
This feature addresses the following accessibility criteria:
WCAG 2.1 success criterion 1.4.3 Contrast (minimum)
This feature is available to Brightspace Core clients for all regions and is automatically enabled for all users.
Course Import/Export – Import and Export intelligent agents | New
With this release, administrators and instructors can now include intelligent agents when importing or exporting courses.
This allows administrators and instructors to share the dynamic notification interactions
in imported and exported courses with other Brightspace instances.
Previously, intelligent agents were not included when importing or exporting courses.
This feature is available to Brightspace Core clients in all regions, and is automatically enabled for all users.
Discussions – Consistent evaluation experience | Updated
This feature is a continuation of the Discussions – New Discussion evaluation experience | Updated feature introduced in
September 2021/20.21.9. With this release, the d2l.Tools.Activities.CEDiscussionsOptIn configuration variable is set to on.
This removes the ability to opt-out of the new Discussions evaluation experience.
To give customers flexibility in implementing this feature, administrators can still override the configuration variable.
However, the configuration variable will be removed in the January 2022/20.22.01 release.
This feature is available to all clients, and is automatically enabled for all users.
Discussions – Consolidated dates ON by default | Updated
This feature builds on the default setting progression for visibility and posting restrictions in discussion forums and topics.
In August 2021/20.21.8, it was possible for administrators to opt into the workflow. This was updated again in September 2021/20.21.9
when the default was updated to be on by default, but administrators could change the setting. With the final change to the workflow in
December 2021/20.21.12, the discussion date consolidation is now on by default for all clients and cannot be turned off.
Note that all date overrides are cleared when the default changes  to on.
Once a new workflow is enabled, The following changes are visible to instructors when creating  or editing discussion forums and topics:
From the Restrictions tab, the previous Locking Options are now consolidated with the Availability Start Date and End Date options
and display as the following new options:
Visible with access restricted before/after the start/end date:
The topic/forum is visible to learners before/after the start/end date, but they cannot access it.
Previously, Classic Content was the only tool to make discussions visible without access.
Visible with submission restricted before/after the start/end date:
This topic /forum is visible to learners before/after  the start/end date and they can access it, but they cannot post new threads or replies.
This effectively makes a discussion read-only.
Previously this was accomplished with the lock option or unlock dates; and
Hidden before/after the start/end date:
The topic/forum is hidden from learners until the start/end date. This is a new feature.
Calendar events for Availability Starts and Availability Ends are hidden until the start/end date.
Previously the hidden status of a topic was decided by the tool displaying the topic.
From the Restrictions tab, the Display in Calendar option is now consolidated with the Availability Start Date and End Date options,
which adds the start date and end date to the calendar.
Previously, the tool decided which calendar event should be added to the calendar.
With this change calendar events for availability dates may change and additional events for Availability Start Dates may be added;
Calendar events for unlocked dates are now hidden from learners;
Where Discussions and User Progress may have previously hidden a topic or forum when outside the availability dates,
those tools may now show them as visible but inaccessible; and
From Discussion Settings, instructors can now set the default visibility and access behavior for the new discussion forums and topics.
The defaults can be set at an organization level.
Note that these changes also affect the Classic Content and Manage Dates tools.
This feature is available to Brightspace Core clients in all regions, and is automatically on for all users. It can no longer be set to off.
Email – Address Book changes to To, CC, and Bcc options | Updated
This feature changes the Email tool's workflow when selecting an email recipient in the To, CC and/or Bcc fields.
Each of these fields in the Compose window are now links that, when clicked, launch an Address Book dialog to select recipients from.
Once a user or users are selected, they are added to the respective field.   Each of the three fields (To, CC, and Bcc) have their own separate links.
This feature also affects the Intelligent Agents tool; when users create a new Intelligent Agent,
they can select the Send an Email option. Users then click the Address Book button next to each To, CC, and/or Bcc fields
to choose the recipient or recipients from. In effect, the changes made to the Email above are also reflected in the Intelligent Agents tool.
Under the previous workflow, users would have to select Address Book, select recipient or recipients from the list
by clicking the checkbox, and then selecting the Add Recipients button.
The existing Address Book button remains unchanged; users can continue to use the old workflow.
This feature is available to all clients and is automatically enabled for all users.
Widgets – Ability to configure navigation in visual Table of Contents | Updated
In the visual Table of Contents widget, it is possible to navigate by two separate methods.
You can click the image on the course tile to navigate at the root module level,
or you can click the text module link to navigate to the next submodule.
By using the config.txt JSON file used to configure cloud-based widgets, administrators can now use the new
forceTopLevelModuleNav variable to manage the Table of Contents behavior so that the navigation always goes to the root module.
To set the text module link in the course tile to navigate to the root module within the Table of Contents,
set the forceTopLevelModuleNav variable to true.
To set the text module link in the course tile to navigate to the sub module, set the force toplevel module nav variable to false, which is the default.
This feature is available to all clients using the visual Table of Contents widget.
This functionality is automatically enabled for visual Table of Contents widget users.
Widgets – Arabic language support for selected hosted widgets | New
To improve the user experience across more international languages, the following widgets now have Arabic language support:
Visual Table of Contents;
Photo Banner;
and Learner Awards
This feature is available to all clients. This functionality is automatically enabled for widget users.
Languages automatically display based on the defined Locale Management settings.
LTI® Advantage – Assignments and Grade Services | updated
A new LTI Advantage Assignments and Grade Services (AGS) configuration option is available at the Deployment level
that allows grades created using LTI Advantage to be included in final grades.
Previously, with the legacy LTI Basic Outcomes integration, grades created by a tool were automatically excluded from the final grade
as most instructors pre-configured the gradebook in advance. With LTI Advantage's AGS including a more robust grade integration,
it removes the need to pre-configure the gradebook in Brightspace.
Administrators can now choose how grade items created by AGS affect final grades.
Grade items created using LTI Advantage that do not have a score can be deleted if you send an AGS delete command.
If the grade item has a score, the AGS line item is deleted, but the grade item in Brightspace Learning Environment remains.
This feature addresses PIE item D7778.
This feature is available to all clients using LTI Advantage tools. The functionality is automatically enabled for LTI Advantage users.
LTI® Advantage – View as role logic change | New
This feature changes Brightspace Learning Environment behavior when using the View as role feature and completing an LTI launch.
Previously ,when a user selected View as role and completed an LTI launch, they were sent to
the IMS role mapped to their current role in the org unit where the launch occurred.
Now, when a user selects View as role and completes an LTI launch, they are assigned
the IMS role that is mapped to the role they selected from the viewer's role menu.
This allows instructors to view a course as a learner,   preview LTI materials as a learner would see them,
and maintain consistency with how role switching is treated in Brightspace Learning Environment.
This feature is available to all clients using LTI Advantage tools. This functionality is automatically enabled for all LTI Advantage users.

title: October 2021   Release Highlights

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features
of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.21.10
Brightspace Editor – Drag and drop as well as copy and paste images
This feature updates the Brightspace Editor functionality as released in the Rubrics,
Brightspace Editor Additional Functionality - Updated feature in September 2021 / 20.21.9
and complements the Brightspace Editor – Improvements - Updated feature released in May
2021 / 20.21.5. The drag/drop and copy/paste functionality of images are now available
in areas that contain no user-specific data. See Release Notes for full details.
This feature partially implements PIE items D7884, D2190, and D7968.
This feature is available to all clients and is automatically enabled for all users.
Brightspace Editor – Email notifications for users tagged in discussion posts and threads - Updated
Brightspace Editor – Email notifications for users tagged in discussion posts and threads
This feature updates the Brightspace Editor – Additional functionality - Updated feature
released in June 2021 / 20.21.6 and now adds the ability for users tagged
in discussion posts and threads to receive email notifications.
The new Discussions - new mention in a discussion post or thread option appears
in the Notifications page (Admin Tools menu > User Related > Notifications) when the following
configuration variables are turned on:d2l.Tools.WYSIWYG.Mentions
d2l.Tools.Discuss.Notifications
These configuration variables are turned off by default.
For full information on this update, see the 20.21.10 Release Notes
Brightspace for Parents – Mobile app
To better represent the people supporting young learners at home, the Brightspace for Parents
mobile app, introduced in the September 2021 release, is now the Brightspace Parent & Guardian
mobile app. This name change also extends to the name of the web application in Brightspace
This feature is available to Brightspace Core clients in all regions.
To enable, the Brightspace Parent & Guardian web application must be
currently enabled in your school's Brightspace Learning Environment.
Content – Add Print button to PDF Files – Updated
This feature adds the option to print PDF file types to Classic Content.
The Print button is visible when viewing a PDF topic or the Course Overview as a PDF.
This button will also only appear for users with Compile and Print Content permission.
No option to print PDFs was previously available.To enable: This functionality is available to all
clients and is automatically enabled for Content users, regardless of whether the
d2l.Tools.DocumentViewers.CustomPdfRendererEnabled is on or off.
Ensure that the user has Compile and Print Content enabled for their role.
Content - Customize Language Terms in the new content experience
With this release, administrators can use the Language Management tool to override default
language terms in the New Content Experience, including the New Learner Experience. This
allows administrators to use terminology that is consistent with their organization, for example,
using custom terms for "unit," "lesson," and "folder." Previously, language terms in the New
Content Experience were not customizable.This feature is available to all clients.
To enable, Ensure the d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn
configuration variable is set to On or On(Opt-In).Use the Language Management tool to customize
language terms that appear in the New Content Experience.
Course Import - View Course Import historyUsers can now view the history of course import
attempts for courses in a specific org unit. From the Import/Export/Copy tool on Course Admin, users
can view the Course Import History page, which includes the following information for each course
import attempt: the original package name, status of the import, user who created the import job,
and date and timestamp for the import attempt.The content is sorted by Start Time
(Descending) by default, but clients can change this sort setting as required.
After users have viewed the page, they can return to the Import/Export/Copy Components landing page
in Course Admin, and click View Import Log to see a more detailed log. The log opens
at the end point for the course conversion.This feature is available to all clients.
To enable, ensure that the user has the Import/Export/Copy Components > Import Content
Packages permission enabled for their role.This feature implements PIE items D2336 and D5473.
For full information on this feature, see the 20.21.10 Release Notes.
Course Publisher – Tool UpdateAs of the October release, Course Publisher
will be available to all clients in the admin cog without requiring D2L staff to enable it.
The information banner that appears when you publish a course for the first time
is being updated to include more language around possible overages incurred by creating a course.
This feature is available to all clients. This functionality
is automatically enabled for all clients.
To see Course Publisher in admin tools,
ensure Admin Users have the permission Publish > Publish Courses enabled.
Data Hub – Added and removed columns in Discussions - Updated
As part of the visibility and posting restrictions for Discussions introduced
in the August 2021 release, this release adds and removes several
date columns from the Discussion Forums and Discussion Topics Brightspace Data Sets.
This feature is available to Brightspace Insights and Brightspace Core clients in all regions.
To enable, ensure the Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission
is granted to administrators at the org level.
See the Release Notes for this release for more information on this update.
SCORM - Improved editing in New Content ExperienceAn improved editing experience for SCORM topics
is available to instructors in the New Content experience. With the new create
and edit experience enabled, a new edit page for SCORM topics allows instructors to edit
dates and associated grade items from the New Content experience.
Previously, users could not set dates or change the associated
grade item the New Content experience . The d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn
configuration variable must be enabled for the new SCORM editing page to be visible.
This feature is available to Brightspace Core clients.
To enable, ensure the New Content experience is enabled,
or that instructors can opt-in to the New Content experience using the
d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn configuration variable.

title: Release Highlights - August 2021 (v 20.21.8)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.21.8.
The legacy assignment evaluation experience is now retired and the Consistent Evaluation Experience is the only available experience.
Note: The new d2l.tools.Activities.CEAssignmentsOptIn configuration variable is now permanently turned on by default.
Assignment release conditions can now be automatically shared with associated grade items in the new assignment creation experience.
Administrators can determine the behavior of assignment release conditions with the new d2l.Tools.Grades.ReleaseConditionSync configuration variable.
The new Brightspace Editor is now the default editor across Brightspace Learning Environment.
Administrators can no longer edit the d2l.Tools.WYSIWYG.NewEditor (Org) configuration variable, which will be archived in the September 2021/20.21.9 release.
The Account Settings > HTML Editor Settings option is no longer available as it is not applicable with the new Brightspace Editor.
To simplify navigation in the Portfolio tool and allow learners to more easily manage their course portfolios,
this release introduces the following usability enhancements:
A toggle to view all courses or evidence.A toggle to view all courses or evidence in tile or list format.
A list to view active evidence or archived portfolios.Evidence filters.
This feature allows instructors to manage dates for most topic types in the new content experience (Lessons),
and makes those dates visible to learners using the new learner experience (LX).
With this release, administrators can provide instructors with the ability to opt-in to the new date management experience.
To enable: Ensure the d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn configuration variable is set to On or On(Opt-In)
and the d2l.Tools.Content.NewExperienceDisplayDates configuration variable is set to On.
This feature updates the user evaluation experience when assessing a topic or an individual learner,
allowing instructors to better review and evaluate discussion contributions.
To enable: Ensure the d2l.Tools.Activities.CEDiscussionOptIn configuration variable is set to On(Opt-In) or On.
This feature implements PIE items D2211, D2348, D2514, D3430, D3673, D4859, D4920, D5148, D4393, D6911, and D7253.
Administrators can now opt-in to a new workflow that makes it easier for instructors to set visibility and posting restrictions for discussion forums and topics.
To enable: Set the new d2l.Tools.Discuss.ConsolidatedDatesEnabled configuration variable to ON. By default, the value is OFF.
Note: With this new workflow, the Override Locked Topic Restrictions permission is renamed to Override Availability Date Submission Restrictions.

title: Release Highlights - June 2021 (v 20.21.6)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.21.6.
Your instructors can now restore deleted attendance registers and associated data.
Note: Deleted registers do not appear in the Attendance data set.
This feature implements PIE ideas D6051 and D1535.
The Brightspace Editor now allows users to copy and apply text formatting, and include @mentions in discussion posts.
Note: Tagged users are notified by alert notifications in the navbar.
To make this functionality available in your organization the following configuration variable must be turned ON at the ORG level.
A new Learner Engagement card has been added to the Insights Portal. This allows users to quickly navigate to individual users Learner Engagement Dashboards.
This feature also adds a visualization in the Engagement Dashboard Summary view. The Content View histogram tracks how many times course content objects have been viewed.
You must have the Can See Engagement Dashboard and Can Query Data Platform permissions enabled at the Organization level.
Your Instructors can now create LaTex equations in the HTML and Brightspace Editors.
Your Instructors must have the following configuration variable turned ON at the ORG level.
This feature implements PIE ideas D1822 and D7732.
There are nine new Learning Outcomes Brightspace Data Sets. For information on each new Learning Outcome data set, click the link in the description to access the full release notes.
Note: you must have the Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission at the org level.
The Save a copy of each outgoing message to the Sent Mail folder checkbox has been removed and all sent messages are automatically saved in the Sent Mail folder.
Criterion groups can now be reordered in the New Rubric Creation Experience.
This implements PIE item D5263.

title: Teaching Tips - Edit HTML Templates - Instructor

captions.text: Quickly build engaging content in your courseby editing HTML Templates.
This tutorial shows how to edit HTML templatesusing dynamic elements.
This template package comes with several purpose-builttopic types, such as Course Intro, Module
Intro, Meet Your Facilitator, Basic Page,Video Lecture, and Conclusion.
You also receive dynamic element pages which include interactive elements such as accordions, and tabs.
For this example, we will create a CourseIntroduction. Click Upload/Create.
…and select Create a File.
Enter a title.
Note: Applying the template to an existingpage will overwrite the content and you will
lose your work.Click, Select a Document Template.
Select the template you want to apply to thefile. For this example, select 01_intro.
Edit the template.
Tip: When beginning to build your course,it is considered a best practice to create
a hidden module that houses every contenttemplate, so you can use this as reference.
For more information about working with HTMLtemplates, reference the Daylight HTML Template
3.0 Community Article.
Next, we will add an accordion to this page.Open another tab in Brightspace, and navigate
to your reference page “accordions”.
Note: If you are copying an element, the HTMLeditor must be in edit mode in order to capture
the underlying code.Click the context menu…
and select, Edit HTML.
Each Dynamic Element page includes text cuesto help you capture the code you need.
Copy your selection…
Then, navigate to your Course Introductionpage.
Lastly, paste your copied dynamic elementinto the HTML editor.
Now that your dynamic element has been pasted,you can begin editing by removing the prompts,
and updating the text within the element.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Your templated content displays.
Quickly build engaging content in your courseby editing HTML Templates.

title: Quick Eval - Evaluate by Activity - Instructor

captions.text: Find and prioritize unevaluated learner submissionsusing the Activity view in Quick Eval.
This tutorial shows how to complete evaluationsusing the Activity view in Quick Eval.
To begin, from Quick Eval, click Activities.
Here, submissions are grouped by activity.
Activities are a collection of user submissionsorganized by their respective titles, and
consist of Discussions, Assignments, and Quizzes.
Activities are visible in Quick Eval if thereare unevaluated learner submissions or if
not all learners have completed the activity.
This allows you to easily identify how many new submissions have been made, how many learners have
completed each activity, how many submissions you have evaluated,
and evaluations with published feedback.
Use Filter…
to filter results by Activity Name, and ifapplicable, by course.
Hover over an activity…
to view and evaluate submissions from withinQuick Eval. Click Evaluate All…
The evaluation panel displays.Here, you can navigate between all submissions
by using Previous and Next, complete the rubricif applicable, or enter a Topic Score…
Navigate to General Feedback…
to provide any additional feedback.
The learner submission is available for reference.
When you are satisfied with your evaluation,click Save Draft, to save your evaluation
in draft state, or click Publish, to publishyour evaluation.
For this example, click Publish.
Note: When evaluations have been published, the actions available to you become Update or Retract.
To return to Quick Eval, click Back to QuickEval.
Hover over an activity…
and click More Actions.
To Publish all evaluations, or dismiss theactivity until a specified date.
For this example, click Publish All.
A confirmation message displays. Click Yesto continue..
Find and prioritize unevaluated learner submissionsusing the Activity view in Quick Eval.

title: Activity Feed - Overview of Activity Feed - Instructor

captions.text: Use Activity Feed to create a central placefor users to engage and stay up-to-date on
what’s happening in their course.
This tutorial gives an overview of commonuse cases and functionality of Activity Feed.
To begin, from your course homepage, clickthe Plus icon to create a post.
When creating a post, you can choose from the following options: Write a Post, Create an Assignment
Post, Upload a File, Attach Link to ExistingActivity, Attach Weblink, and Attach from
Google Drive (TM) or One Drive (TM), AttachVideo from Web, and Post Later.
Create an Assignment Post allows you to quicklycreate a new assignment submission folder
and link it to your grade book from withinthe Activity Feed, or link an existing assignment
to Activity Feed.
Upload a File allows you to attach a filefrom your device to a post.
Attach Link to Existing Activity allows youto create a direct link to existing course
material and bring it to users’ attentionin a prominent location.
Attach Weblink allows you to create a messageand attach an external page or video to share
with users.
Attach from Google Drive or Attach from OneDriveallows you to quickly attach additional materials
that are stored in their respective onlinestorage space.
Attach Video from Web allows you to link toan external video that will display in the
feed.
Post later allows you to schedule posts toappear to learners at a specified date and
time.
Enter a message to share with learners.
You can use the Allow Comments checkbox tocontrol commenting on a post by post basis.
When you are ready, click Post.
Your message displays in Activity Feed.
Use Activity Feed to create a central place for users to engage and stay up-to-date on what's happening in their course..

title: Content - Create a File and Insert Stuff - Instructor

captions.text: Create new topics right in your course and insert stuff, such as: images, videos, or
other objects into the topic.
This tutorial shows how to create a new topicin a module or sub-module and how to insert
stuff into that topic.
In this example, we will create a new topicin a sub-module.
Click Upload/Create.
Select Create a File.
Give your file a title.
Then, enter your content.
You can also insert stuff, such as videosor images, into your topic.
To do this, click Insert Stuff.
Click on the location where you will searchfor an item.
In this example, we will insert a YouTube video.
Enter your search terms…
…and click Search.
Select the video you would like to use.
Then, click Next.
Click Insert.
When you are ready, click Save and Close tomake the topic available in your course.
Create new topics right in your course anduse insert stuff , such as: images, videos,
or other objects into the topic.

title: Quizzes - Create a New Quiz - Instructor

captions.text: Quickly create quizzes to assess your learners.This tutorial shows how to create a new quiz.
To begin, from Manages Quizzes, click NewQuiz.
Enter a name for your quiz.
Navigate to Quiz Questions.
Then, to populate your quiz, click Add/EditQuestions.
Here, you can Add a new question, section,or question pool, or Import existing questions
from Question Library, or a CSV. Click Add.
Then, select New Question.
For this example, select short answer.
Enter your question details.
When you are satisfied with your question,click Save. Note: Use the Save actions menu
to Save and New to continue creating questions, or Save and Copy to create a copy of the question you created.
Continue adding questions to your quiz, click Import.
Select Browse Question Library.
and select the question you want to import. For this example, we will add all existing questions to the quiz.
Then, click add.
Your questions display. To change a question’sproperties, select its checkbox.
You can delete the question, or click moreactions…
To Toggle Bonus status, Toggle Mandatory status, or change the Set Points value.
For this example, delete the question.
Note: Deleting a question from a quiz will
not remove it from Question Library. Confirmyour selection.
Questions can be rearranged using the Handlesto drag and drop the selection into a new
location…or using keyboard only navigation. When you
are satisfied with your quiz, click Back toSettings for
Lastly, to add the quiz to your course, clickSave and Close.
Quickly create quizzes to assess your learners.

title: Quizzes - Associate a Quiz with a Grade Item - Instructor

captions.text: Associate a grade item with a quiz to connectthe quiz results to Grades.
This tutorial shows how to associate a gradeitem with a quiz.
From Manage Quizzes, click the quiz you wantto associate with a grade item.
Then, click the Assessment tab.
The Grade Item menu contains a list of activegrade items in the course.
You can also add a new grade item.
For this example we will associate the quizwith an existing grade item.
Click the Grade Item drop down.
Each Grade Item in your grade book, displaysin this menu.
Select the grade item that relates to yourquiz.
Auto export to grades prompts the system tosend autograded attempt scores to directly
to the grade book if a quiz is associatedwith a grade item.
Use this option if you’re using questiontypes that the system can grade, such as true
or false and multi select questions.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
The grade item icon displays next to yourquiz.
Associate a Grade item with a quiz to connectthe quiz results to your grade book.

title: Release Highlights - June 2020 v. 20.20.6 - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.20.6.
The classic tab view in Assignments has been transformed into a new, fully immersive page layout.
To enable you must set the d2l.Tools.Dropbox. CreateExperienceOptIn configuration to On (Opt-In).
The primary panel contains frequently used fields that are always displayed. Instructors can add a due date,
instructions and any attachments.The additional panel organizes more advanced
options such as start and end dates, rubrics,annotation tools, and Turnitin.
A new ResultId column has been added to allow for more detailed Release Condition reporting.
ResultId has been added to the following Brightspace Data Sets: Discussion Forums, Discussion Topics,
Checklist Objects, and Assignment Summary.
You must have the Can Access Brightspace DataSets permission at the org level, and the
d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version configurationvariable set to version 4 or 5.
Immediately following each continuous deliveryupdate, non-production sites will generate
Brightspace Data Sets FULL and DIFF files.You must have the Can Access Brightspace Data
Sets permission at the org level, and thed2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version configuration
variable set to version 4 or 5.
Quiz Questions and Survey Questions BrightspaceData Sets have been removed.
A new partner Brightspace Data Set, VirtualClassroom Usage has been added. This BDS reports
on how Virtual Classroom by Bongo is beingused and is available to all clients with
the Premium version of Bongo.
You must have the Can Access Brightspace DataSets permission at the org level, and the
d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version configurationvariable set to version 4 or 5.
Now, when you copy outcomes you can unlink the copied objects in the target course to be editable.
Note: This feature does not apply to Achievement Standards Network (ASN)
or Program-imported outcomes.
The learning outcomes hierarchy tree is now displayed, and users can now search the outcomes
list to find the best outcome to align withquiz activities in their courses and programs.
Here your Instructors can collapse or expandsections by clicking on the section titles,
search for a specific outcome, and browseoutcomes.
A checkbox has been introduced so Instructorsusing hidden rubrics can opt to transfer their
feedback from the hidden rubric to generalfeedback in Grades.
Instructors can now transfer their feedbackfrom a hidden rubric to general feedback in
grades, by clicking Include rubric feedbackin overall feedback
Now, when users navigate to a module or topicusing a widget, they are returned to the homepage
when they complete the module or topic.
The ability to filter permission by Org Unit has been added to the Edit Permissions page
in Roles and Permissions. This feature partially implements PIE item D3686.
To filter permissions by Org Unit, click ChooseOrg Unit Types…
When you are satisfied with your changes,click Apply Filter.
Several accessibility improvements have beenmade to the Rubric creation workflow.
You must have the d2l.Tools.Rubrics.CreateExperienceOptIn configuration
variable set to On or On (Opt-in).
For more information, review the release notes.
Self-Serve Analytics allows for personalizedand customized reporting to be completed in
an easy way without additional systems, technicalskills or alternate logins.
You must have the Can Access Brightspace DataSets permission at the org level, and the
Can Manage Self-Serve Analytics permission to request activation of the product and manage authors.
For more information, review the release notes.
Thanks for watching! We are always lookingto hear from you about the types of videos
you’d like to see. Leave us a comment belowand as always don’t forget to subscribe!

title: Navigate Brightspace Learning Environment - Video Note - Learners

captions.text: Personalize your course interactions using Video Note.
This tutorial shows how to create and post a Video Note in Brightspace Learning Environment.
You can use a Video Note to record a webcam video or audio snippet in various places
throughout Brightspace Learning Environment.
Navigate to the HTML Editor.
Click Insert Stuff.
Then, select Add Video Note.
A preview pop-up will display.
Note: You will be asked to grant Brightspace access to your webcam and microphone.
To begin recording, click New Recording.
When you are satisfied with your recording, click Stop Recording.
Then, click Next.
Enter a title and description for your video.
Then, select an audio language.
Add closed captioning to your video, click Automatically generate captions from audio.
To add the video note, click Next.
A preview displays. Lastly, to add the video note to your content, click Insert.
Your video will display inline for others to view.
Personalize your course interactions using Video Note.

title: Release Highlights - March 2020 (v.20.20.3) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.20.3.
Announcements now displays author information on new and edited announcements. This functionality
is controlled by d2l.Tools.News.AuthorInformationDefault configuration
variable and a new Can Manage Author Information and Settings permission.
When a user creates or edits an announcement,a new Display Author Information checkbox
displays in the New/Edit Announcement page.
Users reading the announcement may see someor all of the following author information:
the original author, the original date andtime of the announcement, the author who edited
the announcement, the date and time of theedit.
The d2l.Tools.Dropbox.AssignmentGraderLinkURLand d2l.Tools.Dropbox.ShowAssignmentGraderLink
configuration variables, and the DownloadAssignment Grader banner on the Submissions
page has been removed.
To improve cloud environment security, D2Lis proactively blocking suspicious requests
using a Web App Firewall (WAF).
Note: This feature is currently availableto Australia and Europe-hosted clients and
will be rolled out to Canada and US in April.
The End of Unit page has been updated to removethe moose puzzle image.
This feature implements PIE item D5344.
In the new learner experience, the End ofUnit page now includes a progress meter.
To align with IMS Global best practices, twonew history fields that comply with the LTI
1.0, 1.1 and 1.3 specifications are now supportedwhen copying courses with LTI links.
This feature implements PIE items D3632 andD1633.
For more information, review the release notes.
Brightspace Data Sets version 5.0 is now available.Version 4 will continue to exist in parallel
for 6 months.
To enable, ensure the Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission is granted to administrators at the  org level,
and the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version configuration variable is set to version 5.
This feature implements PIE item D5306.
For more information review the release notes.
To increase the value of the Data Hub offeringand provide a consistent data access experience,
Portfolio data sets are now aligned with existingBDS schedules.
Note: The Portfolio Data Sets require thed2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version set
to version 4 or 5 and the Can Access BrightspaceData Sets permission is granted to administrators
at the org level.
Historical data dated back to May 2019 isnow available in the existing Portfolio Evidence
Log data set.Two new data sets have also been created:
Portfolio Categories, and Portfolio Objects.
To enable, ensure the Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission is granted to administrators at the org level,
and the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Versionconfiguration variable is set to version 4 or 5.
Your instructors can now add an exact timewhen enrollment for groups opens, and the
exact time when self-enrollment expires.
This feature implements PIE item D3002.
Instructors using anonymous marking can accessQuick Eval with confidence that it supports
their anonymous marking needs.
This feature implements PIE item D5647.
Your instructors can now import quiz questionsstored in Brightspace Learning Object Repository (LOR).
Note: This requires the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewQuizBuilderExperience
configuration variable, and the Retrieve Objects from the LOR permission is set at the course offering level.
To import quiz questions stored in LOR, clickImport….
…and select Import from Learning Repository.
The publishing workflow in the new Rubricsgrading experience now includes a confirmation
message that warns users when the rubric isnot fully evaluated.
Users attempting to publish an incompleterubric evaluation must now click Publish to
complete the workflow.
This feature implements PIE item D3819.
In Rubrics, when using keyboard navigationto tab to a row of selectable cells, there
is now a focus indicator to help orient userson the page.
Your instructors can now manually map achievementlevels to Rubric levels for all types of rubrics.
Instructors are also able to override thepercentage scale alignment with respect to
an individual rubric if they choose to do so.
The Overall Score level is now calculatedafter all the criteria in the rubric has been assessed.
Thanks for watching, we are always lookingto hear from you about the types of videos
you’d like to see. Drop us a comment below,and as always, don’t forget to subscribe!

title: Release Highlights - February 2020 (v20.20.2) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Bightspace Learning Environment 20.20.2.
User Progress, Grades, and Assignments now feature a new View Inline Feedback link
that takes learners directly to the annotations or TurnItIn view.
This feature implements PIE Item D5351.
Now in some instances, when you upload a .jpeg file
in Brightspace Learning Environment
an exchangeable image file (EXIF)
data warning appears to inform you when your file may contain geolocation data.
To improve security, D2L is proactively blocking suspicious requests using a Web App Firewall.
Note: This feature is available to Singapore-hosted clients and will roll out globally in future releases.
Your developers can now add a deep link to Brightspace Pulse in custom apps.
Effective February 2020 Brightspace Wiggio is no longer available to users.
A new Course Reset tool is now available.
Course Reset will reset a course back to an empty shell.
Course Reset permanently deletes the course data and it will not appear
in any reporting or data sets after the reset process is complete.
This feature requires the See Course Reset permission at the course offering level.
From Course Administration, click Course Reset.
To see a detailed list of materials excluded in a course reset, click What am I deleting.
To begin the reset process, click Delete course content, activities, associated files, user grades,
user progress, and interaction data.
You can further customize your reset by selecting, Delete group enrollments and group categories,
and or, Delete course homepages, navbars, and widgets.
Note: Course Reset permanently deletes the course data and it will not appear
in any reporting or data sets after the reset process is complete.
When you are ready, click Reset.
A confirmation displays. Confirm the reset action by typing the course code being reset into the text field.
Note: The Delete button will not become available until the correct course code is entered.
Click Delete.
The course reset will process.
Once the reset is complete, you are taken to the Audit Log to view the reset results.
A new Brightspace Data Sets category, Portfolio, is now available.
Portfolio data sets will always generate as a weekly full and a daily differential.
Note: This feature is available to Brightspace Insights and Core clients in North America, EMEA, and APAC.
This feature implements PIE Item D5403.
As of the February 2020 release, Brightspace Data Sets Version 4 is now enabled by default,
and will migrate all clients who have yet made the change.
Game Based Learning has been redesigned to improve user experience,
increase accessibility, and make it easier for your instructors to use.
Note: This feature is available to Engagement Plus, and existing Course Adventure Pack clients.
Tab separated value files can now be imported into Gradebook.
This feature implements PIE item D5385.
You can now specify new number and date formats when creating or editing a custom locale.
This feature implements PIE items D3931 and D4083.
Navbar icons are now available for Manager Dashboard and Learning Groups.
A new config variable, d2l.Tools.WYSIWYG.MathjaxScaling,
now allows you to change the default scaling percentage of mathematical equations.
Levels of achievement mapping in rubrics is now generally available.
Your instructors can now add rubrics to Portfolio evidence.
When your instructors open Quick Eval at the course level, only activities relating to that course will display.
This feature implements PIE item D5474.
Activities can be dismissed in Quick Eval until another submission is made by a learner.
This feature implements PIE item D5505.
In Quiz Builder, questions can be aligned to learning outcomes.
Once an outcome is aligned to a question, that alignment applies to all quizzes with that question.
Note: Outcomes alignments are copied between courses but are not included in export packages.
Video Note now automatically generates closed captions for newly created videos.
These captions can be manually added or updated for previously recorded videos.
Users can also download a transcript and the closed caption file associated with a video.
For a list of available languages, review the release notes.
This feature is available to all Core clients.
This feature implements PIE item D5864.
A new Learning Paths tools is now available, for detailed set up information review the release notes.
To see the full workflow for the Game Based Learning Tool Redesign, check out
the Instructor Release Highlights, and as always don’t forget to subscribe.

title: Discussions - Create a Forum - Instructor

captions.text: Use discussion forums and topics to increasecommunication and collaboration in your course.
This tutorial shows how to create a discussion forum.
Discussions are your course message boards,which are organized into forums and topics.
All discussion topics must belong to a forum.
To create a new forum, from Discussions, click New...
…and select New Forum.
Give your forum a title.
Navigate to Description.
Enter a description, if desired, to provide learners with details about the information to be covered in the forum.
Select the options you want to apply to the forum, such as allowing anonymous posts or requiring a moderator
to review the comments learners make prior to posting them.
In this example, we want to ensure that learners post an original comment before they can reply.
Therefore, we will check,
“Users must start a thread before they can read and reply to other threads in each topic."
Select “Display forum description in topics” this allows you to enter one set of consistent instructions for
learners that will display in both the forum and topic.
When you are ready, navigate to the Restrictionstab…
…and click it.
Here you can set availability and locking details.
To restrict learner access to a specific date range, set the Start and End date availability.
Leave the default if you want to make the forum always available to learners.
For this example, make the forum available to learners for the month of October.
Click Has Start Date…
…to set the date and time the forum willbecome available.
Click Has End Date…
…to set the date and time the forum will no longer be available.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Your forum displays in the Discussions List.
Use discussion forums and topics to increase communication and collaboration in your course.

title: Content - Add a Module - Instructor

captions.text: Structure and organize your content by adding modules and sub-modules to your course.
This tutorial shows how to add modules and sub-modules to your course.
To add a module to your course, from Content in the Table of Contents panel, click Add a module...
Enter a name for the module
and press enter (or click outside the field).
The module displays on the canvas.Click Add dates and restrictions…
to edit availability and locking details.
For this example, this module will remain always available.
Click Cancel.
To provide learners with a summary of whatis included in the module, click Add a description.
Enter your description.
When you are ready, click Update.
Sub-modules give your course another levelof organization.
To add a sub-module, click Add a sub-module.
Enter a name…
And press enter, or click outside the field.
The sub-module appears on the canvas, nestedbeneath the module.
Add modules and sub-modules to your courseto structure and organize your content.

title: Discussions - Subscription Options - Instructor

captions.text: Remain up-to-date on discussions by subscribing to forum, topics, or threads.
This tutorial shows how to set subscription options in Discussions.
There are various ways to subscribe to and unsubscribe from discussions.
These ways depend on where you are within discussions.
From the discussion list, you can subscribe to entire forums or topics.
To do this, click the context menu for the forum or topic you want to subscribe to…
…and select Subscribe.
Confirm how you want to receive notificationsfor your subscription…
…and click Subscribe.
To unsubscribe click the context menu….
and select Unsubscribe.
A confirmation displays, click Yes to continue.
Click a topic you want to subscribe to…
Here you can subscribe to the topic by clicking Subscribe.
Just like when subscribing from the discussions list confirm your notification preference,
and click Subscribe.
Navigate to threads…
Click Subscribe to subscribe to only that thread in the discussion topic.
Note: If you have already subscribed to the forum or topic, you are automatically subscribed
to all threads within that forum or topic.
You can also subscribe to new threads when you create them. Click Start a New Thread…
Depending on your chosen settings, Subscribe to this thread option may be checked or unchecked
when you create a thread. Check this option if you want to subscribe to your thread and then post your message.
Remain up-to-date on discussions by subscribing to forum, topics, or threads.

title: Content - Create a Course Overview - Instructor

captions.text: Welcome learners to your course and provide access to important information by creating an overview.
This tutorial shows how to create an overview for your course.
To begin, from Content, in the Table of Contentspanel, click Overview.
Click Add a welcome message, overview, ordescription…
To include a welcome message as part of youroverview.
Enter your message.
When you are ready, click Update.
Add an outline to provide learners with informationabout the overall course objectives, your
contact details, or other general information.Click Add Attachment.
Drag and drop the attachment onto the uploadtarget.
Your attachment displays inline.
Welcome learners to your course and provide access to important information by creating a course overview.

title: Instructor Release Highlights - December 2019 (v20.19.12)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
Learners can now see submission file sizes
