in the submission receipt email.This feature implements PIE item D5253.
When your learners review a submission confirmationemail, the file size now displays.
A new column displays the Submission ID onthe View Feedback page, for learners, in Assignments.
Now, when learners navigate to View Feedback,a new column displays identifying the Submission
ID.You can now specify sort options for HTML
templates in Content.From Content, click Settings.
Navigate to Content Authoring.To change the sort order from directory structure
to alphanumeric, click Sort HTML Templateby name.
The New Assignment option in the Upload/Createmenu in Content has moved.
Assignments now appears above new Checklistplacing it in alphabetical order.
Grades are now fully synchronized in Assignmentsand Discussions regardless of the import method.
This expands upon recent grade synchronizationupdates for Assignments and Discussions.
This feature implements PIE items D3610, andD391.
New toast messages appear to learners whennew content is released to them through Release
Conditions.Release Condition menus have been reordered.
Both the View Conditions for, and Condition Type menus now display tools in alphabetical order.
We’re looking to hear about the type of
video content that you’d like to see, dropus a comment to let us know!
And, as always, don’t forget to subscribe!

title: Grades and Assignments - Create and Apply Selectbox Grade Items - Instructor

captions.text: Use letter grades to evaluate your learners, by creating Selectbox grade items.
This tutorial shows how to create Selectbox grade items and apply them to an assignment.
This is a twostep process. To begin, from Grades, click New.
Then, select Item.
Click Selectbox.
Enter a name for your grade item.
Navigate to Grading.
Select the Category, if applicable.
Next, click the Grade Scheme drop-down.
Select the grade scheme you want to use, for this example, leave letter grade selected.
Note: Grade Schemes available to you will vary based on your institution.
When you are satisfied with your grade item, click Save and Close.
Now, we will add the newly created grade item to an assignment for evaluation.
Navigate to Assignments.
For the assignment you want to edit, click its context menu…
and select edit assignment
Navigate to Evaluation and Feedback.
Click the grade item dropdown.
Select your new grade item.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Now, when you evaluate the assignment, you can select letter grades…
that will apply the score automatically, based on the grade scheme selected.
Use letter grades to evaluate your learners, by creating Selectbox grade items.

title: Release Highlights - December 2019 (v.20.19.12) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and
updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.12.
Now, when learners submit an assignment, file
size information now displays next to thefile name in the submission receipt email.
This feature implements PIE item D5253.
Now, when a learner submits an assignment,
their email confirmation identifies the filesize.
There is a new column that displays submissionID information, visible to learners, on the
View Feedback page in Assignments.
From View Feedback, when the learner navigates to their submission information…
…Submission ID now displays.
Starting January 2020, Brightspace LearningEnvironment
will no longer support Internet Explorer.
Now, if users attempt to accessBrightspace Learning Environment using Internet
Explorer in a test environment, an unsupportedpage appears.
For more information, review the release notes.
The d2l.Tools.Notifications.AllowInactiveCourses(User) and
d2l.Tools.Notifications.AllowPastCourses(User) configuration variables have been removed
from the Config Variable Browser.
You can now set the default sort order for HTML templates, to be displayed alphabetically or by file path,
for the org or specific org units by setting the d2l.Tools.Content.SortHTMLTemplatesByName
configuration variable to on.
Note: Instructors can override the sort order,in Content, at the course level.
The sort order in Upload/Create menu in Contenthas been updated.
Previously, New Assignment appeared betweenNew Discussion and New Quiz. Now, New Assignment
appears between New SCORM/xAPI Object andNew Checklist.
New columns are available for the DiscussionTopics data set including: GradeItemId, ScoreOutOf,
ScoreCalculationMethod, IncludeNonScoredValues,and Version.
The Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission must be granted to administrators
at the org level.
You must also ensure the d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version
configuration variable is set to version 3 or 4.
This feature is available to Core clientsin North America, EMEA, and APAC.
There is a new Brightspace Data set that reportson all tools used within your organization.
The Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permissionmust be on for administrators at the org level.
The d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Versionconfiguration variable must be set to version 3 or 4.
This feature is available to Core clients in North America, EMEA, and APAC.
Grades are now fully synchronized in Assignments and Discussions when grades are added to Brightspace
via the existing Import as CSV, Import as Excel, and API entry options.
Note: Synchronization only occurs for new grade entries.
This feature implements PIE items D3610 and D391.
You can now use and maintain users preferred First and Last name in an ILP or LIS 2.0 integration.
Upon configuration, you can configure preferred names to be kept up to date by SIS.
You can now extend the visibility of unevaluated learner submission in Quick Eval past the end date of a course.
To enable, set d2l.Tools.UnassessedActivities.DaysToExtendEndDate
configuration variable to 7, 30, or 60 daysbeyond a course’s end date.
This feature implements PIE item D5437.
The default value for the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewQuizBuilderExperience
configuration variable is changing from Offto On (opt-in) in the 20.20.1 release.
You can edit this configuration variable to Offif desired.
Learners are now informed when new contentbecomes available through a release condition
that was satisfied. Learners will now be notifiedusing a pop-up (“toast”) message to let
them know that new items are available inthe course.
When adding Release Conditions to activitiesor content the ordering of Tools has been updated.
Conditions for, and Condition Type menus now display tools in an updated order.
The default setting for the d2l.Tools.Rubrics.CreateExperienceOptIn
configuration variable changes from Off toOn in the January 20.20.1 release.
In this release you will also be able to share rubricsfrom the organization level using the updated
Rubric creation experience.
A new dedicated storage area tied to widget, org unit and user is available.
This feature introduces the following permissions: Modify Org Unit Custom Widget Data,
Modify Own CustomWidget Data, Retrieve Org Unit Custom Widget Data
Retrieve Own Custom Widget Data. Note:If you have a custom widget provided by D2L
Learning and Creative Services, you will becontacted for assistance migrating data from
previous storage locations to the new. Formore information review the release notes.
Thanks for watching! We’re always looking to hearabout the type of video content that you’d
like to see, drop us a comment to let us know!And as always, don’t forget to subscribe!

title: Release Highlights - November 2019 (Version 20.19.11) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the newand updated features of Brightspace Learning
Environment 20.19.11.
Assignments includesa New column that highlights the number of
new submissions or resubmissions. You cancontrol the visibility of this column using
the d2l.Tools.Dropbox.UseAssignmentListOptInconfiguration variable. This feature implements
PIE item D5396. A New column will now identifynew and resubmitted assignments. Letter grading
is available in Assignments. Your instructorscan apply Selectbox Grade Items to an assignment,
and any Selectbox grade item can use an Organizationlevel grade scheme without being required
to copy that scheme into a specific course.Grade schemes have also been re-ordered and
follow a default of highest grade to lowestdisplay. API routes have been added to enable
the creation of selectbox grade items. Thisfeature implements PIE items D3152, D805,
D3109, D479. When instructors create and evaluatean assignment, they can now use Selectbox
grade items. In the Evaluation panel, navigateto Score Click the Score dropdown and select
the letter grade the learner has achievedfrom the provided scale.
You can now enable a customauthentication method which allows usernames
to be whitelisted. When the custom authenticationis enabled, only users defined by the whitelist
can successfully use the D2L local login.Users who cannot be authenticated using your
LDAP settings are blocked from logging in.The whitelist can be configured to work with
other authentication methods. A third authenticationmethod allows you to define two LDAP configurations
or an LDAP and the new whitelist can be configured.Note: To enable this feature, contact your
Technical Account Manager, Customer Success Manager or D2L Support.
New, Release Condition Objects,Release Condition Results, Pre-Requisite Conditions
Met, and Grade Objects Log Data Sets havebeen included. Note: This feature is available
to Brightspace Core clients in North America,EMEA, and APAC. Data Purge now has a Complete
with Errors status, which allows a purge tocontinue regardless of if a single object
fails. Learners that self-enroll in a courseusing Discover can now self-unenroll.
You can now add images to Intelligent Agent emails using Add Image in the HTML Editor. Additionally,
new permission checks are in place limitingthe ability to assign new enrollments using
Intelligent Agents. A new permission, PerformUnenroll, has been added and controls whether
unenrollment options are available to a rolein Intelligent Agents. When creating an Intelligent
Agent, click Insert Image. Select the filelocation Then, for this example, drag and
drop a file onto the upload target. Then,click Add. Your image displays inline.
Learning Groups now display group tiles to provide at-a-glance information about group members
and course assignments. Learning Outcomescan be created at the org level that are available
to all courses, removing the dependency onthe Achievement Standards Network. This feature
implements PIE item D5117. From Standards,click Programs. Next, click Create Program.
Enter a Program Name. Then, click Create.Then, click the newly created program.
Next, create your own Learning Objectives, or Importfrom Achievement Standards Network. For this
example, add a learning outcome. Click Save.Your newly created learning outcome displays.
More in-depth information around feedbackand the complete context of an assignment
is visible in the Outcomes Progress page,in User Progress. Learning Outcomes can no
longer be added to a course from the Lessons. There is now a link to
the Standards Management page in the Lessons. Quiz feedback can be saved
in draft and mass-published in Quick Eval.Quiz restoration can only be completed on
the latest deleted attempt, and restorationcannot be completed while an attempt is in
progress. Your instructors can now easilyidentify when feedback is saved, or published.
The quiz evaluation experience now uses thePublish and Save Draft buttons used in other
assessment tools for consistency. Additionalquizzing options, such as making a question
bonus or mandatory, are now available in theQuiz Builder experience. From the Quiz Builder
Experience, select the checkbox for the questionyou want to edit. Click More Actions... to Toggle
Bonus, Toggle Mandatory, or change the pointvalue of a question. You can now set default
viewing experiences for SCORM, and contentproviders can select the launch experience.
A new permission, and a new API route, areavailable to let you easily end all active
sessions for a user. This functionality requiresthe new Can End Active Sessions permission
at the Org level. Video Note now uses theContent Service. This change removes both
Flash-based recording options and the legacyusage reporting tool. Your instructors can
now attach pre-existing Video Notes in the record video workflow.
Thanks for tuning intothe November Release Highlights! Check outour Instructor version by following the link
in the video! And, as always, don t forgetto subscribe!

title: Instructor Release Highlights - October 2019 (v.20.19.10)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.10.
When evaluating an assignment submission,the user interface has been updated.
The Next Student and Previous Student buttonsabove the submission and learner information
have been replaced by forward and back chevronsthat display in the immersive navigation bar.
Several improvements have been made acrossBrightspace Learning Environment to provide
a more consistent experience.Updates include interface controls, language,
and work flows.This feature implements PIE items D3981, D615,
D4016, and D1965. It also partially implementsPIE items D4055 and D1375.
For more information review the Release Notes.
Microsoft Internet Explorer® is approachingEnd of Life status as a supported browser.
To provide more visibility about this upcomingchange, when an existing user logs in to Brightspace
Learning Environment using Internet Explorer,a banner now informs the user about the approaching
End of Life date.
Using the iOS Brightspace Portfolio App, orAndroid Brightspace Portfolio App, you can
log in to your own account using the My Devicemode, and capture work on behalf of learners
enrolled in any of your courses.This feature implements PIE item D4629.
Brightspace Pulse now supports the Dutch language.
Intelligent Agents now support attachmentsand embedded images.
This feature implements PIE item D5283.
When creating a message, you are now ableto upload files or select from available course
files.Note: Attachment size is based on the email
attachment size setting for your organization.
The Links tool now requires newly createdlinks to follow new validation rules. Only
specific URL paths will be accepted. For acomplete list of accepted paths, review the
release notes.
The Activities view in Quick Eval is now compatiblewith screen reader technology.
When evaluating a quiz submission, the userinterface has been updated slightly.
The Next Student and Previous Student buttonsabove the submission and learner information
have been replaced by forward and back chevronsthat display in the immersive navigation bar.
Administrators can now control the abilityto preview and grade in-progress quizzes using
the Enter In-Progress Quiz as User permission.With this change, users marking quizzes no
longer need to have impersonation permissions.Note: This permission is automatically set
to ON for any user that currently has CanGrade and Preview Quiz enabled
for Quizzes.
For a refresher video on the recently released Activities view in Quick Eval follow the link in the video.
And as always, don't forget to subscribe!

title: Release Highlights - October 2019 (Version 20.19.10) - Administrators

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.10.
As part of our ongoing commitment to design and develop against WC3 accessibility best practices,
we have updated or included the following:
input type and auto-complete to appropriate fields,
escape commands where appropriate to components that appear on hover or focus,
components that activate on down event can be canceled,
adjusted color contrast ratios.
In the Assignment evaluation experience,
the Next Student and Previous Student chevrons
have been moved into the nav bar.
Several consistency updates have been made to improve the user experience
and span across the following categories:
Visibility,
Icon and Icon Order,
Restriction tab content,
and language.
This feature implements PIE items D3981,
and D1965,
and partially implements PIE items D4055 and D1375.
Visibility controls have been standardized across Brightspace.
Now, in assignments, quizzes, discussions, surveys and grades, a checkbox is used
and the language has been updated to Hide from Users.
Visibility controls have also been moved into the Restrictions tab across these tools.
In Content, the visibility icon also acts as the visibility toggle. Click Visible….
to reveal the toggle.
Visibility status is displayed when a topic is not visible, when bulk editing, or editing-properties-in-place.
All common activity icons displays before tool-specific icons,
Special Access has been reduced to a single icon, and the Exemptions icon now displays in Assignments.
Alt-text displays on all icons.
For a comprehensive list of changes, review the release notes.
To support the End of Life of Microsoft® Internet Explorer support, users logging into Brightspace
with Internet Explorer will now see a banner.
This banner informs the user of the impending End of Life date, and can be dismissed for a single session
Each time a user accesses Brightspace using Microsoft® Internet Explorer this banner will reappear.
Your instructors can use the iOS and Android™  Brightspace Portfolio apps
to capture work on behalf of learners.
This feature implements PIE item D4629.
The Brightspace Portfolio Apps for iOS and Android are available in Dutch.
The Links tool now requires newly created links to follow new validation rules.
Only specific URL paths will be accepted.
For a complete list of accepted paths, review the release notes.
The latest version of Brightspace Pulse is supported on Apple devices with iOS 11 or higher.
Older versions of Brightspace Pulse will continue to work on Apple devices with iOS 10,
but will not receive app updates.
The CompetnecyActivityResults Brightspace Data sets now includes the AchievedDate column,
and the QuizUserAnswers Brightspace data set includes the SectionID column.
Several new Brightspace Data Sets have been released, for more information review the Release Notes.
Intelligent Agents now supports attachments.
This feature implements PIE item D5283.
When creating a message, you are now able to upload files or select from available course files.
Note: Attachment size is based on the email attachment size setting for your organization.
The Activities view in Quick Eval are now screen-reader compatible.
In the Quiz evaluation experience, the Next Student and Previous Student
chevrons have been moved into the nav bar.
You can now control the ability to preview and grade in-progress quizzes
using the new Enter In-Progress Quiz As User permission.
With this change, impersonation permissions are no longer required,
and instructors will not accidentally infringe on a learner’s privacy.
For a refresher video on the Activity view in Quick Eval, follow the link provided in the video!
And, as always, don't forget to subscribe!

title: Instructor Release Highlights - September 2019 (v20.19.09)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
20.19.9.Activity Feed displays remote plug-in quicklinks
inline as embedded attachments and no longerrequires navigation to view.
To enable you to share a wider variety ofmaterials, embed codes can be pasted directly
into the body of message posts.Note: Activity Feed only renders embedded
material that your administrators have setusing Trusted Sites.
When creating a new message post, enter yourmessage, and copy your embed code into Create
a Message.Clean up your message by removing the HTML.
Your material will continue to display! When you are ready, to share it with your learners,
click Post.Embed codes will automatically display inline
for users to view and interact with.Weblinks can be added to Activity Feed posts
by pasting them into the body of the post.Copy the weblink into Create a Message. Clean
up your message by removing the HTMLThen, click Post.
If applicable, a thumbnail and descriptionof the weblink displays inline.
When grading assignment submissions from Grades,your evaluation also appears with the submission
in Assignments.This feature implements PIE items D3610, and
D391.A number of improvements have been made to
Assignments.This release introduces user-tied tool preferences.
When you select the tools, such as annotations,to use in an assignment submission, Brightspace
remembers your selections for subsequent assignmentcreations.
When navigating back, or closing your browser,a new failure to save notification appears
prompting you to save your changes or activelychoose to proceed without saving.
Note: User-tied tool preferences for Annotationsare available to Brightspace Core clients.
This feature implements PIE items D5321, D5611,D5450, D5367, and D5229.
The Assessment Quality Dashboard supportsQuestion Pool data.
Brightspace Pulse now supports Activity Feednotifications in the Updates tab.
When grading discussion posts from Grades,your evaluation also appears with the post
in Discussions.This feature implements PIE items D3610, and
D391.Course Admin now features a link to import
outcomes from the Achievement Standards Networkinto your courses. Learning Outcomes can still
be imported using the New Content Experience- Lessons, and outcomes imported in one location
will display in the other.Note: Learning Outcomes may display as Competencies
or Standards depending on your organization’ssettings.
From Course Administration, navigate to Standards…and click it.
Here, you can view existing standards thathave been aligned to your course, or import
new ones. The standards import workflow mirrorsthe existing import workflow in the New Content
Experience - Lessons.Use Activities in Quick Eval to display a
dashboard of pending evaluations organizedby acitivity.
This feature implements PIE item D5475.In Quick Eval, easily complete all assessments
for one activity using the new Activity view.Activities display when there is an unevaluated
submission, or no submissions in the activity.Activities display indicators to identify
new submissions, and show the progress oflearner submissions, completed evaluations
and published feedback. Hover your mouse overthe indicators….
To evaluate all submissions, review the submissionlist, or publish all feedback.
Arithmetic and Significant Figures questionsnow round up from .5 by default.
This feature implements PIE item D1751.A new Completed content topic release condition
has been introduced.The method of completion for Completed content
topic depends on the type, such as viewinga file or submitting an assignment.
Optional content topics can trigger this releasecondition, and this condition ignores exemptions,
meaning the condition can be met regardlessof the activity being required, option or
exempt.The Visual Table of Contents will now display
the optimal number of modules in the widget,and has introduced paging.
Want to see the rest of the workflow for importingstandards from Course Admin? Follow the link
in the video and as always, don’t forgetto subscribe!

title: Standards - Import Standards from Course Admin - Instructor

captions.text: Import standards from the Achievement StandardsNetwork so you can measure and track learner
achievement. This tutorial shows how to importstandards from the Achievement Standards Network
in Course Administration. To begin, from CourseAdministration, navigate to Standards Management….
and click it. Here, you can import and managestandards in your course.
Note: Standards may display as Competencies or Learning Outcomes depending on your organization's settings
Click Import Standards
Next, set the appropriate filters for Jurisdiction,Subject, Framework, and Education level. Then,
in Available items, select the appropriateset of learning outcomes. Lastly, click Import
Selected Outcomes. Your learning outcomesdisplay. Import standards from the Achievement
Standards Network so you can measure and tracklearner achievement.

title: Class Progress - Configure Class Progress Settings - Administrator

captions.text: Help instructors easily compare and trackparticipant progress by setting default Class
Progress indicators for your organization.
This tutorial shows how to configure the default class progress settings for your organization.
To begin, click Admin Tools
and select Class Progress and User Progress.
Note: The ModifyOrg Default Progress Indicators, Class Progress
permission must be set at the Organizationlevel to access this feature.
Here you can select which indicators display by defaulton the class progress dashboard for your organization.
By default Content Completion, ObjectivesCompletion, Login History for the last 30
days and Checklist Completion display. Toreset Class and User Progress for all courses
select Reset all courses to use these defaultsettings checkbox.
Click an indicators context menu
to reorder, replace, and hide indicatorsfrom users. Note: Progress indicators that
are hidden from users will display the Hiddenfrom User icon next to the context menu.
For this example, select Replace.
Here you can select another indicator. Click the indicator you want to set.
The new indicator displays.Click User Progress.
Customize the Progress Indicators you want to display in the User Progress report.
Edit the Progress Report Information Settings if desired.
Here youcan customize the Color Indicators percentages.
Click the On Track percentage
to update thepercentage indicator.
Note: Instructors can override these settings at the course level.
When you are satisfied with your changes, click Save.
Help instructors easily compareand track participant progress by setting
default Class Progress indicators for yourorganization.

title: Awards - Manually Issue an Award - Instructor

captions.text: Issue awards to learners in recognition oftheir accomplishments. This tutorial shows
how to manually issue an award.To begin, from Awards, select the users you
want to issue an award to.Then, click Issue.
Select the award using the Select an Awarddrop down. For this example, we will leave
the selected award.Next, tell the learner why they are receiving
the award by entering details in Award Criteria.Then, click Issue.
The newly issued award displays.Learners will get both popup and minibar notifications
when they receive awards.
Issue awards to learners in recognition of their accomplishments.

title: TurnItIn® - Assess an Assignment using TurnItIn® - Instructor

captions.text: Provide inline annotations, and feedback whilemonitoring an assignment for plagiarism by
assessing an assignment with TurnItIn® enabled.
This tutorial shows how to assess an assignment using TurnItIn® GradeMark®.
To begin, from Assignments, navigate to theassignment you want to assess…
…and click it.
Then, navigate to the submission you want to assess.
The TurnItIn GradeMark® column will displaygrading you have already completed, and easily
identify submissions that require your attention.Note: If Originality Check® is turned on for
the assignment, learner’s originality scoreswill display.
Click Edit or view TurnItIn GradeMark® informationto launch TurnItIn® in a new tab.
Here you can view the learners name and filestructure.
Enter a score for the assignment, and navigatebetween submissions using next submission,
previous submission or select a submission.In the instructor feedback layer, access QuickMarks
that insert grammar details and other commontips, Feedback Summary of voice and text comments,
and Rubric/Form which allows you to mark associatedrubrics.
If applicable, in the Similarity layer youcan view Match Overview, view All Sources
and sourcing options, change Filters and Settings,and view Excluded Sources. Additionally, you
can Download the submission and view detailedSubmission Information.
Begin your evaluation, enter a score.
Leave your feedback for the learner by selectinga section of text and inserting a QuickMark,
Comment or Strikethrough.For this example, leave a comment.
Continue your evaluation.Note: TurnItIn® autosaves your work.
When you are ready, close the TurnItIn® tab.
To immediately sync your feedback betweenTurnItIn® and Brightspace click Refresh TurnItIn
GradeMark® for submission to force a refresh.
Note: This will occur naturally when the page is reloaded.
Grading that contains markup displays the
Feedback has been provided in TurnItIn GradeMark®icon. To publish this feedback, click the
learners checkbox…
and click Publish Feedback.
A confirmation displays, click Yes to continue.
Provide inline annotations, and feedback whilemonitoring an assignment for plagiarism by
assessing an assignment with TurnItIn® enabled.

title: Awards - Create a Certificate - Instructor

captions.text: Recognize completion and other achievementsby creating and issuing certificates.
This tutorial shows how to create a new certificateand add it to your course.
To begin, from Classlist Awards, click CourseAwards.
Here you can view any existing badges or certificates.To add a certificate to your course, click
Add Award to Course.Here, you can add an existing award, or create
a new one. For this example, click Create.Enter a name…
and description for the award.Next, select an award type. Click the Award
Type dropdown…and select Certificate.
Navigate to Availability.In Availability, you can choose to share your
awards with other courses, with other awardscreators, or restrict their use to child org
units.You may also change the award’s expiry settings.
Next, choose an image for the certificate’sicon.
You can choose an existing image, upload anew one, or create a new image to upload.
For this example, click From Existing Library.Select an image.
Then. click Select.Now choose a certificate template.
Note: Certificate templates are PDF formsthat can be used to generate printable certificates.
These templates use replace strings to incorporatedynamic data in certificates.
For instance, this sample certificate templateuses replacement strings to generate certificates
with the recipient’s name, the award description,and more.
You can upload a new template, or load anexisting one. To load an existing template,
click, From Existing Library.Select a template.
Then, click Select.Make any necessary modifications to the award
issuer information. When you are ready, clickSave and Close.
The newly created certificate appears in theCourse Awards list. You can now award it to
learners manually from the Classlist Awardspage. Or, from Edit Properties, you can add
release conditions that will automaticallyaward the certificate to learners when the
release conditions are met.Recognize completion and other achievements
by creating and issuing certificates.

title: TurnItIn® - Exempt Individual Learners from TurnItIn® - Instructor

captions.text: Exempt individual learners in a course fromTurnItIn® to take advantage of TurnItIn®
functionality for a select group of learners.This tutorial shows how to exempt individual
learners in a course from TurnItIn®.
To begin, from Assignments, click More Actions…
and select Manage Preference for TurnItIn®.
Learners enrolled in the course are listed.To exempt a learner from TurnItIn® search
for or navigate to the learner in the classlist.
When the user is located, click the TurnItIn®toggle to exempt the user.
X indicates the user is now exempt from TurnItIn®for the course.
Note: Submissions made by exempted learnersto any assignment in the course are not subject
to Originality Check® or other TurnItIn®functionality.
Exempt individual learners in a course fromTurnItIn® to take advantage of TurnItIn®
functionality for a select group of learners.

title: Assignments - Add Restrictions to an Assignment - Instructor

captions.text: Add restrictions to an assignment to set availability,release conditions, and special access for
your learners.This tutorial shows how to add restrictions
to an assignment.
From Assignments, click the context menu ofthe assignment to which you want to add restrictions…
…and select Edit Assignment.
Then, click the Restrictions tab.
Within the Restrictions tab, you can customizethe availability, release conditions, and
special access to the assignment.
Setting the availability allows you to setthe visibility state, as well as start, end,
and due dates for the assignment.Set a start date that dictates when a learner
will be able to submit their work…
…a due date…
…and end date, after which learners willno longer have access to the assignment.
Next, specify the Release Conditions.Release Conditions allow you to associate
an assignment with other items in BrightspaceLearning Environment.
For this example, we will create a conditionthat requires learners to view the related
course content before the assignment becomesavailable to them.
Click Create and Attach.
Select the Condition Type.
Next, select the topic you want to associatewith the condition.
Click Create to add the new release conditionto your assignment.
Navigate to Special Access.
Special Access permissions allow you to setdifferent availability dates and times for
specific users.You can grant special access by allowing access
outside the normal availability or restrictingthe folder to specified learners.
For this example we will specify learnerswho can submit files outside the normal availability
dates for this folder.Click Add Users to Special Access.
Select the Date Availability you want specialaccess users to have.
Navigate to Users…
Then, select the check box beside each learnerto which you want to give special access.
When you are ready, click Save.
Verify the restrictions you have set.
Note: All specified restrictions must be met before the learner can view the assignment.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Add restrictions to an assignment to set availability,release conditions, and special access for your learners.

title: Quizzes - Restore a Quiz Attempt - Instructor

captions.text: Identify, and restore deleted quiz attemptsas required using the Quiz Log.
This tutorial shows how to restore a quiz.
From Quizzes, click the context menu of thequiz you want to restore.
navigate to Attempt Logs…
and click it.
An Overview displays, here you can filterby, Quiz Entry, Quiz Completion, Quiz Attempt
Deleted and Quiz Attempt Restored.You can also view a detailed attempt log by
clicking Detailed.To restore a deleted quiz attempt, click Restore.
Navigate to the restored attempt.
To view your restored Quiz Attempt.
Identify and restore deleted quiz attempts as required using the quiz log.

title: Class Progress - Use and Modify User Progress - Instructor

captions.text: Customize the User Progress report to easilytrack learners’ performance. This tutorial
shows how to customize the User Progress reportto meet your needs.
In User Progress, a user’s progress is summarizedacross as many as nine indicators. To view
more information about a user's performance,expand each section.
Where applicable, box plot graphs displayinformation about a user’s performance in
relation to their peers on items with assessmentsattached. The bracketed area represents the
range of grades assigned to users, the bluebar represents the middle range of grades,
and the black dot represents this user’sperformance. Your feedback and assessment
are visible in this section by clicking Feedback.To collapse the section, click it.
Hover over bar graphs to get more information.You can also hover over the user information
areato email or message the user.
Select a report from the report list areato learn more about a user’s progress with
respect to a single indicator.To modify which indicators are included in
User Progress, click Settings.Uncheck an indicator to exclude it’s report
from User Progress. For this example, we willexclude the Checklist indicator.
Navigate to Progress Report Information Settings.Here, you can choose to whether to display
the box plot graphs for graded items. Youcan also choose whether to display the user’s
potential final grade range. Additionally,you can customize the Color Indicators that
display throughout Class and User Progress.Note: Changes made to this page apply to all
users in the course.When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Now, the Checklist indicator no longer appearsin the reports list.
Customize the User Progress report to easilytrack users’ performance.

title: Class Progress - Understand and Modify Class Progress - Instructor

captions.text: Customize Class Progress to make it easierto track and compare the performance of learners
in your course. This tutorial shows how tocustomize Class Progress to display indicators
relevant to your course. Class Progress liststhe learners enrolled in your course and provides
visual indicators which enable you to viewand compare learner performance at a glance.
You can hover the mouse over an indicatorto reveal more detailed information… and
clicking on the indicator brings you to thecorresponding learners User Progress report.
Class Progress always displays 4 of 10 availableindicators. Available indicators include:
Content Completed, Objectives, AssignmentSubmissions, Grades, Checklist Completion,
Content Visited, Discussion Participation,Login History, Quiz Performance, and Survey
completion. To change which indicators aredisplayed and which order they are displayed
in, click Settings. To move or replace anindicator, click its context menu.
Here you can move the indicator up (to theleft in Class Progress), down (to the right
in Class Progress), or replace it. For thisexample, select Replace.
Then, navigate to…and select a new indicator,by clicking it. When you are ready, click
Save and Close. The new indicator nowdisplays. Customize Class Progress to make
it easier to track and compare the performanceof class participants.

title: Pulse Dates - Set Date Restrictions for an Assignment - Instructor

captions.text: set date availability for an assignment
so it will appear in brightspace pulse
this tutorial shows how to set date
availability for an assignment
to begin from assignments click the
context menu of the assignment you want
to edit
and select edit assignment
then click the restrictions tab
here you can set availability unlocking
details start date signifies the day
that the assignment becomes available to
learners due date constitutes the date
that learners are expected to have
completed the assignment and the end
date is the date that access to the
activity is revoked note at a minimum
the due date must be established so the
activity will appear in brightspace
pulse click has due date
then set the due date and time
navigate to start and end date
and set the start date and time
then set the end date and time
when you are ready click Save and close
your availability details display and
the assignment will appear in
brightspace pulse
set date availability for an assignment
so it will appear in brightspace pulse

title: Discover - Configure Discover Settings - Administrator

captions.text: Configure Discover settings so learners cansearch for courses and self-enroll
This tutorial shows how to configure Discoversettings.
There are 5 steps to enable discover, orgtools, Manage Discover Permission for Instructors,
Access Discover Permission for learners, anew configuration variable for learners, and
adding Discover to the navbar.To begin, click Admin Tools.
Navigate to Organization Tools…
and click it.
First, you must enable Discover for your orgunit. Navigate to Discover…
and click the toggle.
Note: Although Discover appears for all clients,only Brightspace Core clients can turn it on.
To display form elements for self enrollment you must enable is Displayed
for Registration and Description elements.
Navigate to Admin Tools…
…and click it.
Then, select Form Elements,
Click Form Elements.
…and select CourseOfferingInfo.
Click Edit.
Then select the check boxes for Registrationand Description.
Then, navigate to Save...
...and click it.
Next, set the configuration variable for learners. Click Admin Tools...
and select Config Variable Browser.
Then, search for the d2l.System.Enrollment.LearnerRoleconfiguration variable…
and click it.
Set this configuration variable to the learnerrole using Add Value, and then selecting the
appropriate org unit and role.
Next, set the appropriate permissions for instructors and learners.
Click Admin Tools...
and select Roles and Permissions.
First set the new Discover, Change Visibilityin Discover permission for Instructors at
the organization level. Click Instructor…
and select the Change Visibility in Discoverpermission at the org level.
Note: Set this permission for all roles whowill manage self-enrollment options.
Next, to allow learners access to Discover,ensure the learner role has the Discover,
Access Discover permission set at the organizationlevel. Filter by Role…
Then select Access Discover.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Lastly, add Discover to the org level navbar.
Click Actions for Navbar…
and select Edit This Navbar.
Click Add Links.
Search for Discover…
and select it.
Then, click Add.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Configure Discover settings so learners cansearch for courses and self-enroll.

title: Pulse Dates - Set Date Restrictions for a Quiz - Instructor

captions.text: Set date availability for a quiz so it appearsin Brightspace Pulse.
This tutorial shows how to set date availabilityfor a quiz to ensure learners can view it
on their mobile devices through BrightspacePulse.
To begin, from Quizzes, click the quiz youwant to edit.
Then, click the Restrictions tab.
Here you can set availability and lockingdetails.
Due Date constitutes the date learners areexpected to have completed the quiz, Start
Date signifies the day the quiz becomes availableto learners, and End Date is the date that
access to the quiz is revoked.Click, Has Due Date.
Set the desired date and time.
Then, navigate to Availability
Set the date and time you want the quiz tobecome available to learners.
Then, set the end date and time.Note: At a minimum, the End Date must be established
so the quiz will appear in BrightspacePulse.
Then, add the quiz to your course calendar,click Display in Calendar.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Your availability details display, and thequiz is now visible in Brightspace Pulse.
Set date availability for a quiz so it appearsin Brightspace Pulse.

title: Pulse Dates - Set Date Restrictions for a Discussion Topic - Instructor

captions.text: Set date availability for a discussion topicso it will appear in Brightspace Pulse.
This tutorial shows how to set date availabilityfor a discussion topic.
To begin, from Discussions, navigate to thetopic you want to edit.
Click its context menu…
and select Edit Topic.
Next, click the Restrictions tab.
Here you can set the availability and lockingdetails.
You can add a start date, and end date forthe discussion topic.
Start Date signifies the day that the discussionbecomes available to learners and End Date
is the date that access to the discussiontopic is revoked.
Note: At a minimum, the End Date must be establishedso the discussion will appear in Brightspace Pulse.
For this example, we will add a Startand End Date. Click Has Start Date…
Then, set the date and time that you wantthe discussion topic to become available to learners.
Then click Has End Date…
…and select the End Date and Time.
Then, click Display in Calendar to add thediscussion topic to the course calendar.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Your availability details display, and thetopic will appear in Brightspace Pulse.
Set date availability for a discussion topicso it will appear in Brightspace Pulse.

title: Activity Feed - Customize Notifications - Instructor

captions.text: Control how you receive information aboutActivity Feed happenings by customized your
notification preferences.This tutorial shows how to customize your
email and SMS notifications for Activity Feed.
To begin, click your Personal Menu…
…and select Notifications.
Note: To enable notifications you must setup and verify an email address or mobile number.
Navigate to Instant Notifications.
Select the preferred method of contact youwant to receive for each notification.
When you are ready, click Save.
In addition to SMS and email notifications,you will automatically receive minibar update
alerts when a new post or comment is made.
Control how you receive information aboutActivity Feed happenings by customizing your
notification preferences.

title: Pulse Dates - Set Date Availability for a Calendar Event - Instructor

captions.text: Set date availability for a Calendar eventso it will appear in Brightspace Pulse.
This tutorial shows how to set date availabilityfor a Calendar event.
To begin, from Calendar, click Create Event.
Enter an event title. For this example, wewill create an event for students attending
a play.
Then add a description.
Navigate to When.
Here you can set the event to be all day,or as in this example at a specific time.
Enter the start date and time.
Then, enter the end date and time.
Here you can also add a Recurrence, or Restrictionsif desired.
When you are ready, click Create.
Your event displays both in the course calendarand Brightspace Pulse.
Set date availability for a Calendar eventso it will appear in Brightspace Pulse.

title: Navigate Brightspace Learning Environment - Lessons (New Content Experience) - Learner

captions.text: View and review course materials in Lessons.
This tutorial shows how to navigate Lessons in Brightspace Learning Environment.
When you enter Lessons, the table of contents
display.You can quickly pick up where you left off,
or begin a course, from the Continue tile.Navigate the table of contents...
To view a complete list of course modules.Each module displays a completion tracker
that indicates how many topics are included,and how many you have completed.
Click a module...To view completion tracking for individual
topics. A checkmark indicates that you haveviewed the topic. You can select a topic to
begin reviewing course material, or as inthis example, click Launch Unit.
You are directed to the Title Page. All contentdisplays full-screen. To navigate to the next
sub-module or topic, click the NavigationMenu.
Then click the next topic.To close the Navigation Menu and continue
viewing the content, click elsewhere on thescreen.
Return to the Table of Contents at any timeby clicking Back to Content. You can also
navigate using Previous Activity, or NextActivity. For this example, click Next Activity.
When you complete a module, a congratulationsmessage displays. To continue, click I’m
Done.Click Launch Unit...
and navigate to the desired topic.When you navigate to a discussion, quiz, or
assignment, you can start a thread, take aquiz, or submit an assignment inline. Continue
through the module.Reached the end of the unit, but missed something?
The End of Unit page will let you know thatyou still have some content to view.
View and review course materials in Lessons.

title: Discussions - Restricting Access in Discussions - Instructor

captions.text: Restrict learner access in Discussions usingrelease conditions.
This tutorial shows how to create releaseconditions in a Discussion Topic.
To begin, from Discussions, click New...
and select New Topic.
Select the forum that will house your topicfrom the Forum drop-down, or create a new
Forum using New Forum. In this example, wewill choose an existing Forum.
Then, determine the Topic Type. For this example,leave the default, Open Topic selected.
Navigate to Title.
Enter a Title for your discussion.
Then, enter a description if necessary.Here, you can also select additional options.
Next, edit the Availability and Locking Options,if desired.
Then navigate to the Restrictions tab.
...and click it.
Add a Release Condition.Click Attach Existing, to attach an existing
release condition, or as in this example,click Create and Attach
to create a new release condition.
To create a new release condition, first selectthe condition type.
and navigate to the Condition Type you wantto use.
Condition Types can include: Checklists, Classlist,Competencies, Content, Discussions, Assignments,
Grades, Quizzes, and Surveys.In this example, we will set the release condition
to the completion of a Quiz.
Then, in the Condition Details section, selectthe quiz that will trigger the release condition.
Click the quiz drop down.
Using the Number of Attempts drop-down, definehow many quiz attempts are required to trigger
the condition. For this example, leave theNumber of Attempts at 1.
When you are ready, click Create.
Your Release Condition displays. If desired,complete the Assessment and Objectives tabs.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Restrict learner access in Discussions usingrelease conditions.

title: Release Highlights - June 2019 (Version 20.19.06) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
20.19.06.The d2l.Tools.Dropbox.UseAssignmentListOptIn
functionality has been split into two configurationvariables; one for learners and one for instructors.
The d2l.Tools.Dropbox.LearnerUseAssignmentListOptInallows learners to opt-into the updated Assignment
list, and the existing d2l.Tools.Dropbox.UseAssignmentListOptInwill determine if instructors can opt-into
the updated Assignment list. By default, theseconfigs will respect the existing value of
the d2l.Tools.Dropbox.UseAssignmentListOptInconfiguration variable.
Chat, Awards, Email and Quick Eval data isnow included in the Tool Usage Trends and
Tool Usage Comparison visualizations.Users without the Manage Chat Alias permission
will now see their preferred names when usingChat. Users with the Manage Chat Alias permission
are not affected.This feature implements PIE item D5174.
This release introduces a new configuration variable, d2l.Tools.IntelligentAgents.DisableAgentsOnCopy,
which allows you to set the default statefor Intelligent Agents when a course is copied.
This new configuration is set to On, by default.This feature implements PIE item D5190.
This release includes the new Award ObjectsBrightspace Data Sets.
The Brightspace Data Sets Version will beautomatically updated to Brightspace Data
Sets 3.0 now that the 6 month opt-in windowhas ended.
There are new columns available in the AwardsBrightspace Data Sets. For more information,
review the release notes.There is a new Quiz Section Objects data set,
detailing the sections and question poolsacross your organization.
The new Discover tool allows learners to searchfor active courses and self-enroll. Discover
may be a suitable replacement for Course Catalogand the Self-Registration tool depending on
your institution’s needs. Only courses thatallow self-enrollment appear in Discover.
To access Discover, Discover must be enabled in Organization Tools. The new d2l.System.Enrollment.LearnerRole
must be set with the learner role as the value. To allow users to configure courses for self-enrollment
the new Manage Discover, Discover permission must be set at the organization level, and
the access discover the new Access Discover, Discover permission must be set at the organization
level.For additional information, review the Release
Notes.The Access to Discussions permissions has
been renamed to View Discussions. No functionalityhas changed, and all user roles that have
this permission will maintain their permission.Your instructors now have the option to save
discussion feedback in draft state for discussionsassociated with rubrics.
Changes have been made to email headers toalign with the DMARC mail standard. For more
information, review the release notes.A new See Advanced Course Search, Manage Courses
permission has been introduced. This functionalitywas previously controlled by the See My Courses
Widget, Homepages permission.You can now give some users access to see
the My Courses Widget and the search functionalityin the View All Courses overlay without access
to Advanced Course Search.myDesire2Learn no longer leverages the Edudentity
login service. Current users will experienceno change and will be emailed directly with
notification of the change. There will bea new user registration workflow that only
applies to future users.Missed activities in the End of Unit screen
of the learner New Content Experience nowdisplay items in a hierarchical list.
Courses with multiple educators that use portfoliocan now leave comments on artifacts that are
visible to other educators but hidden fromlearners and parents. This is controlled by
a new visibility toggle in the Teacher Onlysection.
Quick Eval has been improved for a betterevaluator experience.
A draft icon displays for discussion poststhat have feedback in draft status.
and instructors will only see ungraded assignmentsubmissions, discussion posts, and quiz attempts
for sections they are enrolled in.Arithmetic and Significant Figures questions
in quizzes now round up from .5 by default.To opt out of this change, you can turn off
the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.RoundingLogicUpdateconfiguration variable.
Past quiz attempt scores are not affectedby this change. This feature implements PIE
item D1751.The new quiz authoring experience now allows
users to do the following: delete questions,sections, and question pools from a quiz.
Note: It is currently not recommended foruse in production environments.
The See the Quizzes Tool permission has beenrenamed to View Quizzes. No functionality
has changed, and all user roles that havethis permission will maintain their permission.
Your instructors will now experience a moreconsistent grading experience with the updated
rubrics grading experience enabled, regardlessof workflow.
When instructors assess a rubric with learningobjectives attached, the updated grading experience
displays.When your instructors assess a topic that
has a learning objective the pyramid learningobjective icon will display on the row it
is associated with, or with the overall scoredepending on alignment. The Associated learning
objective will display below the rubric forreference.
Content progress tracking logic has been consolidatedso that it is calculated in a consistent way
across the platform.Content must meet all of the following criteria
to be included in the users progress: thelearner must have access to the content, the
content must be marked with a completion methodof Required Automatic or Required Manual,
and the content is not exempt.There is a new Content Completed indicator
available in Class Progress, and the existingContent indicator has been renamed to Content
Visited.When learners view Class Progress, the Topics
Visited statistic now has a denominator, andthe # Visits column has been renamed Total
Visits. For a full list of changes, reviewthe release notes.
Brightspace Tutorials now offers our learner tutorial videos in Canadian French, Mexican Spanish, and Brazilian Portuguese.
Find links to the playlists in the description.

title: Release Highlights - May 2019 (Version 20.19.05) - Instructor

captions.text: This video highlights the new and updatedfeature of Brightspace Learning Environment
20.19.05 for instructors.You can now toggle a full screen mode when
providing assessment feedback using annotations.When evaluating an assignment, you can now
click Toggle Fullscreen.To enter the new full-screen annotations mode.
To exit full-screen, click Toggle Fullscreen.If your administrators have enabled the annotations
feature for a course, you can now controlwhether to use annotations on an assignment
by assignment basis.When creating or editing an assignment, you
can now navigate to Annotation Tools...and can choose whether to enable Annotations
on an assignment by assignment basis withoutneeding to request a configuration change
from your administrators.To maintain a consistent grading experience
across Brightspace, you can now save discussionfeedback in draft state prior to publishing
feedback.You can now save assessment feedback in draft
state in Discussions.Note: The Save Draft button does not appear
when a discussion topic is only associatedwith a rubric.
When assessing activities using rubrics, therubric score will now automatically transfer
to the associated grade item.If enabled by your administrators, Quick Eval
is a new tool that allows you to identifyand complete assessments for unevaluated learner
submissions.In Quick Eval, all ungraded submissions display.
Submissions can be sorted by learner name,activity name, course or submission date,
and can be filtered using Filter.To evaluate submissions, click a learner’s
name.Evaluate the submission.
You can publish the learners score or SaveDraft. For this example, Save Draft.
To return to Quick Eval, click Back to QuickEval.
A draft icon will appear next to learner’sname when an evaluation is saved as draft.
As you complete and publish evaluations theywill no longer display in Quick Eval. When
all evaluations have been completed, QuickEval will display a “You’re all caught
up!” message.To enhance your evaluation experience, you
will now enter a full-screen mode when gradingquiz attempts.
From the Grade Quiz page, navigate to theattempt you want to grade...
and click it.To enter the new, full-screen, quiz attempt
grading experience.You can now assess learners on learning outcomes
aligned to rubric criteria. If an administratorhas mapped achievement levels to percentage
ranges when creating a learning outcomes scale,you will see a suggested learning outcome
achievement level in the evaluation panel.To begin the assessment, click the associated
rubric.Rubric criteria with standards aligned will
display the Standards icon. Select the levelsachieved.
Then, click Close.Navigate to Standards...
To view the suggested level of achievement.The Rubrics Grading Experience is now available
for group Assignments and group Discussions.When a rubric assessment is in draft state
the assessment is not viewable by membersof a given group. Once feedback is published,
all group members can view the rubric.Additionally, the assessment symbol on the
Grade All screen now launches the assignmentassessment experience for non-file submission
assignments that are connected to the gradebook.For more information about Quick Eval, follow
the link provided in the video!Not what you expected in an Instructor
Release Highlights Video? Provide us some feedback by joining the discussionon Community!

title: Standards - Create Levels for Outcome Tracking - Administrator

captions.text: Allow your instructors to assess learner’scompetencies by creating levels for outcome
tracking.This tutorial shows how to create levels for
outcome tracking.To begin, click Admin Tools...
...and select Standards. Note: To make a new scale, the Mange Outcomes Learning Outcomes
permission must be set at the organization and course offering level.
Click Create Scale.
For this example, we will create a four-levelachievement scale at the Organizational Level.
Enter a name for your scale.Then, enter the Number of levels for it.
To include percentage achievement ranges forstandards assessment, leave Map levels to
percentage scores selected. Navigate to Levelsof achievement.
The levels are arranged from Advanced to Novice.To select the color associated with the level,
click Change Level Color Selector Color.You can enter the hex code for a specific
color by clicking More, or as in this example,select a color from the existing palette.
and enter a name for each level.Then, set the percentage ranges for each level.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.You are returned to Standards.
To apply the achievement scale, click itscontext menu...
And select, Set as default.A confirmation appears. Click Set as default
to continue.Your Achievement Scale is now available to
instructors.Allow your instructors to assess learner’s
competencies by creating levels for outcometracking.

title: Brightspace Pulse - Navigation - Learner

captions.text: View announcements, deadlines, and gradestogether, in real-time, using Brightspace
Pulse.This tutorial shows how to navigate Brightspace
Pulse.To begin, from Brightspace Pulse, the Courses
tab displays the courses you are enrolledin. Tap the Assignments, Discussions, or Quizzes
icons to launch their respective pages usingyour device’s default browser, without leaving
the app. To view a table of course contents,tap a course tile.
Select a module from the table of contentsto view its submodules. To quickly view upcoming
work across your courses, tap Upcoming.From here, a graph displays detailing the
amount upcoming activities at a glance. Youcan filter this by selecting Work To Do, Events,
or All.A summary of activities due each day also
displays, indicating the time it is due, andthe course it is associated with. Tap a date
in the calendar...To view the activities that are due on that
date.To add events to the calendar yourself, tap
the plus icon.and select New Work To Do, or New Event. For
this example, tap New Work To Do.Enter a title.
Next, select the course the work is associatedwith.
Then, set the due date.If desired, tap Percentage Worth to associate
a value with the item. Note: This value isfor your reference only.
When you are ready, tap Save.Lastly, tap OK.
Your Work To Do displays. Note: If you logout, or delete the app, all personal dates
are erased.To change the graph settings, tap Settings.
Tap Graph Settings.Toggle the types of events that you want to
display or customize the starting day of theweek. To return to settings, tap Back.
Then, tap Done.To view notifications, tap Notifications.
Here, you will be notified of and view thegrades you have earned, new or updated course
content, review discussion posts, and courseannouncements. To view a grade, tap the assignment
title.To reveal your grade, swipe left.
You can view feedback by tapping Open in Safari.To continue browsing announcements, or grades,
tap NotificationsView announcements, deadlines, and grades
together, in real-time, using BrightspacePulse.

title: Navigate Brightspace Learning Environment - Quizzes - Learner

captions.text: Access a course’s quizzes or tests fromQuizzes.
This tutorial shows how to navigate Quizzesin Brightspace Learning Environment.
The Quiz List displays current quizzes andtests available in the course.
Each quiz includes a title and its availability.
You can also see how many times you have attemptedthe quiz and the total number of attempts allowed.
To take a quiz, click its title.
A summary of the quiz details displays.
The Time Allowed section tells you if thereis a time limit for taking the quiz.
If there is a time limit, your remaining timedisplays while you take the quiz.
Read the instructions and then, when you areready, click Start Quiz.
The quiz has finished loading once the questionsdisplay.
You can now begin the quiz.
The Questions panel summarizes your progressand indicates the status of each question.
Quizzes autosaves your answers.
Continue completing quiz questions.
When you are satisfied with your answers,click Next Page.
Continue answering quiz questions.
When you are satisfied with your answers, click Submit Quiz.
Then click Submit Quiz to confirm your submission.
After you submit your quiz, a summary displays.You can return to this summary later from
the Quiz List page.Note: The contents of the quiz summary depend
on the options your instructor selects.When you are ready, click Done.
Access a course’s quizzes and tests fromQuizzes.

title: Self Assessment - Create a Self Assessment - Instructor

captions.text: Create a self assessment for learners to reflecton their learning and course material comprehension.
This tutorial show’s how to create a selfassessment.
From Self Assessments, click New Self Assessment
Complete your self assessment details.
Enter a name.
Assign a category, if desired.
You can choose to allow hints, and shufflequestions at the self assessment level.
When you are ready, click Save.
Next, add questions to your self assessment.Click Add/Edit Questions.
Click New, to create new questions, or Importto select questions from question library
or upload a file.
Note: D2L recommends that you create all selfassessment questions within Question Library.
For this example we will import questionsfrom the question library. Click Import...
...and select Browse Question Library.
Find the questions or sections that you wantto import. You can search question text, filter
and sort questions.
When you are ready, click Add.
Next, click Done Editing Questions.
You are returned to the Self Assessment.
Lastly, click Save and Close.
Your self assessment displays.
Note: Ensure your learners can access SelfAssessments. Add a self assessment to a Content
topic, Announcement, or event.
Help learners reflect on their learning andmaterial comprehension using self assessments.

title: Rubrics - Create an Analytic Rubric - Instructor

captions.text: Evaluate learners based on multiple criteriaby creating and using an analytic rubric.
This tutorial shows how to create an analyticrubric.
To begin, from Rubrics, click New Rubric.
Enter a name for your rubric
Rubrics autosaves your changes. Change thestatus of your rubric if necessary. For this
example, keep the default, Published.
Click Rubric Type, to change the rubric toHolistic. For this example, leave Rubric Type
as Analytic.
Then, select your scoring method. Scoringmethods include: No Score, Points and Custom
Points. Note: Custom Points rubrics can beused to create weighted rubrics. In this example,
we will use the default Points method.
You can reverse the level order of the rubric.Add new levels before or after the existing
levels using Add new level before or Add newlevel after, respectively, at any time. Remove
levels using Remove level.
Criteria can be rearranged by using the handlesto drag and drop the criterion into the new
location. Remove criterion you are no longerusing with Remove Criterion.
Use Add Criterion to add new criteria to therubric.
Begin filling in your rubric, click the criteriontext box to edit it.
Update the level names and values.
Next, add the criteria and level details totell learners how the rubric will be applied
to their work.
When adding details you will have access to basic HTML such as bold, italics and bulleted lists.
If desired, you can include initial feedbackthat will display to learners when they review
the rubric.
Navigate to Overall Score.
Add details into the Overall Score feedback.
Next, click Options.
Here, you can update rubric visibility.
Select Hide scores from students, to hidestudents’ points value if you use a different
grade scheme.
Enter a description for the rubric for your personal reference.
Edit Advanced Availability to change associationswith Competencies and ePortfolio.
When you are ready, click Close.
Your rubric displays.
Evaluate learners based on multiple criteriaby creating and using an analytic rubric.

title: Release Highlights - January 2019 (Version 10.8.9) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.8.9. The existing configuration variable d2l.Tools.ActivityFeed.ShowWidget
is now set to On. You are able to turn theconfguration Off.
Assignment Grader now supports On paper, andObserved in person submission types. This
feature implements PIE items D2694 and D4909.A new Learning Outcomes tab has been added
to assignments. Your instructors can browsepre-defined outcomes that have been previously
imported into Lessons.To use outcomes without using the Lessons
experience, you can import outcomes whileLessons is enabled, and then switch to Content
once the import is complete.This feature requires the d2l.Tools.Content.IsLessonsEnabled,
d2l.Tools.Content.UseLessonsExperience, and the d2l.Tools.LearningOutcomes.ToolIntegrationEnabled
to be set to On.The Manage Outcomes permissions must be set
at the organization and course offering levelfor administrators.
When creating or editing an assignment, instructorscan now select Learning Outcomes.
To add pre-defined outcomes to an assignment,click Add Outcomes...
and click the checkbox for learning outcomesyou want to add.
Then, click Add.The learning outcome displays. To remove an
existing outcome, click Remove Alignment.Instructors are now able to assess assignment
submissions directly against outcomes alignedto an assignment.
This feature requires the d2l.Tools.Content.IsLessonEnabled,d2l.Tools.Content.UseLessonsExperience and
d2l.Tools.LearningOutcomes.ToolIntegrationEnabledconfiguration variables to be On.
The Manage Outcomes Learning Outcomes Permissionis required for Administraators at both the
organizaation and course offering levels,and for instructors at the course offering
level.Now, Learning Outcomes can be assessed in
the Evaluation panel of the Evaluate Submissionspage. Select the appropriate level of achievement
from the scale provided.To make this feedback available to learners,
click Publish.This Assignments list view now displays updated
information.The new d2l.Tools.Dropbox.UseAssignmentListOptIn
configuration variable is defaulted to On(Opt-in).This feature implements PIE item D1422.
To opt-into the new Assignment list experience,click Turn it on.
The new list view displays assignment name,the number of learners who have completed
the assignment, the number of learners whohave been evaluated, the number of learners
who have had feedback published, and the DueDate.
This allows instructors to quickly determinewhat assignments they need to evaluate, how
far along they are with their evaluations,and if they have published the evaluations.
Learners also experience an updated view ofthe assignments list.
The d2l.System.BrightspaceDaylightWidgetStyleconfiguration variable is no longer available.
Teachers can now directly email parents fromClasslist using the learner’s context menu.
The Email Parents permission must be set forInstructors at the organization and course
offering levels.From Classlist, click the learner’s context
menu...and select Email Parents.
The Course Conversion Service used to importcourse packages now uses the new AWS Course
Conversion Service and is enabled by defaultfor all clients.
New columns have been added to a number ofdata sets. For more information, review the
release notes.The Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission
must be set at the organizational level forAdministrators.
There are two new data sets available. TheRole Details data set provides the full set
of attributes of each role in your organization.The Enrollments and Withdrawals data set provides
all enrollment actions from all time acrossyour organization. For more information on
the new data sets, review the release notes.The new On paper and Observed in person submission
types available in Assignments can now becreated from Groups.
From Groups, click the context menu of thecategory you want to edit...
and select Edit Category.Navigate to Additional Options
Click the submission type drop down...On paper submission and observed in person
submission types are now available.A specific error message now appears to users
who click a quicklink to an activity thatis outside the availability dates. For more
information about supported tools, reviewthe release notes.
This feature implements PIE item D784Intelligent Agent run history can now be exported
to a CSV file.From Intelligent Agents, click More Actions.
...and select Export Agent History.Specify which agents will be included in the
export by clicking the Select an Agent drop down....
and select a specific agent, or all agents.For this example, leave all selected.
Select Include Practice Runs to practice rundata in the export.
Enter a date range for the export.Then, click Export.
To download the CSV file, click it.Open the file...
to review the export.The Manager Dashboard and Learning Groups
user interface now supports the German language.Users can select their preferred language
in the Locale & Language area of the AccountSettings page.
Rubrics has been updated to a single-pageworkflow.
From Rubrics, click the context menu of arubric you want to edit.
and select Edit.The new Rubric Experience displays on a single
page.

title: Grades - Create a Category - Points - Instructor

captions.text: Group related items by creating categories.
This tutorial shows you how to create a category in your grade book.
Categories group related items together inyour grade book. For example, in this grade
book, there are currently categories for assignments,quizzes, and the final exam.
We will add a discussions category.
To begin, from Manage Grades, click New, andselect category.
Enter a name for the category.
The name will display in your grade book.
In the grading section, you can set the distributionfor the grade items that will be included
in the category.
Distribution works differently depending onthe type of grading system you use in your grade book.
If you are using a weighted grading system,assign a weight to the category. Then, select
the distribution method you want to use forthe category. In this example, the categories
weight is 15, and the weight is distributedevenly across all items in the category. This
means that, for example, if we had three discussiontopics in this category worth 15 percent of
the final grade, each topic would be worth5 percent of the category.
If you are using a points grading system,click distribute points across all items.
You can then set the points per item and decideif you would like to drop the highest or lowest
non-bonus grade items for each user. In thisexample, we will set the points to 15 per
item, and leave the non-bonus items fieldsat 0.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
The category displays in your grade book.You can now create new grade items, and assign
them to this category, or move existing itemsinto it.
Group related items by creating categoriesin your grade book.

title: Bongo - Troubleshoot Virtual Classroom and Video Assignments - Administrator

captions.text: Virtual Classroom or Video Assignments notdisplaying? Troubleshoot some common issues
related to your Bongo integration.This tutorial shows troubleshooting options
when your Virtual Classroom or Video Assignmentsintegrations aren’t displaying as expected.
Review the Security settings for the BongoLTI tool provider to ensure all settings are
correct.It is important that you review and make decisions
about the security settings and scope of accessto this tool.
Click Admin Tools......and select External Learning Tools.
In the Manage Tool Providers tab,Click the Bongo tool provider entry.
Navigate to the Security Settings.Carefully review the settings.
Ensure you have selected the Send tool consumerinformation to tool provider, Send context
information to tool provider, Send courseinformation to tool provider, Send LTI user
ID and LTI role list to tool provider, Senduser name to tool provider, Send user email
to tool provider, Send link title to toolprovider, and Send link description to tool
provider check boxes.Then, click Save to turn on the security settings.
If you cannot access Virtual Classroom orVideo Assignment, ensure you share the Bongo
LTI tool provider across the organization.Navigate to the Make tool provider available
to section......and set the scope of sharing so that the
integration is shared across the organizationby clicking Add Org Units.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.Review and correct the launch point URL if
errors were introduced during the copy andpaste process.
When setting up your Bongo integration, thereare instances where you copy and paste the
Launch Point URL as well as add a plugin codeto that URL.
Carefully review the Launch Point URL fieldwhen setting up the navbar and quicklink to
ensure that the URL from the Bongo Tool Providerinstance is correct and that the applicable
plugin code follows it.Also check for other errors that may have
been introduced in the copy and paste process,such as introducing a space, or pasting text
that does not belong in the URL.Troubleshoot some common issues related to
your Bongo integration to share Virtual Classroomsor Video Assignments integrations with your
organization.

title: Grades - Export Grades - Instructor

captions.text: Organize your learners' grades by generatingan appropriately structured CSV or TXT file
using export grades.
This tutorial shows how to export grades fromthe grade book.
To begin from Grades, click Export.
Customize your export from the Export Optionspage.
To select which users you will include inthe export, click the export grade items for
drop down, and select from two options, Allusers, or Groups.
For this example, select All users.
If you select the group option, you are promptedto select group categories or specific groups
from within those categories.
Navigate to the user details section to continuecustomizing the export.
In the Key Field section, select how you wantthe export to identify a user. In the Grade
Values section select how the export willpresent existing grade item scores.
Choosing Points grade will show the totalpoints achieved on a grade item, and choosing
Grade Scheme will show the percentage achievedby the user. In the User Details section,
select any additional user identifiers youwant the export to include. For this example,
include the points grade, as well as learnersFirst and Last Names in the export.
Next, navigate to the Choose Grades to Exportsection.
And select the grades you want to includein the export. When you are ready, choose
between exporting to a CSV file or Excel spreadsheetfile. For this example click Export to Excel.
A new window will open. Click the link todownload the export file.
Open the file, to review the export.
Organize your learners' grades by generating an appropriately structured
CSV or TXT file using export grades.

title: Grades - Create a Grade Scheme - Instructor

captions.text: Create and use grade schemes to organize learners'performance on grade items
into levels of achievement.
This tutorial shows how to create a gradescheme for your grade book.
In the grades tool, click schemes.
Grade schemes created by your organizationand
shared to you will display in the schemes list.
To create a new grade scheme, click New Scheme.
Enter a new name for the grade scheme. Inthis example,
we will create a general scheme for the course.
Next, begin defining the ranges in your gradescheme. Symbols and start percentages are
required for each range. Symbols can be individualletters, such as A+ or B-, or words or phrases,
such as needs improvement, or excellent.
Note that in the start percentage column thefirst range has a start percentage of zero.
So, when creating the grade scheme, make sureyou start at the lowest level
and work your way up.
You can also associate a color with each rangein the grade scheme. Associating colors with
grade scheme ranges provides learners withvisual indicator of their achievement. Color
associations also display in your grade book.
Click the context menu and select the coloryou want to associate with the range.
The Assigned Value percentage is where youenter the numeric grade you want learners
to achieve when you evaluate them using thegrade scheme. For example, an assignment value
percentage of 50 would mean that learnersthat fall in the needs improvement range of
the grade scheme would receive a numeric gradeof 50%.
Note: if you do not enter an Assigned Value%, the Start % is used by default.
Complete the ranges for your grade scheme.
Click Add Ranges to add ranges to your grade scheme.
Complete the fields for the additionalrange.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
The new grade scheme displays in the schemes list.
Create and use grade schemes to organize learners'performance
