on grade items into levels of achievement.

title: Bongo - Set up Virtual Classroom and Video Assignments - Administrator

captions.text: Create a virtual classroom session using theVirtual Classrooms by Bongo integration; or
create video assignments and remote presentationsusing Video Assignments by Bongo.
This tutorial shows how to set up VirtualClassrooms or Video Assignments by Bongo.
Note: To get access to Virtual Classroom orVideo Assignments, you must request deployment
using the Service Catalog.Once deployed, click Admin Tools...
...and select IMS Configuration.Map the Administrator role to the IMS Administrator
role,...the Instructor or Faculty role to the IMS
Instructor role,...and the Learner role to the IMS Student
or IMS Learner role.When you are ready, click Save.
From the Org Unit Types tab,map the Course Offerings org unit type to
the IMS Course Offerings type.When you are ready, click Save.
Click Admin Tools......and select Roles and Permissions.
Now, we will ensure administrators, instructors,and learners have the required Brightspace
Learning Environment permissions.Let’s start with Administrators.
In the Filter by Tool menu......select IMS Configuration,
then, click Apply Filter.Confirm the Manage IMS Configuration permission
is selected.Click the Filter by Tool menu again...
...and this time select External LearningTools.
Then, click Apply Filter.At the Course Offering level, you must have
the Launch External Learning Tool Links, ManageExternal Learning Tool Links, and Create Quicklinks
from Available External Learning Tools Linkspermissions.
Additionally, these same permissions are requiredfor instructors.
Learners must have the Launch External LearningTools Links permission at the Course Offering
level.When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Click Admin Tools......and select External Learning Tools.
From the Manage Tool Providers tab,...click the Bongo tool provider entry.
Take note of the Bongo Launch Point URL.You will need this URL later when creating
your navbar and quicklink remote plugins forVirtual Classroom or Video Assignments.
Review the Security Settings.All options are required except for Send system
username to tool provider, Send system OrgDefined ID to tool provider, and Send system
role to tool provider.Next, add the Org Units that you want to use
the integration in the Make tool provideravailable to section.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
You have now prepared the Bongo integrationso that navbar and quicklink remote plugins
can provide your organization with accessto Virtual Classrooms and Video Assignments
by Bongo.

title: Bongo - Create the Navbar and Quicklink Remote Plugins for the Bongo Integration - Administrator

captions.text: Let Bongo provide your organization with itsVirtual Classrooms and Video Assignments features
within Brightspace Learning Environment bycreating remote plugins.
This tutorial shows how to create a navbarremote plugin and a quicklink remote plugin
for Virtual Classrooms or Video Assignments.To begin, click Admin Tools...
...and select Remote Plugins.Click New Remote Plugin.
Then, click the Plugin Type drop-down menu......and select Navbar.
Enter the name that you want to appear onthe navbar for your Bongo integration.
In the Launch Point URL field, enter the URLfrom the Bongo Tool Provider instance, followed
by the applicable plugin code.Leave the LTI Key and LTI Secret fields blank
to use the key and secret specified in thetool provider entry.
In the Icon URL field, you can specify a smallor large icon for either Virtual Classroom
or Video Assignments.Note: The navbar supports one icon size. For
your navbar, choose the icon size that bestsuits the user experience for your organization.
Next, select the same sharing criteria youused when reviewing the tool provider entry
by adding org units.Then, when you are ready, click Save.
Click Admin Tools......and select Remote Plugins.
Click New Remote Plugin.Then, click the Plugin Type drop-down menu...
...and select Quicklink.Enter the name that you want to appear on
the navbar for your Bongo integration.In the Launch Point URL field, enter the URL
from the Bongo Tool Provider instance followedby the applicable plugin code.
Leave the LTI Key and LTI Secret fields blankto use the key and secret specified in the
tool provider entry.Choose the icon that best suits the user
experience for your organization and enterthe applicable URL to specify the icon you
are creating for your plugin.Select the same sharing criteria you used
when reviewing the tool provider entry byadding org units.
When you are ready, click Save.You have now prepared the navbar and quicklink
remote plugins, which can be added to yournavbar so users can access Virtual Classrooms
or Video Assignments by Bongo.Let Bongo provide your organization with its
Virtual Classrooms and Video Assignments featureswithin Brightspace Learning Environment by
creating remote plugins.

title: Release Highlights - December 2018 (Version 10.8.8) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 10.8.8.
To maintain consistency, attachment icons now display when scheduling an Activity Feed post.
When editing a Planned Post,
and an instructor clicks Attach...
attachment icons display.
A new Learning Outcomes tab has been added to assignments.
Your instructors can browse pre-defined outcomes that have been previously imported into Lessons.
To use outcomes without using the Lessons experience, you can import outcomes
while Lessons is enabled, and then switch to Content once the import is complete.
This feature requires the d2l.Tools.Content.IsLessonsEnabled,
d2l.Tools.Content.UseLessonsExperience,
and the d2l.Tools.LearningOutcomes.ToolIntegrationEnabled
configuration variables to be set to On.
The Manage Outcomes permissions must be set at the organization
and course offering level for administrators.
When creating or editing an assignment, instructors can now click Learning Outcomes.
To add pre-defined outcomes to an assignment, click Add Outcomes...
and select the checkbox for learning outcomes you want to add.
Then, click Add.
The learning outcome displays. To remove an existing outcome, click Remove Alignment.
Your instructors can assess assignments directly against learning outcomes.
This feature requires the d2l.Tools.Content.IsLessonsEnabled,
d2l.Tools.Content.UseLessonsExperience,
and the d2l.Tools.LearningOutcomes.ToolIntegrationEnabled
configuration variables to be set to On.
The Manage Outcomes permissions must be set at the organization and course offering level.
Now, Learning Outcomes can be assessed in the Evaluation panel of the Evaluate Submissions page.
Select the appropriate level of achievement from the scale provided.
To make this feedback available to learners, click Publish.
Your instructors can now change the assignment and submission types
for assignments that have no submissions.
This feature implements PIE items D3654 and D4880.
Evaluate Learners can be accessed by clicking a learner’s name from the Submissions page.
This feature implements PIE item D1014.
A number of improvements have been made to the Evaluate Submissions page.
If applicable, a Launch Turnitin link has replaced Markup Document.
The Publish and Save Draft buttons have moved out of the Evaluatation and Feedback pane.
An additional Next Student link has been added following Publish and Save Draft.
A new Adoption Dashboard has been embedded in the Insights Portal.
This dashboard provides visualizations with filtering options for organization-wide adoptions, such as:
login trends, course access, tool usage trends and enrollment trends.
This feature requires the new Adoption Dashboard, Insights permission,
and the Query Data Platform, Brightspace Data Platform permission at the organization level.
Note: This feature is available with the Performance Plus package, and is not available in Canada.
Instructors can now view any evidence that can be converted to a PDF
by the Document Conversion Service in the Brightspace Portfolio web application.
This feature implements PIE item D4252
This feature requires the d2l.System.Services.DocumentConversion.IsEnabled
configuration variable to be set to On.
On paper and observed in person assignment types can be created directly from content.
In the unit you want to add an assignment to, click Upload/Create
Navigate to...
and click, New Assignment.
Enter the relevant details, and then select Submission type...
where your instructors can now choose from On paper and Observed in person submission types.
Course Builder now supports On paper and Observed in person assignment types.
Additional data columns have been added to a number of data sets.
For more information, review the Release Notes.
The Users data set has been updated to remove the Internal Email column,
and now instead displays a FirstLoginDate column.
The Internal Email column removal requires the
d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Version configuration variable to be set to 3.0.
Grading with rubrics in Discussions offers new functions and an improved workflow.
When assessing discussions with rubrics all assessments and feedback
automatically save in draft state.
Select the levels the learner has achieved.
A saving/saved indicator displays. Continue providing feedback to the learner...
to provide the feedback to learners, click Publish.
Uncheck the Status checkbox to retract feedback.
Retracting feedback allows your instructors to remove the published
feedback from the view of learners to change the Total Score
The Overall Score and Overall Feedback of the rubric can be edited without retraction.
A new Standards tool has been introduced. Standards allows you to
define scales for measuring achievement in learning outcomes.
This feature requires the d2l.Tools.Content.IsLessonsEnabled,
d2l.Tools.Content.UseLessonsExperience, and the d2l.Tools.LearningOutcomes.ToolIntegrationEnabled
configuration variables to be set to On.
The Manage Outcomes permissions must be set at the org
and course offering levels for administrators, and Learning Outcomes to in Org Tools must be set to On.
Once Standards have been imported to Lessons, click Admin Tools.
Select the new Standards option.
Then, click Create Scale.
Enter a title for the scale, and edit the Number of levels if necessary.
Navigate to Levels of Achievement...
Edit the level colors and names, click Change Level Colour Selector Color
Lastly, click Save and Close to make this scale available to your instructors.
Lessons will display content up to four levels deep.
When an instructor opts-into Lessons with course content more than four levels deep,
a notification displays that some content cannot be displayed.
This feature requires the d2l.Tools.Content.IsLessonsEnabled,
and the d2l.Tools.Content.UseLessonsExperience configuration variables to set to On
and the d2l.Tools.Content.ChooseContentExperience configuration variable
must be set to On for the Instructor role.
In Lessons, a visibility toggle has been added to the creation pages
for units, lessons, folders, HTML documents and web links.
From Lessons, select the Unit or Lesson you want to add, and click Add.
Select the type of content you want to include. For this example, click HTML Document
Instructors can now immediately control the visibility of material using the new Visibility toggle.
The Manager Dashbaord and Learning Groups user interface now supports Brazilian Portuguese, and Dutch.
Workflow improvements have been made to Learning Groups for an easier and more intuitive experience.
For more information, review the release notes.
The Initial Text field has been reintroduced to the Written Response question type.
This feature implements PIE item D3957.
When creating or editing Written Response questions, the Initial Text field displays.
Initial Text allows instructors to prompt student responses during the quiz taking process
by automatically inserting the text into the text editor.
Note: Questions with existing initial text will automatically have this field reapplied
Users can no longer opt-out of the new quiz experience.
The d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewQuizExperienceOpt-In has been removed from the Config Variable Browser.
the d2l.tools.Rubrics.DisplayActivityRubricsOnGrades configuration variable is now turned on by default and is no longer available in the Config Variable Browser.
The rubric creation experience has been updated.
This new experience is controlled by the new, temporary, d2l.Tools.Rubrics.CreateExperienceOptIn configuration variable.
This configuration variable allows your instructors to opt-into and out of the new creation experience.
This feature implements PIE items D505, D2300, and D2915.
When creating or editing a rubric instructors will be prompted to remain in the new experience or turn it off.
Instructors can choose to use or turn off the new creation experience at any time. Click, Leave it on.
Instructors can now easily change between rubric types, and scoring methods.
New criteria levels can be added before, or after, existing levels using Add new level before or Add new level after respectively.
Instructors can quickly create and edit rubric levels, criteria, and points inline. The new rubric experience auto-saves changes you make.
Criteria can be rearranged using drag and drop, or keyboard navigation. Click and hold the Handles...
to drag and drop the criterion into a new position.
Edit criterion level feedback by clicking the text editor...
to access basic HTML formatting. Note: The Initial Feedback section is not HTML enabled.
Navigate to Add Criterion.
Add more Criterion to a rubric using Add Criterion. Instructors can create Criteria Groups to organize feedback.
The Overall Score has been visually separated from the rubric displaying in its own section to help identify overall achievement.
Experience API packages can now be imported and played using the new SCORM solution.
This feature requires the d2l.Tools.ContentService.Endpoint configuration variable to be set to On.
For videos about using the new Standards available
to administrators and instructors, follow the links provided in the video.

title: Grades - Understanding Grades - Instructor

captions.text: Use Grades to centralize assessment and evaluationfor your course.
This tutorial outlines key aspects of creatingand using your grade book.
You must create a grade book to use Grades.
Your first time in Grades create your gradebook using the Setup Wizard. The Setup Wizard
lets you select which grading system you willuse, how you want to calculate final grades,
how you want to treat ungraded items, andgrade scheme and display settings.
Once you complete the wizard you can begincreating grade items and categories, thereby
building your grade book.
Your grade book is organized into differentsections, grade item, type, association, and
max points. Grade Items can be stand-aloneitems or organized into categories.
For example, in this grade book Solar Systemis a stand-alone grade item. Where as, Assignments
is a Category made up of four grade items.
The type of grade item also displays. In additionto Numeric grades you can create Selectbox,
PassFail, Formula, Calculated, and Text gradeitems.
If you link a course activity, such as a discussion,assignment, or quiz to a grade item, this
connection will appear in the Associationcolumn.
For example, each grade item in the Assignmentscategory is associated with an assignment
submission folder in the course.
The Max. Points column displays the maximumscore a learner can achieve from that grade
item. For example, the final exam in thisgrade book is worth 40 points.
If you are using a weighted grading system,your grade book will also contain a weight
column. The weight is the percent a categorycontributes to the overall grade, as well
as the percent an individual grade item contributesto a category.
For example, the assignments category in thisgrade book is worth 60 percent of a learners
overall grade in the course. Each assignmentis worth 25 percent of the category.
Click More Actions to delete items or categories,reorder items or categories, or view the Event Log.
The Event Log notes all actions completedin your grade book. This can be helpful if
multiple people, such as teaching assistantsare using the same grade book, or if discussing
grades with learners.
To return to your grade book, click ManageGrades in the breadcrumb trail.
Use Grades to centralize assessment and evaluationfor your course.

title: Navigation and Themes - Create a Theme - Administrator

captions.text: Align your organizations branding with yourBrightspace Learning Environment by creating
a theme.This tutorial shows how to create a theme.
To begin, click Admin Tools.Then, navigate to Navigation and Themes...
click it.Click Themes.
Then, click Create Theme.Enter a Name.
Next, import your logo. You can upload ordrag-and-drop a local file onto the upload
target, or Choose Existing logo images fromShared Files, if available.
For this example, drag and drop the file ontothe upload target.
Next, navigate to Primary Color.Adjust the primary and accent colors. Primary
color changes the appearance of the Navbarlink area, and the table of contents in the
Lessons experience. Accent Color changes theappearance of the top color strip.
In the Primary colors section, select Choosecolors.
Click Change Primary Color...Enter the hex value of a specific color by
selecting More, or select a color from thepalette.
A preview displays, and you will be informedif WCAG AA standards for small text are not
met. To try to resolve this, click the Foregroundmenu...
and select from light or dark foreground text.Next, change the accent color. Click Choose
a color.Then, click Change Accent Color....
and select a color.When you are ready, click Save and Close
Note: Themes must be applied to a Navbar inorder to display chosen colors and logos.
Align your organizations branding with yourBrightspace Learning Environment by creating
a theme.

title: Assignments - Resubmit a Submission - Learner

captions.text: Replace and update assessments and activities using Assignments.
This tutorial shows how to resubmit an assignment.
Once you have successfully submitted a file to an assignment, you cannot delete it.
However, if you have the ability to make another submission, you may be able to
resubmit the file as long as the end date for the submission has not passed.
To begin, from Assignments, select the assignment you want to submit your work to.
Navigate to Submit Files...
...and click Add a File.
Browse to the file you want to submit as a replacement for the current file.
You can attach files from your local computer or storage device,
a personal locker, a group locker or Brightspace ePortfolio.
For this example, we will select a file from My Computer.
Drag...
...and drop a file onto the upload target.
When you are ready, click Add.
Next, enter any comments you want to submit with the file.
Note: You may be allowed to submit more than one file at a time.
When you are ready, click Overwrite.
Confirm whether you would like to overwrite the exiting file.
A confirmation appears.
Note: Ensure you contact your instructor and let them
know that you are resubmitting a file to the assignment submission.
Click View History...
...to view a breakdown of the current and deleted submissions.
If you don’t have the ability to make another submission, contact your instructor
and let them know that you would like to resubmit a file to the assignment submission.
Replace and update assessments and activities using Assignments

title: Navigate Brightspace Learning Environment - Assignments - Learner

captions.text: Submit course assignments and view feedbackusing Assignments.
This tutorial shows how to navigate Assignmentsin Brightspace Learning Environment.
Assignments is where you submit assignmentsfor grading.
Assignments are organized into categories.
You can see how many submissions you have made,
and the due date for each assignment.
Your score displays when an assignment has been graded and that grade has been published.
Click View Feedback to access any feedback your instructor has provided.
The feedback page can include general feedback ...
a rubric assessment...
...your grade and the submitted file.Click Done to return to Assignments
To submit an assignment, click the assignmenttitle
Read any instructions provided.
If a file is associated with the assignment,
it displays in the Attachments section.Not all assignments require a file submission.
You may be required to enter your work directlyinto the HTML Editor, or mark work completed
in person as complete.For this example, file submission is required.
To do this, click Add a File.Select the file’s location...
Drag...and drop your file on to the upload target.
Lastly, click Add to attach it to your submission.If you want to include remarks with your submissions,
enter them in the Comments field.When you are ready, click Submit.
A confirmation displays. Click Done.
Submit course assignments and view feedback using Assignments.

title: Learning Environment - Navigate Homepage and My Courses - Instructor

captions.text: Develop comfort navigating the homepage andMy Courses widget in Brightspace Learning
Environment.This tutorial shows how to navigate and customize
the homepage and My Courses widget.To update your homepage layout, navigate to
the course from the My Courses widget...or the Course Selector.
Then, click Course Admin......and Homepages.
Click the active homepage to edit it.Then navigate to the layout section...
...and click Change Layout to update yourcourse homepage, if desired. D2L recommends
using a two panel homepage to ensure contentremains responsive.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.Click My Home to return to your homepage.
The My Courses widget provides a visual representationof your course offerings.
All courses display a default image assigned
from the curated image library.You can select an image that is more representative
of the course from the library provided byD2L, or add your own image for the course
tile.To change the default image, from the My Courses
widget, hover over the course imageand click the More Options menu.
If you are using assistive technology or keyboard-onlynavigation, press Tab to access the More Options
button and press Enter to view the menu items.Select Change Image.
Note: If this option is not available to you,contact your Brightspace Administrator.
Search or browse the list of available images,then hover over the image you want to use...
...and click Use this image.If you are using assistive technology or keyboard-only
navigation, press Enter to select the image.The updated image now appears in the My Courses
widget.Pinned courses have a visible pin icon on
the course title.The My Courses widget will display manually
pinned courses, followed by current enrollments,then future enrollments if available.
My Courses will display 12 course cards. Note:More than 12 courses might appear if they
are manually pinned.Develop comfort navigating the homepage and
My Courses widget in Brightspace LearningEnvironment.

title: Navigate Brightspace Learning Environment - Lessons - Learner

captions.text: View and review course materials in Lessons.
This tutorial shows how to navigate Lessons in Brightspace Learning Environment.
In the course navigation area, you can view and navigate course materials and activities.
Course material can be organized into units...
lessons...
optional folders, and materials.
You can click Download to save course materials that you want to read later while offline.
Click a course material...
to view it in the display area.
Use the course navigation area to navigate to other course materials.
Course material will also navigate you to other course activities you need to complete,
such as quizzes or assignments.
View and review course materials in Lessons.

title: Getting Started - Lessons - Instructor

captions.text: Post and organize course content so that classnotes, supplementary resources, and activities
are clearly displayed to learners.This tutorial shows how to navigate Lessons
in Brightspace Learning Environment. Lessons has two main areas.
The course navigation area provides coursestandards, options, and a lesson overview
where you can browse course materials andassignments.
The display area allows you to view the coursematerials and assignments.
The Course Standards Coverage gauge allowsyou to view and import expectations from the
Achievement Standards Network.Click Course Standards coverage...
to view a table that displays all contentunits and the standards they align to.
The numbers in each column indicate the numberof activities in a unit satisfying a standard.
Click Display only expectations which haveno course material...
...to determine which ones are not yet linkedto course materials.
You can add a unit by clicking New Unit.In the Course Options menu...
you can pace your course, or preview it asa student.
When you pace your course...set a date range to pace content evenly between
the dates.Pacing dates ensures there is enough time
to complete all material in the allottedtime for your course and helps you stay on
track.This can be modified at any time.
Note: This information is not visible to learnersand it is meant to assist you with the pacing
of your course.In the course navigation area, you can view
and navigate course materials and activities.Course material can be organized into units...
lessons...optional folders, and materials.
When you click a material...you can view it in the display area.
Hide or make visible a unit, lesson, or materialfrom your learners by clicking the visibility
toggle.The Hidden from Students icon indicates that
learners cannot view the object.Objects without this icon are viewable by
learners.Click Add...
...to add an object to your course.Note: You can also drag and drop local files
directly into the Table of Contents to addnew material.
When you click the Options menu...you can edit the title of a course object,
view standards or release conditions, postmaterials to your course homepage, download
materials, organize materials using the moveand reorder features; or delete course objects.
For this example, select Post to Course Homepageto share the content with your homepage in
the Activity Feed widget.Enter your reason for sharing the material
with your learners, such as an announcement,reminder, or to-do.
Then, click Post...to share with your learners.
When you navigate to an activity based inanother tool...
...you are prompted to navigate to that item.Post and organize course content so that class
notes, supplementary resources, and activitiesare clearly displayed to learners.

title: Lessons - Locate Gaps in Course Standards Coverage - Instructor

captions.text: Locate and close gaps in course standardscoverage to ensure your course offering aligns
with all necessary standards.This tutorial shows how to locate and fix
gaps in course standards coverage.To begin, from Lessons, click Standards.
From here, you can view the standards associatedwith your course offering.
Now, we will locate expectations that arenot yet aligned with the course offering.
Select Display only standards which haveno course material.
In this example, there are a few standardsthat still need to be aligned with the course
offering.Close the dialog box.
Next, we will align the unallocated standardswith the related course material.
Navigate to a unit from the table of contents....click Options...
...and select View Standards.Click the Materials tab.
Then, click Edit Standards Alignments to getstarted!
...and select the desired check boxes to associatematerial from the selected unit to the available
standard.When you are ready, click Save Changes.
Then, click Close.Now, more of the standards for the course
offering have been aligned with the relatedcourse materials. Continue this process until
you reach 100 percent.Locate and close gaps in course standards
coverage to ensure your course offering alignswith all necessary standards.

title: Lessons - Edit Course Standards Alignment - Instructor

captions.text: Reevaluate and edit your course offering’s standards coverage as your course evolves.
This tutorial shows how to edit course standards coverage.
To begin, from Lessons, select a unit or course material.
Click the Options menu...
...and select View Standards.
Click the Materials tab.
Then, click Edit Standards Alignments to get started!
...and select the standards that align to your course material.
When you are ready, click Save Changes.
Then, click Close.
The standards are now aligned with your course material.
Reevaluate and edit your course offering’s standards coverage as your course evolves.

title: Release Highlights - August 2018 (Version 10.8.4) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.8.4.To reduce clutter in Activity Feed, posts
that exceed four lines of text are now truncatedand display a 'more' link.
Posts longer than four lines automaticallytruncate. To view the rest of the post, click 'more'.
The login page top color strip and logo are
now defined by Login Page Management.A new menu option, View Auditor(s), has been
added to the user context menu in Classlistand Grades. This allows instructors to view
and email auditors, if they have the necessarypermissions.
This feature implements PIE item D3452 andpartially implements PIE item D4357.
Two new auditing permissions have been added:View Auditors and Email Auditors.
In classlist, click a users context menu...and select the new View Auditor(s) option.
To view the auditors assigned to a leaner,email the learner and auditor, or email the
auditor.D2L supports the latest Firefox ESR version,
and has a 12-week supported grace period forthe previous version.
Pre-Daylight has been turned on for all clientsand the d2l.System.BrightspaceDaylightExperience
configuration variable is no longer editableby users.
The Quiz and Survey Attempts data sets nowinclude in-progress attempts.
A new Sort Order text field now exists inReorder Grade Items and Categories for instructors
whose gradebooks contain more than 200 gradeitems. The previous Sort Order dropdown menu
still appears for gradebooks with fewer than200 grade items.
You, and your instructors, can now offsetprevious course activity dates during the
course import process.When importing a course package, click Advanced
Options...Click Continue.
Select the items for import, and navigateto Advanced Options.
To see a new Offset all dates of importedcomponents option, click it...
and select an offset method.
The new Assigned Learning microservice is
used by Manager Dashboard and Learning Groups to store due dates.
Personal Dashboard is no longer available to clients.
The 'off' value for the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewQuizExperienceOpt-In
configuration variable has been removed, andthis variable is now set to 'on (opt-in)'.
Dynamic previews are now available in questionpools.
When creating a question pool, a preview ofthe included questions displays. Instructors
can test how the question pool will generatequestions based on their specifications by
clicking Refresh Preview.
Rubric feedback has been improved in User
Progress. Assignment details in Content nowdisplay the graded rubric, general feedback
and score.General feedback, graded rubrics, and score
now display in the Grades, Discussions andAssignments pages of User Progress.
Learners can view GradeMark feedback underGrades, and in Content. Additionally, error
and status messages have been improved.
The Visual Course List widget is no longer available to clients.
For a tutorial on how to set up Turnitin for
an assignment submission folder, or aboutcreating a question pool, follow the links
in the video.

title: Brightspace Portfolio - Oversee and View Individual Portfolios - Instructor

captions.text: Curate learners’ work in your course bymanaging, reviewing, and editing their portfolios.
This tutorial provides an overview of thefeatures available in an individual learner's
portfolio.
Note: Before you begin, you can print passcardsto prepare the Portfolio mobile app for your
entire class by clicking Print Class Passcards.
From the Portfolio tool, navigate the learner whose portfolio you would like to view, and click that portfolio.
You can upload additional evidence into thelearner's portfolio. To do so, click Add to
Portfolio.Upload a file from your preferred local or
online source. To return to the learner'sportfolio, click Close.
You can quickly share evidence with parents,through Brightspace for Parents, or spotlight
evidence, which pins it to the top of theportfolio for all audiences. The Teacher Feedback
and Category icons will redirect you to theevidence details page.
Note: Learners have access to the Add to Portfolioand Spotlight functions
when viewing their portfolio.
Alternatively, this can be accomplished byclicking on the More Actions menu.
You can unapprove or delete evidence fromthe More Actions menu. Click elsewhere on
the screen to close the menu. Note: You can print or reprint an individual learner's passcard by clicking
Print Passcard.
You can also filter the evidence in a portfolio usingpre-existing categories. Click the Filter
dropdown to view available categories.
To dismiss the filters, click elsewhere on
the screen to close the menu.Capture learners work in your course by managing,
reviewing and editing an individual learner'sportfolio.

title: SCORM - Set up the SCORM Solution - Administrator

captions.text: Allow your instructors to vary how they delivery their course materials by setting up the SCORM solution.
This tutorial shows how to set up the SCORM solution in Brightspace Learning Environment.
To begin, click Admin Tools.
and select the Config Variable Browser.
Navigate to Tools...
ContentService...
and Endpoint.
Verify that the System Value is set to the correct AWS Region.
Note: For details about AWS region endpoints follow the link provided in the description.
Then to turn on the Content Service, click Admin Tools
Navigate to
and select Organization Tools.
Navigate to Content Service.
Click the toggle to turn it on.
Lastly, we will set the Roles and Permissions needed to add and view SCORM packages
Navigate again to Admin Tools...
and click it.
Then, navigate to
and select Roles and Permissions.
Decide which role you want to be able to create and add content in your organization.
For this example, click Instructor.
In the Filter by Tool drop down...
select Content Service.
Then, click Apply Filter.
Select the appropriate permissions for the role.
Note: For information about SCORM permissions review the link provided in the description.
When you are ready, click Save.
Next, set the permissions to allow learners to view SCORM content. In the Filter by Role drop down
switch the role to Student.
and click, Apply Filter.
Then, select the relevant permissions.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Allow your instructors to diversify how they delivery their course materials by setting up the SCORM solution.

title: Brightspace Portfolio - Review and Approve Portfolio Items - Instructor

captions.text: Easily review, provide feedback for, and approvea learner's work, then share it with their
parents right from the learner's portfolio.This tutorial shows how to review and approve
items captured by learners in BrightspacePortfolio.
Note: Before you begin, you can print passcardsto prepare the Portfolio mobile app for your
entire class by clicking on Print Class Passcards.To begin, from the Portfolio tool, click Approve
Evidence.You can see how many items need attention
for all students, or by individual learner.Note: You can also filter based on sections
in your course.To filter the evidence list by a specific
learner, click their name.You can approve or delete the collected evidence
based on its relevance. In this example, clickApprove to Portfolio.
To continue reviewing evidence, either clickAll Students or select an individual leaner.
For this example, click All Students.Click a piece of evidence to learn more about
it.In the Student and Parent Teacher Feedback section, you can provide
feedback for the learner. In the Teacher Only section you can  leave notes and feedback that is only visible to you.
To share evidence with parents, turn on the Share toggle.
You can also retitle the project. Click the title placeholder...
And enter a title.Then, click Save.
Following the Title section......audio will be available if a learner recorded
audio during evidence collection. If a learnerprovides audio after collecting their evidence,
you can attach it by clicking Upload an AudioFile.
If a learner expresses additional thoughtsto you, you can document those for the learner.
Note: Learners can also edit the title andassociated text and audio reflections for
the evidence.Additionally, you can categorize evidence
to show how it relates to a course objective.To do so, click Add Category.
Available categories display. For this example,select Essential Skills.
Note: You or your administrator can createcategories. For information about category
creation please review the Brightspace Portfoliodocuentation.
When you are ready, click Close.To continue approving evidence navigate to
the Back to Approve Evidence section...and click Back to Approve Evidence.
You can also approve all evidence at once,click Bulk Actions.
Then, select Approve All.
Easily review, provide feedback for, and approvea learner's work, then share it with their
parents right from the learner's portfolio.

title: Release Highlights - July 2018 (Version 10.8.3) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.8.3.Instructors can now create Text Submission
assignment types in Brightspace Learning Environment.This feature implements PIE item D135.
Now, when creating an assignment submissionfolder, in the Submission Options section,
you can specify if you want learners to createand submit text documents directly in Assignments
using a rich text editor.When using the Text Submission assignment
type, learners can now work directly withinBrightspace Learning Environment, allowing
for a simpler workflow and standard file typesubmissions.
You can now group courses that appear in theMy Courses widget by Semester Name, Department,
or Role.Before you begin, you must turn on the d2l.Tools.MyCoursesWidget.UpdatedSortLogic
configuration variable to use this feature.Click the My Courses widget's context menu,
and select Customize this widget.Then, in the Group Courses By section, select
your preference for grouping courses by semester,department, or role, and click Save.
Courses are separated into tabs within thewidget for easy viewing and selection.
System and custom widgets now display moreprominently against homepage backgrounds.
The new widget container style appears bydefault for both system and custom widgets.
You may temporarily opt out of this stylisticchange until October 2018 using the d2l.System.BrightspaceDaylightWidgetStyle
configuration variable.Parents can now download a learner’s assignment
submissions to increase their awareness ofwork completed by their children.
Now, when a parent accesses their child'sassignment and navigate to the submission,
they can click the submission to downloadit.
Parents can now view rubric feedback addedto assignments by instructors to increase
awareness of learner performance.Now, when a parent accesses their child's
assignment and navigate to the rubric, theycan view how the instructor evaluated the
assignment.Instructors can now filter classes by section
in Brightspace Portfolio.Now, from Brightspace Portfolio instructors
can click the All Users filter, and selecta section, to filter learners by sections
based on their enrollment.When you export a course from Brightspace
Learning Environment, any rubrics associatedwith course assessments -- such as assignments,
quizzes, and discussions -- are now preservedin the resulting course package. This allows
you, as well as course designers and instructors,to import the course package without manually
recreating the rubric associations in thecourse.
Now, during the bulk course copying process,you can offset previous course dates to dates
relative to the new semester in the destinationcourses via the new Day Offset and Hour Offset
columns in the CSV file. These columns areoptional and may be left blank if date offset
is not required.For AWS-hosted Brightspace Core clients, the
Course Conversion Service used to import coursepackages is now located in Amazon Web Services™.
Brightspace Core clients that are not AWS-hostedcontinue to use the Course Conversion Service
located at a D2L data center.Some columns have been removed from the Rubric
Object Criteria Brightspace Data Set and anew Rubric Criteria Levels data set has been
created. The two sets cover all of the columnsin the original Rubric Criteria Object data
set and each new data set has its own primarykey columns.
These data sets are available as both Fulland Differential data sets.
To provide you with more information whenanalyzing differences between data sets, some
Brightspace Data Sets now include rows ofdata that have been soft deleted from the
application, but are still present in thedatabase.
You will notice three new columns added tosome full and differential Brightspace Data
Sets.You will notice an updated page refresh behavior
and navigation changes in the PlugNPlay screen.When a user refreshes the IPSIS PlugNPlay
screen, they now remain on their current pageor tab and persist all filter and search parameters,
allowing them to link and navigate to specificerrors or transactions.
SIS providers now have a unique step whilecreating an SFTP integration, shown as Generate
SFTP Credentials, streamlining the integrationconfiguration process.
Configuration and password reset for SFTPare now available in the Configuration tab
on the IPSIS Administration page, along withthe other configuration options.
You now have the ability to display imageswithin feed messages.
The updated LIS Endpoint configuration includesthe new bulk endpoint configurations for LIS
2.0 configurationsIn addition, OneRoster clients will see minor
UI change which improves consistency throughoutthe LMS.
Instructors and learners will notice interfacechanges to the table of contents in Lessons.
Arrow icons display on tiles that containadditional course components, indicating you
can expand them.The selected tile displays handles, indicating
you can drag-and-drop it to rearrange it inthe table of contents.
Tiles can now display more characters, allowinglonger names.
Highlighting around the selected tile is moreprominent.
Also, each material type displays a uniqueicon, making it easier to visually distinguish
materials.Lessons now supports two ReadSpeaker integrations.
The ReadSpeaker HTML content integration solutionautomatically enables ReadSpeaker online text-to-speech
technology for HTML content in Lessons.The ReadSpeaker docReader integration provides
audio rendering of supported document typesin Lessons.
As images and text can be included in anytype of question using the features of the
HTML editor, there is no longer a need forimage and text information items. Image and
text information items in existing quizzesor question libraries convert into sections
and are still displayed to learners attemptingthe quiz. One section is created for each
existing image or text information item.You will notice a number of improvements to
the TurnItIn version 2 integration.Set the d2l.3rdParty.Turnitin.LTI.PaperViewRequestEmail
configuration variable to collect all TIIPaper View Requests in a single email.
Set the new d2l.3rdParty.Turnitin.GrademarkAutoTransferDefaultconfiguration variable to Auto copy as draft
to automatically copy scores over to BrightspaceLearning Environment as a draft.
All other functionality is automatically enabledfor TII version 2 users.
The version of HTTPS communications has beenupdated from TLS 1.0 to TLS 1.2.
Updates have been made to automate date managementin TurnItIn. Start and End dates are no longer
managed separately or prohibitive when learnersmake a submission in Brightspace Learning
Environment and the TurnItIn dates are notset correctly.
Submissions made to a TurnItIn enabled assignmentsubmission folder are pre-validated at time
of submission to ensure they are within thefile type and size requirements enforced by
TurnItIn.Learners have access to formative feedback
left in GradeMark (even if there is no score,which can be found in the assignment submission
folder, in User Progress, or in Grades).Feedback on Group Assignments is now provided
to all learners in the group.

title: Groups and Sections Tools - Defining Groups and Sections - Instructor

captions.text: Use Groups to create collaborative work areasfor learners and Sections to divide your classlist
into sections that display learning materialsand users only to those enrolled in the section.
This tutorial differentiates Groups from Sections.Use Groups to create group work areas for
learners.From the Manage Groups page, you can create
Categories, which are subdivided into groupsof learners.
You can use group categories to organize users’work on presentations and assignments, or
create special work areas for users with differentlearning needs.
Learners can belong to multiple categoriesand groups within the same course.
For example, a learner can simultaneouslybelong to a group in the seminar group presentation
category and the Moon Discussion category.Each group can have its own assignment submission
folder, discussion forum, or locker area towork in.
You can grade items by group members individuallyor as a team.
Use Sections to divide your class into sectionsthat help manage enrollments.
Sections make it easier to organize assistants,learners, assignments, and grades because
users only see learning materials and otherusers from their own section.
When you set up the section, you can selectthe enrollment type, number of users and or
sections, and how the users are enrolled.When you set up the section, you can select
the enrollment type, number of sections, andhow the users are enrolled.
Additionally, you can set up discussion areasthat are exclusive to each section.
You can further customize the sections bymodifying user enrollment or adding or deleting
the sections as necessary.Use the Groups tool to create group work areas
for learners and the Sections tool to divideyour classlist into sections that display
learning materials and users only to thoseenrolled in the section.

title: Learning Environment - Switch Roles - Instructor and Administrator

captions.text: Review what others in your organization experienceby switching roles.
This tutorial shows how to switch betweenroles in Brightspace Learning Environment.
To begin, click your Personal Menu...and select Change (or Change Role if using
a screenreader).Then, select the role whose perspective you
want to view your course from. For this example,select Student.
When a role switch is active, your profilepicture changes, and the role you are mimicking
displays following your name on the PersonalMenu. Role switching allows you to view the
course from the perspective of a particularrole without special access. Actions you take,
such as accessing content or discussion topics,are not marked as completed.
Navigate to the content you want to view asa learner.
To end the role switch, click your PersonalMenu...
and select Stop viewing as or Stop viewing as [Role] if using a screen reader.
Review what others in your organization experience by switching roles.

title: Groups - Modify Group Enrollment - Instructor

captions.text: Change which learners are working togetheron group assignments by removing a learner
from one group and adding them to another.
This tutorial shows how to add or remove learnersfrom groups or move a learner from one group
to another.
To begin, on the Manage Groups page, clickthe View Categories drop-down list and select
the category you want to modify.
Click the context menu for the category andselect Enroll Users.
From here, you can modify group enrollments.
In the Display category, you can select aspecific group to modify, or "All Groups"
to see all groups and learners at once.
If you have a large classlist, you can usethe search function to locate the user that
you want to enroll or unenroll from a group.
In the group table, you can select or clearthe check boxes associated with learners to
modify their enrollment in a group.
For this example, we will move Aline Souzato new group so she is no longer in a group
of one.
Clear the check box following a learner'sname to unenroll them from groups.
Then, select a check box following a learner'sname to add them to a different group.
When you are ready, click Save.
When you move a learner to a new group, theirenrollment in the associated workspaces changes.
Discussion posts remain in the previous groupand, when applicable, do not count towards
a learner’s grade.
If the forum or topic is associated with agrade item, the learner must satisfy the discussion
post requirements in the new group.
Or, you can override the grade using the Gradestool.
Locker files remain in the previous group.
Learners must add any files they want to keepto their new locker area themselves.
Assignments submitted for the previous groupremain with that group.
If the assignment submission folder is associatedwith a grade item, the learner receives the
grade achieved by their new group on any groupassignment folders.
Or, you can change the learner’s grade toanother value using the Grades tool.
Change which learners are working togetheron group assignments by removing a learner
from one group and adding them to another.

title: Manage Dates - Offset Dates - Instructor

captions.text: Conveniently move content forward or backwardto a different day by offsetting dates for
course objects.This tutorial shows how to offset dates using
Manage Dates.You can edit and offset dates for various
course objects within Manage Dates.Filter the course objects that display by
selecting Specific Tools in the filter options.In this example, we will select Content.
You can also specify Advanced Filter Options,such as name, due date, duration, or calendar
status.Click Apply Filter.
You can select specific course objects orall course objects. In this example, we will
select all.Click Bulk Offset Dates to move the availability
of course objects forward or backward by aspecified number of days.
In the Dates to Offset section, select whetheryou want to offset the date dates, start dates,
or end dates for course objects.Select whether you want to move the selected
course objects forward, backward, or calculatedbased on two dates.
If you select Calculated based on two dates,you will be prompted to select a start and
end date. The system will calculate the numberof days between these selections and move
course objects forward or backward based onthis calculation.
From the Days menu, we will offset the due,start, and end dates for course objects by
moving them forward 140 days.When you're ready, click Save.
You have offset the dates for the course objects.Conveniently move content forward or backward
to a different day by offsetting dates forcourse objects.

title: Release Highlights - May 2018 (Version 10.8.1) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.8.1.Instructors can now pin an Activity Feed post
to the top of the feed.Now, when an instructor has an older Activity
Feed post they would like to remind learnersof, they click its Options menu, and select
Pin Post to Top.The post now displays at the top of the feed,
followed by remaining posts in chronologicalorder.
You can now add a banner image to the organizationor a custom org unit, such as a department,
or enable instructors to do so.This feature implements PIE item D3781.
To enable banner images on homepages by default,turn on the existing d2l.Tools.Homepages.Banner.DefaultForCourses
and the new d2l.Tools.Homepages.Banner.DefaultForOtherOrgUnitsconfiguration variables.
Then, map the permissions for users you wantto be able to access this feature.
In the Course Management Console Tool, setthe See Course Info permission at the correct
org unit levels for the desired users.And, in the Manage Courses Tool, set the Change
Course Image permission at the correct orgunit levels for the desired users.
From the Organization or a custom org unithomepage (such as a department), click the
Actions menu and select Display Homepage Banner.Now, you can view and edit banner images for
courses and other org units.You can now change the Top Color Strip of
a minibar from Navigation and Themes insteadof Minibar Settings.
Now, to change the org default navbar color,from the Themes tab of Navigation and Themes,
click More Actions and select Change OrganizationDefault Color.
Select a Top Color Strip value, then, clickSave to apply it.
You can also set a unique color for an individualtheme on the Edit Theme page in Navigation
and Themes.Now, when parents view Assignment Details,
they can see the assignment score as wellas written feedback left by instructors.
To provide more context on an assignment’simpact on a learner’s final grade, the assignment
score is now visible to parents.Additionally, written feedback left by instructors
now displays.To provide you with more information when
analyzing differences between data sets, someBrightspace Data Sets now include rows of
data that have been soft deleted from theapplication, but are still present in the
database.To indicate a soft delete, the IsDeleted,
DeletedDate, and RecycledDate columns areincluded in the Org Units Brightspace Data
Set.In addition, the Gradebook Settings Brightspace
Data Set now contains rows associated withdeleted Org Units.
To simplify access to Brightspace Data Sets,users now only require the Can Access Brightspace
Data Sets permission.All permissions previously required to run
specific Brightspace Data Sets have been removed.Instructors can now scroll through users'
grades without losing the context for whichand whose grades they are looking at
This feature implements PIE item D622.Now, when instructors scroll within the Standard
View, Spreadsheet View, Grade Category, IndividualGrade Item, and Final Grades pages within
Grades the Name column or header row is lockedin place when using Chrome, Firefox, and Safari
web browsers.Note: The locked Name column or header row
will not be active when using a small screenspace such as a mobile device.
Instructors will find it easier to add andorganize materials within Lessons due to a
number of interface improvements.The New Unit button now displays on the main
interface to make it more intuitive to getstarted and organize your course.
Now, the Add button is always visible to easilyadd lessons, folders, and materials to a course
offering.When you click Add, a breadcrumb trail now
indicates where you are adding material to,allowing you to easily navigate up or down
the tree to add material at different levels.The types of materials you can add to your
course now appear on a full-screen page.All options are intuitively organized with
clear names and icons.You can also immediately browse or drag and
drop files onto the upload area.Instructors will notice a number of improvements
to Manage Dates.This feature implements PIE item D227.
The course start date and end date appearsat the top of the Manage Dates page and acts
as a reference for instructors when operatingon the dates of the various activities.
If you have assigned instructors the ManageCourses > Change Start and End Dates permission,
they can launch a dialog box to edit the dates.Course activities now display in the order
in which an instructor would see them in theirrespective tools.
When viewing Calendar events, instructorscan now edit the start and end dates of events
that were manually created and not tied toexisting activities or content topics.
Lastly, the new Review and Manage Dates buttonappears at the end of copy course components,
course import, and course import advancedpages.
Corporate administrators and managers cannow easily view course enrollment and activity
status for each user.Managers can now view the course enrollment
status for all users in a course from theActive Courses tab on the User Details page.
The Pending Enrollment state now appears clearlyin the Course Status column.
Courses the user has completed appear in theCompleted Courses tab.
Now, assigned users and users with pendingenrollments in the course appear on one page,
with the Pending Enrollment state of a userclearly indicated in the Completion Status
column.The Not Assigned tab has been removed.
Corporate administrators and managers cannow more easily manage course enrollment.
An improved workflow on the Course Detailspage includes a new Assign People button.
This makes it easier to assign and removeusers from courses.
Instructors and learners will notice interfacechanges when previewing rubric definitions.
Rubric previews have an improved look andfeel.
Rubric definition previews open in a pop-upwindow or are embedded in the assessment view
(such as from an assignment or discussion).Each rubric definition preview accommodates
current rubric types (6 levels and 10 criteria).A Total row replaces the Overall Score row
for the entire rubric.Rubric definition previews maintain a consistent
appearance across tools in Brightspace LearningEnvironment, including responsive display
on desktops and mobile devices.Instructors can now add new SCORM solution
objects into their courses directly from Lessons.The workflow is the same as adding new SCORM
solution objects using Content.

title: Data Hub - Set up Brightspace Data Sets - Administrator

captions.text: Access, filter, and export pre-defined collectionsof data from the Brightspace platform to further
analyze that data according to your needs.
This tutorial shows how to set up and exportthe Brightspace Data Sets.
Ensure that Data Hub is enabled prior to settingup a data set.
Brightspace Data Sets contain raw, user-leveldata from Brightspace Learning Environment
and are available to Brightspace Insightsand Brightspace Core clients.
With Brightspace Data Sets, you can downloadthe complete historical data for the data
extracts with a few exceptions.
There is a default system limit to return150 million rows of the most recent data.
There are a few data sets where the data islimited to the last two calendar years (noted
in the descriptions of the data sets).
To set up Brightspace Data Sets, click theAdmin Tools menu and select Roles and Permissions.
To ensure you have control over who has accessto your important data, you must set up the
permissions for the data extracts.
Click the role you want to be able to viewthe data sets.
Typically, this will be an administrator.
Click the Filter by Tool drop-down list andselect Brightspace Data Sets.
Then, click Apply Filter.
Make the Can Access Brightspace Data Setspermission active at the Organization level.
From Brightspace Data Sets, you can generatethe same information as in the Advanced Data
Sets, and more.
When you are ready, click Save.
Once you have set the permissions, you canexport a Brightspace Data Set.
From the navbar, click Data Hub.
Click the data set you want to analyze.
Unzip the data set package and open the CSVfile with a CSV-compatible software.
You can use the CSV file containing the dataset to analyze that data according to your
needs.
Access, filter, and export predefined collectionsof data from the Brightspace platform to further
analyze that data according to your needs.

title: Teaching Tips - Itemize Assignments using Checklists - Instructor

captions.text: Help learners deconstruct a large assignmentinto smaller tasks using a checklist.
This tutorial shows how to create a checklistto help learners stay on track and complete
an assignment.Checklists consist of categories and items.
In this video we are going to create a checklist with five categories
outlining the different phases of the assignment
and each category has related tasks that need to be completed during that phase
To begin, from the New Checklist page, enter a name.
Then, if desired, enter a description for the checklist.
The description will display at the beginning of the checklist and when linked to another tool,
such as content, will display in the topic. Next, click Save.
Navigate to the Categories and Items section...and click New Category.
Enter a name, and if desired a description.Repeat this process to create the needed number
of categories of steps for the assignment.
Note: Clicking Save and Newwill allow you to continue creating new categories
without returning to the checklist page. Whenyou are ready, click Save.
Navigate to the Categories and Items section....and click New Item.
Use the Category dropdown to select whichcategory the item will belong to, in this
example, this item will be associated withthe research category. Then enter a name for it.
Navigate to the Due Date section.
Tip: Use Due Dates and Display in Calendarto give visibility to learners and offer pacing
guidelines.Click Due Date.
and adjust the due date and time if necessary.Then, click Display in Calendar.
Click Save to return to the checklist.Navigate to the Categories and Items section...
to review your checklist. When you are ready,click Save and Close.
Tip: Add the checklist to a relevant contenttopic to help learners understand the assignment
instructions and pace their work.Help learners deconstruct a large assignment
into smaller tasks using a checklist.

title: Lessons - Add a New Unit and Lesson - Instructor

captions.text: Structure and organize your course materials by adding units and lessons to your course offering.
This tutorial shows the steps to add units and lessons to your course offering.
Click the Course options menu in the Table
of Contents panel and select Add Unit to add a unit to your course.
Enter a name for the unit and click Save.The module displays on the canvas.
Note: The unit number is determined by itsorder in the table of contents.
Lessons give your course another level oforganization, allowing you to separate related
lesson plans within the same unit.To add a lesson, click Add Lesson.
Then, enter a name for it and click Save.The lesson appears on the canvas.
Note: New units and lessons are hidden fromlearners by default. Make the course materials
visible once you are ready to share them.The lesson appears in the table of contents,
nested following the unit.
Structure and organize your course materials by adding units and lessons to your course offering.

title: Grading in Brightspace

captions.text: Access the Quick Eval tool from the organizationalhomepage Navbar or the course level Navbar.
If Quick Eval is not located on your Navbar,use Course Admin to access it.
Quick Eval can also be accessed at the institution level through the Quick Eval widget if configured by your administrators.
Quick Eval offers two views for instructors:Submissions and Activities.
The Submissions view provides a convenient list of all student submissions that are awaiting evaluation across all of your courses.
In Quick Eval, assessments will remain visibleuntil an evaluator publishes a Grade and Feedback.
The Submissions view provides powerful filters for faculty to sort or focus on specific activities, dates, and courses.
To filter, select the filter’s drop-down menu.
You can also use the Search bar to find specific submissions.
To grade a submission, click on the student'sname. This will open the student's submission.
Activities view displays indicators to show the learner's progress on submissions,
instructor's progress on evaluations, and on publishing feedback to learners.
It also includes links to the Evaluation page,Submission page, and Publish All action.
More information on evaluating student submissionswill be available later in this video.
To grade a student's assignment submission,complete the following:
from the Quick Eval Submissions or Activity view, select the assignment submission you want to grade.
To add a score to the assignment, enter thevalue in the Overall Grade field.
You may also annotate a submission using the Annotation tools.
Optionally, to evaluate based on the rubricyou have attached to the activity,
select the rubric and complete the Rubric Scoring criteria.
Additionally, you can include text, audio,or video feedback using the Brightspace Editor.
Once feedback is completed, select either Publish or Save Draft.
Publish will make feedback available to the student,
whereas Save Draft will save all completed feedback but will not yet be released to the student until published.
When using the Save Draft feature, there are a couple optional steps you may choose to use:
if selecting Save Draft, feedback can be published later by returning to the student's submission or through the Activities tab
and to return to Quick Eval, select Back to Quick Eval on the top left corner.
From the Activities tab, locate your desired course and activity, hover over the Activity Name and click More Actions.
Select Publish All to publish all evaluated submissions for this activity.
Most quiz question types are automatically graded by Brightspace.
To manually access written response questions,complete the following:
from Quick Eval, access the quiz you want to grade.
On the Quiz Evaluation page, select the attemptand scroll through student responses.
On the Written Response submission, reviewstudent submission and enter a Score.
Optionally, you can include feedback using the Brightspace editor.
To return to Quick Eval, select Back to Quick Eval on the top left corner.
From Quick Eval, select the Discussion post you want to grade.
Review student Discussion post and any replies, if applicable.
To add a score to the Discussion post, enter the value in the Overall Grade Field.
Optionally, if you have a rubric attached to the Discussion post, assess a student's submission using the rubric.
Additionally, you may include text, audio or videofeedback using the Brightspace Editor.
Once feedback is completed, select either Publish or Save Draft.
Published will make feedback available tothe student,
whereas Save Draft will save all completed feedback,but will not be released to the student.
To return back to Quick Eval, select Back on the top left corner.

title: Release Highlights - July 2019 v.20.19.07 - Instructor

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.07.
Blackboard Ally is a content accessibilityservice, and is now available as an integration.
Ally assists you improve content accessibilityby checking for accessibility issues and generating
alternative accessible formats.
As part of our ongoing commitment to designand develop against WC3 accessibility best
practices, there are updates to our sharedweb components, such as fonts, buttons, menus,
and input fields to ensure they align withWCAG 2.1 standards. For a list of changes,
review the Release Notes.
You can now pin multiple posts to the topof your Activity Feed. This feature implements
PIE item D4635.
From Activity Feed, click Options for Post.
and select Pin Post to Top.
To pin an additional post, navigate to thepost you want to pin…
…click Options for Post…
and select Pin Post to Top.
Note: Posts are pinned by date, with the oldestpinned post appearing at the top of the list.
Activity Feed can now filter by and send poststo specific sections in a course.
Note: You must be enrolled in more than onesection of a course for sections in Activity
Feed to appear.This feature implements PIE item D3952
From Activity Feed click Create a post…
Leave All sections selected to send a postto all learners, or click Send To…
to select one or more sections.
To sort your course activity feed by a section,click Filter By.
You can now edit all categories in Assignmentsfrom one page. This feature implements PIE
items D1858, and D1913.
From Assignments, click Edit Categories…
Here you can add, modify, delete, and sortcategories, as well as manage unused categories.
If a category with assignments is deleted,those assignments are added to the No Category area.
An eraser is now available in the Annotationstool bar to remove ink annotations.
When evaluating a learner’s submission,click Annotations.
and select your markup type.
Here you can choose Eraser to remove pen andhighlighter ink annotations.
In Class Progress, the default Content Visitedindicator is switching to the Content Completed
indicator. This change applies to all userswho are currently using the Content Visited
indicator or default settings.
From Class Progress, the new Content Completedindicator graph displays. To opt out of this
change, edit your settings.
All references to ucourses.com, desire2learn.com,and brightspace.com
domains in the d2l.Tools.HelpDesk.FromEmail and d2l.Tools.Notifications.Email.From
Address Email-related configuration variables are now updated to follow the
implementation standardof [your organization name].brightspace.com.
If a user does not upload a user profile imagein Brightspace Learning Environment, the navbar
now displays the user’s initials in theuser-profile badge. This change occurs for
all roles and displays in the BrightspaceLearning Environment navbar and Activity Feed.
The table of contents in the New Content Experiencehas been enhanced.
Learners can now assign categories to tagthe evidence they collect with Portfolio.
This feature implements PIE item D5100.
Several improvements have been made to QuickEval. Different date formats are supported
in the Submission Date column.This feature implements PIE item D5432.
The Back to Quick Eval button directs usersto the Quick Eval tool at the course level
or org level, depending on where you launchedit from.
The Manage Discussions permission is no longerrequired to evaluate discussion topic submissions.
The default state of the organization-leveld2l.Tools.Rubrics.UpdatedGradingExperience
configuration variable is now set to On.
Several updates have been made to Surveys.This feature implements PIE items D4528, and D1023.
While learners are taking an anonymous survey,an alert appears.
The primary button when completing a Surveyhas been updated from Save Responses to read
as Submit Survey. Learners are still requiredto save survey answers manually using Save
Responses.When a learner attempts to complete the survey
with unanswered questions…
…a new Back to Questions button is displayed.
There are changes to lang term values to increasethe clarity of the fields in the Updates Widget,
the My Courses Widget, and Assignments tomore clearly describe the capability of the
feature. For more information, review therelease notes.
Not sure what dates to set so alerts appearin Brightspace Pulse? Check out our new Brightspace
Pulse playlist, and be sure to Subscribe!

title: Learning Environment - Introducing Daylight - Administrator

captions.text: Enable the Daylight Experience in your learningenvironment to explore its defining features,
including new: font, color scheme, icons,and a responsive layout.
This tutorial shows significant visual changesthat occur with the implementation of the
Daylight Experience.The My Courses widget has an improved ability
to search for courses.Relevant courses automatically display in
the widget for most users.Hover over a course image...
...and click the context menu...To view Course Offering Information, change
the course image, or unpin the course fromthe widget.
Click Change Image......to view other image options for your course.
Hover over the image you'd like to assign......and click Use this Image.
You can now apply navbar logos at all orgunit levels using the active navbar and theme.
This allows you to showcase different logosat the org, department, course, and custom
org unit levels.You can also configure the org unit name to
appear in addition to the logo, except onthe org navbar (which always hides the name),
and course navbar (which always shows thename)
There is a color strip across the top of thescreen in the navbar.
This color is set by the Top Color Strip settingin Edit Theme.
From the bottom of the Homepage...You can access the Actions menu...
and click Display Homepage Banner...To set a banner that is visible to the entire
org, or a specific org unit such as a department.As with course images you can select an image
from an existing library or open a custom image.
There are significant visual changes at theplatform level that extend across the product
to all features and tools, including a newfont with consistent line heights, margins,
and other styling.The Daylight navbar provides a single link
area to ensure a straightforward navigationmodel.
Links that appear in the Daylight navbar comefrom the current active navbar.
New icons are used sparingly and consistentlyin areas such as the minibar...
and other navigation panes.The Daylight Experience features a responsive
layout that scales appropriately for smallerscreens.
...such as tablets......and mobile devices.
In some cases, certain menus may not be fullyfunctioning in the mobile menu.
Turn on the Daylight visual design by enablingthe d2l.System.BrightspaceDaylightExperience
configuration variable.Enable the Daylight
Experience in your learning environment toexplore its defining features, including new:
font, color scheme, icons, and a responsivelayout.

title: ePortfolio - Create an Artifact - Learners

captions.text: Document your learning by adding artifactsto your Brightspace ePortfolio.
This tutorial shows how to add an artifactto your ePortfolio.
Some artifacts can be added directly fromthe dashboard, but in this example we will
add an artifact from the My Items page. To begin, from the ePortfolio dashboard, click My Items.
Click Add.You can add many types of artifacts. Add reflections
to record your thoughts, goals, ideas, andmore.
You can add links to websites,......and upload existing files.
Create and add web documents that includeformatted text, images, videos, audio files,
and links.Record audio directly within ePortfolio.
Add form responses by filling out available
form templates.You can also import course results, like Assignments
submissions, quizzes, and grades.
You can import learning objectives from yourcourses too.
For this example, we will upload a file. SelectFile Upload....
and click the location of the file you want to upload.
Then, click upload or drag-and-drop the fileonto the upload target.
Click Add.And, click next.
You can modify the file's name, and add adescription.
Navigate to the Tags section. Adding tagsmake artifacts easier to find and organize
into collections.To add a tag, click the Tags field and enter
a word you want to use as a tag.Then, click Add Tag.
Added tags appear following the Tags field.Repeat this process to add multiple tags.
When you are ready, click Save.After saving the artifact you can modify its
comment and assessment permissions. You canalso add a rubric that can be used to assess
your artifact.Navigate to Learning Objectives.
You can also associate the artifact with LearningObjectives. When you are ready, click Save
and Close.The artifact has been added to your ePorfolio.
When you click My Items......the newly added artifact now appears in
your list of items.Document your learning by adding artifacts
to your Brightspace ePortfolio.

title: Concepts for Administrators - K-12 Organization Structure - Administrators

captions.text: The organization or "org" structure is a treestructure made up of individual org units
that are arranged in parent-child relationships.This tutorial provides an example overview
of a basic org structure and its org unitswhile discussing how you can use this structure
to organize your K-12 school board in D2LLearning Environment.
This is an example of a basic org structure.The organization, department, course template,
and course offering org units are required.All other org units are optional ways to define
the tree structure.We will discuss each org unit individually.
First, we will discuss the organization orgunit, which is highlighted in orange.
The organization org unit – also known asthe “My Home” page in D2L Learning Environment
– is the highest level of the tree structureand represents your entire school board or
school.At this level, you can define elements that
will be common to all users throughout theentire school, such as the default homepage.
For this example, we look at the org structurefor the fictional Riverside School District.
Next, we'll look at custom org units.You can use custom org units to create an
additional level or levels of structure betweenthe organization and department org units.
For example, custom org units could dividethe organization into schools or regions.
These optional org units can be in a hierarchyor parallel to each other.
If you have multiple schools within a schoolboard, it can be helpful to divide your org
structure by these locations if they havea unique set of course offerings.
For example, the Riverside School Districtis made up of both elementary and high schools.
The custom org units further subdivide theseschool types into the Applemont and Wingate
schools.Departments are mandatory org units that divide
the org level or custom org units.Department org units organize courses and
learners within the overall tree structure.You can define these org units however you’d
like.For example, a department org unit can represent
a subject or grade level.In this example, the department org units
depict the grade levels that are taught withinthe school -- Grades 5, 6, and 7.
Next, we will discuss course templates.Course templates add an extra level of structure
between departments and course offerings.They act as a container that collects related
course offerings.Note: Course templates and course offerings
have a parent-child relationship.Course offerings must be the child of a course
template.For example, there are two types of classes:
Grade 5 Core and Grade 5 Music.Course templates group together course offerings
that fall within these categories.Next, we will discuss course offerings.
Course offerings are the courses in whichlearners are enrolled and where they access
their learning materials. In general, a courseoffering is populated by instructors.
Learners access course offerings from theorganization homepage using the course selector
on the minibar.In this example, the Grade 5 Core class has
a Fall 2015 offering with Ms. Smith.You can further subdivide course offerings
into sections.Sections allow administrators or instructors
to subdivide a course offering into multiplesections.
This is especially useful for dividing largeclasslists into more manageable units.
In this example, the course offering is subdividedinto two sections to divide the students by
the time of day at which they are taking thecourse.
Groups provide an additional layer of organizationto the tree structure.
Groups divide a course offering for the purposeof group work.
You can create multiple categories for groups,and enroll learners into one or more groups.
Note: Sections divide the classlist into distinctchunks.
Groups allow organized collaboration.In this example, the class is divided into
two collaborative groups for an in-class assignment.Finally, we will discuss semesters.
Semesters are an optional org unit.You can use semesters to divide course offerings
into time-based categories.Dividing course offerings into semesters allows
