administrators to search for course offeringsthat are being offered within a specified
time period.For this example, the org structure depicts
the course offerings for the 2016/2017 schoolyear.
Org structures are flexible in their composition.You can custom-make org units to best fit
your school board or school's purpose.This is an example of a default organization
structure.You can customize additional org units to
structure your school or school board.As a best practice, you should contact the
D2L Implementation Consultants to design andcreate the ideal organization structure.

title: Assignments - Associate an Assignment with a Grade Item - Instructor

captions.text: Associate your assignment with a grade itemso it appears in your grade book.
This tutorial shows how to associate an assignmentwith a grade item in your grade book.
To begin, from Assignments, create a new assignmentor navigate to an existing assignment…
Click the context menu of the assignment youwant to edit…
and select, Edit Assignment.
Then, navigate to Evaluation and Feedback.
In the Grade Item section, you can selectan existing grade item, or create a new one.
For this example, click New Grade Item.
Enter a Name for it.
If desired, you can enter a Short Name, whichdisplays in the grade book.
Then, select a Category for the grade itemto be housed in your grade book.
Navigate to Grading…
Note: The Maximum Points will automaticallypopulate based on the category settings. If
no category is selected the assignment weightwill contribute to the final grade.
Next, specify whether the category can exceedthe assigned Max Points Value, will be considered
a Bonus item, or Excluded from Final GradeCalculations.
Note: Bonus items are not counted towardsthe maximum points for a category or final grade.
If applicable, you must select the Can Exceed check box, and the Bonus check box to allow users' grades to
exceed the maximum points specified.
Navigate to Grade Scheme.
You can also specify additional properties,such as a grade scheme or restrictions.
When you are ready, click Save.
Lastly, click Save and Close.
Upon creating the new assignment, the newlycreated grade item will display in your grade book.
Associate your assignment with a grade itemso it appears in your grade book.

title: Grades - Grade a Discussion in your Grade Book - Instructor

captions.text: Evaluate learners’ contributions to onlineconversations by assessing discussion posts.
This tutorial shows how to reference the contextof a discussion post and then assign a grade
in the grade book.To begin, from Grades, click Enter Grades.
You have different options when entering gradesin your grade book. One way is to enter grades
for any or all items or learners by switchingto spreadsheet view.
For this example, we will remain in the StandardView.
In the standard view, you have the optionto view additional icons, such as view submission,
and view discussion posts, as well as viewthe grade scheme. You can also enter grades
for learners individually.Navigate to the learner and grade item that
you want to grade.For this example, we will grade Wil Fischer's
discussion post.Click New Posts to view a rubric that outlines
the criteria you will use to evaluate thediscussion post.
Select the criteria that best represent thelearner's achievements.
The Overall Score populates based on the criteriayou select.
In the Post section, you can review what thelearner shared. This can help you when choosing
the criteria or providing constructive feedback.Click the post title to open the discussion
in a new window or tab and view it withinits original context.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.The score for the grade item has been updated.
Evaluate learners’ contributions to onlineconversations by assessing discussion posts.

title: Brightspace Learning Environment - Making Use of the HTML Editor - Instructor

captions.text: Create, design, and format HTML to integrateit into Brightspace Learning Environment.
This tutorial shows how to use the HTML Editorto create and edit HTML in tools that have
HTML content creation capabilities.The HTML Editor integrates with all Brightspace
Learning Environment tools that have HTMLcontent creation capabilities, such as discussion
topics, custom instructions for assignmentfolders, content topics, and more.
Using the HTML Editor allows you to quicklycreate and format content with the optional
ability to edit the HTML directly.The design view loads automatically when you
access the HTML Editor.To begin, enter your content and use the available
controls to apply formatting to your text,insert images and tables, and create links.
Insert options allow you to insert non-textitems, such as files, images, links, or symbols.
For this example, we will insert an imagefrom a URL.
Enter the address of the online image andclick Add.
Then, enter alternative text for the image,or indicate that it is decorative.
When you are ready, click OK.Paragraph styling lets you apply a consistent
appearance for individual paragraphs elements,such as headings.
The paragraph styling applies a predefinedset of fonts, alignment, spacing, and so on.
Highlight text you would like to stylize clickthe paragraph styling drop-down menu
and select the style you want to apply.Text formatting options allow you to stylize
individually-selected text.Highlight the text you want to stylize
and click a text formatting option, such as italics,to apply it.
Paragraph formatting options let you controlthe appearance of individual paragraphs, such
as changing the alignment, adding an indentation,or creating a list.
The Font formatting options allow you to changethe font face and size.
Font color options allow you to change thecolor of a font so it stands out from other
text.The Table formatting options allow you to
add and modify a table.Show All Components toggles other options
that are not immediately viewable, which mayinclude the equation editor, undo option,
and editing options.Use the Spellcheck to verify the spelling
for your content.When you have finished running the Spellcheck,
click OK.Click the accessibility checker to ensure
that the HTML page meets conformance to WCAGand Section 508 accessibility standards.
The checker indicates if the content is freeof accessibility issues, or offers suggestions
to fix them.When you are ready, click Close.
Click the HTML Source Editor to view the codethat structures and formats your content.
Use the HTML Source Editor if you have experiencewith HTML and prefer to author your content
this way or want to apply styles from a cascadingstyle sheet.
Click Preview to view a preview of your HTMLcontent in a new window.
This allows you to preview content and ensurethat it displays as expected prior to saving
any changes.Create, design, and format HTML to integrate
it into Brightspace Learning Environment.

title: Fundamentals - Enroll a User - Administrator

captions.text: Enroll users in org units to define theiraccess to and role throughout different levels
of the organization.
This tutorial shows how to enroll a user inan org unit.
To begin, from the Users tool, Search Forthe user you want
to enroll in a course.
This search will query all fields.
Click the context menu associated with thedesired user...
...and select manage User Enrollments.
Next, we will locate and enroll the user inan org unit.
You can locate an org unit using Filter Byor Search For.
Enter the search criteria......and click Search.
Locate the course......and click Edit in the Role column.
Select a role from the drop-down list.
The roles available may differ depending onyour organization's preferences.
For this example, we will enroll the useras a Student in the Course Offering.
Click Apply to confirm the role change.
The user will now appear in the Classlist.
Click Close to return to the Users page.
Enroll users in org units to define theiraccess to and role throughout different levels
of the organization.

title: Instructor Release Highlights - February 2020 (v20.20.2)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.20.2
User Progress, Grades, and Assignments now feature a new View Inline Feedback link
that takes learners directly to the annotations or TurnItIn view.
This feature implements PIE Item D5351.
Now, in some instances, when you upload a .jpeg file in Brightspace Learning Environment,
an exchangeable image file (EXIF) data warning appears to inform you
when your file may contain geolocation data.
To improve cloud environment security, D2L is proactively blocking
suspicious requests using a Web App Firewall (WAF).
Note: This feature is available to Singapore-hosted clients, and will roll out globally in future releases.
Effective February 2020, Brightspace Wiggio is no longer available to users.
Administrators can now reset a course back to an empty shell using Course Reset.
Game Based Learning has been redesigned to improve the user experience and increase accessibility.
Note: Game Based Learning is available to Engagement Plus and existing Course Adventure Pack clients.
In Content, from the module or sub-module you will add a Game Map to, click Upload/Create.
and select, New Game Map.
Navigate to Description.
Enter a Map Name and a Map Description.
Click Next.
Select a background or upload a custom image.
Then, click Next.
Begin customizing the elements on your map.
Then, navigate to Next.
Click it.
Select from the preset objects to populate your map.
Navigate to Next.
and click it.
Create your learning path. To add another activity, click Add.
Click and Drag the activity to the desired location.
Repeat this process for as many activities as you want to include.
To branch paths, or connect to the finish node, click and drag the branching icon to the desired location.
Now, add activities to your map. Click a node.
Select the activity location…
and add them to your map, then navigate to activity details.
Here, you can change the activity name, and add a description. When you are ready, click Next.
Your map is ready for publishing, to add it to your course, click Publish.
You can now import tab separated value (.tsv) files into your Gradebook.
This feature implements PIE item D5385.
Levels of achievement, used to measure progress towards a learning outcome,
can be mapped to rubric levels.
You no longer have to use a percentage score to translate rubric levels to levels of achievement.
When creating, or editing, a rubric Achievement Level thresholds display inline.
These thresholds identify learners’ learning outcomes progress based on rubric levels during evaluation.
For more information, including the distribution breakdown, review the Release Notes
You can now add one or more rubrics to Portfolio evidence and assess that evidence against the rubric.
Learners and Parents immediately see instructor feedback, including criteria, level of achievement,
and feedback associated to the specific criteria.
You can now access and evaluate learner submissions from Quick Eval at the course level.
This feature implements PIE item D5474.
Quick Eval at the course level allows you to view and evaluate submissions on a course-by-course basis.
Here you can also switch to the org level Quick Eval. Click More Actions…
…and select Multi-Course Quick Eval.
You can now remove items from your Quick Eval list until a new submission is received for the activity.
This feature implements PIE item D5505.
From the Quick Eval Activity View, hover over the activity you want to dismiss…
Click More Actions…
… and select Dismiss until…
Here, you can dismiss the activity until the Next submission, A specific date, or Forever.
In the new Quiz Builder, questions can be aligned to learning outcomes.
When creating or editing a quiz, navigate to Quiz Questions…
and click Add/Edit Questions.
Select the question you would like to associate an outcome with.
Then, click More Actions…
and select Align to Standards.
Next, select a standard to associate it with the question.
Thanks for watching, we are always looking to hear from you about videos you’d like to see.
Drop us a comment below, and as always, don’t forget to subscribe!

title: Learning Environment - Customize the My Courses Widget - Administrator

captions.text: Customize and control the level of detaildisplayed in the My Courses widget across
your organization.This tutorial shows how to customize the My
Courses widget in Brightspace Learning Environment.To begin, from the homepage, click the My
Courses context menu......and select Customize this widget.
Note: Changes made to the My Courses widgetwill affect all users.
You can display the course code, the semesterthe course is offered, and specify sorting
options. In the Course Code section, clickShow Course Code.
In the Group Courses By section you can enforcespecific course sorting options such as by
Semester, Department or Role. For this example,leave none selected.
Navigate to Updates.Click Show course updates
...and select the updates you want users tobe notified of.
When you are ready, click Save.The widget will refresh, now the Course Code,
and notifications will display for all users.Notifications are separated by tool.
Customize and control the level of detaildisplayed in the My Courses widget across
your organization.

title: Grades - Enter Grades - Instructor

captions.text: Remain up-to-date on assessments and evaluationin your course by entering grades in your
grade book.This tutorial shows how to enter grades in
your grade book.You have different options when entering grades
in your grade book.One way is to enter grades for any or all
items or learners by switching to spreadsheetview.
Consider this option when entering gradesfor many grade items and learners at once.
Click Switch to Spreadsheet View.Enter grades for the desired learners and
grade items...And click Save.
Saved grades are shared with learners.The grades are saved.
Click Switch to Standard View to return tothe standard view of your grade book.
In the standard view, you have the optionto view additional icons, such as view submission,
and view discussion posts.
You can also enter grades for learners individually.This can be helpful if receiving multiple
late submissions from one learner.Click the learner's name...
...and enter the learner's grade for the desiredgrade item.
When you are ready, click Save and Close
The learner's grades display in your gradebook.
Note: You can identify whether grades arereleased or not released to learners by the
Open and Closed Eye icons found in the Final Grades column of your grade book.
Enter grades for a specific grade item byclicking the context menu for that item...
...and selecting Grade All. Note:You can also grade an entire category by completing
the same actions from its context menu.Enter the grades the learners achieved on
the assignment...And, when you're ready, click Save and Close.
The entered grades display.If you have associated a grade item with a
course activity, such as a discussion, assignmentsubmission folder, or quiz, you can also grade
the activity right in that tool and then publishthe grades to your grade book.
Remain up-to-date on assessment and evaluationin your course by entering grades in your
grade book.

title: Brightspace Capture™ - Create a Capture Portal User - Administrator

captions.text: Create a Capture Portal user with a specificrole to grant that user some level of access
to content and to portal management features.
This tutorial shows how to create a CapturePortal user.
To begin, log in to Capture Portal and clickAdmin. Note: the Admin page will only be available
once you have logged in.
Now click Manage Users.
Click Create User.
Enter a username and a password.
You may also enter the user's name and informationabout their company.
Enter an email address for the user.
Now select a role for the user.
The user's role determines what level of accessthey have to features and content in the Capture
Portal. For example, the basic role enablesusers to watch live events and published presentations
that require user login, but it does not grantthem the ability to add content or manage
portal features.
For this example we will select Publisher.A Publisher can manage and edit their own
content, but they cannot modify content publishedby other users.
You can add users to groups, enable them toreceive system emails, and enable them to
receive caption request emails.
Note: If you are creating a user that willmonitor Capture Station automation, enabling
them to receive system emails will allow themto get status information updates about automated
stations connected to the server.
When you are done click Save Changes.
Create a Capture Portal user with a specificrole to grant that user some level of access
to content and to portal management features.

title: Set Up Classlist, Class Progress, and Grades | Instructor

captions.text: To complete this video series, Classlist, Grades, and Class Progress will be highlighted
To access your Classlist, navigate from your course level navbar and select Classlist to access a directory of names, emails, and group settings,
which provides you with quick access to a full list of the participants in your course.
From your course level navbar, select Class Progress to view a summary of the competencies a user has completed within the current org unit.
For more information on Classlist and Class Progress, visit the article on How to Monitor Class Progress
Finally, from your course level navbar, select Grades to track grades and detailed class statistics
From here, you can import, export, or edit single or multiple grades
Users can also view their personal grades
For more information on the Grades tool, visit the article on Grading in Brightspace

title: Activity Feed - Create an Assignment Post - Instructor

captions.text: Create an share new assignments with learnersdirectly from Activity Feed.
This tutorial shows how to create a new assignment
and link it to your grade book using Activity Feed.
To begin, click the Plus icon to create apost…
…and click Assignment
Enter a title, instructions, and due datefor the assignment.
Then, specify the submission type using thesubmission type menu.
If you have supplementary materials, add themto the assignment by selecting Attach.
File options include: File Upload, Attachfrom Existing Content, Weblink, Google Drive™,
OneDrive™, and Video From Web.To add the new assignment to your grade book,
click Add to Grades.Note: This can only make numeric grade items.
Adjust the Max Points for the assignment asnecessary.
When you are ready, click Post.
The new assignment post displays and tracksthe number of assignments submitted by learners.
Create and share new assignments with learnersdirectly from Activity Feed.

title: Groups - Enroll in a Group - Learner

captions.text: Work with your peers to learn content then apply it to a collaborative project by joining groups.
This tutorial shows how self-enroll in a group
in Brightspace Learning Environment.You can find direct links to sign up for a
group throughout a course, such as in an announcementor within course materials.
Click the quicklink to navigate to the GroupSelection page.
From here, you can review the group categoryand Expiry Date, after which you will be enrolled
in a group if you have not yet chosen one.In the Group table, you can review a group,
its description and how many members havealready enrolled in a group.
To view who has enrolled in a group, clickthe associated number.
Select the group you want to enroll in.When you are ready, click Select.
Confirm your enrollment in the group.You are now enrolled in the group.
From Groups, you can review the members ina group, and, if it is set up by your instructor,
you can view the related assignment submissionfolder, discussion, or locker area.
If available, clicking the email icon associatedwith a group drafts an email to all members
of a group.You may also have the option to leave a group
that you have chosen yourself.To see if there are any more groups you can
partake in, click View Available Groups.Review the available groups, and click Join
Group to join it.
Work with your peers to learn content then apply it to a collaborative project by joining groups.

title: Office 365™ Widget - Add Office 365 Widget to a Course Offering - Administrator

captions.text: Add the Office 365 Online Service to a courseoffering so instructors and learners can conveniently
access their email, calendar, and OneDrive®online storage.
This tutorial shows how to add the Office365 online service widget to a course offering.
The Office 365 widget can be added to anyhomepage in you organization.
To begin, from Homepages, click the activehomepage.
Navigate to the Widgets section.This section provides a mock-up of the homepage
layout with options to add widgets.For this example, we want to add the Office
365 widget following the Announcements widget.Click Add Widgets.
You can browse, filter, or search the listof widgets.
For this example, we will search using thecriteria "Office 365."
Select Office 365 from the list of widgets,then click Add.
To add the widget to the homepage, click Saveand Close.
Your default homepage is now updated.Your course offering homepage now displays
the Office 365 widget.Add the Office 365 Online Service to a course offering
so instructors and learners can conveniently access their email, calendar, and OneDrive online storage.

title: April 2022 / 20.22.4 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the April 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe April 2022 Version 20.22.4 Release Notes,
which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
Quiz filter and contextual help added to AssessmentQuality Dashboard in Brightspace Insights;
In Data Hub, the Adoption Period for BrightspaceData Sets Version 7 has ended;
Create Agent page facilitates more flexiblescheduling and frequency options in the Intelligent
Agents tool;
In New Content Experience, add and edit datesfor Google Drive and Microsoft OneDrive link
topicsThe Homepage Widget Expansion pack features
a Widget Editor and updated permissions;and finally a Summary of Changes made for
all the other features.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Within Brightspace Insights, two new improvementshave been added:
A new search input in the Quiz Details areawhere users can enter the name of a quiz to
filter the dashboard results.
Filtering the dashboard to quizzes with thesame name allows users to compare multiple
occurrences of the same quiz.
Hover text has been added to the exclamationmark icons to provide context to users about
when to act on flagged quizzes and questions.
Navigate to the Assessment Quality Dashboard,and then Enter the name of the Quiz you wish
to search for into the Quiz Details field.
Select the magnifying glass button to search.
Select the X button to clear the search termsand reset the results in the table.
You can hover your cursor over the exclamationmark icon in the table to view additional
information.
This feature is available to all clients whohave the Performance Plus package or who have
purchased Brightspace Insights in the previouspackaging model.
This feature is automatically enabled.
Brightspace Data Sets Version 7, first announcedin the October 2021 / Version 20.21.10 release
notes, has ended the adoption period for Version7 with this release.
It is now the only supported version.
Version 7 includes major changes that removecolumns in existing Brightspace Data Sets:
VisibleStartDate, VisibleEndDate, PostingStartDate,and PostingEndDate from Discussion Forums
and Discussion Topics BDS.
ChecklistItemCount from Checklist ObjectsBDS;
And NumberOfItems from Checklist CategoryDetails BDS.
This feature is available to Brightspace Insightsand Brightspace Core clients in all regions.
To enable, grant Can Access Brightspace DataSets permission to administrators at the org
level and set configuration variable d2l.Tools.BrightspaceDataSets.Versionto version 7.
For more information, refer to Motivationsbehind the changes in Data Hub Brightspace
Data Set Major Version 7.0 October 2021 Releasein Brightspace Community.
The Intelligent Agents feature updates theCreate Agent page to facilitate additional
scheduling options and frequency.
Changes include:An updated user interface, which moves Scheduling
options to the top of the page.
It also adds ability to expand or collapsesections (Scheduling, Criteria, and Actions).
Two new agent frequency options: One-TimeRun, for a single run on a given date; and
Hourly, which runs every set number of hours.
The existing scheduling options now have aScheduled Time option, to pick what time the
scheduling runs at on the corresponding interval.
Finally, the Subject line of agents' emailsnow supports up to 128 characters, bringing
it in line with the Email tool.
Previously, the character limit was 100 characters.
Navigate to Intelligent Agents, and then entereither the Create Agent or Edit Agent page.
Then expand the Scheduling label and SelectHourly from the Frequency dropdown.
You can then set the Repeats Every field tothe desired value.
This sets how many hours pass between eachrun.
Now select One-Time Run from the Frequencydropdown.
Set the Scheduled Date and Time in the correspondingfields.
Selecting one of the earlier frequencies,such as Weekly, from the dropdown menu, you
can set the desired Scheduled Time.
Enter the desired time into the ScheduledTime field, or select from the dropdown menu.
Once you've made your changes (and set otherAgent information), click Save and Close.
This feature implements the following PIEItems:
D7457 (increase Intelligent Agent email characterlimit to 128);
D5830 (Allow easier 'once off' intelligentagent scheduling);
D5208 (Add "Time' Option to Restriction toSchedule of Intelligent Agent);
And D7726 (Ability to Run Intelligent AgentsMultiple Times Per Day).
Thank you to those who put forward these PIEsuggestions to implement this feature!
This feature is available to all clients,and is automatically enabled.
This feature improves the consistency of createand edit workflows across Brightspace Learning
Environment using the New Content Experience.
Instructors can use a new edit page for GoogleDrive and OneDrive links where dates can be
added and edited, or associated files canbe replaced.
Previously, only the topic title could beedited for Google Drive and Microsoft One
Drive link topics in the new content experience.
The New Content Experience Feature is availableto all clients with the New Content Experience
& the new create/edit workflow experienceenabled.
To enable, set the configuration variabled2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn
to enabled.
Depending on which integrations are in use,the d2l.3rdParty.GoogleDrive.EnableGooglePicker,
and/or d2l.3rdParty.OneDrive.EnableOneDrivePickermust be enabled as well.
To streamline and improve control over thewidget configuration workflow, some system
widgets (previously custom widgets) in theHomepage Widget Expansion Pack now use the
new Widget Editor for configuration and thenew Retrieve Org Unit Custom Widget Data and
Modify Org Unit Custom Widget Data permissions.
Previously, shared files were used to configuresome system widgets and there were no permissions
to control who could configure system widgets.
The system widgets now configured by the WidgetEditor include:
Visual Table of Contents Widget;Welcome Window Widget;
And Slim Announcements Widget
Navigate to your course and select the widgetyou wish to edit – in this case, we’re
using Visual Table of Contents.
Select the Customize Widget button to openthe Widget Editor field.
Once you’ve finished making your changes,click Save and Close.
The new Widgets feature is available to allclients that purchased the Homepage Widget
Expansion Pack.
To enable, once the Widget editor has beendeployed and turned on, grant the Homepages
> Retrieve Org Unit Custom Widget Data andModify Org Unit Custom Widget Data permissions
to the desired instructors.
For more information on configuring each systemwidget, refer to Homepage Widget Expansion
Pack in Brightspace Help.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Improving readability of text and tags withBrightspace Editor – Advanced code editor
visual update and accessibility improvements.
Brightspace Portfolio – Streamlined usernavigation and filter controls moves filters
area and header bar together for improvedease of use.
Improved analytics for when and how long usersaccess courses provided by Data Hub – Course
Access Log Brightspace Data Set.
Group/Section Management – AsynchronousGroup Creation moves group creation to a background
task, allowing users to continue using Brightspaceand perform other actions.
My Courses Widget – Language now managedin language pack allows users to customize
language terms within the widget.
Apply language translations and create customoverrides to rubric web components with Rubrics
– Customize language terms in Rubrics.
The Rubrics – Rubric Overall Score is availablein Brightspace Portfolio and Parent & Guardian
now displays a learner’s Overall Score belowthe rubric criterion evaluations.
Edit dates, associated grade items, LOR details,and LOR version information with SCORM – Edit
dates and associated grade items for LOR basedSCORM packages
IPSIS – Course Has Sections option permanentlyturned on means that all course offerings
must have sections.
And lastly, Ouriginal – Language updatesfor improved clarity and removal of opt out
option brings the tool into compliance withGeneral Data Protection Regulations.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the April 2022 / Version
20.22.4 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: Release Highlights - June 2019 (version 20.19.06) - Instructor

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of
Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.6.
Depending on your organizations settings,you and your learners now see preferred names
reflected in the Chat tool
This feature implements PIE item D5174.
To provide learners with greater flexibilityand control over their personal learning goals,
the new Discover tool allows them to searchfor active courses and self-enroll.
Note: Your administrator must enable Discoverfor learners to search your course and self-enroll.
You are now able to save feedback in draftstate on discussions associated with rubrics
before publishing it to learners.
In discussions, from the topic you want toassess, navigate to learner submissions.
and select the post you want to grade.
When assessing a learner, the Save Draft buttonis now visible.
Emails forwarded from D2L servers now appearto originate from the sender’s D2L domain
account instead of the original sender account.This provides more consistent and successful
email delivery on D2L servers.
Email header changes show the new “From”address as the user’s D2L email address,
and the “Reply-To” address as the originalsender’s (external) email address.
The user registration flow for myDesire2Learnwill no longer leverage the Edudentity login
service. Current myDesire2Learn users willexperience no change, and will be contacted
with direct notification of this change.
The End of Unit layout in the New ContentExperience has been improved for learners.
You can now share comments with other educatorsin the same course or classroom, while keeping
them private from the learner and parentsusing the visibility toggle in Portfolio.
Improvements have been made to the Quick Evallist.
A draft icon displays for discussion poststhat have feedback in draft status.
You will now only see ungraded assignmentsubmissions, discussion posts, and quiz attempts
for sections you are explicitly enrolled in.
Arithmetic and Significant Figures questionsin quizzes now round up from .5 by default.
This feature implements PIE item D1751.
The Discussions grading experience has beenmade consistent when using the updated rubrics
grading experience regardless of preferredworkflow.
From the discussion topic you want to grade,navigate to learner submissions.
And select an available rubric.
The window now displays the Topic score...
all available rubrics...
Overall Score, General Feedback...
and the learner’s post.
When you assess a rubric with associated learningobjectives, the updated grading experience
now displays.
Note: The new experience displays in all locationswhere you can assess a rubric with learning
objectives.
When you assess a topic that has a learningobjective, the pyramid learning objective
icon will display on the row it is associatedwith, or with the overall score depending
on alignment. The Associated learning objectivewill display below the rubric for reference.
User Progress logic has been consolidatedso that it is calculated in the same way across
the platform.
Content must meet three criteria to be includedin the user progress: The learner must have
access to the content, the content must bemarked with a completion method of Required
Automatic or Required Manual, and the contentis not exempt.
There is a new Content Completed indicatoravailable in Class Progress, and the existing
Content indicator has been renamed to ContentVisited.
When learners view Class Progress, the TopicsVisited statistic now has a denominator, and
the #visits column has been renamed TotalVisits. For a full list of changes, review
the release notes.

title: Teaching Tips - Make Regular Announcements - Instructor

captions.text: Boost engagement in your course by communicatingfrequently with all learners enrolled in your
course offering by making regular announcements.This tutorial provides suggestions for making
regular announcements to increase your communicationwith learners in your course offering.
Do your learners need a reminder? Would youlike to let them know about materials that
are new or updated? Did you remember thison a weekend or at two in the morning?
Scheduling regular announcements is the perfectway to deliver them to learners at a convenient
time.To begin, from Announcements, click New Announcement.
Enter a descriptive Headline; this is similarto the subject line of an email.
Then, enter and format the Content; this issimilar to the message within an email.
Select a start date and time for your announcement.If you choose a day in the future, the announcement
will remain hidden from learners until suchtime.
This allows you to prepare announcements aheadof time, and post them at a convenient time.
Tip: Space out the deployment of announcementsso as not to overload your learners with information.
If the information contained in an announcementis no longer relevant after a certain date,
you can also add an end date.Click Remove announcement based on end date
and select the date and time that you wantthe announcement to be unavailable to learners.
When you are ready, click Publish.Learner's won't see the scheduled announcement
until the Start Date.Schedule multiple announcements so that your
learners hear from you regularly.Is a project now available for your learners
to start working on? Or perhaps there is aquiz due soon?
Attaching a release condition to course itemsallows you to deliver an announcement to your
learners at just the right time.For this example, we will create a release
condition that releases the announcement whenan assignment is completed.
When creating or editing an announcement,navigate to the Additional Release Conditions
section.Click Create and Attach.
Click the Condition Type menu and select aCondition Type.
For this example, select Submission to folderfrom the Assignments category,
Then, in the Condition Details menu, clickthe Assignment Submission Folder menu and
select a folder.When you are ready, click Create.
The release conditions displays.When you are ready, click Publish.
The release condition decides when learnerswill be able to view the announcement.
Boost engagement in your course by communicatingfrequently with all learners enrolled in your
course offering by making regular announcements.

title: Question Library - Add an Answer Key - Instructor

captions.text: Maintain consistency across multiple graders by incorporating
an answer key in your written response questions.
This tutorial shows how add an answer key to the written response question type.
To begin, from Question Library, navigate to the question you want to add an answer key to...
click its context menu...
and select Edit.
Click Options...
and select Add Answer Key.
Click elsewhere on the screen to close the menu.
Enter your answer key. This is visible to all users with the Grading permission
in your course and allows for more consistent grading.
When you are ready, navigate to and click Save.
Lastly, click Done Editing Questions.
Now, when grading the question, the answer key displays to guide the grading.
Maintain consistency across multiple graders by incorporating an
answer key in your written response questions.

title: Manage Account Settings | Instructor

captions.text: This video will demonstrate how to use Account Settings in Brightspace Learning Environment as an Instructor
Managing your Account Settings customizes your Brightspace experience to fit your working and teaching style
On your homepage, navigate to your profile and select Account Settings
General Settings allows you to change your email or your password
Pronouns lets you make your pronouns available to other users
Font Settings allows you to customize the font size for your Brightspace experience
Reading Content lets you choose to automatically mark items as read once you read them
Video Settings lets you choose to optimize video presentations for assistive technologies
Locale & Language allows you to choose your preferred language for your account
Time Zone lets you choose your preferred time zone and continent
Signing In lets you decide how you want your status to appear when you’re online and your Login Destination
Application Settings allows you to view the applications registered to your account
You can also customize the Clock, First Day of the Week, Date, Number Format, and Percentage Format
Select Save & Close to confirm your account settings

title: Discussions - Assess from within a Thread - Instructor

captions.text: Use the Assess Student option to evaluatelearners’ discussion contributions without
having to leave the thread.
This tutorial shows how to assess learners’
discussion contributions without leaving thethread.
From Discussions, navigate to the topic youwant to grade...
and click it.
When viewing a discussion topic, the propertiesare listed together following the topic’s
name, including the availability and lockingdetails you set.
Filtering options are available from the Filterby: drop-down preceding learners’ posts.
You can filter by all threads, unread andflagged or drafts.
Click the topic you want to assess.
Click the thread’s context menu...
... and select Assess Student.
Note: Assess Student appears only when a topic has an associated grade item.
The Topic Score Details display. From here,
you can review the number of posts made bythe learner and enter the learner’s score
for the discussion topic.If you have the Assess with Embedded Rubrics
feature enabled, the rubric will also displayfor grading purposes.
Navigate to Overall Score.
An Overall Score will be selected automaticallyusing the rubric results. To override the
Overall Score level click the level you wantto assign.
Achievement levels may be suggestedto you based on rubric score, if defined by
your institution.
You can also include any comments you wantto provide to the learner in the Feedback
field. When you are ready, click Save Draft,to save the assessment to complete later,
or if you are satisfied with the assessmentclick Publish.
You are returned to the discussion thread.From here, you can continue to assess learners’
contributions. Click the context menu fora learner who has replied to the thread.
Then select Assess Student to continue withyour evaluation.
Use the Assess Student option to evaluatelearners’ discussion contributions without
having to leave the thread.

title: External Learning Tools - Create a Link - Administrator

captions.text: Increase the extensibility of your Brightspace Learning Environment by using External Learning Tools.
This tutorial shows how to create an external
learning tool link in Brightspace LearningEnvironment.
Learning Tools Interoperability (or LTI) isa standard for passing user, course, and organization
information between Tool Consumers (such asBrightspace Learning Environment) and Tool
Providers (such as remote proctoring tools,wikis, and publisher content).
Brightspace Learning Environment is LTI 1.1.1compliant.
LTI links in Brightspace Learning Environmentare created and managed through External Learning
Tools.To access External Learning Tools, click Admin
Tools and select External Learning Tools.Here, you can manage external learning tool
links or tool providers.In this example, we will create a new link.
Click New Link.Then, enter a title.
Then, enter the URL for the link.This is where users will be sent when they
click the link from within their courses.Enter a description, if desired, to explain
to other users what the External LearningTool is and what its benefits are.
The Key/Secret section is how External LearningTool links are made secure, similar to using
a username and password.For this example, we will leave the default
settings.In the Custom Parameters section, you can
customize the default behaviors of the tool.Select the information you will send to the
tool provider in the Security Settings area.Tool providers should provide you with what
values need to be on or off to have a successfuland meaningful integration.
For this example, select Use tool providersecurity settings.
You can share links created at the organizationlevel with all or a selection of courses.
To share the link, click Add Org Units.Select the org units you want to share the
link with and click Insert.When you are ready, click Save and Close.
The link displays in the list.From here, you can preview the link.
Click the link's context menu and select Preview Link to see what the tool will look like for users.
Increase the extensibility of your Brightspace
Learning Environment by using External LearningTools.

title: Office 365™ Widget - Connect to the Office 365 Online Service - Instructor

captions.text: Connect to the Office 365 online service toconveniently access your email, calendar,
and OneDrive online storage.This tutorial shows how to connect to the
Office 365 online service.To begin, from the Office 365 widget, click
Sign in to your Office365 accountNote: Some organizations will automatically
log you into your Office 365 account.Enter your email address, then click Next
to verify it.Note: Your organization may occasionally require
you to log in again.Next, you will sign in.
Enter your email address and password.Then, click Sign in.
You are then redirected to your Office 365widget.
From the widget, you can browse directly toyour email, calendar, or online storage.
Or, expand the widget to preview these items.For this example, we will browse to email.
Click an email in the preview to browse tothe email inbox.
Connect to the Office 365 online service toconveniently access your email, calendar,
and OneDrive online storage.

title: November 2021 Release Highlights

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.21.11.
Brightspace Editor – Additional support for drag/drop and copy/paste images | Updated
Expanding further on the Brightspace Editor – drag/drop and copy/paste images | Updated feature Discussions  Thread feedback released in October 2021/20.21.10
and Brightspace Editor – Improvements | Updated feature released in May 2021 20.21.5,
additional tools and editors now support the drag and drop and copy paste functionality, including:
Quizzes - Feedback
Grades - Feedback
Grades - Comments
Discussions - Post feedback
Discussions - Thread feedback
This functionality is now available in user-specific areas that may contain images with learner-sensitive information.
As a result, these images are stored in the database rather than the Manage Files area of a course offering.
In addition, the Course Copy function does not include these images.
This feature is available to all clients and is automatically enabled for all users.
Content – Customize language terms in the New Content Experience | Updated
This feature builds on the Content – Customize language terms in the New Content Experience | New feature released in October 2021.
With this release, administrators can use Language Management to override default language terms in the New Learner Experience.
This allows administrators to use terminology that is consistent with their organization, for example, using custom terms for "unit," "lesson," and "folder."
Previously, language terms were only customizable in the New Content Experience.
Language terms for the New Learner Experience are located in:
Package: Content; Collection: SequenceView
Package: WebComponents; Collection: d2l-sequences\d2l-sequences
This feature is available to all clients. To enable, use Language Management to customize language terms that appear in the New Learner Experience.
Content – PDF inline viewer menu improvements | Updated
This feature updates the PDF Inline viewer used when showing all converted documents (for example Word documents) as PDFs within Brightspace Classic Content.
As a result, the PDF inline viewer menu has moved to the top of the PDF document, along with PDF navigation and actions and an overall refreshed button design.
Users who have d2l.Tools.DocumentViewers.CustomPdfRendererEnabled configuration variable set to ON
also see the updates for all original PDFs (i.e. PDF files).
d2l.Tools.DocumentViewers.CustomPdfRendererEnabled also forces all original PDFs to also use the same viewer as converted documents.
This has the benefit of consistent PDF viewer within the Content Classic interface and
it is recommended that customers that do not need restrictions on printing and or downloading enable this variable as this respects printing and or downloading permissions.
This feature is available to all users of Brightspace Classic Content. This feature is automatically enabled for all users when viewing converted documents.
To enable this feature for original PDFs, set the d2l.Tools.DocumentViewers.CustomPdfRendererEnabled configuration variable to ON.
Data Hub – Auditor Relationships Log Brightspace Data Set | New
To increase the value of the Data Hub offering, this release adds the new Auditor Relationships Log Brightspace Data Set, aka BDS.
In the data set, each row represents an auditor-learner relationship that was created or deleted.
The new data set is available with the November 2021/20.21.11 release; however it may appear blank unless new auditor-learner relationships are added.
All historical data is populated within 30-60 days after clients receive the new data set.
This feature implements PIE item D6664.
This feature is available to Brightspace Insights and Brightspace Core clients in all regions.
To Enable, ensure the Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission is granted to administrators at the org level.
The User Auditors tool and the d2l.Tools.UserManagement.OrgHasAuditors configuration variable must both be enabled.
New data sets appear the first time the data set runs after the CD update.
Email – Increased Limits for To and CC Fields | Updated
This feature increases the number of email addresses that can be added to the To and CC fields in a single email to 200.
This is a result of increased limits on the size of headers in Brightspace SMTP servers.
Previously, the limit was 50 email addresses.
This feature is available to all clients. To enable, ensure that the user has the Access Email permission enabled at the Org Unit level for their role.
Manage Files – Users receive warning message when uploading a file blocked due to security | New
This feature provides the user with a warning message if they attempt to upload a file with an extension that is either
not allowed by the Assignment or is on the security restricted list.
This message appears as "This file extension is not allowed." for Assignments and as
"This file extension is not allowed for security reasons. Please see our Restricted File Extensions article in the D2L Community for more detailed information."
for security restricted file extensions.
Users can restrict Assignment extension types by enabling the d2l.Tools.Dropbox.RestrictFileExtensions configuration variable.
This feature implements PIE item D3945.
This feature is available to all clients. The functionality for security restricted file extensions is automatically enabled for Brightspace Learning Environment users.
To enable this functionality for assignment file extensions, set the d2l.Tools.Dropbox.RestrictFileExtensions configuration variable to ON.
Work To Do Widget – Date range configuration variables | Updated
To increase the value of the Widgets – Work To Do widget | New feature released in May 2021/20.21.5,
there are now two configuration variables available to customize date ranges used by the widget.
The d2l.Tools.WorkToDo.OverdueWeekLimit (Org) configuration variable sets the date range
that determines how far into the past overdue items appear in the Work To Do widget.
By default, the widget displays items with due dates for the previous 12 weeks, which administrators can increase up to 52 weeks.
The d2l.Tools.WorkToDo.UpcomingWeekLimit (Org) configuration variable sets the date range that determines
how far into the future upcoming items appear in the Work To Do widget.
By default, the widget displays items with due or end dates within the upcoming 2 weeks,
which administrators can increase up to 52 weeks.
To set these two configuration variables, administrators require the Can See/Edit Config Variable Values permission.
This feature is available to all Brightspace Core clients using the Work To Do widget.
To set these configuration variables, administrators require the Can See/Edit Config Variable Values permission.
SCORM - Improved editing in New Content Experience | New
An improved editing experience for SCORM topics is available to instructors in the New Content Experience.
With the new create and edit experience enabled, a new edit page for SCORM topics allows instructors to edit dates and associated grade items.
Previously, users could not set dates or change the associated grade item in the New Content Experience.
The d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn configuration variable must be enabled in order for the new SCORM editing page to be visible.
The new editing experience only applies to SCORM packages added to Brightspace Learning Environment using the Content Service,
other import methods will be supported in a future release.
This feature is available to all clients.
To enable with the New Content Experience enabled, ensure that d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn is set to ON; or ON (Opt-In).

title: Release Highlights - April 2019 (version 20.19.04) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
20.19.4.Learners can now create Activity Feed posts.
A new configuration variable, d2l.Tools.ActivityFeed.LearnerPostDefault,defaults to not allow learner posts. Your
instructors can adjust this setting in thewidget configuration settings on a course
by course basis. Note: Learner generated postswill not display in Brightspace for Parents.
This feature implements PIE item D3999.To change posting and commenting abilities
at the course level, click the Activity Feedcontext menu.
Then, select Manage commenting and posting.Here, you can choose whether to allow learner
posts. Click Save...and navigate the activity feed.
Additionally, when posting, your image andname display as part of the post to identify
each post or comment. When viewing posts youhave made, the personalized pronoun ‘me’
displays, and when viewing posts from otherstheir name will display. The Options menu
has been changed from the word Options toan ellipses icon to better align the user
experience for a more consistent responsiveview. New posts will display in real time,
with an inline notification in the activityfeed.
When instructors evaluate assignments andnew or updated feedback is published, email
instant notifications are available for learners.The Upcoming Work and Overdue widgets will
now display assigned checklist items.The Upcoming Work and Overdue widgets now
display surveys with end dates included?A new Awards Issued advanced data set has
been added to Data Hub, providing informationon awards that have been issued. This Advanced
Data Set requires the Can Execute Awards Issued,Advanced Data Set permission be set for Administrators
at the Org level.Your instructors can now align learning outcomes
to discussion topics.When learners participate in a discussion
activity, the learning outcomes display followingthe description of the discussion topic.
When creating or editing a discussion topic,a new Standards tab displays. Click it.
Then click Add Standards, to browse the standardsavailable to your course.
Then select the standards that apply to thediscussion topic.
Instructors can now assess discussion threadsagainst learning outcomes aligned to a discussion
topic.When assessing a discussion topic, instructors
can now assess responses against learningoutcomes aligned to the course. Instructors
select from the available scale to assessthe progress of selected outcomes.
To align with the DMARC mail standard, changeshave been made to forwarded email messages.
For more information, review the release notes.Course designers can now add a D2L Javascript
solution to HTML content topics containinglinks to multiple HTML pages. With this Javascript,
the Content tool’s next and previous buttonsnavigate between the linked HTML pages, instead
of content topics.When printing QR codes, Portfolio now honors
the section filter. When navigating to a learnerportfolio in a list, your position in Portfolio
is maintained, and when Brightspace for Parentsisn’t enabled, the Evidence Details section
currently named Students and Parents willnow display as Students.
Users with the See Rubrics permission cannow create quicklinks directly to rubrics
that are visible to learners.The See Rubrics permission is not required
for learners to access quicklinked rubricsthat are visible to learners and associated
with a tool for evaluation.This feature implements PIE items D202 and
D384.To better help learners understand how they
will be assessed, rubrics are now availablethrough quicklinks. Click Insert Quicklink.
Select rubrics...and choose the appropriate rubric.
Learners can then follow the quicklink toview their rubric.
This feature releases a read-only previewof the Quiz Builder. D2L does not recommend
using this feature in live production coursesin its preview form. To preview this functionality,
ensure the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewQuizBuilderExperienceconfiguration variable is set to On (Opt-In).
When creating or editing a quiz, click Add/EditQuestions.
To preview the new quiz building experience,click Turn it on.
Note: This experience is read only. To close the
preview click, You are previewing the newquiz building experience!
Then, click Turn it off.D2L encourages you to share feedback on the
new design as you leave the new experiencepreview.
Instructors can now align learning outcomesto rubric criteria.
You can now customize the My Courses widgetto hide or show course dates. Note: Changes
you make to this widget configuration settingimpact all users.
This feature implements PIE items D5080, D5022,and D5044.
There is now an option display course startand end dates when customizing the My Courses
Widget.

title: Teaching Tips - Use Replacement Strings for Personalization - Instructor

captions.text: Personalize communications, such as announcementsor email templates, for learners by using
replace strings.This tutorial shows how to integrate replace
strings into an announcement to personalizecommunication with learners enrolled in your
course offering.To begin, from Announcements, click New Announcement.
Enter a headline.Then, enter content that uses replace strings.
Replace strings are variables enclosed incurly braces that are automatically replaced
by the corresponding variable values.For example, this announcement contains the
{FirstName} replace string to address thelearners by their forst name; the {OrgUnitName}
replace string to remind learners which courseoffering the announcement is from; and the
[OrgId} replace string so learners can reusethis information for administrative purposes.
Note: Not all replace strings apply to alltools. See Brightspace Help for a comprehensive
list of replace strings.When you are ready, click Publish.
Then, view the announcement from the perspectiveof a learner to ensure that the replace strings
display as expected.Click your personal menu and select View as
Student.Then, navigate to the announcement you want
to review.Now, instead of seeing a replace string enclosed
in curly braces, you see a personalized messagefor the learner.
Personalize communications, such as announcementsor email templates, for learners by using
replace strings.

title: Brightspace Capture™ - Webcast a Live CaptureCast™ Presentation - Instructor

captions.text: Present to and interact with online viewers by webcasting a live CaptureCast presentation.
This tutorial shows how to webcast a liveCaptureCast presentation.
To begin, on the main Capture software screen click Webcast.
Note: You will only be able to do so if you are logged in.
Click the Event drop-down list.
And select an existing event, or create a new one.
For this example we will select an event thathas already been created.
The Title and Presenter fields are automaticallypopulated but you can alter the information
for either. You can also change the presentationlayout, and disable the chat function.
When you are ready click Continue.Click Start when you are ready to begin your
live broadcast.When the chat function is enabled, you and
your viewers can exchange messages. From thechat tab, click Send a regular message to
contact the live event's participants.Type your message and press the Enter key.
Click Stop when your presentation is complete.Your live presentation has been recorded and
can be published for on-demand viewing.Click Finish to return to the main Capture
Software screen.Present to and interact with online viewers
by webcasting a live CaptureCast presentation.

title: Create a Discussion Topic | Instructor

captions.text: This video will demonstrate how to create a discussion topic
From the Organizational Homepage, select the desired course using the My Course widget or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page
From your course level navbar, select Discussions to access the Discussions tool
You can also access the Discussions tool from your Course Admin link if you do not have the Discussions tool on your course navbar.
Discussion topics are housed within discussion forums.
To create a discussion topic, select the New > New Topic from the Discussions tool
Fill out the discussion topic properties including selecting the discussion forum that the discussion topic should be associated with,
selecting the topic type, adding a title, using the Brightspace Editor to add a description, and selecting the topic options and rating system if desired.
Navigate to the Restrictions tab to set the discussion topic restrictions.
This includes visibility, date availability, release conditions, and group and section restrictions, if required.
Optionally, you can create a graded discussion topic with a linked grade item.
To do this, navigate to the Assessment tab, apply a grade item that will count toward the final grade calculation.
Please note: you can choose a pre-existing grade item if you've already created grade items within the Grade book.
Apply a point value within the Score Out Of field.
The Score Out Of field for the discussion topic does not need to have the same value as the associated grade item.
Brightspace will automatically calculate and translate the Score Out Of value compared to the associated grade item value to apply the appropriate score within the Grade book.
To create a graded discussion topic with an associated rubric, select Add Rubric to apply an existing rubric to the discussion topic
or choose Create Rubric in New Window to create and associate a new rubric.
If desired, configure the discussion topic to follow individual post evaluations
Select Allow assessment of individual posts and set the calculation
Navigate to the Objective tab next to the Assessment tab to associate a learning objective to the discussion forum
Select Save and Close to create the discussion topic or Save and New to create more topics
Discussion topics can be added into Content modules within the Content tool to provide a streamlined navigational experience for students
To do this, navigate to your course level homepage, navigate to the Content tool,
select the module you want to add a discussion to, select Existing Activities, and Discussions
Click the specific discussion forum to access discussion topics.
Select the appropriate discussion topic you want to display in your Content module.
The discussion post will now be visible in your Content module

title: Bongo - Add the Virtual Classroom or Video Assignments Plugin to a Navbar - Administrator

captions.text: Provide users with access to Virtual Classroomsor Video Assignments by Bongo by customizing
your navbar.This tutorial shows how to add Virtual Classroom
by Bongo or Video Assignments by Bongo toyour navbar.
For instructors to access Virtual Classroomsand Video Assignments, you must add the tools
to the navbar.To begin, click Admin Tools...
navigate to,and select Navigation & Themes.
Click the navbar that you want to add thelink to.
Click Add Links.Search for the navbar link you created in
the remote plugin setup.Select the option you want to add.
Then, click Add.When you are ready, click Save and Close to
modify the navbar.Lastly, Bongo uses the roles and IMS role
mappings from Brightspace Learning Environmentto determine which users are instructors and
learners.To sync roles for IMS Mapping, contact Bongo
to open a support ticket. Within the ticketplease provide the institution, the custom
role(s) and how they should be mapped. Forexample, student, educator, or content developer.
Now that you have added Virtual Classroomsor Video Assignments by Bongo to your navbar,
users can access virtual classroom sessions,or create video assignments and remote presentations.
Provide users with access to Virtual Classroomsor Video Assignments by Bongo by customizing
your navbar.

title: Release Highlights - January 2018 (Version 10.7.9) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 10.7.9.
Instructors can now upload local files as
attachments when creating message posts inActivity Feed.
To enable this feature for instructors, youmust grant the Upload Files permission in
the Manage Files tool at the course offeringlevel.
Note: Files uploaded for message posts arestored in the Manage Files area of a course.
Now, when instructors add private files froma Google Drive account to Brightspace Learning
Environment, they are notified if the fileis private and are given the option to change
permissions so that anyone with the link canview the file.
From anywhere in Brightspace Learning Environmentwhere you can add a file from Google Drive,
click Google Drive.Navigate to and select the file you want to
add.If the file is private, you will see a notification
that gives you the option to change permissionsso that anyone with the link can view the
file.Parents can now view the child's final course
grades and grade feedback from the instructorusing Brightspace for Parents.
From the Recent Grades widget, click Viewall grades.
From the learner's Grades page, find the applicablecourse and grade item, and click view feedback
to read the text feedback the instructor providedon the grade item.
You can now turn on the new d2l.Tools.ParentPortal.N.ParentDigestEnabledconfiguration variable, which allows parents
to choose if they would like to receive aweekly email summary of their child's activity
in Brightspace.In the new Brightspace Portfolio settings
page, you can now configure whether the coursedisplays Portfolio Funsters or profile photos
to represent learners, whether evidence uploadedby learners using a web interface requires
instructor approval before it is visible,and whether evidence uploaded to the course
using the Portfolio in-class mobile app requiresinstructor approval before it is visible.
Learners can now use their own mobile devicesto capture evidence instead of using a shared
classroom device.To use the Bring Your Own Device feature,
you must download the Brightspace Portfolioapp from the App Store or Google Play.
For more information, please see the BrightspacePortfolio - Bring Your Own Device video tutorial
for learners.Instructors can now create their own categories
for Brightspace Portfolio evidence and canaccess those categories in all their classes.
From evidence in a learner's portfolio, navigateto the Evidence Categories section.
Then, click Add Category.Enter a name for the category and click Add.
Instructors can now add private comments toevidence submitted by learners into Brightspace
Portfolio.From a learner's evidence in Brightspace Portfolio,
click Teacher OnlyThen click Add a private note and enter a
message for yourself.When you are ready, click Add.
Instructors can now either include or excludeexempted users in quiz statistics via an Exemptions
Log Data Set and an option on the View Statisticspage.
From Quizzes, click Statistics.Then, click the quiz you want to view the
statistics for.On the View Statistics page, you now have
the option to either include or exclude exemptedusers in quiz statistics.
You can now add a link to Intelligent Agentsto the navbar. Additionally, a link to Intelligent
Agents has been added to Class Progress.Now, when you create or edit a navbar, and
click Add Links.You can add a link to the existing Agent List
page.Additionally, from Class Progress there is
now a link to the Intelligent Agents tool.Instructors can now use the Post to Course
Homepage option in Lessons to create assignmentposts to add to their Activity Feed.
This allows assignment posts to be createdeasily and increases the visibility of upcoming
assignments for learners.From an assignment in Lessons, click the Options
menu and select Post to Course Homepage.Instructors can now schedule posts to display
at a specific date and time when using thePost to Course Homepage option in Lessons.
Now, when you Create a post for Activity Feedin Lessons, click Post Later and choose a
date and time that you want the post to becomeavailable to learners.
When you are ready, click Schedule Post.Then, click Save.
An icon in the table of contents shows thatthe post is scheduled.
Additionally, the same icon appears in thecontent and includes a description of when
the information will be posted.Instructors have new ways to search the Question
Library when adding questions to a quiz usingnew question import workflows.
Now, when you import questions to a quiz fromQuestion Library you can search or browse
for questions by specifying the source, typeof question, or how you want the questions
sorted.Now, you can force instructors to use the
new quizzing experience by setting the defaultstate for the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewExperienceOpt-In
configuration variable to ON.Learners will notice an updated quizzing experience,
where they do not need to confirm the startor submission of a quiz multiple times.
This feature implements PIE item D288.

title: Seating Chart - Create a Seating Chart - Instructor

captions.text: Create a seating chart to assign seats aswell as track attendance and participation.
This tutorial shows how to create a seatingchart.
To begin, from the Locations tool, click ManageSeating Charts.
Click Create a Chart to begin assigning seatsto learners.
Enter a name for your seating chart...
You can select a Location from the Locationdropdown list if there are multiple locations
created for your organization.
You can also select a set of attendees, clickon the Attendees dropdown list...
and select who the seating chart will applyto.
When you are ready, click Save.
Learners who have yet to be assigned a seatdisplay in Unassigned Students.
To assign an individual learner to a seat,click and drag the learner to the desired
location.
Alternatively, you can assign a learner toa seat by clicking their context menu...
...and selecting Assign User.
Then, select the Row and Seat you want thelearner to occupy.
You can also randomly assign learners to availableseats, click Assign All...
...and select Randomize.
Re-assign a learner's seat by clicking anddragging the learner onto a new location.
When you are satisfied with your seating chart,click Return to Events.
On this page, you can view summarized informationsuch as learner attendance, participation
scores, and cold calls.
Create a seating chart to assign seats aswell as track attendance and participation.

title: Release Highlights - July 2019 v.20.19.07 - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.07.
Blackboard Ally is a content accessibilityservice, and is now available as an integration.
Ally assists instructors improve content accessibilityby checking for
accessibility issues and generating alternative accessible formats.
Ally also provides institution wide reporting on course content accessibility.
As part of our ongoing commitment to designand develop against WC3 accessibility best
practices, there are updates to our sharedweb components, such as fonts, buttons, menus,
and input fields to ensure they align withWCAG 2.1 standards.
For a list of changes, review the Release Notes.
Instructors can pin multiple posts to thetop of their Activity Feed. This feature implements
PIE item D4635.
Activity Feed can now filter by, and sendposts to specific sections in a course.
Note: The Instructor must be enrolled in morethan one section of a course for sections
in Activity Feed to appear.This feature implements PIE item D3952
From Activity Feed click Create a post…
Leave All sections selected to send a postto all learners, or click Send To…
to select one or more sections.
Instructors can also use Filter By to sorttheir course activity feed by a section, allowing
them to focus on posts from a specific section.
An Edit Categories option is now availablein Assignments to allow users to edit all
categories from one page. This feature implementsPIE items D1858, and D1913.
From Assignments, click Edit Categories…
Here instructors can add, modify, delete,and sort categories, as well as manage unused
categories. If a category with assignmentsis deleted, those assignments are added to
the No Category area.
An eraser has been added to the Annotationstool bar to allow evaluators to remove ink
annotations made when evaluating assignmentsubmissions.
When evaluating a learners submission, clickAnnotations.
and select your markup type.
Instructors can now choose Eraser to removepen and highlighter ink annotations.
To ensure that learners receive more up-to-dateinformation in Brightspace Pulse, they now
receive push notifications for all updates.With this update learners are no longer able
to share notifications. This feature implementsPIE item D4753.
In Class Progress, the default Content Visitedindicator is switching to the Content Completed
indicator. This change applies to all userswho are currently using the Content Visited
indicator or default settings.
From Class Progress, the new Content Completedindicator graph displays. To opt out of this
change, edit your default settings.
When using the Org Unit Purge option featurein the Data Purge tool, you now have an additional
option to purge User Contributed Files. Thenew User Contributed Files option purges user
contributed files but not any other user-contributeddatabase information, including quiz attempts
and grades.
All references to ucourses.com, desire2learn.com,and brightspace.com domains
in the d2l.Tools.HelpDesk.FromEmail and d2l.Tools.Notifications.Email.From Address
Email-related configuration variables are now updated to follow the
implementation standardof [your organization name].brightspace.com.
Course Completion Tracking available in theManager Dashboard and Learning Groups can
now display a progress bar that shows theprogress of a learner through a course as
a percentage.For more information, review the Release Notes.
If a user does not upload a user profile imagein Brightspace Learning Environment, the navbar
now displays the user’s initials in theuser-profile badge. This change occurs for
all roles and displays in the BrightspaceLearning Environment navbar and Activity Feed.
The table of contents in the New Content Experiencehas been enhanced.
Learners can now assign categories to tagthe evidence they collect with Portfolio.
This feature implements PIE item D5100.
Several improvements have been made to QuickEval. Different date formats are supported
in the Submission Date column.This feature implements PIE item D5432.
The Back to Quick Eval button directs usersto the Quick Eval tool at the course level
or org level, depending on where you launchedit from.
The Manage Discussions permission is no longerrequired to evaluate discussion topic submissions.
This release includes a preview of workflowsrelated to reordering quiz questions using
keyboard interaction in Quiz Builder. Oncethis read-only preview feature is turned on
at the course level, instructors can thenopt in or out of the new experience.
Note: D2L does not recommend using this featurein live production courses in its preview form.
The default state of the organization-leveld2l.Tools.Rubrics.UpdatedGradingExperience
configuration variable is now set to On.
Several updates have been made to Surveys.
This feature implements PIE items D4528, and D1023.
While learners are taking an anonymous survey,an alert appears.
The primary button when completing a Surveyhas been updated from Save Responses to read
as Submit Survey. Learners are still requiredto save survey answers manually using Save
Responses.When a learner attempts to complete the survey
with unanswered questions…
…a new Back to Questions button is displayed.
There are changes to lang term values to increasethe clarity of the fields in the Updates Widget,
the My Courses Widget, and Assignments tomore clarly describe the capability of the
feature. For more information, review therelease notes.
Check out our new Brightspace Pulse videosand be sure to click subscribe!

title: Content - Attach a Release Condition - Instructor

captions.text: Influence how learners move through your coursecontent by using Release Conditions. You can
attach a release condition to a topic to withholdit from learners until they satisfy the condition.
This tutorial shows how to attach a releasecondition to a Discussion topic.
Use the Table of Contents panel to browseto the course content area where you will
apply a release condition.For this example, we'll browse to the submodule
called Sunspots and the Solar Cycle.For this example, we’ll add a release condition
to the discussion topic Are sunspots a contributorto global warming? To add a release condition
to a topic, click the context menu next toit.
Select Edit Properties In-Place from the contextmenu.
Several editable fields display followingthe topic name.
Click Add dates and restrictions…From the Release Conditions heading, you have
the option to create a new release condition,or browse for an existing one.
Use an existing release condition if you wantto release several items at once when a learner
meets a single condition.Because we haven’t yet created any release
conditions, we will create a new one for thistopic. Click Create.
From the Select Condition Type menu,select Visited Content Topic.
After selecting the condition type, furtheroptions are available in the Condition Details
section. From the Topic menu,select the content topic that learners must
visit before they can access the discussiontopic. In this example, we’ll select “Sunspots
& the Solar Cycle”.Click Create to turn on the release condition.
Click Update from the Release Conditions sectionfollowing the topic to add the newly created
release condition to the content topic.To dismiss the editable fields, refresh your
browser.With this release condition, the topic is
hidden and unavailable to learners until they’vesatisfied the condition.
The icon and description following a topictitle can help you keep track of which topics
contain release conditions and which actionslearners must take to satisfy the condition.
Include a note in the prerequisite topic'sdescription to inform learners about the action
required to release the hidden topic.With a large set of Release Conditions from
which to choose, you can use these conditionsto influence how learners move through your
course content.

title: Competencies - Create a Competency - Instructor

captions.text: Use competencies to track the general knowledge,skills, and abilities learners acquire as
they participate in courses.
This tutorial shows how to create a competency.
From Competencies, click New...… and select Competency
Enter a name for your competency.
It is a good practice to choose a name thatclearly identifies the knowledge, skills,
or abilities that the competency represents.
The status controls what can be done withthe created competency.
In conjunction with role permissions, statusescan be used to implement a work flow and revision
control process for drafting, reviewing, approvingand archiving competencies.
When set to Draft or In Review a competency’sparent-child associations can be changed,
but the competency will not be visible tolearners and they will not have the ability
to complete the competency.
Only approved competencies can be completedby learners, so when you have finished creating
a competency structure and you're ready touse it to track learner progress you will
need to change its status to Approved.
For this example we will leave the competencyset to Draft.
You can add an additional identifier if, forexample, a professional or academic standard
corresponds to the competency.
Allow learners to monitor their own progresstowards completion by enabling Make competency
and its children visible to users.
Moreover, check Allow re-evaluation of userswho have achieved this competency to enable
the system to automatically re-evaluate userachievements when changes to the competency
structure are made.
When you're done configuring the competencyclick Save.
The created competency is now ready to beincorporated in competency structures.
Use competencies to track the general knowledge,skills, and abilities learners acquire as
they participate in courses.

title: Release Highlights - August 2019 (v20.19.08) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
20.19.08.As part of our ongoing commitment to design
