and develop against WC3 accessibility bestpractices, we have updated our shared web
components to align with WCAG 2.1 standards.For a full list of changes review the release
notes.Activity Feed has received visual improvements
to better support your instructors.An underline has been added to the Post Type
to better differentiate between Message andAssignment posts, and field names have been
added.The post type icon has been removed from the
authoring space when creating a post to betteruse the available space.
The updated Assignment List page is now thedefault view for learners, and this setting
can no longer be configured by administrators.Text within comment annotations is now checked
for spelling mistakes.We have removed the Allow past courses to
send me notifications, and Allow inactivecourses to send me notifications options,
learners will now only receive digest emailsfor future courses.
SMS notifications are no longer availablefor the following: Content - Content Item
Created, Content- content item updated, andContent - content overview updated. Learners
with these notifications currently selectedwill stop receiving these SMS notifications
after the monthly update.D2L recommends using Brightspace Pulse for
content related instant notifications.This feature implements PIE item D2203.
A new Weekly option has been added to theSummary of Activity, and is the default option.
There are additional options of Never or Daily.To better align with WCAG 2.1 level AA criteria,
we have removed the OpenDyslexic font. Foradditional information, review the release
notes.Class Progress now includes an Outcomes tab.
This feature implements PIE item D2703.The Outcomes tab will display a history of
learner’s submissions and assessments againstall learning outcomes aligned to activities
in the course. Click Learning Outcomes.To view a list of associated learning outcomes.
Instructors will also see a visual indicatorof outcome achievement, if your organization
has implemented achievement scales.Users can select Insert Image to add pictures
to an email from their device, a URL, or ManageFiles. Images are inserted in place, attached
to the email, and display in place.This feature implements PIE items D871, D5458,
and D2163.When composing an email Insert Stuff has been
replaced with Insert Image. Click it.and select how you will attach the image,
for this example, click My Computer.Drag and drop, or navigate to the file…
Then, click Add.Your image displays inline.
Email now implements a DKIM rotation policy,with rotation happening on six-month intervals.
The d2l.Tools.Mail.PrivacyAddress configurationvariable replaces the use of the existing
d2l.Tools.Mail.UseReplyToInFromAddress configurationvariable for hiding user names in generated
email messages.This new configuration variable supports and
conforms to DMARC protocol.This feature implements PIE idea D735.
Intelligent Agents now re-evaluate the statusof release conditions at the moment of triggering
to determine whether a user has completeda particular release condition or not.
This feature implements D3497.A number of changes have been made to Learning
Outcomes to improve usability, for a completelist of changes, review the release notes.
Additional customization and usability improvementshave been made to Login Page Management.
Login Page Management now includes a new HTMLmessage box to display content below the login
widget, by default the message box is empty.Options to always expand, collapse, or hide
the login widget have been included, and defaultto expand. And an option to center align the
login widget has been added, by default thewidget is left aligned.
A new section in the Table of Contents menu,of the New Content Experience, displays the
name of the course and overall course progress.Managers can now access Completion Reports
in CSV format using a new Report button inManager Dashboard.
The new Quiz Builder experience is now generallyavailable and recommended for use in production
environments. This new experience is in anopt-in-out state, controlled by the d2l.Tools.Quizzes.NewQuizBuilderExperience(OrgUnit)
configuration variable.The new Quiz Builder experience is ready for
production environments, your instructorscan navigate to Quiz Questions…
and click Add/Edit Questions.To access the new Quiz Builder Experience.
Here instructors can Add, Import or selectand delete questions in the quiz.
Questions can be rearranged using the Handlesto drag and drop, or can be moved using keyboard
only navigation.Deleted quiz attempts can now be restored
using the new Quiz Attempt Log.Your instructors can now click Attempt Logs…
To view an overview of Quiz Entry, Quiz Completion,Quiz Attempt Deleted, and Quiz Attempt Restored.
Filter by Quiz Attempt Deleted…To see a list of deleted attempts. For the
attempt they want to restore, click Restore.A new AutoAnalysis tool has been added to
the Video Assignments Premium integrationby Bongo. This new tool provides English transcription
and analysis of clarity, filter words andspeaking rate in words per minute. This new
tool is available to all clients with theVideo Assignments Premium integration.
The Virtual Table of Contents widget now displaysthe optimal number of modules in the widget
and adds a button for navigation between pages.New clients can no longer access Brightspace
Learning Environment using any version ofInternet Explorer. A not supported page will
appear to users who try to use Internet Explorer,and can be customized using Language Management.
Check out a tutorial for the complete workflowin the New Quiz experience by following the
link on-screen, and be sure to subscribe!

title: Brightspace for Parents - Keep Up to Date With Class Happenings - Parents

captions.text: Keep up to date with class happenings by signingup for weekly email summaries, reviewing your
child's portfolio of collected work, and readingthe class activity feed.
This tutorial shows how to navigate the communicationand update options available in Brightspace
for Parents.To begin, click your Personal Menu...
which lets you manage profile, notification,and account settings or log out of your account.
Profile settings allow you to add or changea profile picture and include additional contact
information. Notification settings allow youto enter an email address and opt-into weekly
email summaries of your children's activitiesin Brightspace Learning Environment. Account
settings allow you to make changes such asyour password and font size.
Select Notifications.Update and verify your contact email.
Note: You can only receive emails once youhave completed a verification process.
To receive weekly emails, ensure you selectYes, email me a summary.
When you are ready, click Save.Select one of your children to view in-depth
information about their progress.The Portfolio Items section highlights the
most recent work that your child's instructorshave shared with you. To learn more about
a portfolio item, click it.to view teacher feedback...
and audio or text reflections. To return toyour child's dashboard...
click Back.Navigate to the Latest Posts section....
to view the most recent posts made by an instructorin the class activity feed, allowing you to
stay up to date with any class announcements.Latest Posts shows posts from all classes
your child is in. You can follow links toexternal materials, but do not have access
to class material.Keep up to date with class happenings by signing
up for weekly email summaries, reviewing yourchild's Portfolio of collected work, and reading
the class Activity Feed.

title: Question Library - Import Questions into Question Library - Instructor

captions.text: Import questions into Question Library toorganize and consolidate questions within
a course and then transfer those questionsbetween courses to reuse them when creating
assessments.This tutorial shows the steps to import questions
into Question Library.To begin, from the Question Library page,
click Import...and select Upload a File.
Drag and drop a file on the upload targetor browse to the desired files. For this example,
For this example, drag and drop the file ontothe upload target.
Your upload will begin. When it is complete,you can import all questions or review questions
for a more selective import. Click Review.All questions you import will display their
title and question type. Make any adjustmentsto the import, and when you are ready click
Import All or Import Selected.When you are done, click Done Editing Questions.
Import questions into Question Library toorganize and consolidate questions within a course
and then transfer those questions between courses to reuse them when creating assessments.

title: Monitor Class Progress | Instructor

captions.text: From the Organizational Homepage, select the desired course using the My Courses widget or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page
From your course level navbar, select Class Progress to access the Class Progress tool
You can also access the Class Progress tool through the Course Admin link if you don't have the Class Progress link on your navbar
Class Progress allows faculty to easily review student progress across multiple metrics in one convenient dashboard
You can access individual student data, select progress indicators for more detailed information,
and hover over students' thumbnails to communicate through email or instant message
To edit your Class Progress dashboard, click the Settings gear in the top-right corner to configure your dashboard
Select the drop-down menu beside each progress tracker to reorder your dashboard or replace it with different progress metrics
Once configured, select Save and Close To further explore all ten-method categories found in the progress summary,
select a student's name next to their thumbnail or the specific metric category.
To reach out to a student directly from the Class Progress tool,
simply hover over the student's profile image and click Send Email or Send Instant Message.
Students also have access to their own personal progress dashboard.
To learn more, please refer to View Course Progress with the Class Progress Tool

title: Grades - Associate an Activity with a Grade Item - Instructor

captions.text: Link course activities to your grade book by associating activity with grade items.
This tutorial shows how to associate anactivity with a grade item.
You can associate different activities withgrade items, such as discussions, assignments
and quizzes.In this example, we will associate a discussion
topic with a grade item.To begin, navigate to the topic you want to
associate with an item in your grade book.
Click the topic’s context menu...
...And select Edit Topic.
Next, click Assessment.
If you have already created the grade itemin your grade book, select the item you want
to associate with the activity from the drop-downlist.
In this example, we have not already createdthe grade item.
To create the grade item, click New GradeItem.
Enter a name for the grade item.
If the grade item will belong to a category in your grade book,
select the category fromthe drop-down list.
In this example, we want the grade item tobelong to the Discussion Participation category.
Select the additional properties - if any- that you want to include with your
grade item, such as a grade scheme or restrictionoptions.
When you are ready, click Save.
Enter the score that the topic will be out of.
We are using a points grade book where each
discussion item is currently worth 15 points.To keep items within the category evenly distributed,
we will enter 15 in the Score Out of field.
When you are ready, click Save and Close
We have now associated the course activity with the designated grade item.
Link course activities to your grade book by associating activities with grade items.

title: Grades - Troubleshoot Final Grades - Instructor

captions.text: Final grades displaying incorrectly? Troubleshootsome common issues related to your grade book.
This tutorial shows troubleshooting options when your final grades aren’t calculating as expected.
Is the final grade not acknowledging a missing
submission? To resolve this, from the Gradestool, click Settings.
Click Calculation Options.Then, navigate to the Grades Calculation section.
Select Treat ungraded items as 0, this willinclude any grade items not entered into the
final calculated grade of your course as azero.
Note: If you select Automatically keep finalgrades updated the learners’ grade will
update in real-time.When you are ready, click Save.
Then, click Close.Click Enter Grades.
The learner's grade now reflects the finalgrade
with the unsubmitted grade item as part of the calculation.
After entering a new grade, are you noticing
that your Final Calculated Grade isn't updating?If your grade book is not set to automatically
update the final grade and you make a changeto your grade book the Final Grade is Out
of Date! icon will display. To update thegrade, click the context menu for Final Calculated
Grade...and select Grade All.
Then, click Recalculate the Final Grade for.Review the grade items that are included in
the calculation. Then, click Calculate.To push this change to the grade book, click
Save and Close.Lastly, confirm the changes.
The grade is now updated.
Troubleshoot your grade book to provide your
learners with the most accurate grades they’ve achieved.

title: Class Progress Overview | Instructor

captions.text: This video explains the Class Progress tool and how to use it as an instructor in Brightspace
The Class Progress tool lets you keep track of your students’ progress for course work like modules, quizzes, and assignments, providing an overview of their progress in your course
On your course homepage, navigate to Class Progress
Content Completed shows a learner’s progress for all your course modules
Quizzing is a learner’s scores for your course’s quizzes
Grades show a learner’s score for different grade items in your course like assignments
If you click on each category for a learner, you are taken to a new page that shows a breakdown of the learner’s class progress by module, discussion post, assignments, quizzes, and more

title: Surveys - Create a Survey - Instructor

captions.text: Solicit feedback from learners using surveys.
This tutorial shows how to create a survey.
To begin, from the Surveys tool, click NewSurvey.
Enter a name for the survey.
In the Anonymous section, select make results anonymous
if you want to hide user data and survey results.
Release Conditions can only be added to asurvey where the respondent is known.
To add questions to your survey click Add/EditQuestions.
Then, click New.
Next, select the question type.
For this example we will create a Likert question.
Enter the questions Introductory Text to provideinstruction to learners.
Select the scale you would like respondents to use when rating items.
For this example, we will select an AgreementScale.
Enter the items respondents will be rating into separate value fields.
To view how your survey will display to respondents click Preview.
Click Done to continue editing the question.
When you are satisfied with your question,click Save.
Then click Done Editing Questions to returnto the Survey page.
Click the Restrictions tab to modify the surveysavailability.
To make your survey available to users click the status drop down list...
and select Active.
In the dates section, you can specify a daterange for the survey. You can also set the
number of attempts respondents can complete.Click the Attempts Allowed drop down list.
In this example we will change the settingfrom Unlimited,
to single attempt that is editable.
This limits respondents to one survey attempt, that they can re-access and edit their answers.
When you are satisfied with your survey, clickSave and Close.
Your newly created survey displays.
Solicit feedback from learners using surveys.

title: Navigation and Themes - Create a Custom Navbar - Administrator

captions.text: Provide users with a customized navigationexperience by creating custom navbars for
your organization and course offerings.This tutorial shows how to create a custom
navbar.To access Navigation and Themes, hover over
the navbar, click the more options menu, thenselect Manage All Course Navbars.
Click Create Navbar.Then, enter a name for it.
Click Add Links to add links to the differentareas of the navbar.
From here, you can create custom links andadd existing links.
To add existing system links, select yourlinks from the list.
Note: The links available depend on the toolsyour organization uses, the custom links and
link groups available, and the tools enabledfor your course.
When you are ready, click Add to confirm yourselection.
Drag and drop the links to rearrange the order.Check Share with child org units to make the
navbar available to child org units.Expand Change the title in the navbar to edit
or remove the title from the navbar.When you have completed your customizations,
click Save and Close.The newly created navbar displays in the list.
To set the new navbar as the default, clickthe context menu and select Set as the default.
When new org units are created, they willuse this navbar as their default.
Provide users with a customized navigationexperience by creating custom navbars for
your organization and course offerings.

title: Activity Feed - Introduce Instructors to Activity Feed - Administrator

captions.text: Empower instructors to try the Activity Feedwidget by duplicating a common course homepage
and activating Activity Feed.
This tutorial shows how to duplicate a CourseHomepage, set up Activity Feed and allow your
instructors to opt into the Activity Feedwidget.
To begin, from the Homepage Management pageselect the context menu of the Course Homepage
you want to duplicate...and select Copy.
Your copy will display.
Click the name of the copied homepage to editit.
Change the name of the homepage so it is distinctand easily identified by instructors.
Click Add Widgets.
Search for, or navigate to, and select ActivityFeed...
and click Add.
Activity Feed displays in the list of homepagewidgets.
To remove widgets from the same panel, clickRemove Widget.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
To empower instructors to try the new ActivityFeed widget for themselves, click the context
menu of your default homepageselect Don't Force Homepage.
This allows instructors the option to selectthe homepage they want to use in their course.
Empower instructors to try the Activity Feedwidget by duplicating a common course homepage
and activating Activity Feed.

title: Pulse Dates - Set Date Restrictions for Content - Instructor

captions.text: Set availability for content so learners haveaccess when using Brightspace Pulse.
This tutorial shows how to set date availabilityfor content to ensure learners can view it
on Brightspace Pulse.
To begin, from content, navigate to the contentyou want to edit.
and click it.
Here you can add dates and restrictions foran individual topic. Click Add dates and restrictions.
You can add a start date, due date, and enddate for the content topic.
Start date signifies the day the content becomesavailable to learners; due date constitutes
the date by which learners are expected tohave reviewed the content; and end date is
the date that access to the content is revoked.Note: At a minimum, the end date must be established
so the content will appear in BrightspacePulse.
Click Add Start Date.
Then, set the date and time that you wantthe content to become available to learners.
Similarly, set the due date and time.
Then, set the End Date and Time.
Teaching Tip: Set the end date for the lastday of the course so that it remains available
to learners.When you are ready, navigate to Update…
…and click it.
Your new Start, Due and End dates display,and the content will be visible in
Brightspace Pulse.
Set availability for content so learners haveaccess when using Brightspace Pulse.

title: Question Library - Create a Multi-Select Question - Instructor

captions.text: Be ready to assess learners’ understandingof concepts with more than one correct answer
by creating and storing multi-select questionsin Question Library.
This tutorial shows how to create a multi-selectquestion in Question Library.
To begin, from the Quizzes tool, click QuestionLibrary.
Click New and select Multi-Select Question.
Give your question a title, if desired.
The title displays in the question list inQuestion Library.
Then, enter the number of points you wantthe question to be worth.
Enter your problem in the Question Text field.
In the Options section, you can select howyou want your options to be enumerated, how
you want your question to display, your gradingmethod, and if you want the options to be
randomized for learners.
There are three ways to grade multi-selectquestions.
Select All or nothing to give learners fullpoints for the question if they select all
of the correct answers and none of the incorrectones.
Learners do not receive points if they missany correct answers or select incorrect ones.
Select Right minus wrong to award learnerspoints equal to the number of right answers
they choose minus the number of incorrectanswers they choose.
To determine how much each answer is worth,the system takes the total number of points
assigned to the question and divides it bythe total number of answer choices.
Select Correct answers to give learners pointsfor each correct answer they select and for
each incorrect answer they leave blank.
Incorrect answers selected and correct answersleft blank are ignored.
For this example, click the Correct answersgrading type.
Click Randomize options so the options appearin a shuffled order when learners view the
question in a quiz.
Enter a choice in each Value field.
And select the Correct check box for everyright answer.
To add options to your question, enter a valueand click Add Option to include more values.
Now that you've added more values, enter anoption for each value and determine whether
it is a correct answer to the question.
When you are ready, preview how your questionwill display to learners by clicking Preview.
Click Done when you are ready to exit thepreview.
When you are satisfied with your question,click Save.
Your question is saved in Question Library.
Be ready to assess learners’ understandingof concepts with more than one correct answer
by creating and storing multi-select questionsin Question Library.

title: Discussions - Grade a  Discussion Topic - Instructor

captions.text: Evaluate learners on their discussion participationby grading discussion topics.
This tutorial shows how to grade a discussiontopic.
From the Discussions list, navigate to thetopic you want to evaluate.
Click the topic's context menu and selectAssess Topic.
Note: The Assess Topic option appears onlyif you link the topic to a grade item.
The Assess Topic page displays.You are presented with a View Options menu,
which, allows you to change between Show TopicScore View, and Show All Scores View.
Navigate to the learner you want to evaluateand click Topic Score to assign a grade.
If you have attached a rubric to the discussiontopic, and the Assess with Embedded Rubrics
feature is enabled, the rubric will automaticallydisplay in the Topic Score window.
Here, you can find the total number of postsa learner made.
You can also view each post in detail.You have the option to enter the learner's
grade into the topic score field, or by evaluatingthe attached rubric. Selecting the rubric
levels the learner has achieved will automaticallygenerate the topic score. Select the rubric
levels the learner has achieved.Click Topic Score to override the rubric-calculated
score.During override a Clear Override option becomes
available.You can also provide the learner with additional
feedback. When you are ready, click Save andClose.
You are returned to the Assess Topics page.Select Publish to Grades for each learner
you have evaluated to update your grade bookwith the newly graded items. When you are
ready, click Save and Close.Evaluate learners on their discussion participation
by grading discussion topics.

title: ePortfolio - Create and Add Items to a Collection - Learner

captions.text: Organize related Brightspace ePortfolio itemsby adding them to collections. This tutorial
shows how to create a collection and add anitem.
To begin, from the Brightspace ePortfoliodashboard, click New Collection.
Give the collection a name.You can add a description and you can add
tags which make searching for the collectioneasier.
When you are ready, click Save.Once you have saved the collection, you can
add items to it.Click Add to Collection.
Choose a method for adding items. The firstmethod allows you to add to the collection
by selecting items from a list of your items.The second method uses tag lists to add items
that have specific tags. For this example, we will choose the first method.
Select the items you would like to add tothe collection.
Note: You can add items to multiple collections.When you are done selecting items click Add.
The added item appears in the collection list.When editing a collection, you have the option
of modifying its comment and assessment permissions.You can also add rubrics.
Associate Learning Objective to linksthe collection with a learning objective.
Click Save and Close when you are done editingthe collection.
Organize related Brightspace ePortfolio itemsby adding them to collections.

title: September 2022/20.22.9 Release Highlights Video

captions.text: This video is a selection of the new and updatedfeatures we're excited to share with you from
the September 2022 Release.
The full list of features can be found inthe September 2022 Version 20.22.9 Release
Notes, which you can find on Brightspace Community.
This month we’re highlighting the followingfeatures:
With Assignments, instructors can save timeby copying assignments to their other courses.
Two new features for Quizzes: Reduce testanxiety by creating quizzes without time limits
and align quiz questions to Learning Outcomesin the New Quiz Creation experience.
Automate asynchronous group creation withCopy Course Components and CCB in Groups and
Section Management.
Choose the last date of enrollment in thecurrent org unit with the Release Conditions
tool.
And finally, a summary of changes for allthe other features this month.
Let’s take a closer look at this month’sfeatures!
Instructors can now copy assignments to othercourses.
This requires the Assignments > Copy to OtherCourses permission on both courses.
A copied assignment retains the followingassignment attributes:
Assignment folder and its properties, includinginstructions, assignment category, and visibility;
Assignment properties, including descriptionand category;
Attachments, such as direct file attachments,uploaded from Google Workspace or OneDrive,
and audio and video files;Grade item and grade category;
Availability dates;Submission and completion information, including
the Optional Grade item and course scheme;and
Any Rubric or rubrics associated with theassignment.
The following attributes are not copied tothe new assignment destination:
Instruction Quicklinks and attachment resourcescreated with the Attach link to existing activity
action;Instruction images added using Insert Stuff
that were saved to course files;Availability release conditions and special
access settings;Submission and completion information including
group assignment designation;Evaluation and Feedback information, including
Turnitin associations, competency, and outcomeassociations; and
Content topic associations (for example, ifthe assignment is linked from content);
Please note that in some cases, referencesto links and images that are not copied may
result in broken links.
Navigate to Assignments and click the drop-downmenu of the assignment you wish to copy.
Then, click Copy to Other Courses.
From the Choose Destination drop-down menu,select the destination course.
You can also choose to include Rubrics and/orGrade Items when you copy the course.
When finished, click Next, and then clickCopy.
The Assignments feature is available to allclients.
This functionality is automatically enabledand is set to On if using the Assignments
> Copy to Other Courses workflow, or if copyingfrom the New Content Experience (Lessons).
Otherwise, administrators can enable thiswith the configuration variable d2l.Tools.Dropbox.AllowSaveandCopy.
In Quizzes, instructors now have the optionto create quizzes without requiring a time
limit.
The No Time Limit option is now the defaultTiming setting for new quizzes.
Previously, instructors who wished to createquizzes with no time limit had to use the
Recommended Time Limit option, which was selectedby default and set to 120 minutes.
Navigate to Quizzes, and either select NewQuiz, or select a quiz you wish to edit.
Expand the Timing and Display menu and selectNo Time Limit for your quiz.
If you are creating a new quiz, this is thedefault selection.
The Quizzes feature implements the followingPIE Items:
D4441 (No Time Limit Enforced Reinstated forQuizzes);
D3582 (Hide the quiz timing information (EstimatedLength) in the student UI when there is no
Enforced Time limit); andD4998 (Quiz: "No Time Limit" option)
Thank you to Karen Sadler and to all thosewho put forward these PIE suggestions to implement
this feature!
The Quizzes feature is available to all clientsand is automatically enabled.
As part of the New Quiz Creation experience,instructors can now view and edit Learning
Outcome alignments in relation to quiz questions.
Instructors can add or remove Outcome Alignmentsby selecting a question and then clicking
More Actions > Align to Standards.
Questions have a visual tag to indicate ifthey are aligned to outcomes.
To create a Release Condition for an IntelligentAgent, navigate to Intelligent Agents and
either click New Agent or select an existingagent.
Under Criteria > Release Conditions, clickCreate.
From the Condition Type drop-down menu, selectDate of enrollment in current org unit.
Enter the desired value into the Days SinceEnrollment field.
You can select either Use first enrollmentdate or Use Last enrollment date.
Once you’re finished, click Save and Close.
This Quizzes feature is available to all clientsusing the new quiz creation experience, and
is automatically enabled.
Building on the asynchronous Group Creationfeature released in April 2022 / Version 20.22.4,
this feature implements group copying viaCopy Course Components and CCB.
Groups copied via Copy Courses are done behindthe scenes and no longer block further course
copy items from completing.
Previously, asynchronous Group Creation wasimplemented in the Groups tool and then automated
with APIs.
The Groups and Section Management featureis available to all clients and is automatically
enabled.
To help users with more flexibility aroundcourse design, the release condition Date
of enrollment in current org unit now includesthe following options:
Use first enrollment date; andUse last enrollment date.
This can also be used to set an intelligentagent; for example, for learners who have
been enrolled more than once in the course,you can decide if the agent applies based
on the first time or the last time they wereenrolled.
Navigate to Quizzes and select a quiz youwish to edit.
Check the box or boxes beside the questionor questions you wish to align to a learning
outcome.
Then click More Actions > Align to Outcomes.
Click Continue.
Check the box or boxes beside the learningoutcome or outcomes you wish to be aligned
with the selected questions.
Once completed, click Save.
The questions are now marked with a labelindicating which learning outcomes they are
aligned with.
The Release Conditions feature implementsthe following PIE Items:
D8405 (Allow Intelligent Agents to check daysbased off the latest enrollment date, not
the first); andD6684 (Reset Intelligent Agent schedule run
dates upon reenrollment).
Thank you to Shelley Stewart and to all thosewho put forward these PIE suggestions to implement
this feature!
The Release Conditions feature is availableto all clients and is automatically enabled.
Finally, let’s take a quick look at theother features for this month’s release.
Brightspace Insights features usability improvementsin new Adoption Dashboard.
Select a start and end date for View All Workin Brightspace Parent and Guardian.
In Brightspace Pulse, the + button for manualdates in Work To Do is being retired.
Easily access and view sections for specificusers in the Classlist tool.
Improved search capabilities and multi-selectwith Google File Picker.
In Groups and Section Management, users cannow view Section Descriptions.
With LTI, Manage grade associations for LTIcontent in New Content Experience.
In addition, Legacy LTI (1.1) automaticallyattempts to migrate to LTI Advantage (1.3)
on Course Copy.
And lastly, Review and Retake default updatedwith language and visual improvements in SCORM.
We hope you enjoyed this month’s releasehighlights.
As before, you can get the full details ofthis month’s changes in the September / Version
20.22.9 Release Notes on Brightspace Community.
See you next month!

title: Brightspace Insights™ - Manipulate Data using the Assessment Quality Dashboard - Instructor

captions.text: Assess and monitor quiz quality and effectivenessusing the Assessment Quality Dashboard. This
tutorial shows how to view and manipulatethe data in the assessment quality dashboard.
To begin, from Insights Portal, click AssessmentQuality.
Assessment Quality provides data visualizationson quiz and question statistics around reliability,
average grade, and correlation for all quizand question types.
To view quiz statistics, click an org unit.Next, select your organizations next org unit
level.Here, you can hover over a data point in the
visualization to view a Course Offering QuizReliability, or KR20 Coeffecient visualization.
Click a course to view all quizzes in a course,or as in this example, a single quiz in the
visualization…To view a breakdown of the quiz name, average
score, number of learners to attempt the quiz,the total number of questions in the quiz,
and the reliability coeffecient.Note: For a breakdown of how reliability is
calculated, review the documentation linkin the video description.
To view question level statistics, click thequiz title.
Assess and monitor quiz quality and effectivenessusing the Assessment Quality Dashboard.

title: Release Highlights - April 2018 (Version 10.8.0) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.8.0.Instructors can now apply simple HTML markup
to Activity Feed posts.This feature implements PIE item D4046.
Instructors can now apply bold, italics, underline,and bullets when creating message and assignment
posts.Instructors and learners can subscribe to
receive email and SMS notifications for postsor comments in Activity Feed.
In Notifications, learners and instructorscan opt-into new Activity Feed notifications.
Learners now receive minibar update alertsfor new posts in Activity Feed.
Learners receive minibar update alerts thatshow a preview of the message, which class
the post was made in, and a timestamp.In addition, instructors receive minibar update
alerts that show when, and which, learnersleave a comment on a post.
Instructors can now make changes to the scheduleof Push to Homepage posts from within Lessons.
You and your instructors can now choose froma larger, more diverse pool of images in the
course image library.Two new configuration variables allow you
to show or hide the message alerts icon andthe course selector.
To hide the message alert icon, enable thed2l.Settings.Navbar.HideAlertsForMessages
configuration variable.and to hide the course selector, enable the
d2l.Settings.Navbar.HideCourseSelector configurationvariable.
Users with role switching or impersonationcapabilities now see a visual reminder.
The personal menu on the minibar now changesthe profile picture and name to provide a
constant reminder that a role switch or impersonationis in effect.
The d2l.Tools.Homepages.Banner.EnabledByDefaultvariable has been renamed
d2l.Tools.Homepages.Banner.DefaultForCourses.
Parents can involve themselves in online learningby viewing assignment details in Brightspace
for Parents.When a parent opens an assignment from the
upcoming work or recent grades widgets...they will see assignment instructions, external
resources (if applicable), and the completionstatus.
You can now use the forward, backwards andrefresh buttons of your web browser without
losing your place in the Config Variable Browser.Additionally, you can now bookmark specific
pages in the Config Variable Browser.This feature implements PIE item D3201.
Three data hub permission names have changed.Can Export Data Competency Log is now Can
Execute Data Competency LogCan Export Activity Exemptions Log is now
Can Execute Activity Exemptions LogCan Export Rubric Object Levels is now Can
Execute Rubric Object Levels
You now have access to a new Competency Activities
data set as both a full and differential data set. This new data set provides data about
rubrics associated with competency activities.This feature implements PIE item D4330.
Instructors now see the assess topic dialogbox in a pop-up window when grading discussions.
With Assess Topic opening in a popup, instructorscan freely move the window to view both the
topic and the grading criteria at once.To maintain a consistent grading experience
between discussions and assignments the d2l.Tools.Dropbox.RubricWindowStyle
config variable has been removed. Now, rubrics
always open in a pop-up window when gradingassignments.
Now, when a new user sets up custom email,they must follow a verification process before
receiving notifications.This feature implements PIE item D1866.
Instructors can now add feedback on learners'grades in bulk. Instructors can also now sort
the feedback column in the grade book to figureout which users do or do not have feedback.
This feature implements PIE item D3953With multiple learners selected in the grade
book, instructors navigate to...and click Add Feedback.
They are prompted to add feedback for multiplelearners.
Instructors can now create subgroups basedon section or group enrollment using a new
group creation category Restrict EnrollmentsTo.
This requires you to turn on the new d2l.Tools.Groups.RestrictCrossSectionGroups
configuaration variable.
Additionally, the RestrictedbyOrgUnitId APIallows you to create groups for learners in
a specific section or group.This feature implements PIE items D1282, D472
and D3830.Instructors can now opt-into or out of pacing
on an individual basis.In the options menu, Schedule My Units was
renamed Pace Course. Instructors can clickit...
and enter the dates the course a begins andends for the content to be evenly spaced within
the specified date range. They can opt outof the pacing by clicking Clear Pacing Dates.
New date types have been included in ManageDates, and some lang terms have been updated.
Dates now display for Quiz Submission viewnames and dates, Quiz Reports, discussion
topic and forum unlock dates, checklists,and surveys.
The status column has been renamed VisibilityStatus and new statuses have been included:
Visible, Visible with conditions and Hidden.Conditions are inactive.
Additionally, Grade Object has been renamedGrade Item or Grade Category, Module has been
renamed Content Module and Topic has beenrenamed Content Topic.
You can now search for specific learning groupsby name in Manager Dashboard.
Improvements have been made to the new SCORMsolution. For further details please review
the Release Notes.
You and instructors now have the option to
render a custom widget in an iFrame.

title: Intelligent Agents - Manually Run an Intelligent Agent - Instructor

captions.text: Manually run an intelligent agent to monitorlogin activity, course activity, and release
conditions in your course outside of its regularschedule.
This tutorial shows how to manually run anintelligent agent.
To begin, from Intelligent Agents, click thecontext menu of the agent you want to run.
and select Run Now.
Note: You do not need to enable an agent torun it manually.
A confirmation displays, click Run to continue.
Note: You will receive an email confirmation once the Intelligent Agent has completed its run.
Click done to return to the Intelligent Agentspage.
The agent will now display a Last Run Dateof just now.
Click number of Users Identified...to view the users identified by the intelligent agent...
as well as the action taken by the system.
Manually run an intelligent agent to monitorlogin activity, course activity, and release
conditions in your course outside of its regularschedule.

title: Assignments - Grade Submissions in Assignments - Instructor

captions.text: Grade assignment submissions from within thetool to quickly evaluate and leave feedback for learners.
This tutorial shows how to grade learners’ submissions from within Assignments.
From Assignments, click the assignment thatyou want to grade.
Then locate…
searching for, filtering options, or directlyselect…
the submission you want to grade.
Note: When dealing with large class sizes, you can use
the Results Per Page drop downto display more submissions.
You can now begin your evaluation.In the document viewer, you can view or download
the submission.Many file formats are compatible with the
document viewer.
Note: Observed in person and On paper submissionwill not display the document viewer, and
will instead increase the size of the evaluationpanel.
When completing an evaluation, you can directlyannotate the submission. With annotations
you have access to a variety of inline markupoptions, such as highlighting, strike through,
notes, text boxes, and lines.For this example, we have associated a rubric
with the assignment and will use it to evaluatethe submission. Click the associated rubric.
Then, assign a score for the assignment, oras in this example, select the levels achieved.
If you want to change feedback associatedwith each criterion, click Criterion Feedback.
To remove feedback, select Clear selection.When you are ready, click Close.
Note: As you grade each submission, you canclick Previous Student or Next Student to
browse to other submissions.
This will push your rubric assessment scoreinto the submission’s overall score and Student
View Preview area.Note: If you created a grade item for the
assignment, the score will appear in yourgrade book after you publish the evaluation.
Provide additional comments and suggestionsin the Feedback field.
You can Add a File or Record Audio as feedback.Click Save Draft to save feedback and continue
grading submissions, or Publish to releaseyour feedback.
For this example, we will publish the gradedsubmission.
Click Back to Submissions to return to Assignments.
Grade assignment submissions from within thetool to quickly evaluate and leave feedback for learners.

title: Question Library - Create a New Section - Instructor

captions.text: Create sections to organize the questionsyou have in Question Library.
This tutorial shows how to create a new sectionin Question Library.
To begin, from the Quizzes tool, click QuestionLibrary.
Click New . . .. . . and select Section.
Give the section a name. The name will displayas the section title in Question Library.
You can choose whether learners can view thesection title by selecting Hide Section Title
from students.You can include a message that describes what
is included in the section in the SectionText field.
This message is viewable by others if yourorganization shares questions and sections
by publishing to a learning object repository.If you do not want to share that information
with your learners, click Hide Section Textfrom students
Click Shuffle questions in this section torandomize the sections and question pools
in this section.Note: Shuffle questions in this section does
not cascade to subsections.When you are ready, click Save.
Your section displays in Question Library.Click the section to add new questions to
it.You can also move existing questions into
the section.To move questions into a section, select the
question or questions you would like to move.Then click Move.
Click the section you want to add the questionto.
Your questions are moved and you are returnedto Question Library.
Create sections to organize the questionsyou have in Question Library.

title: Fundamentals - Edit Form Fields - Administrator

captions.text: Customize forms by editing form fields.
This tutorial shows how to edit form fields.
To begin, from Form Elements, expand the treeviewpane.
Continue to expand the treeview pane to navigateto the form you want to edit.
For this example, we want to edit the CreateUserform.
Click the field you want to edit.
For this example, we will edit the Email field.
Then, click Edit.
You can modify the name of the field, whetherthe field displays in the form, whether the
field is required, and the Sort Order, whichcontrols where the field appears in the form.
For this example, we will make the field requiredwithin the form.
When you are ready, click Save to update theform element properties.
Now, when an administrator creates a new user,the email field is required.
Customize forms by editing form fields.

title: Discussions - Create a Discussion Topic - Instructor

captions.text: Use discussion forums and topics to increase communication and collaboration in your course.
This tutorial shows how to create a discussion topic.
To begin, from Discussions, click New…
and select New Topic.
All discussion topics are contained within forums.
Select the forum that will house your topic from the Forum drop-down list
or create a new forum using New Forum.
For this example, we will select a forum from the drop down list.
Then, select your Topic Type. There are two types of topics, open topics, where all learners can contribute,
and groups or section topics, that restrict contribution to the specified group or section.
Navigate to Title.
Enter a title.
Enter a description, if desired, to provideadditional context or guidelines for learners.
Select the options that you want to applyto the topic, such as the ability for learners
to post anonymously or requiring that a moderatorapprove posts before they display.
For this example, we will require that learners start a thread before they can read and reply to others' threads.
Navigate to Rate Posts.
Here you can apply a rating scheme to your discussion topic.
This allows readers to rate posts using oneof three methods: Five Star, Up Vote/Down
Vote, or Up Vote only.For this example, we will leave the default
No Ratings.Navigate to the Restrictions tab…
…and click it.
Next, set date availability, if desired. Forthis example, we will leave the default so
learners always have access to the discussion topic.
You can also choose to lock or unlock a topic in the Locking Option section.
When you lock a topic, it still displays to learners.
However, they cannot participate in the topic until the date it is unlocked.
For this example, we will unlock the topic for a specific date range.
Click, Unlock topic for a specific date range.
Click Has Start Date and then select the desireddate and time.
Repeat these steps for Has End Date.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
The topic displays following the designatedforum in the Discussions List.
Use discussion forums and topics to increasecommunication and collaboration in your course.

title: Grades - Enter Grades - Instructor

captions.text: Remain up-to-date on assessments and evaluationin your course by entering grades in your
grade book.This tutorial shows how to enter grades in
your grade book using spreadsheet view, bylearner, and by grade items or categories.
You have different options when entering gradesin your grade book.
One way is to enter grades for any or allitems or learners by switching to spreadsheet
view.Consider this option when entering grades
for many grade items and learners at once.Click Switch to Spreadsheet View.
Enter grades for the desired learners andgrade items...
And click Save.Saved grades are shared with learners.
The grades are saved.Click Switch to Standard View to return to
the standard view of your grade book.In the standard view, you have the option
to view additional icons, such as view submission, and view discussion posts.
You can also enter grades for learners individually.
This can be helpful if receiving multiplelate submissions from one learner.
Click the learner's name......and enter the learner's grade for the desired
grade item. When you are ready, click Save and Close.
The learner's grades display in your grade
book.Note: You can identify whether grades are
released or not released to learners by theOpen and Closed Eye icons found in the Final
Grades columnof your grade book.Enter grades for a specific grade item by
clicking the context menu for that item......and selecting Grade All.
Note: You can also grade an entire category by completing the same actions from its context menu.
Enter the grades the learners achieved onthe assignment...
And, when you're ready, click Save and Close.The entered grades display.
If you have associated a grade item with acourse activity, such as a discussion, assignment
submission folder, or quiz, you can also gradethe activity right in that tool and then publish
the grades to your grade book.Remain up-to-date on assessment and evaluation
in your course by entering grades in yourgrade book.

title: ePortfolio - Assess Items Shared with You - Learner

captions.text: Help others improve their work by assessingitems that are shared with you in Brightspace
ePortfolio.This tutorial shows how to assess artifacts,
collections, presentations, or learning objectivesusing a rubric in Brightspace ePortfolio.
To begin, from the ePortfolio dashboard, clickthe shared items filter.
Then, click the context menu for the shareditem you want to assess...
...and select view.Browse to the Assessments section...
...and click Add Assessment.Assessments are completed using rubrics.
Click Select a Rubric......and select the rubric you want to use to
assess the item.Then, click OK.
Select the level you want to assign.When you are ready, click Save.
When you navigate to the Assessment Section...The assessment is available to the user who
posted the item you assessed.Help others improve their work by assessing
items that are shared with you in BrightspaceePortfolio.

title: Inclusive Learning With the Community

captions.text: At D2L we're on a mission totransform the way the world
learns.
That means making learning moreinclusive. Empowering educators
to meet the needs of diverselearners with products that
deliver an exceptionallyinclusive customer experience.
We've created the AccessibilityGateway as your single point of
access to a curated list ofresources and a Community of
accessibility experts to helpfoster the best accessibility
practice in your D2L Brightspace learning environment. The
Accessibility Gateway leads youto multiple spaces.
The Accessibility Academy offersa variety of free courses from
high level introductory topicsto specific assistive technology
tips, helping novice and expertBrightspace users alike.
Our Accessibility Library is acollection of articles and
resources in the Community thatcovers methods and best
practices for supportingaccessibility across technology,
content, and pedagogy, includinghow-tos and use cases for Brightpace
tools. Our AccessibilityInterest Group is for you to
meet every month to discusstopics of mutual interest and
maintain a close knit connectionwith our Community of
accessibility experts.
The Accessibility Discussionspace helps you bring your
questions to the community fordiscussion and contribute to the
ongoing conversation. We believethat technology shouldn't limit
learning opportunities, butshould enable and empower all
learners to do their best tobegin your journey toward
creating more inclusive learningexperiences, visit the
Accessibility Gateway in theCommunity.

title: Quizzes - Customize Submission Views - Instructor

captions.text: Help learners prepare for future assessmentsby allowing them to review completed quiz
submissions.This tutorial shows how to customize the submission
view for a quiz.To begin, from Quizzes, click the context
menu of the quiz you want to edit...and select Edit.
Then, click the Submission Views tab.You can customize the submission view by editing
the default view or adding an additional viewfor an assessment. For this example, click
Add Additional ViewEnter a name...
and a Message.Then, you can set up viewing restrictions,
including the time the past quiz submissionwill be available to learners, and restricting
the viewership to the IP that the quiz wascompleted on.
Next, navigate to the View Details section.You can limit how long the past quiz submission
is available to learners once they've completedthe assessment.
In the View Details section, you can choosewhat information learners can view, including:
questions answered incorrectly, answers answeredcorrectly, questions without a responce, and
show questions with a responce regardlessof being correct. You can further customize
this by opting to display the correct questionanswers and the point values of a question.
For this example, we will show the questionsa learner answered incorrectly, the correct
answers, and the scoring.Navigate to the Statistics section.
Here, you can choose whether to display theclass average and the score distribution to
learners.When you are ready, click Save.
Lastly, click Save and Close.Now, when a user completes a quiz or opens
the Quiz Submissions page...they will have access to the questions they
got wrong and the correct answers.Help learners prepare for future assessments
by allowing them to review completed quizsubmissions.

title: Announcements - Create an Announcement - Instructor

captions.text: Communicate course updates, share new information,
and post reminders for learners by creating announcements.
This tutorial shows how tocreate an announcement.
To create an announcement click the Announcementscontext menu.
And select New Announcement.
Enter a headline.
Here you can choose to display author information.When selected your announcement will display
your name and a time stamp on new and editedannouncements.
Next, enter a message.
Then, navigate to Availability.
By default the start date and time follow an announcement’s headline in the Announcements widget.
Hide this information by clearingthe “Always show start date” check box.
You can change the announcement's start andend dates. The start date determines when
the announcement will be published to Announcements.By default the start date is set to publish
the item immediately. By selecting a futurestart date the announcement will not be published
until then.
You can remove an announcement on the specifiedend date by selecting the "Remove announcement
based on end date" check box. You can stillsee the announcement after its end date, but
it will not appear in Announcements.
You can also attach media to your announcementby adding a file or recording audio.
Add release conditions to further customize how the announcement is released to learners.
If you would like to save your announcementwithout publishing it, click Save as Draft.
When you are done editing the announcementclick Publish to add it to your course.
Communicate course updates, share new information,
and post reminders for learners by creating announcements.

title: Groups - Understand Group Enrollment Options - Instructor

captions.text: Select from seven group enrollment types toarrange groups in your course.
This tutorial shows the options for enrollingusers in groups.
Select # of Groups - No Auto Enrollments tocreate a specific number of groups.
You select which and how many learners youenroll in each group.
Use this enrollment type when you know howmany groups you will create and which learners
you want in each group.For example, your class is working on group
research projects.There are four possible topics from which
students can choose.You create four groups, one for each corresponding
topic and assign learners to each topic.Select Groups of # to create the minimum number
of groups needed to place learners in groupsof a specified size.
In the Group Options section, you can definewhether enrollment is automatic or manual,
and whether learners are randomized or addedto groups in alphabetical order.
If you enable auto-enrollment for new learnersand all of the existing groups are at maximum
capacity, the new learners are added to anew group.
All new learners are added to the same groupuntil it is full.
If you disable auto-enrollment into groups,the system creates the minimum number of groups
needed for the classlist, but does not enrollany learners.
When you enroll learners after groups areset up, they are added to the same group until
it is full.Use this enrollment type when you know how
many learners you want in each group.For example, your course has an associated
lab.The lab is small and can only accommodate
three students and one teaching assistantat a time.
You can use the Groups of # enrollment typeto divide the 10 learners into the minimum
number of groups necessary to host the labs.Select # of Groups to create a specified number
of groups.If you enable auto enrollment into groups,
learners are added using a brick-laying algorithm,regardless of whether they enrolled before
or after you create the groups.That is, if a class has 15 users and three
groups, the first user is added to Group 1,the second to Group 2, and so on.
If you disable auto enrollment into groups,the specified number of groups are created,
but no learners are enrolled.Use this enrollment type when you know how
many groups you want to create, but want thesystem to place learners in groups.
For example, your class is presenting a collaborativeproject
The presentations will take place over fourdays.
You use the # of Groups enrollment type torandomly divide the learners into groups.
Select Groups of # - Self Enrollment to automaticallycreate the minimum number of groups needed
to accommodate users in groups of a specifiedsize.
Learners choose the group they want to enrollin from the Groups page.
Use this enrollment type when you know howmany users you want in each group, but you
want to allow users to choose their own groups.For example, your class is doing group presentations.
You ask the learners to enroll themselvesin one of four groups so they can choose the
classmates with whom they want to work.Select # of Groups - Self Enrollment to create
a specified number of groups in which learnerscan enroll.
Learners choose the group they want to enrollin from the Groups page.
Use this enrollment type when you want tomake a specific number of groups available
for learners to join.For example, your class is doing cumulative
assignments.There are four topics from which learners
can choose.You use the # of Groups - Self Enrollment
enrollment type to allow the learners to choosetheir own groups.
Select # of Groups, Capacity of # - Self Enrollmentto create a specified number of groups with
a specified number of enrollments per group.Learners choose the group they want to enroll
in from the Groups page.Use this enrollment type when you know how
many groups you will create, you want to allowlearners to choose their own groups, and you
want each group to have a maximum number ofusers.
For example, your class is doing group presentations.There are four presentation topics from which
learners can choose.You choose the # of Groups, Capacity of # - Self
Enrollment enrollment type to allow the learnersto choose their own groups.
You create four groups, and limit the groupsto four members each.
Select Single user, member specific groupwhen you want to create journal type groups
with a single user where the first name andlast name of the user is the name of the group.
When a new learner is enrolled in the course,a group is automatically created for them.
Use this enrollment type when you want tocreate a private journaling space for a single
user.For example, your class is doing an individual
research project.One of the requirements is that learners keep
a journal along the way so you know theirproject is on track.
You choose the Single user, member specificgroup type to create a group for each user
enrolled in your course.When a new user is enrolled in the course,
a private group will automatically be createdfor that user.
Select from seven group enrollment types toarrange groups in your course: # of Groups
No Auto Enrollments; Groups of #; # of Groups;Groups of # - Self Enrollment; # of Groups
Self Enrollment; # of Groups, Capacity of# - Self Enrollment; or Single user, member-specific
groups.

title: Competencies - Tracking Competency Achievement - Instructor

captions.text: Competency structures are used to track informationabout the knowledge, skills and abilities
learners acquire.
Use them to help access learning outcomesand formalize course and program requirements
for accreditation.
This tutorial explains how competencies areachieved and how learner progress through
competency structures is tracked.
In the competency tool, you can create, edit,and track the achievement of competencies.
When a competency structure with assessableactivities is approved, the evaluation system
will automatically track the achievement oflearning objectives and competencies as learners
work through activities.
A learner can achieve learning objectivesand competencies by achieving assessable activities.
Uncompleted activities typically start withthe not assessed status.
A learner receives the achieved status whenthey have completed the activity and their
performance exceeded a specified threshold.
However, a learner receives the not achievedstatus when they have completed the activity
but their performance falls short of the threshold.
A learning objective is automatically achievedwhen all its children are achieved.
Likewise, a competency is automatically achievedwhen all its children have been achieved.
Within the Competencies tool you can see whichelements of a structure learners have achieved.
To do so, browse to the structure elementof interest...
...and select it.
Then, click Results.
On the results page, you can see whether learnershave achieved the structure element.
It is also possible for you to track learningobjective completion using the Class Progress
tool.
Depending on its configuration, the ClassProgress view within the Class Progress tool
may include the Objective Completion Summaryindicator.
If it does, information about visible learningobjectives with assessable activities will
be displayed in the Objectives category.
Moreover, within a particular user's progressreport, if the Objectives Progress indicator
is displayed, it will include detailed informationabout the learner's progress towards learning
objective completion and achievement.
Learners can similarly track their own progressby viewing their own user progress report.
Use competency structures to track informationabout the knowledge, skills, and abilities
learners acquire.

title: Grades - Create a Grade Item - Points - Instructor

captions.text: Build your grade book by creating grade items.
This tutorial shows how to create a new gradeitem in your grade book.
To begin, from Manage Grades, click New...and select Item.
Select a Grade Item Type for the new item,as well as traditional numeric items there
are alternative types to choose from.
For example a Selectbox grade item can beuseful when creating formative assessments.
Or consider using a Calculated grade itemwhen you want to determine a learners overall
grade based on specific items in your book.For example, a learners midterm grade.
In this example, we will select Numeric.
Note: Use numeric grade items if you wantto associate the item with a course activity.
Enter a name for the grade item, the namedisplays in your grade book.
If the grade item will be part of a categoryin your grade book, select the category from
the drop down list.
Enter the maximum points you want to assignto the grade item in the Grading section.
This section will look different dependingon the type of grading system you use. If
you use a weighted system, assign the maximumnumber of points you want learners to be able
to achieve on the item. Then, in the weightfield, enter the desired weight you want the
grade item to contribute to it's category.
Note:If you chose to distribute the weightevenly across grade items when you created
the category the weight field will be adjustedautomatically to reflect the addition of a
new grade item.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Your newly created grade item displays inyour grade book.
Build your grade book by creating grade items.

title: ePortfolio - Create a Presentation - Learner

captions.text: Showcase your achievements by creating presentations.This tutorial shows how to create a presentation.
Presentations are a way for you to compileitems into a web project to demonstrate your
learning and accomplishments. To begin, clickNew Presentation.
Enter a name for your presentation.Click Content/Layout to view and edit the
way your presentation will display.From the Content/Layout tab...
you can decide how to structure the navigationand page layout of your presentation. Each
page in your presentation consists of oneor more content areas.
Click Add Component from the content areayou want to add the component to.
Select the type of content you want to addto your presentation. In this example, select
Artifact.Select the artifacts you want to add to the
presentation.Then, click Add.
The artifacts display.You can also change the title of the presentation
pages. Click the context menu...... and click Page Properties.
Enter a new name for the page. Or, you canchoose to hide the page name or the entire
page from your presentation.Then, when you are ready, click Save.
To begin customizing the display of your presentation,click Banner.
The banner appears at the top of each pagein your presentation. Change the title by
entering a new one in the Banner Title section.Click Theme to select from a variety of design
options for your presentation.Note: When you click on a new tab, the changes
you made in the existing tab are automaticallysaved.
Navigate through the theme options...... and click Preview to see how your presentation
will display if you choose that theme.Close the window to exit the preview.
Click Select to choose the theme.Then click Set Theme to confirm.
When you are finished creating your presentation,click Close.
Your presentation displays in your list ofitems.
Showcase your achievements by creating presentations.

title: Instructor Release Highlights - March 2020 (v.20.20.3)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.20.3.
You can now choose to display author name and a time stamp in Announcements.
If you do not have access to this feature, contact your Brightspace Administrator.
When creating or editing an announcement, you can choose to display author information.
If the Display Author Information checkbox is selected and you publish an announcement...
Your name appears with a timestamp in the Announcements widget and...
Author details display when an announcement is Edited.
To improve cloud environment security D2L is proactively blocking suspicious requests
using a Web App Firewall. Note: This feature is now available to Australia and Europe-hosted
clients and will continue a global roll out in future releases.
The moose puzzle image has been removed from the End of Unit page.
This feature implements PIE item D5344.
The End of Unit page now includes a progress meter.
When creating self enrollment groups, you can now specify the exact time enrollment is available for.
This feature implements PIE item D3002.
Quick Eval now supports anonymous assignments.This feature implements PIE item D5647.
In the new Quiz Builder Experience, you can now import questions that are stored in LOR.
The publishing workflow in the new Rubrics Grading Experience now includes a confirmation message
that warns users when the rubric is not fully evaluated.
When evaluating against a rubric, the overall score is now calculated after all the criteria
in the rubric have a score selected.
You can now manually map achievement levels to Rubric levels for all types of rubrics.
Thanks for watching, and as always don't forget to subscribe!

title: Grades - Create Grade Exemptions - Instructor

captions.text: Use grade exemptions to prevent a grade itemfrom being included in the calculation of
a learner's final grade.This tutorial shows you how to set grade exemptions
for learners.Note: If you do not have access to this feature,
contact your Learning Environment Administrator.To begin, from Grades, click Enter Grades.
To set an exemption for a grade item, clickits the context menu...
...and select Grade All.Identify the learners you want to exempt from
the grade item......and click Exempt.
Exemptions are identified in the Scheme column.When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Note: When grade exemptions are set, the Grade Value on Item and No Grade Received release conditions
will not trigger.To set multiple exemptions for a specific
learner, click the learners name......click the learner's context menu...
...and select Bulk Edit Exemptions.Click the grade items you want to exempt the
learner from.When you are ready, click Save and Close.
You are returned to the User Details page,click Save and Close to return to your grade
book.Grade exemptions display in your grade book.
From the Manage Grades page in the Grades tool, click the context menu of a grade item.
and select Enter Grades.
A new context menu appears next to a learner's name. Click it...
and select Bulk edit exemptions...
to view and manage a learner's exemptions.
Use grade exemptions to prevent a grade item from being included in the
calculation of a learner's final grade.

title: Media Library Overview | Instructor

captions.text: This video provides a brief overview of how to create, view, edit, and manage all your audio-video content in Media Library as an instructor in Brightspace
Media Library offers media processing, storage, and streaming options for all audio-video materials
In Media Library, you have access to My Media, which includes all your created audio-video content;
and your Recycle Bin, which includes your recently deleted content
If you click on Filters, you can sort your My Media or Recycle Bin content using various filters
To create new media, click Add
Upload File lets you upload audio-video content
Click Record Webcam to begin a webcam recording
Create Presentation allows you to create audio-video content using the Capture app
Download or launch the Capture app; but note that the Capture app is only available with Creator+ and not part of Brightspace Core
When you record with your webcam, click New Recording to start the video
Toggle the Audio-only switch to on if you only want audio in your video

Media Library also offers Transcript Viewer, which lets any user view and download the transcript for your videos0:01:11.034,1193:02:47.295
Click Stop Recording and then enter the details of your video and click Finish
Transcripts can be downloaded as a .txt or .vtt file

title: Release Highlights - June 2018 (Version 10.8.2) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.8.2.Instructors can now use their Brightspace
credentials with Assignment Grader to annotatenon-PDF assignment submissions.
If your institution is not using the DaylightExperience,
the d2l.Tools.MyCourseWidget.UpdatedSortLogic
configuration variable now defaults to ON. For more information review the release notes.
Parents can now access internal content files
from the Assignment Details page in Brightspacefor Parents.
When parents view the Assignment Details pageand navigate to Attachments...
they can now view internal content files thatprovide context when helping their children
with homework. Clicking the file...prompts a download so parents can view the
materials.As of June 30th, D2L will no longer support
native apps running on Android 4.4 devices.For additional details review the Release
Notes.The Copy Course Components workflow now includes
the option to offset dates.When copying course components, there is a
new Review and Manage Dates option. Clickit...
to offset dates in Manage Dates.A number of Brightspace Data Sets have been
updated to include more information aboutsoft deleted data. For more information review
the Release Notes.Instructors can now click a hyperlink to the
full discussion post when grading from theAssess Topic pop-up in their gradebook.
From Enter Grades, when an instructor selectsa discussion post...
and navigates to the Post section...there is now a hyperlink that opens the discussion
thread the post originated in, in a new tab,for quick reference.
Instructors with the Daylight Experience onwill now see fixed headers in the Enroll Users
page in Groups.Users can now express ideas using an assortment
of emoticons anywhere the HTML Editor is availablein Brightspace Learning Environment.
Users are now auto-generated once the configurationphase of setting up a source system is complete.
You are no longer able to edit the d2l.Tools.Login.OrgLoginPath
and d2l.Tools.Login.OrgMobileLoginPath configuration variables.
You can no longer view the d2l.Tools.Mail.UseReplyToInFromAddress
configuration variable, and its currentlyset value remains unchanged.
For more information, review the release notes.
The Courses page in Manager Dashboard is nowsorted by enrollment status.
Random sections has become question pools;all existing functionality is included in
a new simplified workflow.When editing or adding questions to a quiz,
click New...and select Question Pool.
Enter a title, the number of questions thatwill be pulled from the pool during the quiz,
and the points value for the questions.Then, click Browse Question Library to add
questions.Select the questions for the pool...
and click Add.Now, when you create a role, you can enter
up to 60 characters; this includes Unicodecharacters.
This feature implements PIE item D3403.The new d2l.tools.Rubrics.DefaultRubricsVisibility
configuration variable allows you to controlrubric visibility for learners.
This feature implements PIE items D629 andD2623.
You can set rubric visibility to Always Visibleto Learners, Hidden Until Feedback Published,
or Always Hidden from Learners.Note: Instructors can set the visibility of
individual rubrics at any time when creatingor editing one.
Rubric feedback is now consistent across toolsin Brightspace Learning Environment.
Discussions and Content now include overallfeedback, an indicator and access to rubric
feedback, and score. Learners can now clicka rubric...
To view it in a pop-up. As before you seefeedback that is highlighted based on the
score selected by the instructor...and the Overall Score is now Total.
Learners can now view graded rubrics and associatedfeedback in the grade book, and can view the
completed rubric in the associated tool.You can control this functionality with the
new, temporary, d2l.tools.Rubrics.DisplayActivityRubricOnGrades
configuration variable which is off by default.
This feature implements PIE items D112, D2629,D2617, D1316.
Now, when learners view their gradebook...
they will have direct access to all theirfeedback in one place.
Instructors and learners will notice interfacechanges when previewing rubric definitions.
Rubric previews have an improved look andfeel.
Rubric definition previews open in a pop-upwindow or are embedded in the assessment view
(such as from an assignment or discussion).Each rubric definition preview accommodates
current rubric types (6 levels and 10 criteria).A Total row replaces the Overall Score row
for the entire rubric.Rubric definition previews maintain a consistent
appearance across tools in Brightspace LearningEnvironment, including responsive display
on desktops and mobile devices.

title: Fundamentals - Create a New User - Administrator

captions.text: Create users to enroll them in the top level of your organization.
This tutorial shows how to add users, oneat a time, to your organization using the
Users tool.
To begin, from the Users page, click New User.
Fill in the fields to complete the user profile.
Note: Asterisks identify mandatory fieldsin the form.
Enter an Org Defined ID, such as a studentor employee number.
Then, enter the user's first name......and last name.
Next, enter the user's email address.
You can select whether the user receives anemail with their credentials.
Select a Role from the drop-down list to enrollthe user as at the organization level.
For this example, we will enroll the new useras a Student.
Enter a Username for the user based on usernaming conventions (if applicable) at your
organization.
Note: If you leave the Username field blank,the system creates the username as firstname.lastname.
If the username is taken, the system addsa number to the user’s first name.
You can choose whether you want to set thepassword manually or automatically by the
system.
For this example, select Manually set password.
Enter a password.
The password must be between 8 and 50 charactersin length.
If you don’t type a password the systemassigns a seven-character alpha-numeric one
by default.
Note: The system cannot send passwords byemail, so you must contact the user yourself
if you manually set their password.
To activate the user account upon creation,ensure Make user active is selected.
When you are ready, click Save.
Now that you have created the user at theorganization level, you can enroll them in
other org units.
Create users to enroll them in the top levelof your organization.

title: Quizzes - Preview a Quiz as a Learner - Instructor

captions.text: Confirm content and grading is ready for yourquiz by previewing it from a learner’s perspective.
This tutorial shows how to preview a quizas a learner.
To begin, from Manage Quizzes, click the contextmenu of the quiz you want to preview...
...and select Preview.
Click Start Quiz!...
In preview, you can answer questions,
view hints,
submit the quiz,
and auto-grade answers
When you are ready, click Submit Quiz.
Now you can read feedback, and view report results.
When you are ready, click Exit Preview to return to Manage Quizzes.
Confirm content and grading is ready for your quiz by previewing it from a learner's perspective.

title: Course Management - Create a Course - Administrator

captions.text: Manually set up course offerings for yourorganization using Course Management.
This tutorial shows how to create a template and a course offering together using Course Management.
To begin, From the Manage Courses page, you can search for existing course offerings or templates
used within your organization.
Or you can create a new course offering ortemplate.
Click Create a New Course Offering or Template.
You are prompted to either create a new template,create a new template and course, create a
course based on an existing template, or reoffera course.
For this example, we will create a new templateand a new course.
Once you have made a selection, click Next.
Then, we will create a template.
Templates are shells that create consistencyfor course offering information.
Enter a name for your template.
Then, enter a course template code.
The course template code is used to uniquelyidentify the template in the system.
