Give your tag list a name......and enter the tags you want in the tag
list.Note: Separate tags using commas or spaces.
Use quotation marks to enclose and tag a phrasethat includes spaces.
When you are ready, click Add Tag.Note: All items that use all the tags you
specify in the tag list are automaticallyadded to the collection.
If you share the collection with other users,you automatically share all of the items.
When you are ready, click Save.Create multiple tag lists if you want to create
an OR condition where items tagged with either"x" or "y" are added to a collection.
For example, if you want to add all itemstagged with "astronomy" and either "blackholes"
or "science", you would need to create a secondtag list.
The second tag list would contain the tags"astronomy" and "science."
Collections with both tag list 1 and 2 willinclude all items that have “astronomy”
and “science” as tags, or “astronomy”and “blackholes” as tags.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.Curate your items in Brightspace ePortfolio
using tag lists.

title: Data Hub - Set Up Data Hub - Administrator

captions.text: Export data sets from Brightspace LearningEnvironment to a CSV file and then filter,
aggregate, and transform that data accordingto your needs using Data Hub.
This tutorial shows how to set up Data Hub,which allows you to access predefined collections
of data from the Brightspace platform.Benefits of using Data Hub include gaining
access to raw, user-level data; creating customaggregations and filters for your data; generating
data visualizations and reports; and usingyour data for research.
To set up Data Hub, you must turn on CustomReporting Framework at the org level, and
set the appropriate permissions and configurationvariables.
Data Hub is compatible with Brightspace platform10.6 and higher.
To set up Data Hub, you must turn on CustomReporting Framework at the org level.
To begin, from the organization homepage,click Admin Tools and select Organization
Tools.Navigate to, and turn on the Advanced Data
Sets, Brightspace Data Sets, and Custom ReportingFramework tools.
By default, the tool is turned on at the instancelevel.
Next, we will set up the required permissions.Click Admin Tools and select Roles and Permissions.
Data Hub is intended for administrators andis typically used to provide broad access
to Brightspace data, including PersonallyIdentifiable Information.
To ensure you have control over who has accessto your important data, you must set up the
permissions for the Data Hub tool and itsdata extracts.
You can set this permission for any role andat any level within the org.
Click the role you want to be able to viewthe data sets.
Typically, this will be an administrator.Click the Filter by Tool drop-down list and
select Custom Reporting Framework.Then, click Apply Filter.
Turn on the Can see data hub permission atthe organization level.
This permission controls the visibility ofData Hub.
You can set this permission at any level withinthe org, but Data Hub can only be used at
the org level and reports generated from withinData Hub contain all org data.
When you are ready, click Save.Finally, set the configuration variable for
Data Hub.Click Admin Tools and select Config Variable
Browser.Navigate to the config variable by clicking
Tools, DataHub, DataExport, and FilenamePattern.Edit the org value to specify the pattern
to use for generated report filenames.Supported replacement strings include: {orgId},
{orgUnitId}, {userId}, {userName}, {submitDate},{reportId}, {reportName}, and {defaultFileName}.
When you are ready, click Save.Data Hub supports the Insights Data Sets,
Advanced Data Sets, and Brightspace Data Sets.Each data set type is controlled by separate
tools, configuration variables, and permissions.The data sets that you see in the Data Hub
depend on your Brightspace configuration.Export data sets from Brightspace Learning
Environment to a CSV file to then filter,aggregate, and transform that data according
to your needs using the Data Hub tool.

title: Release Highlights - May 2019 (Version 20.19.05) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.05.
Your instructors can now choose to annotate
assignments in a full screen view.When evaluating an assignment, instructors
can click Toggle Fullscreen.To exit full-screen, click Toggle Fullscreen.
Your instructors can now opt out of usingannotations on an assignment by assignment
basis without requesting a configuration changefrom you.
When creating or editing an assignment folder,your instructors can now navigate to Annotation
Tools...and can choose whether to enable Annotations
on an assignment by assignment basis.You now have more control over who can modify
the core properties of an assignment. To supportadditional roles, such as facilitator, a new
Manage Delivery permission has been addedto Assignments.
Roles with Manage Delivery and See and ManageAssignment Submission Folders permissions
are now able to access the Add/Edit AssignmentPage and are limited to editing the Start
Date, End Date, Due Date, Visibility statusand Notification Email of assignments.
All roles with the Add/Edit Assignment SubmissionFolders permission are automatically assigned
the Manage Delivery Permission.This feature partially implements PIE items
D1620, D4721, and D4408.As of May 31st, 2019, Binder is no longer
supported by D2L and will be removed fromthe app stores. Users who already have Binder
can continue to use it. No maintenance orupdates of the app will be available.
The d2l.Preferences.FontFace configurationvariable is removed from the Config Variable
Browser and font style can no longer be changed.There is a new Assessment Quality Dashboard
available in the Insights Portal. For moreinformation, review the release notes.
Three new checklist data sets are available,for more information, review the release notes.
Your instructors can now save feedback indraft state when assessing discussions.
To maintain a consistent evaluation experience,instructors can now save assessment feedback
in draft state in Discussions.Note: The Save Draft button does not appear
when a discussion topic is only associatedwith a rubric.
The d2l.Tools.System.Features.GradingExperienceconfiguration variable is now set to Automatic
transfer of rubric score to Grade Item bydefault. Additionally, all organizational
overrides are removed and this configurationvariable inaccessible to organization administrators.
When your instructors assess activities againsta rubric, the rubric scores are automatically
transferred to the grade item score.You can now add percentage ranges to learning
outcome achievement scales, ensuring a consistentassessment of learning outcomes when they
are associated with rubric criteria in anactivity.
When creating a new scale, edit the titleand number of levels, if required.
Navigate to Levels of achievement.Now, when editing the scale, you can assign
percentage ranges to each level. This helpsensure your organization applies a consistent
mapping structure for assessing learning outcomes.Edit the levels and enter the percentages
you want to apply.When you are ready, click Save and Close.
A number of changes have been made to courseassignment and restriction in Manager Dashboard.
For more information, review the release notes.The functionality of the Org Unit Editor has
been expanded and improved. For details, reviewthe release notes.
Users who use portfolio with a screen readerwill experience the following improvements:
the Back button is more easily discoveredand screen readers can now focus on the button,
the Menu dialog box can now be used with keyboard-onlynavigation, there is now improved feedback
during the file upload process to indicateprogress, page titles now update to reflect
the various Portfolio pages, and screen readerscan now navigate between evidence tiles for
evidence without a title.Quick Eval is a new tool that allows evaluators
to see a list of unevaluated learner submissionsfrom all of their courses in one location.
To enable Quick Eval for your users, you mustenable the Quick Eval Tool in Organization
Tools, set the View Quick Eval, Quick Evalpermission at the organization level, and
a Quick Eval link must be added to the Orglevel navigation.
In Quick Eval all ungraded submissions display.To view submissions, the evaluator must be
explicitly enrolled in the courses in a non-cascadingrole.
Submissions can be sorted by learner name, activityname, course or submission date, and can be
filtered using Filter.To evaluate submissions, click a learner’s
name.Evaluate the submission.
You can publish the learners score or SaveDraft. For this example, Save Draft.
To return to Quick Eval, click Back to QuickEval.
A draft icon will appear next to learner’sname when an evaluation is saved as draft.
As you complete and publish evaluations theywill no longer display in Quick Eval. When
all evaluations have been completed, QuickEval will display a “You’re all caught
up!” message.The preview Quiz Builder experience will now
allow users to add and import quiz questions. Note: D2L does not
recommend using this feature in live productioncourses in its preview form.
From the Add/Edit Questions page with theNew Quiz Builder Experience enabled, you can
now see the Add and Import question workflows.Click Add.
and select new New Question.Then, select the question type.
Enter your question details.Then, click save.
Your question displays.Your instructors can now evaluate quiz attempts
in full-screen mode.Instructors will now experience the quiz attempt
evaluation experience in full-screen.Instructors can now assess learners on learning
outcomes aligned to rubric criteria.This feature requires the new d2l.Tools.LearningOutcomes.LOASuggestions
configuration variable.To begin the assessment, click the associated
rubric.Rubric criteria with standards aligned will
display the Standards icon. Select the levelsachieved.
Then, click Close.Navigate to Standards...
To view the suggested level of achievement.The Rubrics Grading Experience is now available
for group Assignments and group Discussions.When a rubric assessment is in draft state
the assessment is not viewable by members of the group. Once feedback is published,
all group members can view the rubric.Additionally, the assessment symbol on the
Grade All screen now launches the assignmentassessment experience for non-file submission
assignments that are connected to the gradebook.

title: Teaching Tips - Import HTML Templates to Content - Instructor

captions.text: Quickly build engaging content in your course using HTML templates.
This tutorial shows how to download, and import HTML templates in your course.
Applying HTML templates requires three steps:First, access the Brightspace Community to
download the HTML templates. Next, importHTML templates in Brightspace Learning Environment.
Then, apply a template to content.
Search HTML Templates.
Download the newest version of the HTML templates.Click the link.
Then, click the attachment to begin the download.
The download displays. Click it…
and select Open to view the download.
The template download contains a folder, withassests and pages nested within. Next, navigate
to your Brightspace Learning Environment.
…and then navigate to Course Admin.
Note: Contact your Brightspace Administratorto upload a Template Package to Shared Files
to access HTML Templates in every course offeringacross the organization.
To deploy a Template Package to your course offering, Click Manage Files.
Click Upload.
Drag and Drop the folder onto the upload targetor click Upload.
Select the Brightspace_HTML_Template_v3 folder.
Then click Open.
When you are ready, click Save.
The HTML Template will display. Click thetemplate’s context menu.
…and select Unzip.
The file will unzip in the background, anda confirmation displays. Click OK.
Next, we need to enable HTML Templates inCourse Content. Navigate to Content.
Then, click Settings.
Click to Enable HTML Templates.
For easy access to your HTML Templates,
click, Change Path.
…and select the Brightspace_HTML_Templatefolder.
When you are ready, click Select Path.
Then, click Save.
Quickly build engaging content in your courseusing HTML Templates.

title: Homepage Management - Add Widgets to a Homepage - Administrator

captions.text: Customize your courses and drive learner engagementby adding widgets to a course homepage.
This tutorial shows how to add a widget toa course homepage.
To begin, click Admin Tools...and select Homepage Management.
Click the homepage you would like to edit.
Then, navigate to the Widgets panel...
And, click Add Widgets.
Note: The appearance of your Widgets panelwill vary based on your selected Layout.
Search for, or navigate to, the widget youwant to add.
In this example, select Activity Feed.
Then, click Add.
To remove widgets from the same panel, clickRemove Widget.
To edit the properties of a widget, clickon it.
Then make your selections.
You can choose to hide the widget title, preventit from being minimized or change the title.
To return to the add Widgets panel, clickHide Properties.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
When you navigate to your course homepageusing the Course Selector...
The new widget displays in the edited coursehomepage.
Customize your courses and drive learner engagementby adding widgets to a course homepage.

title: ePortfolio - Make Items Assessable by Others - Learner

captions.text: Get feedback from peers by incorporating rubric assessments into Brightspace
ePortfolio items.This tutorial shows how to configure items
so that others can assess them.To begin, from the ePortfolio dashboard, click
the My Items tab.Then, click the context menu for the artifact,
collection, or presentation for which youwant to enable assessments...
...and select Edit.Browse to the Comments/Assessments section.
If not already enabled, click the Allow othersto add/view assessments if they have sufficient
permission checkbox to allow users to assessan item based on a rubric.
Then, click Add Rubrics.Select the rubric you want to attach...
...and click Add Selected.When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Now that assessments are enabled, we willshare the item with the user or users who
will assess it.Click the context menu for the item...
...and select Share.Click Add Users and Groups.
Search for the users or groups of users youwant to add by using the Search field,
or browse using the All, Users, or SharingGroups filters.
For this example, we will search for Aline.Click Aline to add her to the Selected Users
list.Then, select the Add Assessments permission...
...and click Share to assign the permissions.When you are ready, click Close.
Get feedback from peers by incorporating rubricassessments into Brightspace ePortfolio artifacts.

title: Teaching Tip - Create a Weighted Rubric - Instructor

captions.text: Emphasize the assessment of specific criterionby creating a weighted rubric.
This tutorial shows how to create a weightedrubric.
To begin, from Rubrics click New Rubric.
Enter a name.
Rubrics autosaves your changes.
To create a weighted rubric, change the scoringmethod to Custom Points.
Click Scoring...
and select Custom Points.
Navigate to customize levels and criterion.
Next, customize levels and criterion by clickingit.
Note: Weighted rubrics should be aligned tothe total score of the assignment, or weighted
out of 100.
Assign total values to each Criterion. Forthis example, Identifies and explains two
literary devices used in the story is themost important criterion, and will receive
a higher total value.
For this example, weight the rubric out of100.
Customize the points for each level and addInitial Feedback if desired.
Navigate to Add Criterion.
The Overall Score is assigned to studentsbased on their level of achievement. To update
the Overall Score levels and feedback clickit.
Click Options.
To customize your rubric options.
When you are ready, click Close.
Emphasize the assessment of specific criterionby creating a weighted rubric.

title: Grades Tool – Settings

captions.text: From the organizational homepage, select thedesired course using the My Courses widget
or the Course Selector icon at the top rightof the page.
From your course level Nav bar, select grades to access the grades tool.
You can also access the Grades Tool through your Course Admin link if you do not have the grades link on your course Nav bar.
The Configure Personal Grades tool settings allow faculty to set up their own personal grade book view.
These settings will not be available to students.
In the grades tool, click Settings at the top right.
Set personal display options: Theseconfigurations include user details,
including what information is displayed for your students, including user name or Org Defined ID
such as student number; Grade Details includingPoints, Grade Scheme Symbol, as well as
Grade Scheme Color, Number of characters to displayfor text items,
Number of columns before user details repeat,
Number of users before column header repeats, Repeat final grades.
Start page: Select the Default Starting Page when launching the Grades tool
includes Enter Grades, Manage Grades, Grade Settings, Grade Schemes, and Setup Wizard.
The Configure Org Unit Display Options: Select the Org Unit Display Options to configure your course display settings.
The Configure Org Unit Display Options aresettings that are used to set the default for other users,
such as students, when viewing the Grade Book.
Set the Managing View Display Options. This setting controls how many decimals will be displayed to a user grading a course.
This value must be an integer between zero and five.
Set the Student View Display Options: Grade Details including Points, Grade Scheme Symbol, as well as Grade Scheme Color,
Characters Displayed, Final Grade Calculation, and ePortfolio Artifacts.
Select Save, then Close.
The Configure Grade Calculation option settings allows for the configuration and adjustment of the overall grading system.
From the Settings page, select Calculation Options to configure grade calculation settings.
Many of these settings can be set up using the Setup Wizard.
Grading System (Weighted, Points, or Formula);
Final Grade Released (Calculated or Adjusted);
Drop Ungraded Items or Treat Them as a Zero.
Auto Update: automatically keep final grades updated.
Select Save, then Close.

title: ePortfolio - Navigate Brightspace ePortfolio - Learners

captions.text: Store, organize, reflect on, and share items that represent your learning using Brightspace
ePortfolio.This tutorial shows how to navigate Brightspace
ePortfolio.The Dashboard is the landing page for ePortfolio.
From the Dashboard, write a reflection abouta current learning experience in the "What
are you learning?" panel. You can also addfile artifacts or link artifacts that are
associated with the reflection.The Newsfeed consolidates recent activity
on your items, and those shared with you.View the Unread Invites area of your Dashboard
to find invitations to view, comment on, orassess items.
Create new presentations, new collections,and other items directly from the dashboard
within the Build your ePortfolio area.Beyond the Dashboard, click My Items to create,
view, and manage your ePortfolio items.Your items display when you access the My
Items page. Use filters to view items ofa specific type. Click Add, New Presentation
or New collection to add new items.Click on an items' context menu...
...and make a selection to perform commonactions on that item. Or, click elsewhere
on the page to close the menu without makinga selection.
To perform actions on multiple items at once,select some or all the items,
click More Actions,and select an action from the list. Or, click
elsewhere to close the menu without makinga selection.
Click Explore see a consolidated list of itemsthat have been shared with you.
From the Explore page you can browse throughand filter these shared item, subscribe to
an item or a user, and more.Click Sharing Groups to view, create, and
manage sharing groups.Sharing groups let you save the sharing permissions
you want a group of users to have, and reusetheses permissions whenever sharing items
within that group.Click ePortfolio to Navigate back to the Dashboard.
Store, organize, reflect on, and share items that represent your learning using Brightspace ePortfolio

title: Release Highlights - October 2018 (Version 10.8.6) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment
10.8.6.Activity Feed now supports the new assignment
types available in Assignments.When creating an assignment post, instructors
can now specify the Submission Type. Clickthe Submission Type menu...
and select the appropriate submission type.To help reduce unconscious bias in assignment
grading you can set the new d2l.Tools.System.Features.AnonymousMarking
configuration variable to allow your instructors
to configure assignment submissions to displayanonymized learner names.
A new User Information Privacy permission,See Name for Anonymized Activities, has been
included and will display the user’s realname alongside the anonymous indicator, if
required.When creating a new assignment
a new Anonymous Marking section isavailable. Selecting the checkbox for Hide
student names during assessment will createanonymous indicators for all assignment submissions.
Assignments submitted no longer indicate individualusers.
Users with the See Name for Anonymized Activitiespermission enabled will also be able to view
both the anonymized identifier and given namefor each submission.
The assignment properties tab interface hasbeen updated to simplify the creation workflow,
and two new assignment types have been added,On paper submission and Observed in person.
The assignment creation user interface hasbeen simplified,
to streamline creation. Now, assignment creationincludes a new Submission type menu, click
it.and select from the available submission types
including the two new options: On paper submission,and Observed in person.
These new assignment types allow for a largervariety of assignments to be provided to learners
while still providing feedback and evaluationall in one place. Select the submission type...
To specify the completion type for the newassignment options. Click the Marked as completed
menu...to indicate if the assignment will be identified
as completed for all learners on the due date,to have the learner indicate completion on
their own, or to manually be marked ascompleted upon evaluation by the instructor.
Navbar color and text color schemes can nowbe adjusted, from Navigation and Themes, to
better align with your organizations branding.From Edit Theme, you can now alter the color
of the links and text in the navbar. Clickchoose colors...
and choose the appropriate color for yourbrand, or click more to enter a specific Hex
Value.Then, if necessary adjust the text color to
ensure WCAG standards are met.A preview displays
When you are ready click Save.
Now, the navbar will reflect your selectedcolor.
Brightspace for Parents will support the newassignment types: On paper submission and
Observed in person.The Upcoming Work and Overdue widgets now
display content activity with the appropriatedates set.
The Send to Binder option in Content willno longer be available as of November 1st,
2018.The download schedule for clients extracting
full daily datasets is changing to a dailydifferential and weekly full datasets.
There is a new Brightspace dataset providinginformation about discussion forums.
There is a new Brightspace data set providinginformation about discussion topics.
A new, specific, error message now appearsto users who click a quicklink to course activity
that is outside availability dates.This feature applies to: assignments, content
topics/modules, checklists, and discussiontopics.
This feature implements PIE item D784.Your instructors can now create new material
in Lessons by dragging and dropping existinglocal files onto the table of contents.
You can now set relative due dates in ManagerDashboard and Learning Groups. Relative due
dates allow individual users in a learninggroup to have separate due dates for their
assigned courses.Courses that have already been assigned to
learners in Manager Dashboard and LearningGroups now display as Already Assigned. A
new View Details link is available and opensa dialog box that provides details about the
original assignment.Learners’ quiz responses are now automatically
saved. The Save all Responses and Go to SubmitQuiz buttons have been removed.
This feature implements PIE items D246 andD247.
When students take a quiz, their responseswill save automatically once an answer is
selected...or every 10 to 15 seconds for text questions.
HTML enabled questions will save once a userclicks outside the response input area.
Autosaves will send the save timestamp tothe quizzing log.
Instructors can no longer attach rubrics toa quiz or grade rubrics already attached to
a quiz.
Grading with rubrics in Assignments now offer
new functions and workflows. New featuresinclude: rubrics automatically save in draft
while being updated, the ability to assessrubrics individually or all at once in the
same window, and separate Total and OverallScore areas.
These new features are controlled by the new d2l.tools.UpdatedGradingExperience
configuration variable
Note: This timed variable is defaulted to Off and allows for  opt-in for six months.
D2L is releasing a new version of BrightspaceInsights by the end of December 2018. To make
these exciting improvements, we are discontinuingthe Insights Console and several of the Insights
Portal reports by the end of March 2019. Formore information, review the Release Notes.
For a video on creating anonymizing assignments,follow the link in the video.

title: TurnItIn® - Create an Assignment and Enable TurnItIn® - Instructor

captions.text: Enable the TurnItIn® integration on yourassignments to monitor, grade, annotate, and
compare submissions to an online databaseof original content.
This tutorial shows how to edit an assignment,enable the TurnItIn® integration, and configure
the Originality Check® and GradeMark® functionality.
When creating or editing an assignment, clickthe TurnItIn® tab to begin configuring TurnItIn®.
Click Enable GradeMark® for this folder.GradeMark® enables the grading and feedback
made through the TurnItIn® interface availablefor learners in Assignments.
Then, set your transfer preferences. SelectAutomatically sync grades as Draft in Brightspace
if you want to automatically transfer themost recent submission grade from GradeMark®
to Brightspace, or select Manually sync gradesas Draft in Brightspace if you want to manage
which grades to transfer yourself.For this example, leave Automatically sync
grades as Draft in Brightspace selected.Next, click Enable Originality Check® for
this folder.Originality Check® lets you monitor assignment
submission to identify potential cases ofplagiarism by comparing the learner’s submission
against an online database of original content.
Allow learners to see Turnitin® similarityscores in their submission folder allows learners
to see their similarity scores in the assignmentsubmission folder.
Note: D2L recommends that you hide the similarityscore for group submissions since group members
cannot follow the link to view the OriginalityReport.
Next, determine whether the system checksall submissions or those you identify for
Originality Check®.
Click More Options in TurnItIn® to configure additional options.
Verify that the Title and Max Grade matchthe assignment you are adding TurnItIn® functionality
to.Then, click Optional Settings to configure
additional items.
For example, you can allow late submissions,attach a rubric…
and make changes to comparison sources andreport generation.
When finished configuring additional options,click Submit.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Enable the TurnItIn® integration on yoursubmission folders to monitor, grade, annotate,
and compare submissions to an online databaseof original content.

title: Locations - Create a Location - Administrator

captions.text: Represent your organization’s rooms andtheir layouts by creating locations.
This tutorial shows how to create a locationwith a layout.
To begin, click Admin Tools.and select Locations.
To create a new location, click Create Location.
Enter a name for your location......and the building or area for the location.
Next, click Add Layout to define the roomsize.
Define the number of seats available.
Select the number of rows in the location......and define the number of columns, which
represent the number of seats available ineach row.
When you are satisfied with the number ofseats available, click Save.
Cells in the chart represent seats.
Click a cell to toggle a seat between activeand inactive.
Grey cells indicate inactive seats.
Only active seats will be available for assigned seating in seating charts.
As you move seats between active and inactivethe Seat Capacity will change to reflect your
current layout.
When you are ready, click Done.
Your location displays as active on the Locationspage.
Represent your organization’s rooms and their layouts by creating locations.

title: Roles and Permissions - Overview - Administrator

captions.text: Use roles and permissions to define and controlusers’ access levels to Brightspace Learning
Environment.This tutorial defines and explains the permissions
and roles in Brightspace Learning Environment.
Permissions specify the actions a user canand cannot take within your Brightspace Learning
Environment.
Permissions correspond to tools in BrightspaceLearning Environment.
Define how users can interact with the toolsin your Brightspace Learning Environment by
allowing or disallowing users to view, manage,or participate with a tool using permissions.
For example, permissions define whether userscan take actions such as creating discussion
topics or editing a navbar.
Roles are collections of permissions thatsupport a distinct function within your Brightspace
Learning Environment.
The three common roles in an initial include:administrators, who manage the system and
can access most admin tools; instructors,who create course content and instruct course
offerings; and students, who participate incourse offerings.
Additional roles that you can create, butare not limited to, include: super administrators,
course developers or teaching assistants.
You assign permissions to roles and then assignroles to users for specific org units.
Furthermore, you can assign users a differentrole at each org unit level.
That is, the same user can have a differentrole and set of permissions depending on where
they are in the system.For example, a user could be enrolled as an
instructor in one course offering and as alearner in another.
When a user accesses your Brightspace LearningEnvironment, they have access to the features
set up according to their roles and permissions.

title: Quizzes - Why Can't I Access a Quiz? - Learner

captions.text: Having trouble accessing a quiz? Here aresome common issues you can troubleshoot before
contacting your instructor.This tutorial shows you how to recognize and
move beyond common roadblocks when takinga quiz.
You can access quizzes from various placesin your course. The most common being the
Quizzes tool itself.You may also find quizzes in-line with the
course content or linked from elsewhere inthe course, such as an announcement.
Anywhere you can click links can potentiallylead to a quiz!
Because quizzes can be links within the courseitself, sometimes you will find the link to
the quiz before it becomes available or afterit is closed.
If you click a link to a quiz from an announcement,for example you are directed to a Quiz Summary
page.However, you will notice that the Start Quiz
button is not available at the bottom of thepage.
Review the Quiz Period to find out when thequiz begins and ends.
If the quiz period hasn't started yet, returnto the quiz during the specified period and
a button will appear that allows you to takethe quiz.
If the quiz has ended but you would stilllike to take the quiz, you can contact your
instructor to see if they will make an exceptionfor you.
Want to retake a quiz during a quiz period?Sometimes, your instructor will limit the
number of times you can take a quiz.If you access a quiz you may find that the
attempts are completed.In the attempts section, you will find how
many attemps were allowed and how many youhave completed during the quiz period.
Did you lose your Internet connection mid-quiz?Did the page freeze and you had to reboot?
Do you have multiple attempts at a quiz?If it hasn't timed out, your quiz attempt
may still be in progress.The next quiz attempt cannot be accessed until after
the previous quiz attempt has been submitted.An asterisk indicates that you have an incomplete
quiz attempt.Click the quiz, then review the instructions.
Click Continue Quiz... when you are readyto resume.
Any answers that were previously saved willstill be available.
Respond to any unanswered questions and savethe responses.
When you are ready, submit the quiz.Now, when you return to the Quiz List, you
can access subsequent quiz attempts.Recognize and move beyond common roadblocks
when taking a quiz.

title: Navigation and Themes - Create a Custom Link - Administrator

captions.text: Include URLs to web content, third-party tools,and other areas of Brightspace Learning Environment
in your organization and course navbars bycreating custom links.
This tutorial shows how to create a customlink to include in your navbar.
Creating custom links allows you to includeURLs to web content, third-party tools, and
other areas of Brightspace Learning Environmentin your organization and course navbars to
provide users with a customized navigationexperience.
To access Navigation and Themes, hover overthe navbar, click the more options menu, then
select Manage All Course Navbars.
Custom links allow you to name tools accordingto your organization's preferences and direct
users to specific areas.
Click Custom Links.
Then, click Create Link.
Enter a name for it.
Then, enter a URL to point to an externalsource, or click Insert Quicklink to point
somewhere within Brightspace Learning Environment.
From the Behavior menu, select whether youwant the link to open in the same window or
in a new window.
Click Share with child org units to make thecustom link available for use in navbars created
in child org units.
When you are ready, click Save.
The custom link displays in the list.
Include URLs to web content, third-party tools,and other areas of Brightspace Learning Environment
in your organization and course navbars bycreating custom links.

title: Lessons - Add New Materials - Instructor

captions.text: Vary the types of learning materials in yourcourse offering by adding items from assignments,
quizzes, discussions, uploading files, andmore.
This tutorial shows how to add new materialsin Lessons.
Begin in the unit, lesson, or folder whereyou want to add the material. From the Unit
level, click the Add menu......and select the desired option to add to this level.
Or, navigate the Table of Contents...
...to include materials at the lesson or folderlevels.
For this example, from the Lesson, click AddMaterial.
and select Add Material.Select from the available options, including:
Assignment, Quiz, Link, Discussion, File Upload, Document, Google Drive, OneDrive, or External
Tool Activity.Note: You may also see Content-Item Message
tool providers, such as Critique^It, appearamong the Add Materials tiles.
For this example, we will add a Document tothe Lesson.
Enter a Title.Then, if there are HTML templates available
to you, click Browse for Template.Using templates brings a more consistent feel
to your course content.Select an HTML template from Course Offering
Files or Shared Files.Then, enter content for the course material.
When you are ready, click Save.The newly added material displays at the end
of the lesson and will be hidden from learners.This gives you the opportunity to make changes
and choose when the material becomes availableto your learners.
Vary the types of learning materials in yourcourse offering by adding items from assignments,
quizzes, discussions, uploading files, andmore.

title: Release Highlights - March 2018 (version 10.7.11) - Administrator

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 10.7.11.
Images now display directly within Activity Feed.
Supported image types include.gif, .jpeg, .png, and .bmp.
Activity Feed comments can be toggled on oroff for an entire feed or on a post by post
basis.Click the Activity Feed context menu...
and select the new Manage commenting option...to enable, or disable comments for the entire
feed. Note: When comments are disabled, existingcomments are not deleted and will repopulate
if reenabled.When creating a new post, comments are allowed
by default. To disable comments, deselectthe Allow Comments checkbox.
To disable comments on an existing post, clickOptions.
Select Edit Message...and deselect Allow Comments.
Then, click Save Changes.
Four new data sets have been added to Brightspace
Data Sets: Rubric Object, Rubric Object Criteria,Rubric Object Levels, and Quiz Objects.
Now, you, and your instructors with the appropriatepermissions, can override the icons associated
with icon-based navbars to better suit branding or age-groups. This feature implements PIE item D2133.
When editing an icon-based navbar, click the
link you want to update...to open a new popup window where you can upload
or drag-and-drop a new image for the link.The display of icon grops when using icon-based
navigation has changed. Groups with 4 or less links display in a 2
by 2 square. Groups with 5 or more links display in a 3
by 3 square.Test sites will have Daylight turned on by
default in preparation for the August 2018end of life for pre-Daylight.
You can temporarily disable Daylight in yourenvironment by changing the d2l.System.BrightspaceDaylightExperience
configuration variable.Also, in preparation for teh August 2018 end
of life for the pre-Daylight UI, the pre-daylightinterface is now in maintenance mode.
For pre-Daylight availability lifecycle details please review the release notes,
which can be found by following the link in the video description.
Brightspace for Parents is now generally availablefor all clients.
For setup instructions please review the Brightspace for Parents Administrator Guide,
which can be found following the link in the video description.
Brightspace for Parents allows parents toview how their child is doing in class by
providing access to upcoming and overdue work,assignment and course grades and feedback,
and - if additional functionality is enabled- shared portfolio items and the class activity
feed, without any extra work required on thepart of an instructor.
Evidence collected in Brightspace Portfolionow self-archives.
The Previous Years section of a learners'Portfolio automatically populates with collected
evidence when the learner completes or isunenrolled from a course.
Usability improvements have been made to HTMLtemplates and topic visibility in Lessons.
Topic visibility is controlled with a newtoggle. Click the toggle...
to change a topic's visibility. Hidden topicsare identified by the Closed Eye Icon in the
table of contents.You can shorten the URL used to access your
organization's learning platform. Please reviewthe Release Notes for information regarding
URL mapping.Due Dates are now supported by the Manage
Dates tool.This feature implements PIE item D227.
Due Dates can be edited on an individual basis,and through Bulk Offset.
Manager Dashboard is now generally available.Manager Dashboard allows mangers in your organization
to easily track, assign and monitor completionof development and training requirements.
Managers can view course assignments and completionstatus for direct reports. If applicable,
this information is also available for indirectreports.
Users click courses...to view a list of courses assigned to them,
and their completion status.Manager Dashboard also allows for the creation
of Learning Groups...in which managers can define rules that automatically
assign courses across the organization. Formore information, please review the Release
Notes.The LaTeX equation editor has been added to
the HTML editor in the new quizzing experience.This feature implements PIE item D4072.
A simpler interface for creating Sectionshas been introduced to the new quizzing experience.
When learners take a quiz the Section Titleand Section Text are now visible by default,
a preview of the section displays, and theSave drop down includes 'Save and New' and
'Save and Copy' options.
For more information about Brightspace for Parents, click the video link provided.

title: Discussions - Add a Rubric to a Discussion Topic - Instructor

captions.text: Help learners understand how you will assess their discussion contributions by adding a
rubric to a discussion topic.This tutorial shows how to add a rubric to
a discussion topic in your course.
To begin, navigate to the topic where youwant to add a rubric.
Click the topic's context menu.And select Edit Topic.
Click Assessment.And click Add Rubric to add an existing rubric
to the topic. Note: If you do not alreadyhave the rubric you want to use, click Create
Rubric in New Window. You can create and savea rubric in a new window. Then, you can return
to the original window and add it to the discussiontopic.
Select the rubric you want to use. . .. . . and click Add Selected.
The rubric displays. When you are ready, clickSave and Close.
Help learners understand how you will assesstheir discussion contributions by adding a
rubric to a discussion topic.

title: Question Library - Create Complex Fill in the Blanks Questions - Instructor

captions.text: Be ready to assess learners' comprehensionof concepts and terminology by creating and
storing fill in the blank questions.This tutorial shows how to create a fill in
the blank question with multiple blanks inQuestion Library.
To begin, from Question Library, click New.Then, select Fill in the Blanks Question.
Give the question a title, if desired. Thetitle displays in the question list in Question
Library. Then, navigate to the Question Text section.
Enter the text that will appear before thefirst blank in the question.
Next, navigate to the first blank section.
For this example,
we will use 4 blanks with an interchangeableorder of answers weighted equally at 25% and
answers will be case insensitive.
Then, enter the correct answer or answersfor the first blank and enter the weight the
correct answer will have towards the questionsoverall points value.
Continue this process for the remaining textsand blanks.
To view how your completed question will appearto learners, click Preview.
Review the question, and click Done.When you are ready, click Save.
Be ready to assess learners' comprehensionof concepts and terminology by creating and
storing fill in the blank questions.

title: ePortfolio - Share an Item - Learners

captions.text: Choose which items you share with others andcustomize how they engage with them.
This tutorial shows how to share an item.You can share artifacts, collections, reflections,
presentations, and learning objectives withindividual users, sharing groups, and groups
of users bassed on course or department enrollment.To begin, click the context menu for the item
you want to share...... and select Share.
Click Add Users and Groups.Filter your options by clicking the Users
or Sharing Groups tab.Click the group you want to share the item
with.Customize how you want others to engage with
your item by selecting the appropriate permissions.In this example, we will leave the permissions
so that others can read others' comments andadd their own comments to the item. When you
are ready, click Share.You can also decide when a shared item will
be available to be viewed from VisibilityOptions. Items can always be visible, always
hidden, or visible for a specific amount oftime - for example, visible for a semester.
In this example, we will keep this set toAlways Visible.
Click Close to return to the item list.The item is now shared with one sharing group.
Choose which items you share with others andcustomize how they engage with them.

title: Brightspace Capture™ - Edit a Presentation's Video and Audio - Instructor

captions.text: Use the Producer tool to make simple editsto published CaptureCast™ presentations.
This tutorial shows how to cut video and audiofrom published presentations.
To begin, log in to Capture Portal and click Admin. Note: the Admin page will only be available
once you have logged in.
Then, click Presentations.
Click the context menu for the presentationyou want to edit and select Open in Producer.
Click on the timeline bar to moveto a particular point in the presentation.
To cut portions of the presentation's audioand video you will need to use markers to
segment the presentation. Click the markericon to add and remove markers.
Then click the timeline bar where you wouldlike to add a marker.
A marker has been added.
Click the arrow icon if you would like touse the cursor to jump to another point in the presentation.
Continue to add markers until you have segmentedthe presentation into the portions you would
like to show to and hide from viewers.
After you are done segmenting the presentationwith markers click the cut icon.
And click on the segments in the timelinebar you want to hide from viewers.
Note: Cut segments are not permanently removed from the presentation, but they will not appear to viewers.
Click on a cut segment to enable it and makeit visible to viewers once more.
Click Save when you are done.
Use the Producer tool to make simple editsto published CaptureCast presentations.

title: Competencies - Incorporate Activities - Instructor

captions.text: Incorporate quizzes, surveys, and other activitiesinto competency structures to introduce assessable
elements that can be used for automatic competencycompletion tracking.
This tutorial shows how to incorporate anactivity into a competency structure.
Activities are incorporated into competencystructures by associating them with learning
objectives.
There are many ways to associate activitieswith learning objectives.
In this example we will work within the Competenciestool to associate an activity with an existing
learning objective.
To begin, we will browse to...and select the learning objective we want
to associate an activity with.
Now click Structure...... and select the Edit Structure tab.
To add an activity......select Incorporate Activities.
Now select the activity type you would liketo incorporate.
Quizzes, surveys, assignment submission folders,discussions, grade items, and content topics
must be created outside the Competency toolbefore they can be incorporated as activities
within competency structures.
By contrast, manual assessment activitiesare created directly within the Competency
tool.
They can be used to assess live presentationsor other activities which happen beyond Brightspace
Learning Environment.
For the purposes of tracking competency achievement,both quiz and grade item activities can be
assessed based on a learner's numeric score.
Moreover, with the exception of content activities,all activities can be assessed using rubrics.
Though content activities can be associatedwith learning objects, they cannot be assessed.
Activities that are not assessed have no impacton competency structure completion and do
not affect competency or learning objectiveevaluations.
In this example we will create a manual assessmentactivity.
Enter a name for the activity.
Now select a rubric.
You can create a new rubric, but in this examplewe will use an existing rubric.
Click Select Rubric......select the desired rubric from the list...
...and click Save.
To use the rubric assessment as a basis fordetermining when the associated learning objective
is completed by learners, check The activityis required to complete learning objective.
Now set a threshold.
The threshold is the minimum required rubriclevel the user must achieve in order to complete
the associated learning objective.
When you are done click Add.
The newly created manual assessment is nowdisplayed as one of the learning objective's
children.
Incorporate quizzes, surveys, and other activitiesinto competency structures to introduce assessable
elements that can be used for automatic competencycompletion tracking.

title: ePortfolio - Create a Sharing Group - Learner

captions.text: Easily share and collaborate with your peerson Brigthspace ePortfolio items by creating
sharing groups.This tutorial shows how to create a sharing group
To begin, from the ePortfolio dashboard, click
the Sharing Groups tab.Then, click New Sharing Group.
Give the group a Name......and a description.
Click Add Users.Search for the users or groups of users you
want to add by using the Search field, orbrowse using the All, Users or Course filters.
For this example, we will add Astronomy 101b– which includes all users enrolled in the
course – to the sharing group.Then, navigate to Assign Permissions....
to control whether members of the group cancomment, assess or edit items. For this example,
select edit.Click Add.
When you are ready, click Save and Close.
Easily share and collaborate with your peers
on Brigthspace ePortfolio items by creatingsharing groups.

title: Competency and Quizzes - Associate Competencies with Quiz Questions - Instructor

captions.text: Track the competencies learners acquire by associating a learning objective to a quiz section or question.
This tutorial shows how to attach a competency to a particular quiz question.
This is a two-step process. First, we will
associate the learning objective with thequiz question, and second, we will enforce
the assessment method within the competency.To begin, from Quizzes, select the context
menu of the quiz you want to add the competencyto...
and select Edit.Click the Objectives tab.
Then, click Associate Learning Objectives.Click expand node for the competency structure
you want to associate...and select a Learning Objective...
Then, click Add Selected.Next, to link the learning objective to a
specific question, click Associate Questions. Note: You can also link learning objectives to sections.
Navigate to...
and select the question you will tie thelearning objective to.
Then, click Associate questions.Click Save and Close.
Click Save and Close.
For the second step, navigate to the competency tool.
From Competency Home, click the learningobjective you associated with a question to
edit it.Click Structure.
Select the child activity you want to change.Navigate to...
and select Assess Objective.Then, navigate to ...
and click the Assessment Method dropdown.Select Score on selected questions.
Lastly, select the activity is required tocomplete the learning objective.
When you are ready, click Save.Now, when a user successfully answers the
question associated with the learning objective,it is shown as achieved in the competency
results page.Track the competencies learners acquire by
associating a learning objective to a quizsection or question.

title: Fundamentals - Create a User Collection - Administrator

captions.text: Enroll multiple users into the same org units by creating user collections.
This tutorial shows how to create a user collection.
To begin, from the Users page, click User Collections.
Then, click New Collection.
Enter a name and description for your collection.
In the Type section, you can decide whether the collection is Private or Public.
Private collections are accessible only to you.
To make the collection accessible to other users with the appropriate permissions, select Public for Type.
By default the collection has an expiry date.
To make it permanent, clear the Collection will expire and be removed at a set date and time check box.
When you are done editing the properties, click Save.
Then, click the Users tab to begin adding users to the collection.
Use the Search For field to find users that you want to add to the collection.
Select the users you want to add and click Add.
Repeat to add more users to the collection.
When you are ready, click Close.
The new collection appears on the User Collections page.
Enroll multiple users into the same org units by creating user collections.

title: Create an Assignment | Instructor

captions.text: To create a new assignment, log in to Brightspace and navigate to a course from the Organizational Homepage
Select the desired course using the My Courses widget or the Course Selector icon at the top right of the page
From your course level navbar, select Content to access the Content tool
You can also access the Content tool from your Course Admin link if you do not have the Content tool on your navbar
From the Content tool, from the Table of Contents located on the left-hand side of the page,
select the module you want the assignment to be created in.
To create and manage modules, see the supporting documentation called Setting Up and Managing a Course
To create a new assignment, select Upload / Create > New Assignment and fill out the desired assignment details
Assignment details include assignment grade and assignment grade value as well as assessment type
Select In Grade book for a summative assignment or Not in Grade book for a performative assignment
Final details can include assignment Due Date, if applicable, and assignment Description
Note: For additional assignment configurations, use the drop-down menus located on the right-hand side of the assignment creation tool
For more details on advanced assignment configurations, see the video titled Adding Advanced Assignment Options
Once completed, set assignment Visibility and then click Save and Close
Your assignment has now been created.
If a grade item was entered, you will now see it in your Grade book and date and grade information will now be visible based on assignment details
Follow the breadcrumbs located just under the navbar to return to your Content modules

title: Instructor Release Highlights - November 2019 (v.20.19.11)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new andupdated features
of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.19.11.
Assignments includes a New column that highlights
the number of new submissions or resubmissions.This feature implements PIE item D5396.
A New column will now identify new and resubmittedassignments.
Letter grading is available in Assignments.You can apply Selectbox Grade Items to an
assignment, and any Selectbox grade item canuse an Organization level grade scheme without
being required to copy that scheme into aspecific course. Grade schemes have also been
re-ordered and follow a default of highestgrade to lowest display. API routes have been
added to enable the creation of selectboxgrade items.
This feature implements PIE items D3152, D805,D3109, D479.
When you create and evaluate an assignment,you can now use Selectbox grade items. In
the Evaluation panel, navigate to Score…
Click the Score drop down…
…and select the letter grade the learnerhas achieved from the provided scale..
Then, continue to provide feedback.
You can now add images to Intelligent Agent
emails using Add Image in the HTML Editor.
When creating an Intelligent Agent, click Insert Image.
Select the file location…
Then, for this example, drag and drop a fileonto the upload target.
Then, click Add.
Your image displays inline.
An option to import program outcomes createdby administrators at the Organization level
is now available.As an instructor, you can also create child
outcomes for program outcomes at the courselevel.
This feature implements PIE item D5117.
You can now import customized program standards,click Import from Program.
Next, select the Program Standard from thedrop down.
Then select applicable standards to importinto your course.
When you are ready, click Import SelectedStandards.
Your outcomes display.To create your own learning outcome, click Add Standard.
Enter your learning outcome.
When you are ready, click Save.
Your learning outcome displays.
To create a child outcome click the context menu of the outcome you want to edit.
And select Add lower-level standard.
More in-depth information around feedbackand the complete context of an assignment
is visible in the Outcomes Progress page,in User Progress.
Learning Outcomes can no longer be added toa course from the Lessons/New Content Experience.
There is now a link to the Standards Managementpage in the Lessons/New Content Experience.
Quiz feedback can be saved in draft and mass-publishedin Quick Eval.
Quiz restoration can only be completed onthe latest deleted attempt, and restoration
cannot be completed while an attempt is inprogress.
You can now easily identify when feedbackis saved, or published. The quiz evaluation experience
now uses the Publish and Save Draftbuttons used in other assessment tools for consistency.
Additional quizzing options, such as making
a question bonus or mandatory, are now availablein the Quiz Builder experience.
From the Quiz Builder Experience, select thecheckbox for the question you want to edit.
Click More Actions...
to Toggle Bonus, Toggle Mandatory, or change the point value of a question.
You can now set default viewing experiences for SCORM,
and content providers can selectthe launch experience.
Video Note now uses the Content Service. Thischange removes Flash-based recording options.
You can now attach pre-existing Video Notesin the record video workflow.
Thanks for watching! As always, don’t forgetto subscribe!

title: Awards - Add a Release Condition to an Award - Instructor

captions.text: Automate the distribution of awards basedon set criteria by adding a release condition
to an award. This tutorial shows how to adda release condition to an award. To begin,
from Awards, to view the badges and certificatesassociated with your course, click Course
Awards. Select the/For the award you wantto add a release condition to, click Edit
Properties. Then, click Create. Specify thetrigger you want to use to release an award,
click the Condition Type dropdown… Next,set the condition details, which further define
when an award is released. Then, if necessary,select a criterion from the Criteria dropdown.
Click Create. Lastly, click Save.
Automate the distribution of awards based on set criteriaby adding a release condition to an award.

title: Grades - Delete Grade Items with Associations - Instructor

captions.text: Disassociate a grade item from a tool so youcan remove a grade item altogether when it
is no longer relevant to your course.
This tutorial shows how to delete a gradeitem that is associated with a tool in Brightspace
Learning Environment.
If your grade item has an association, youmust first disassociate the grade item from
the tool before you can delete it.
To view information regarding the association,from the Manage Grades page, click the associations
information icon.
Which outlines the grade items specific detailsincluding tool associations. For this example,
this grade item is association with an assignmentsubmission folder, click OK to continue.
To disassociate the grade item, navigate tothe appropriate tool. For this example,
that is Assignments.
Note: The Tied to grade item icon identifieswhen and where a grade item is associated.
Click the context menu for the appropriateassignment, and select Edit Assignment.
In the folder properties navigate to the gradeitem section...
Click the grade item drop down...and select none.
Note: For associated quizzes, the Grade Itemmenu is in the Assessment tab of Quizzes...
Then, click Save and Close.
Next, navigate to grades. Click More Actions,and select delete. Now that you have disassociated
the grade item from any tools, it is deletable.Select the assignment, then click Delete.
A confirmation displays. Click Delete to continue.The grade item is now deleted and removed
from your grade book.
Disassociate a grade item from a tool so youcan remove a grade item altogether when it
is no longer relevant to your course.

title: Question Library - Create Significant Figures Questions - Instructor

captions.text: Be ready to assess learners' ability to calculateaccurate measurements in scientific notation
by creating and storing significant figuresquestions.
This tutorial shows how to create a significantfigures question in Question Library.
To begin, from Question Library, click New.Then, navigate to...
and select Significant Figures.Give the question a title, if desired. The
title displays in the question list in QuestionLibrary.
Then, navigate to the Question Text section.and enter a problem.
Navigate to the Formula section.Enter the formula for the question.
You can adjust the number of significant figuresneeded for an accurate answer and instruct
the system to deduct a percentage of the markfor including the incorrect number of significant
figures, or adjust the tolerance to acceptnear-accurate and rounded answers. For this
example, this question will have a percentagetolerance of 5.
Next, navigate to the Units section.Enter the unit of measurement for the question.
If applicable, select the percentage of thepoints that are assigned for the using the
correct unit.You can also set the unit to be case sensitive
or not, or include a regular expression.Navigate to the Variable section...
Enter the variable details for your formula.
To view how your question will appear to learners,
click Preview.Review the question,
and preview a grading sample with the correct answer based on a generated variable. When
you are ready, click Done.When you are ready, click Save.
Be ready to assess learners' ability to calculateaccurate measurements in scientific notation
by creating and storing significant figuresquestions.

title: Release Highlights - June 2020 v. 20.20.6 - Instructor

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.20.6.
The classic tab view in Assignments has been transformed into a new, fully immersive page layout.
The primary panel contains frequently used fields that are always displayed.
Here you can add a score, due date, instructions and any attachments.
The additional panel organizes more advanced options such as start and end dates, rubrics,
annotation tools, and Turnitin.
Now, when you copy outcomes you can unlinkthe copied objects in the target course to
be editable.Note: This feature does not apply to Achievement
Standards Network (ASN) or Program-importedoutcomes.
The learning outcomes hierarchy tree is nowdisplayed in Quizzes.
From the Edit Quiz page, click Add/Edit Questions.
Select the questions you want to align tolearning outcomes.
Click More Actions…
and select Align to Outcomes.
Here you can collapse or expand sections byclicking on the section titles, search for
a specific outcome, and browse outcomes.
You can now transfer your feedback from ahidden rubric to general feedback in Grades.
Navigate to Rubric Visibility.
To transfer your feedback from this hiddenrubric to general feedback in grades, click
Include rubric feedback in overall feedback
Now, when you navigate to a module or topicusing a widget, you are returned to the homepage
when you complete the module or topic.
Several accessibility improvements have beenmade to the Rubric creation workflow.
For more information, review the release notes.
Self-Serve Analytics allows for personalizedand customized reporting to be completed in
an easy way without additional systems, technicalskills or alternate logins.
For more information, review the release notes.
The My Courses Widget and the Updates widgethave been improved to consistently notify
you of unevaluated submissions and help youtrack your work.
Thanks for watching. We are always lookingto hear from you about the types of videos
you’d like to see. Leave us a comment below,and as always, don’t forget to subscribe!

title: Classlist - Assign an Auditor - Instructor

captions.text: Grant a user access to a learner's progressby assigning them as an auditor.
This tutorial shows how to assign an auditorto a learner.
To begin, from Classlist, click the contextmenu for the learner you are assigning an
auditor toand select Manage Auditors.
You can add auditors in bulk, or as in thisexample, individually. Click Add Auditors.
Search for, or navigate to, the user thatwill be assigned as auditor. For this example,
we will search for a specific user.Select the user.
Then, click Add.A confirmation displays, click Add to continue.
The learner has now been assigned an auditor.
Grant a user access to a learner's progress by assigning them as an auditor.

title: Release Highlights - September 2021 (V20.21.9)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.21.9
This feature releases the new Delete Submitted Files permission, which determines whether or not you can delete an assignment submission file.
To enable: The new Delete Submitted Files permission is turned on by default for existing roles
with the See and Manage Assignment Submission Folders and View Submitted Files permissions and it is turned off for all other roles.
This feature implements PIE item D1620.
Instructors can now specify the extensions of files that learners can upload as assignment submissions.
To enable: Ensure that the d2l.Tools.Dropbox.RestrictFileExtensions configuration variable is set to ON.
This feature implements PIE items D138, D4412, D8087, D3945, and D6154.

This feature releases the following permissions:User Information Privacy > See Pronouns.
Account Settings > Set My Pronoun.
To enable: set the d2l.Settings.EnablePronouns configuration variable to ON
and enable the new Set My Pronoun permission to a user role, users can set their pronouns through Account Settings.
Note: The user role must also have the User Information Privacy and See Pronouns permissions enabled
to see pronouns set by the users they interact with in the respective user’s profile card.
This feature implements PIE items D5207 and D7231.

This release adds the following new columns to the Quiz Attempts Brightspace Data Set (BDS):DueDate
TimeLimit

GracePeriodTimeLimitEnforced
GracePeriodExceededBehaviour and
ExtendedDeadline
To enable: Ensure the Can Access Brightspace Data Sets permission is granted to administrators at the org level.
New data sets appear the first time the data set runs after the CD update.
An improved editing experience for SCORM topics is available to instructors in the New Content experience.
With the new create and edit experience enabled, a new edit page for SCORM topics allows instructors to edit dates
and associated grade items from the New Content experience.
Previously, users could not set dates or change the associated grade item the New Content experience.
To enable: Ensure the New Content experience is enabled, or that instructors can opt-in to the New Content experience
using the d2l.Tools.Content.LessonsCreateExperienceOptIn configuration variable.
With this release, Domo Employee ID, which is the same as Brightspace User ID, is replacing Domo's Employee Number.
Employee ID is now a trusted attribute in Self-Serve Analytics, along with Employee Email.
The Employee Number field is being deprecated by Domo and will no longer be supported after Brightspace Platform 20.21.12.
To enable: This feature is automatically enabled for Self-Serve Analytics users.
Users must have the Can Use Self-Serve Analytics permission to view the feature.

title: Content - Content Topic Completion Tracking - Instructor

captions.text: Monitor learners progress through your course’scontent topics using completion tracking.
This tutorial provides an overview of completiontracking for content topics.
Completion tracking allows instructors tomonitor the progress of learners through content
topics and it allows learners to monitor theirown progress.
When learners access a content module (orsub-module), a progress bar indicates the
number of module topics they have completed.Content topics are completed by learners as
they view content and complete activities.A check associated with a topic indicates
the learner has completed it.A dot indicates the learner must performed
additional tasks before the topic is markedas complete.
An associated completion checkbox providesthe learner with the opportunity to manually
mark the topic as complete.Topics may also be set so that they are excluded
from completion tracking.As an instructor, you can manage the default
completion tracking settings. To do so, fromthe Content tool, click Settings.
Open the Default Completion Status menu.Topics can be set as required or not required.
Required topics are included in the course’scontent tracking.
Learners complete a module (or sub-module)by completing all the required topics in the
module.Not Required topics are exempted from completion
tracking.Required topics can be configured to be completed
manually or automatically.For manual completion, learners determine
when the topic is complete. They indicatecompletion by selecting the topic's associated
checkbox.For Automatic completion, topics are automatically
marked as complete when learners perform specifictasks.
The tasks vary depending on the associatedcontent or type of activity.
Topics with associated web, text, and mediafiles are automatically marked complete when
the learner clicks to view the topic in theContent tool.
Checklist topics are marked as complete whenthe learner has completed (and checked-off)
all of the items in the checklist.Discussion topics are automatically marked
complete when the learner replies to the associateddiscussion topic.
Content topics associated with an assignmentfolder are marked complete when learners make
a submission to the folder.And, both Quiz and Survey topics are marked
complete when learners submit at least 1 attempt.As an effective practice, when inserting links
to content topics in Brightspace LearningEnvironment, do so in a way that ensures learners
view them in standard mode, instead full-screenmode.
If a learner only views a content topic usinga direct link to it in full-screen mode, the
topic will not automatically be marked ascomplete.
For this example we will select Required:Automatic as the default completion status.
Click Save to continue.In addition to setting the default completion
status, you can modify the completion statusfor one or more topics.
Let's start with changing the completion statusfor a group of topics.
Click Bulk Edit.Navigate the Content to the items you want
to edit.Click the Change completion method drop-down
menu and select from the options.For this example, select Not Required.
You can continue to change the completionstatus for multiple topics in a course.
When you are done making changes, click DoneEditing.
You can set the completion status for individualtopics. To do so, navigate to the topic you
want to configure.And click the topic.
Then, navigate to the Activity Details section.The topic's current completion status is displayed,
along with a description of the tasks requiredto complete it. To change the topic's completion
status, open the context menu and make a selection.Note: Changing an automatically tracked topic
to manual completion resets completion trackingfor that topic. This means that learners might
have to return to the topic to manually markit complete.
To monitor learner progress, click CompletionSummary to see which learners in you class
have completed the topic.Content completion tracking data is also incorporated
into the Class Progress tool.Click a lerner's name and click User Progress
to see more detailed information about theirprogress through course modules.
Monitor learners progress through your course’scontent topics using completion tracking.

title: Announcements - Delete and Restore Announcements - Instructor

captions.text: Direct the flow of information by deletingor restoring announcements.
This tutorial shows how to delete and restoreannouncements.
To begin, from Announcements, click on anannouncements context menu…
...to edit the item, view the item, dismissit from Announcements, or delete it.
Click elsewhere on the page to close the menu.
You can also delete multiple announcementsat once. To do so, select all of the items
you want to delete.Then, click Delete.
A confirmation displays, click Yes to continue. The deleted items no longer appear in the list.
You can also restore deleted announcements.
To do so, click More Actions…and select Restore.
Next, select the announcements you want torestore.
Then, click Restore.The announcements have been restored. To view
them, in the breadcrumb trail, click Announcements.The previously deleted items appear once again
in the course’s announcement list.Direct the flow of information by deleting
or restoring announcements.

title: Quizzes - Edit a Question During its Availability - Instructor

captions.text: Edit a quiz question after a quiz is available and even after some learners have submitted  quiz attempts.
This tutorial shows how to edit a quiz question during a quiz’s availability
and update learners’ grades accordingly.
This task requires two steps:First we will edit the quiz question to correct
it for learners who have not yet taken thequiz. Second, we will update attempts that
have already been made on the quiz.
To begin editing the quiz question, clickthe quiz’s context menu.
and select edit.
Navigate to Quiz Questions…
and click, Add/Edit Questions.
A message displays to indicate any modificationsmade to this quiz will not affect existing
attempts or attempts in progress. Click Continue.
Then, click the question.
Edit the quiz question.
When you are satisfied with your changes,Navigate to Save…
… and click it.
Click, Back to Settings for.
Then, click Save and Close.
You are returned to Manage Quizzes.
If you want updated attempts to be automaticallypushed to your grade book before updating
quiz attempts, ensure that the quiz’s assessmentsettings allow for the automatic export of
grades. This option is found under the assessmentstab when editing a quiz.
Next we will update the quiz attempts forlearners that have already completed the quiz.
To update attempts, click the quizzes contextmenu.
And select Grade.
Click the Questions Tab.
Then, confirm that the Update All Attemptsoption is selected.
The edited question replaces the incorrectquestion in the question list. The incorrect
question appears in the Questions that arenot in the quiz anymore section. Click the
question text to update the attempts.
Navigate to Grading Type.
You can update the number of points for allattempts by inputting the desired score for
the incorrect answer, or give points to aspecific answer.
For this example, give 1 point to answer 2.
Include a comment if desired, to explain tousers why the update was made.
When you are ready, click Save.
A confirmation appears, select Yes to continue.
Then, click Go Back to Questions.
Ensure the Published option is checked foreach attempt you updated. This ensures that
the system pushes the updated attempts toyour grade book.
Edit a quiz question after a quiz is available and even after some learners have submitted quiz attempts.

title: Navigate Brightspace Learning Environment - View Grades and Feedback - Learner

captions.text: Evaluate your performance in a course by reviewinggrades and feedback from your instructor.
This tutorial shows how to check your gradesand feedback from your instructor in Brightspace
Learning Environment.You can view feedback and grades within the
Grades tool in a specified course offering.For this example, we are viewing Grades in
Astronomy 101.Your instructor will create Grade Items, which
are the tasks you're assigned.The grade items may be further categorized,
helping you and your instructor locate gradeitems quickly.
Want to know how you stack up against yourpeers? Click View Statistics to view the Class
Averageand Grade Distribution, which shows how many
learners achieved a particular score.When you are ready, click Close.
In the Grade column, you will find the scorethat you have earned.
In the Comments and Assessments column, youcan review personalized feedback and applicable
rubrics.Individual Feedback gives you personalized
comments from your instructor.Click View Graded Rubric to see a breakdown
of how you earned a grade, specific feedback,your total score, and overall feedback.
Click Close.Navigate Grades to view the feedback for multiple
grade items.Evaluate your performance in a course by reviewing
grades and feedback from your instructor.

title: Instructor Release Highlights - January 2020 (v.20.20.1)

captions.text: This video highlights some of the new and updated features of Brightspace Learning Environment 20.20.1.
This new Assignments page is now on by default.
Your view will change if the new Assignmentspage was not already in use.
This feature implements PIE items D5124 and D5396.
You and your learners no longer have access to Brightspace Learning Environment
when using Internet Explorer.
Brightspace Pulse is now available in additional languages. For a complete list review the Release Notes.
Changes have been made to Classlist to improve ease of use.
This feature implements PIE items D508 and D4186.
In Classlist, the total numberof users enrolled in your course now displays.
The Print Classlist and Email Classlist pages now use floating buttons for consistency and ease of access.
For consistency in Discussions you now have multi-select options to publish feedback and retract feedback.
Multi-select options Publish Feedback and Retract Feedback have been added to Discussions.
Click the checkbox for the users you want to publish evaluations.
Then click Publish Feedback.
A confirmation displays. Click Yes to continue.
The Status column has been updated to displaynew messaging, Not yet evaluated, Published
date/time, or Draft date/time.
Grade exports will now be sorted based on your user information privacy permissions.
This feature implements PIE items D1058 and D1804.
From Grades, navigate to Sort By.
Then click the Sort By drop-down,to select from the new sorting options.
You can now edit group capacity and start datesfor self-enrollment groups.
Self-enrolled group members now see the description of their group at all times.
This feature implements PIE items D1027, D373, and D3002.
From Manage Groups, click the context menu of the group you want to edit.
And select Edit Category.
Navigate to Category Setup.
The description will now display to learners and you can now edit the number of users.

Then navigateto advanced properties.
Here, you can now Set Self Enrollment Start Dates.
Levels of Achievement are now automatically mapped to rubric levels.
When creating or editing a rubric AchievementLevels thresholds display inline.
These thresholds identify learner's learning outcomes progress based on rubric levels during evaluation.
For more information, including the distributionbreakdown, review the Release Notes.
The Picture Library Widget is no longer available, and has been removed from any homepages using it.
You can now dismiss activties from QuickEval. This feature implements PIE item D5505.

And select Dismiss until...

Click Dismiss Activity.
